original: om devā ha vai sattraṃ niṣeduḥ agnirindraḥ somo makho viṣṇurviśve devā
analyzed: om devāḥ ha vai sattram niṣeduḥ agniḥ indraḥ somaḥ makhaḥ viṣṇuḥ viśve devāḥ
translated: Om. The gods sat down for a sacrificial session: Agni, Indra, Soma, Makha, Vishnu, the Vishvedevas,

original: anyatraivāśvibhyām / / /🔽teṣām kurukṣetram devayajanamāsa tasmādāhuḥ kurukṣetram devānāṃ
analyzed: anyatra eva aśvibhyām  teṣām kurukṣetram deva yajanam āsa tasmāt āhuḥ kurukṣetram devānām
translated: apart from the Ashvins.

original: devayajanamiti tasmādyatra kva ca kurukṣetrasya nigacati tadeva manyata idam
analyzed: devayajanam iti tasmāt yatra kva ca kurukṣetrasya nigacati tat eva manyate idam
translated: Their sacrificial ground was Kurukshetra. Therefore they say: Kurukshetra is the sacrificial ground of the gods. Therefore, wherever one goes in Kurukshetra, he thinks:

original: devayajanamiti taddhi devānāṃ devayajanam / / /
analyzed: devayajanam iti tat hi devānām devayajanam
translated: This is the sacrificial ground. For that is the sacrificial ground of the gods.

original: ta āsata śriyaṃ gacema yaśaḥ syāmānnādāḥ syāmeti tatho eveme sattramāsate śriyaṃ
analyzed: te āsata śriyam gacema yaśaḥ syāma anna ādāḥ syāma iti tathā u eva ime sattram āsate śriyam
translated: They sat there, thinking: May we attain glory, may we be famous, may we have plenty of food. In the same way, they sit for a sacrificial session, thinking:

original: gacema yaśaḥ syāmānnādāḥ syāmeti / / /🔽te hocuḥ yo naḥ śrameṇa tapasā śraddhayā yaiñenāhutibhiryajñasyodṛcam
analyzed: gacema yaśaḥ syāma anna ādāḥ syāma iti  te ha ūcuḥ yaḥ naḥ śrameṇa tapasā śraddhayā yaiñena āhutibhiḥ yajñasya udṛcam
translated: May we attain glory, may we be famous, may we have plenty of food.

original: pūrvo'vagacātsa naḥ śreṣṭho'sattadu naḥ sarveṣāṃ saheti tatheti / / /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ uvagacāt sa naḥ śreṣṭhaḥ usat tat u naḥ sarveṣām saha iti tathā iti
translated: They said: He who among us first attains the goal of the sacrifice through our toil, austerity, faith, offering, and oblations, shall be our best. Let him share it with all of us. So be it.🔽Vishnu was the first to attain it. He became the best of the gods. Therefore they say:

original: tadviṣṇuḥ prathamaḥ prāpa sa devānāṃ śreṣṭho'bhavattasmādāhurviṣṇurdevānāṃ🔽śreṣṭha iti / / /
analyzed: tat viṣṇuḥ prathamaḥ prāpa sa devānām śreṣṭhaḥ bhavat tasmāt āhuḥ viṣṇuḥ devānām 🔽śreṣṭhaḥ iti
translated: Vishnu is the best of the gods.

original: sa yaḥ sa viṣṇuryajñaḥ sa sa yaḥ sa yajño'sau sa ādityastaddhedaṃ yaśo viṣnurna
analyzed: sa yaḥ sa viṣṇuḥ yajñaḥ sa sa yaḥ sa yajñaḥ usau saḥ ādityaḥ tat ha idam yaśaḥ viṣnuḥ na
translated: Now, that Vishnu is the sacrifice, and that sacrifice is yonder sun. Now, that glory of Vishnu

original: śaśāka saṃyantu tadidamapyetarhi naiva sarvaiva yaśaḥ śaknoti saṃyantum / / /
analyzed: śaśāka saṃyantu tat idam api etarhi na eva sarvā eva yaśaḥ śaknoti saṃyantum
translated: was not able to unite itself. Even now it is not able to unite itself with all glory.

original: sa tisṛdhanvamādāyāpacakrāma sa dhanurārtnyā śira upastabhya tasthau tam devā
analyzed: sa tisṛdhanvam ādāya apacakrāma sa dhanuḥ ārtnyā śiraḥ upastabhya tasthau tam devāḥ
translated: He took up his bow with three arrows and went away. He stood there supporting his head with the back of his hand. The gods

original: anabhidhṛṣṇuvantaḥ samantam pariṇyaviśanta / / /
analyzed: an abhidhṛṣṇuvantaḥ samantam pariṇyaviśanta
translated: were not able to overcome him. They surrounded him on all sides.

original: tā ha vamrya ūcuḥ imā vai vamryo yadupadīkā yo'sya jyāmapyadyātkimasmai🔽prayacetetyannādyamasmai prayacemāpi dhanvannapo'dhigacettathāsmai
analyzed: tāḥ ha vamryaḥ ūcuḥ imāḥ vai vamryaḥ yat upadīkāḥ yaḥ usya jyām api adyāt kim asmai  prayaceta iti annādyam asmai prayacema api dhanvan apodhigacet tathā asmai
translated: The Vamyas said: These are the Vamyas, the Upadukas. If anyone were to bite off his bowstring, what should we give him?

original: sarvamannādyam prayacemeti tatheti / / /
analyzed: sarvam annādyam prayacema iti tathā iti
translated: We should give him food. If he were to get water from the bow, we should give him all food. So be it.

original: tasyopaparāsṛtya jyāmapijakṣustasyāṃ cinnāyāṃ dhanurārtnyau viṣphurantyau
analyzed: tasya upaparāsṛtya jyām apijakṣuḥ tasyām cinnāyām dhanuḥ ārtnyau viṣphurantyau
translated: Having approached him, they bit off his bowstring. When it was bitten through, the back of the bow burst open

original: viṣṇoḥ śiraḥ pracicidatuḥ / / /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ śiraḥ pracicidatuḥ
translated: and split Vishnu's head.

original: tadghṛṅṅiti papāta tatpatitvāsāvādityo'bhavadathetaraḥ prāṅeva prāvṛjyata
analyzed: tat ghṛṅ iti papāta tat patitvā asau ādityaḥ bhavat atha itaraḥ prāṅ eva prāvṛjyata
translated: It fell with a sound ghr and having fallen became yonder sun. Then the other one turned away to the east.

original: tadyadghṛṅṅityapatattasmādgharmo'tha yatprāvṛjyata tasmātpravargyaḥ / / /
analyzed: tat yat ghṛṅ iti apatat tasmāt gharmaḥ utha yat prāvṛjyata tasmāt pravargyaḥ
translated: What fell as 'ghṛṅ' became the Gharma (hot oblation). What was sprinkled became the Pravargya (sprinkling).

original: te devā abruvan mahānbata no vīro'dādīti tasmānmahāvīrastasya yo raso
analyzed: te devāḥ abruvan mahān bata naḥ vīraḥ udādi iti tasmāt mahāvīraḥ tasya yaḥ
translated: The gods said, Great indeed is the hero who has eaten (us). Therefore (he is called) Mahāvīra. The essence that flowed from him

original: vyakṣarattaṃ pāṇibhiḥ sammamṛjustasmātsammrāṭ / / /
analyzed: vyakṣarat tam pāṇibhiḥ sammamṛjuḥ tasmāt sammrāj
translated: they rubbed together with their hands. Therefore (he is called) Samrāṭ (emperor).

original: tam devā abhyamṛjyanta yathā vittim vetsyamānā evam tamindraḥ prathamaḥ prāpa
analyzed: tam devāḥ abhyamṛjyanta yathā vittim vetsyamānāḥ evam tam indraḥ prathamaḥ prāpa
translated: The gods rubbed him, as if they were about to find wealth. Indra was the first to reach him.

original: tamanvaṅgamanunyapadyata tam paryagṛhṇāttam parigṛhyedaṃ
analyzed: tam anvaṅgam anunyapadyata tam paryagṛhṇāt tam parigṛhya idam
translated: He followed him and clung to him. He seized him and, having seized him,

original: yaśo'bhavadyadidamindro yaśo yaśo ha bhavati ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: yaśaḥ bhavat yat idam indraḥ yaśaḥ yaśaḥ ha bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: he became this glory which is Indra's glory. He who knows thus becomes glorious.

original: sa u eva makhaḥ sa viṣṇuḥ tata indro makhavānabhavanmakhavānha vai tam
analyzed: saḥ u eva makhaḥ sa viṣṇuḥ tatas indraḥ makhavān abhavat makhavān ha vai tam
translated: He is the very Makha (sacrifice), he is Viṣṇu. From him Indra became the possessor of the Makha. The possessor of the Makha, indeed, they call him

original: maghavānityācakṣate paro'kṣam paro'kṣakāmā hi devāḥ / / /
analyzed: maghavān iti ācakṣate parokṣam parokṣa kāmāḥ hi devāḥ
translated: Maghavan (the wealthy one) by the esoteric name, for the gods love the esoteric.

original: tābhyo vamrībhyo'nnādyam prāyacan āpo vai sarvamannaṃ
analyzed: tābhyaḥ vamrībhyaḥ unnādyam prāyacan āpaḥ vai sarvam annam
translated: To them, the ants, they gave the food, for the waters are all food.

original: tābhirhīdamabhiknūyamivādanti yadidaṃ kimvadanti / / /
analyzed: tābhiḥ hi idam abhiknūyam iva adanti yat idam kim vadanti
translated: For by them this world is as if pressed, as if eaten, whatever there is to be eaten.

original: athemam viṣṇuṃ yajñam tredhā vyabhajanta vasavaḥ prātaḥsavanaṃ rudrā
analyzed: atha imam viṣṇum yajñam tredhā vyabhajanta vasavaḥ prātaḥsavanam rudrā
translated: Then they divided this sacrifice, Viṣṇu, into three parts: the Vasus the morning pressing, the Rudras

original: mādhyandinaṃ savanamādityāstṛtīyasavanam / / /
analyzed: mādhyandinam savanam ādityāḥ tṛtīyasavanam
translated: The midday pressing is for the Adityas, the third pressing is for the Visve Devas.

original: agniḥ prātaḥsavanam indro mādhyandinaṃ savanam viśve devāstṛtīyasavanam / / /
analyzed: agniḥ prātaḥsavanam indraḥ mādhyandinam savanam viśve devāḥ tṛtīyasavanam
translated: Agni is the morning pressing, Indra is the midday pressing, the Visve Devas are the third pressing.

original: gāyatrī prataḥsavanam triṣṭummādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ jagatī tṛtīyasavanaṃ
analyzed: gāyatrī prataḥsavanam triṣṭubh mādhyandinam savanam jagatī tṛtīyasavanam
translated: The Gayatri is the morning pressing, the Tristubh is the midday pressing, the Jagati is the third pressing.

original: tenāpaśīrṣṇā yajñena devā arcantaḥ śrāmyantaśceruḥ / / /
analyzed: tena apaśīrṣṇā yajñena devāḥ arcantaḥ śrāmyantaḥ ceruḥ
translated: With that headless sacrifice, the gods wandered about, worshipping and toiling.

original: dadhyaṅ ha vā ātharvaṇaḥ etaṃ śukrametaṃ yajñam vidāṃ cakāra
analyzed: dadhyaṅ ha vai ātharvaṇaḥ etam śukram etam yajñam vidām cakāra
translated: Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan, indeed, knew this bright (sacrifice), this sacrifice,

original: yathāyathaitadyajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathaiṣa kṛtsno yajño bhavati / / /
analyzed: yathā yathā etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathā eṣa kṛtsnaḥ yajñaḥ bhavati
translated: as to how the head of this sacrifice is restored, as to how this whole sacrifice becomes (complete).

original: sa hendreṇokta āsa etam cedanyasmā anubrūyāstata eva te śiraścindyāmiti / / /
analyzed: sa ha indreṇa uktaḥ āsa etam ced anyasmai anubrūyāḥ tatas eva te śiraḥ cindyām iti
translated: He was addressed by Indra: If you should teach this to anyone else, then I would cut off your head.

original: tadu hāśvinoranuśrutamāsa dadhyaṅṅu ha vā ātharvaṇa etaṃ śukrametaṃ yajñam
analyzed: tat u ha aśvinoḥ anuśrutam āsa dadhyaṅ u ha vai ātharvaṇaḥ etam śukram etam yajñam
translated: This, indeed, was heard by the Ashvins: Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan, indeed, knows this bright (sacrifice), this sacrifice,

original: veda yathāyathaitadyajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathaiṣa kṛtsno yajño bhavati / / /
analyzed: veda yathā yathā etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathā eṣa kṛtsnaḥ yajñaḥ bhavati
translated: as to how the head of this sacrifice is restored, as to how this whole sacrifice becomes (complete).

original: tau hetyocatuḥ upa tvāyāveti kimanuvakṣyamāṇāvityetaṃ śukrametaṃ yajñam
analyzed: tau ha itya ūcatuḥ upa tvā ayāva iti kim anuvakṣyamāṇau iti etam śukram etam yajñam
translated: They came to him and said: We will come to you. What will we learn? This bright (sacrifice), this sacrifice.

original: yathāyathaitadyajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathaiṣa kṛtsno yajño bhavatīti / / /
analyzed: yathā yathā etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhīyate yathā eṣa kṛtsnaḥ yajñaḥ bhavati iti
translated: As this head of the sacrifice is restored, as this whole sacrifice becomes complete.

original: sa hovāca indreṇa vā ukto'smyetaṃ cedanyasmā anubrūyāstata eva te śiraścindyāmiti
analyzed: sa ha uvāca indreṇa vai uktaḥ asmi etam ced anyasmai anubrūyāḥ tatas eva te śiraḥ cindyām iti
translated: He said, Indra told me, 'If you teach this to anyone else, I will cut off your head.'

original: tasmādvai bibhemi yadvai me sa śiro na cindyānna vāmupaneṣya iti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt vai bibhemi yat vai me sa śiraḥ na cindyāt na vām upaneṣye iti
translated: Therefore, I fear that if he does not cut off my head, he will not let me initiate.

original: tau hocatuḥ āvām tvā tasmāttrāsyāvaha iti katham mā trāsyethe iti yadā nā🔽upaneṣyase'tha te śiraścittvānyatrāpanidhāsyāvo'thāśvasya śira āhṛtya tatte
analyzed: tau ha ūcatuḥ āvām tvā tasmāt trāsyāvaha iti katham mā trāsyethe iti yadā na  upaneṣyasetha te śiraḥ cittvā anyatra apanidhāsyāvaḥ uta aśvasya śiraḥ āhṛtya tat te
translated: They said, We will protect you from that. He said, How will you protect me? They said,🔽When you will not initiate, then we will cut off your head and put it elsewhere. Then, having cut off the head of a horse, we will put it on you.

original: pratidhāsyāvastena nāvanuvakṣyasi sa yadā nāvanuvakṣyasyatha te śiraścetsyatyatha
analyzed: pratidhāsyāvaḥ tena nau anuvakṣyasi sa yadā nau anuvakṣyasi atha te śiraḥ cetsyati atha
translated: With that you will speak to us. When you will speak to us, then we will cut off your head.

original: te svaṃ śira āhṛtya tatte pratidhāsyāva iti tatheti / / /
analyzed: te svam śiraḥ āhṛtya tat te pratidhāsyāvaḥ iti tathā iti
translated: Then, having brought back your own head, we will put it on you. He said, So be it.

original: tau hopaninye tau yadopaninye'thāsya śiraścittvānyatrāpanidadhaturathāśvasya śira
analyzed: tau ha upaninye tau yadā upaninyetha asya śiraḥ cittvā anyatra apanidadhatuḥ atha aśvasya śiraḥ
translated: They initiated him. When they initiated him, they cut off his head and put it elsewhere. Then, having cut off the head of a horse,

original: āhṛtya taddhāsya pratidadhatustena hābhyāmanūvāca sa yadābhyāmanūvācāthāsya
analyzed: āhṛtya tat ha asya pratidadhatuḥ tena ha ābhyām anūvāca sa yat ābhyām anūvāca atha asya
translated: they put it on him. With that he spoke to them. When he spoke to them,🔽they cut off his head.

original: tadindraḥ śiraścicedāthāsya svaṃ śira āhṛtya taddhāsya pratidadhatuḥ / / /
analyzed: tat indraḥ śiraḥ ciceda atha asya svam śiraḥ āhṛtya tat ha asya pratidadhatuḥ
translated: Indra cut off his head. Then he brought back his own head and put it on him again.

original: tasmādetadṛṣiṇābhyanūktam dadhyaṅ ha yanmadhvātharvaṇo vāmaśvasya śīrṣṇā pra🔽yadīmuvācetyayataṃ taduvāceti haivaitaduktam / / /
analyzed: tasmāt etat ṛṣiṇā abhyanūktam dadhyaṅ ha yat madhvātharvaṇaḥ vām aśvasya śīrṣṇā pra  yat īm uvāca iti ayatam tat uvāca iti ha eva etat uktam
translated: Therefore it was said by the seer: 'What Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan, said to the Asvins,🔽with the head of the horse, that he said to Indra.' 'He said what is far,' he said.

original: tanna sarvasmā anubrūyāt enasyaṃ hi tadatho nenma indraḥ śiraścinadaditi yo nveva
analyzed: tat na sarvasmai anubrūyāt enasyam hi tat atha u na id me indraḥ śiraḥ cinadat iti yaḥ nu eva
translated: Therefore one should not recite it to everyone, for it is sinful. Moreover, 'Lest Indra cut off my head,' one should say it to one who is known,

original: jñātastasmai brūyādatha yo'nūcāno'tha yo'sya priyaḥ syānna tveva sarvasmā iva / / /
analyzed: jñātaḥ tasmai brūyāt atha yā unūcānā utha yaḥ usya priyaḥ syāt na tu eva sarvasmai iva
translated: then to one who is learned, then to one who is dear to him, but not to everyone, indeed.

original: samvatsaravāsine'nubrūyāt eṣa vai samvatsaro ya eṣa tapatyeṣa u
analyzed: samvatsara vāsinā anubrūyāt eṣa vai samvatsaraḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u
translated: One should recite it to one who has lived with him for a year, for he who shines yonder is the year,

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmātsamvatsaravāsine'nubrūyāt / / /
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt samvatsara vāsinā inubrūyāt
translated: and the Pravargya is he. Therefore one should recite it to one who has lived with him for a year.

original: tisro rātrīrvrataṃ carati trayo vā ṛtavaḥ samvatsarasya samvatsara eṣa ya eṣa
analyzed: tisraḥ rātrīḥ vratam carati trayaḥ vai ṛtavaḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ eṣa yaḥ eṣa
translated: He observes the vow for three nights. There are three seasons in the year, and he who shines yonder is the year,

original: tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmāttisro rātrīrvrataṃ carati / / /
analyzed: tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt tisraḥ rātrīḥ vratam carati
translated: and the Pravargya is he. Therefore he observes the vow for three nights.

original: taptamācāmati tapasvyanubravā ityamāṃsāśyanubrūte tapasvyanubravā iti / / /
analyzed: taptam ācāmati tapasvī anubravāḥ iti a māṃsa āśī anubrūte tapasvī anubravāḥ iti
translated: He who is practising austerities sips water while heated. He recites the mantras while practising austerities. He recites the mantras without eating meat.

original: amṛnmayapāyī asti vā asyāṃ saṃsṛṣṭamiva yadasyāmanṛtam vadati
analyzed: a mṛd maya pāyī asti vai asyām saṃsṛṣṭam iva yat asyām anṛtam vadati
translated: He does not drink from an earthen vessel. There is as it were a mixture in this, namely when he speaks untruth in this.

original: tasmādamṛnmayadāyī / / /
analyzed: tasmāt a mṛd maya dāyī
translated: Therefore he does not drink from an earthen vessel.

original: aśūdrociṣṭī eṣa vai dharmo ya eṣa tapati saiṣā śrīḥ satyaṃ jyotiranṛtaṃ strī śūdraḥ
analyzed: eṣa vai dharmaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati sā eṣā śrīḥ satyam jyotiḥ anṛtam strī śūdraḥ
translated: He does not eat the leavings of a Shudra. This indeed is the law, namely he who shines yonder. That is glory. Truth is light. Untruth is a woman. A Shudra is

original: śvā kṛṣṇaḥ śakunistāni na prekṣeta necriyaṃ ca pāpmānaṃ ca nejjyotiśca tamaśca
analyzed: śvā kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ tāni na prekṣeta na icriyam ca pāpmānam ca na id jyotiḥ ca tamaḥ ca
translated: a black dog or a crow. He should not look at them. He should not mix glory with sin, light with darkness,

original: netsatyānṛte saṃsṛjānīti / / /
analyzed: na id satya anṛte saṃsṛjāni iti
translated: lest he should mix truth and untruth.

original: athaiṣa vāva yaśaḥ ya eṣa tapati tadyattadādityo yaśo yajño haiva
analyzed: atha eṣa vāva yaśaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati tat yat tat ādityaḥ yaśaḥ yajñaḥ ha eva
translated: Now this indeed is glory, namely he who shines yonder. That which is that glory of the sun is indeed sacrifice.

original: tadyaśastadyattadyajño yaśo yajamāno haiva tadyaśastadyattadyajamāno yaśa ṛtvijo🔽haiva tadyaśastadyattadṛtvijo yaśo dakṣiṇā haiva tadyaśastasmādyāmasmai
analyzed: tat yaśaḥ tat yat tat yajñaḥ yaśaḥ yajamānaḥ ha eva tat yaśaḥ tat yat tat yajamānaḥ yaśaḥ ṛtvijaḥ  ha eva tat yaśaḥ tat yat tat ṛtvijaḥ yaśaḥ dakṣiṇā ha eva tat yaśaḥ tasmāt yām asmai
translated: That which is that glory of the sacrifice is indeed the sacrificer. That which is that glory of the sacrificer is indeed the priests.

original: dakṣiṇāmānayeyurna tā itsadyo'nyasmā atidiśennedyanmedaṃ yaśa
analyzed: dakṣiṇām ānayeyuḥ na tāḥ id sadyas nyasmai atidiśet na id yanma idam yaśaḥ
translated: That which is that glory of the priests is indeed the sacrificial fee. Therefore, if they were to bring a sacrificial fee for him, he should not immediately direct it to another, lest that glory of his🔽should go to another.

original: āgaṃstatsadyo'nyasmā atidiśānīti śvo vaiva bhūte dvyahe vā tadātmanyevaitadyaśaḥ
analyzed: āgan tat sadyonyasmai atidiśāni iti śvas vā eva bhūte dvi ahe vā tat ātmani eva etat yaśaḥ
translated: He comes to it immediately, or on the next day, or on the second day after, having made that glory his own.

original: kṛtvā yadeva tadbhavati tatsa dadāti hiraṇyaṃ gām vāso'śvam vā / / /
analyzed: kṛtvā yat eva tat bhavati tat sa dadāti hiraṇyam gām vāsaḥ ūśvam vā
translated: Whatever it is, he gives that, gold, a cow, a garment, or a horse.

original: athaitadvā āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūtebhakṣayati vā tasya
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
translated: Now, this life and this light enter him who either teaches this (knowledge) to another or partakes of it.

original: vratacaryā nātapati pracādayeta nedetasmāttiro'sānīti nātapati
analyzed: vrata caryāḥ na ātapati pracādayeta na id etasmāt tirosāni iti na ātapati
translated: He should not look at the sun, lest he should look at it from here.

original: niṣṭhīvennedetamabhiniṣṭhīvānīti nātapati prasrāvayeta nedetamabhiprasrāvayā iti
analyzed: niṣṭhīvet na id etam abhiniṣṭhīvāni iti na ātapati prasrāvayeta na id etam abhiprasrāvayai iti
translated: He should not spit, lest he should spit on it. He should not urinate, lest he should urinate on it.

original: yāvadvā eṣa ātapati tāvāneṣa nedetametairhinasānītyavajyotya
analyzed: yāvat vai eṣaḥ ātapati tāvān eṣa na id etam etaiḥ hinasāni iti avajyotya
translated: As long as it shines, so long is it. Lest he should injure it by these (acts), he should avoid (looking at it, spitting, and urinating).

original: rātrāvaśnīyāttadetadasya rūpaṃ kriyate ya eṣa tapati tadu hovācāsurirekaṃ ha vai
analyzed: rātrau aśnīyāt tat etat asya rūpam kriyate yaḥ eṣa tapati tat u ha uvāca āsuriḥ ekam ha vai
translated: He should eat at night. This form of it is made which shines yonder. But Asuri said this:

original: devā vrataṃ caranti yatsatyam tasmādu satyameva vadet / / /
analyzed: devāḥ vratam caranti yat satyam tasmāt u satyam eva vadet
translated: 'The gods indeed observe one vow, namely truth. Therefore one should speak the truth.'

original: sa vai sambhārāntsambharati sa yadvā enānitthāccetthācca sambharati
analyzed: sa vai sambhārān sambharati sa yat vai enān itthāt ca itthāt ca sambharati
translated: He collects the materials. In that he collects them from here and from there,

original: tatsambhārāṇāṃ sambhāratvaṃ sa vai yatrayatra yajñasya nyaktaṃ tatastataḥ
analyzed: tat sambhārāṇām sambhāra tvam sa vai yatra yatra yajñasya nyaktam tatas tatas
translated: The sacrificial grass and the strew are the limbs of the sacrifice. He puts them down in front, for in front are the limbs.

original: sambharati / / /
analyzed: sambharati
translated: He puts them down in front, for in front are the limbs.

original: kṛṣṇājinaṃ sambharati yajño vai kṛṣṇajinaṃ yajña evainametatsambharati🔽lomataścandāṃsi vai lomāni candaḥsvevainametatsambharatyuttarata udīcī hi
analyzed: kṛṣṇājinam sambharati yajñaḥ vai kṛṣṇajinam yajñe eva enam etat sambharati  lomataḥ candāṃsi vai lomāni candaḥsu eva enam etat sambharati uttaratas udīcī hi
translated: He puts down the black antelope skin; the black antelope skin is the sacrifice; verily he puts it together in the sacrifice.

original: manuṣyāṇāṃ dikprācīnagrīve taddhi devatrā / / /
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām diś prācīnagrīve tat hi devatrā
translated: From the hairy side; the hairs are the metres; verily he puts it together in the metres. On the north; for the north is the quarter of men. With the neck towards the east; that is according to the rule of the gods.

original: abhryā vajro vā abhrirvīryam vai vajro vīryeṇaivainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ🔽karoti / / /🔽audumbarī bhavati ūrgvai rasa udumbara ūrjaivainametadrasena samardhayati
analyzed: abhryāḥ vajraḥ vai abhriḥ vīryam vai vajraḥ vīryeṇa eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam  karoti  audumbarī bhavati ūrj vai rasaḥ udumbaraḥ ūrjā eva enam etat rasena samardhayati
translated: With the hoe; the hoe is the thunderbolt, the thunderbolt is strength; verily he makes it up by strength, makes it whole.

original: kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /🔽atho vaikaṅkatī prajāpatiryām prathamāmāhutimajuhotsa hutvā yatra nyamṛṣṭa tato
analyzed: kṛtsnam karoti  atha u vaikaṅkatī prajāpatiḥ yām prathamām āhutim ajuhot sa hutvā yatra nyamṛṣṭa tatas
translated: It is of Udumbara (Ficus glomerata); the Udumbara is strength and sap; verily he makes it up by strength and sap, makes it whole.

original: vikaṅkataḥ samabhavadyajño vā āhutiryajño vikaṅkato
analyzed: vikaṅkataḥ samabhavat yajñaḥ vai āhutiḥ yajñaḥ vikaṅkato
translated: Then again (it is of) Vikankata wood; when Prajapati offered the first oblation, when he wiped (the vessel), from that place the Vikankata tree sprang up; the oblation is the sacrifice, the Vikankata tree is the sacrifice;

original: yajñenaivainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnam karoti / / /
analyzed: yajñena eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: verily he makes it up by the sacrifice, makes it whole.

original: aratnimātrī bhavati bāhurvā aratnirbāhuno vai vīryaṃ kriyate vīryasammitaiva
analyzed: aratni mātrī bhavati bāhuḥ vai aratniḥ bāhunaḥ vai vīryam kriyate vīrya sammitā eva
translated: It is a cubit long; the cubit is the arm, and by the arm strength is exerted: (the altar) is commensurate with strength.

original: tadbhavati vīryeṇaivainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: tat bhavati vīryeṇa eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: It is (made) of that (wood); he thus supplies it with strength, makes it complete.

original: tāmādatte devasya tvā savituḥ prasave'śvinorbāhubhyām pūṣṇo hastābhyāmādade
analyzed: tām ādatte devasya tvā savituḥ prasava aśvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām ādade
translated: He takes it with (the formula), 'On the impulse of the god Savitri I take thee with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan.'

original: nārirasītyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: nāriḥ asi iti asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: 'Thou art a woman,' (with these words) he takes it up; the meaning of this has been explained.

original: tāṃ savye pāṇau kṛtvā dakṣiṇenābhimṛśya japati yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo
analyzed: tām savye pāṇau kṛtvā dakṣiṇena abhimṛśya japati yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ
translated: Having taken it up in his left hand, and stroked it with his right, he murmurs (the verse), 'They yoke the mind, and they yoke the thoughts,'

original: viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvideka inmahī devasya🔽savituḥ pariṣṭutirityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽atha mṛtpiṇḍam pavrigṛhṇāti abhryā ca dakṣiṇato hastena ca hastenaivottarato devī
analyzed: viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid ekaḥ id mahī devasya  savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ  atha mṛd piṇḍam abhryā ca dakṣiṇatas hastena ca hastena eva uttaratas devī
translated: 'The sages, the sages of the great, the wise one,' 'He alone has distributed the priestly offices,' 'The great praise of the god Savitri.' The meaning of this has been explained.🔽He then takes up a lump of clay with the spade on the south side and with his hand, with (the formula), 'Thou art the ladle of the gods,' and on the north side with his hand only. 'O divine Heaven and Earth,' (with these words) he touches (the lump of clay).

original: dyāvāpṛthivī iti yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa ime dyāvāpṛthivī
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī iti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat saḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī
translated: When the sacrifice had its head cut off, its life-sap flowed away; it went to these, heaven and earth.

original: agacadyanmṛdiyaṃ tadyadāpo'sau tanmṛdaścāpāṃ ca mahāvīrāḥ kṛtā bhavanti
analyzed: agacat yat mṛd iyam tat yat āpaḥ usau tat mṛdaḥ ca apām ca mahāvīrāḥ kṛtāḥ bhavanti
translated: What is here (of it), that is this earth; what is yonder (of it), that is yonder sky. The great heroes are made of clay and water.

original: tenaivainametadrasena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti tasmādāha devī dyāvāpṛthivī iti
analyzed: tena eva enam etat rasena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti tasmāt āha devī dyāvāpṛthivī iti
translated: 'O divine Heaven and Earth', he says; for by that sap he supplies and completes it; therefore he says, 'O divine Heaven and Earth.'

original: makhasya vāmadya śiro rādhyāsamiti yajño vai makho yajñasya vāmadya śiro
analyzed: makhasya vām adya śiraḥ rādhyāsam iti yajñaḥ vai makhaḥ yajñasya vām adya śiraḥ
translated: 'May I to-day prosper the head of Makha', he says; Makha is the sacrifice; 'may I prosper the head of the sacrifice', he thereby says.

original: rādhyāsamityevaitadāha devayajane pṛthivyā iti devayajane hi pṛthivyai sambharati🔽makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa iti yajño vai makho yajñāya tvā yajñasya tvā
analyzed: rādhyāsam iti eva etat āha devayajane pṛthivyai iti devayajane hi pṛthivyai sambharati  makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti yajñaḥ vai makhaḥ yajñāya tvā yajñasya tvā
translated: 'On the place of divine worship of the earth', he says; for on the place of divine worship of the earth he collects it.

original: śīrṣṇa ityevaitadāha / / /🔽atha valmīkavapām devyo vamrya ityetā vā etadakurvata yathāyathaitadyajñasya
analyzed: śīrṣṇaḥ iti eva etat āha  atha valmīka vapām devyaḥ vamryaḥ iti etāḥ vai etat akurvata yathā yathā etat yajñasya
translated: 'For Makha thee! for the head of Makha thee!' Makha is the sacrifice; 'for the sacrifice thee! for the head of the sacrifice thee!' is what he thereby says.

original: śiro'cidyata tābhirevainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti bhūtasya prathamajā
analyzed: śiraḥ cidyata tābhiḥ eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti bhūtasya prathama jā
translated: Then (he takes) the ant-hill. 'O divine ants', (with these words) they did this; as the head of the sacrifice was cut off, so it was with them; with them he now supplies and completes it.

original: itīyam vai pṛthivī bhūtasya prathamajā tadanayaivainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ🔽karoti makhasya vo'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyā makhāya tvā makhasya
analyzed: iti iyam vai pṛthivī bhūtasya prathama jā tat anayā eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam  karoti makhasya vodya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ makhāya tvā makhasya
translated: 'The first-born of what hath been', he says; for this earth is the first-born of what hath been; with it he now supplies and completes it.

original: tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: tvā śīrṣṇaḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: 'May I to-day prosper the head of Makha on the place of divine worship of the earth', (with these words) he takes the ant-hill; 'for Makha thee! for the head of Makha thee!' the meaning of this is the same as before.

original: atha varāhavihatam iyatyagra āsīditīyatī ha vā iyamagre pṛthivyāsa prādeśamātrī🔽tāmemūṣa iti varāha ujjaghāna so'syāḥ patiḥ prajāpatistenaivainametanmithunena🔽priyeṇa dhāmnā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti makhasya te'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ
analyzed: atha varāha vihatam iyatī agre āsīt iti iyatī ha vai iyam agre pṛthivī āsa prādeśa mātrī  tām emūṣaḥ iti varāhaḥ ujjaghāna saḥ usyāḥ patiḥ prajāpatiḥ tena eva enam etat mithunena  priyeṇa dhāmnā samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti makhasya tedya śiraḥ rādhyāsam
translated: Then (he digs) the Varaha-vihata (hole). As much as this (earth) was in the beginning, so much was this (hole) in the beginning, a span in size.

original: devayajane pṛthivyā makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: devayajane pṛthivyāḥ makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: The boar, thinking 'this is my food,' dug it up. He is her husband, Pragâpati. With that very pair he now supplies him, and makes him whole, with a dear abode. 'To-day I will complete the head of thy Makha on the altar, on the earth, for Makha thee! for the head of Makha thee!' The meaning of this has been told .

original: athādārān indrasyauja stheti yatra vā enamindra ojasā paryagṛhṇāttadasya🔽parigṛhītasya raso vyakṣaratsa pūyannivāśeta so'bravīdādīryeva bata ma eṣa
analyzed: atha adārān indrasya ojaḥ stha iti yatra vai enam indraḥ ojasā paryagṛhṇāt tat asya  parigṛhītasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat sa pūyan iva aśeta saḥ bravīt ādīrya iva bata me eṣa
translated: 'In the strength of Indra,' (with these words he takes up) the Darbha grass blades. Where Indra then seized him with his strength,

original: raso'stauṣīditi tasmādādārā atha yatpūyannivāśeta🔽tasmātpūtīkāstasmādagnāvāhutirivābhyāhitā jvalanti tasmādu surabhayo yajñasya hi
analyzed: rasoḥ tauṣīt iti tasmāt ādārāḥ atha yat pūyan iva āśeta  tasmāt pūtīkāḥ tasmāt agnau āhutiḥ iva abhyāhitā jvalanti tasmāt u surabhayaḥ yajñasya hi
translated: from that (part) of him, when seized, the sap flowed out. He lay there as if putrid. He said, 'Verily, this sap of mine has been praised.' Therefore (the blades are called) âdâra. And because he lay there as if putrid,

original: rasātsambhūtā atha yadenaṃ tadindra ojasā paryagṛhṇāttasmādāhendrasyauja stheti
analyzed: rasāt sambhūtāḥ atha yat enam tat indraḥ ojasā paryagṛhṇāt tasmāt āha indrasya ojaḥ stha iti
translated: therefore (they are called) pûtîka. Therefore they blaze up when thrown on the fire as if they were an oblation. Therefore they are fragrant, for they have sprung from the sap of the sacrifice. And because Indra then seized him with his strength, therefore he says, 'In the strength of Indra.'

original: makhasya vo'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyā makhāya tvā makhasya tvā🔽śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athājākṣīram yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya śugudakrāmattato'jā
analyzed: makhasya vā udya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ makhāya tvā makhasya tvā  śīrṣṇaḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ  atha ajā kṣīram yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya śuc udakrāmat tatas jā
translated: 'May I to-day prosper the head of your Makha on the place of the sacrifice on earth. Thee to Makha! Thee to the head of Makha!' The meaning of this is the same as before.

original: samabhavattayaivainametacucā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti makhāya tvā makhasya🔽tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: samabhavat tayā eva enam etat cucā samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti makhāya tvā makhasya  tvā śīrṣṇaḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: Then (he takes) goat's milk. When the sacrifice had its head cut off, its life-sap flowed away. From it the she-goat was produced. With that same life-sap he supplies it, makes it whole. 'Thee to Makha! Thee to the head of Makha!' The meaning of this is the same as before.

original: tānvā etānpañca sambhārānsambharati pāṅkto yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pañcartavaḥ
analyzed: tān vai etān pañca sambhārān sambharati pāṅktaḥ yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pañca ṛtavaḥ
translated: He collects those five requisites. The sacrifice is fivefold, the animal victim is fivefold, five are the seasons of the year,

original: samvatsarasya samvatsara eṣa ya eṣa tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti
analyzed: samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ eṣa yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti
translated: the year is he that shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies.

original: tāntsambhṛtānabhimṛśati makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athottarataḥ pariśritam bhavati tadabhiprayanto japanti praitu brahmaṇaspatirityeṣa
analyzed: tān sambhṛtān abhimṛśati makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti asau eva bandhuḥ  atha uttaratas pariśritam bhavati tat abhiprayantaḥ japanti praitu brahmaṇaspatiḥ iti eṣa
translated: Having collected them, he touches them with, 'Thee to Makha! Thee to the head of Makha!' The meaning of this is the same as before.

original: vai brahmaṇaspatirya eṣa tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha
analyzed: vai brahmaṇaspatiḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha
translated: Then there is a fence on the north side. Going towards it they mutter, 'Let Brahmanaspati go forward,'--for he who shines yonder is Brahmanaspati, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says,🔽'Let Brahmanaspati go forward.'

original: praitu brahmaṇaspatiriti pradevyetu sūnṛteti devī hyeṣā sūnṛtācā vīraṃ naryam🔽paṅktirādhasamityupastautyevainametanmahayatyeva devā yajñaṃ nayantu na iti🔽sarvānevāsmā etaddevānabhigoptṝ/nkaroti / / /🔽pariśritam bhavati etadvai devā abibhayuryadvai na imamiha rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā na
analyzed: praitu brahmaṇaspatiḥ iti pradevī etu sūnṛtā iti devī hi eṣā sūnṛtācā vīram naryam  paṅkti rādhasam iti upastauti eva enam etat mahayati eva devāḥ yajñam nayantu naḥ iti  sarvān eva asmai etat devān abhigoptṝn karoti  pariśritam bhavati etat vai devāḥ abibhayuḥ yat vai naḥ imam iha rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrāḥ na
translated: 'Let the lord of prayer go forward,'--for the lord of prayer is the Brahman (priesthood and prayer);--'let Sûnyata go forward,'--Sûnyata doubtless is the sacrifice;--'let Sûryâ go forward,'--Sûryâ doubtless is this (earth);--'let Sâvitri go forward,'--Sâvitri doubtless is the Gâyatrî;--'let Bârhatî go forward,'--Bârhatî doubtless is the Anushtubh;--'let Ushnih go forward,'--Ushnih doubtless is the Trishtubh;--'let Kakup go forward,'--Kakup doubtless is the Gagatî;--'let the divine Sarasvatî go forward,'--Sarasvatî doubtless is speech;--'let the divine Pûshan go forward,'--Pûshan doubtless is the lord of cattle;--'let the divine Dhâtri go forward,'--Dhâtri doubtless is this (earth);--'let the divine Vidhatri go forward,'--Vidhatri doubtless is yonder (sky);--'let the divine Jâtri go forward,'--Jâtri doubtless is the wind;--'let the divine Sûrya go forward,'--Sûrya doubtless is the all-seeing one;--'let the divine Maruts go forward,'--the Maruts doubtless are the clans (or troops) of gods;--'let the divine Indra go forward,'--Indra doubtless is the king of the gods;--'let the divine waters go forward,'--the waters doubtless are the mothers of the gods;--'let the divine plants go forward,'--the plants doubtless are the sisters of the gods;--'let the divine trees go forward,'--the trees doubtless are the kinsmen of the gods;--'let the divine quarters go forward,'--the quarters doubtless are the guardians of the gods;--'let the divine sky go forward,'--the sky doubtless is the highest of the gods;--'let the divine speech go forward,'--speech doubtless is the best of the gods;--'let the divine breath go forward,'--the breath doubtless is the most firmly established of the gods;--'let the divine eye go forward,'--the eye doubtless is the most divine of the gods;--'let the divine ear go forward,'--the ear doubtless is the most divine of the gods;--'let the divine mind go forward,'

original: hanyuriti tasmā etām puram paryaśrayaṃstathaivāsmā ayametām puram pariṣrayati / / /🔽atha khare sādayati makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhuratha🔽mṛtpiṇḍamapādāya mahāvīraṃ karoti makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva🔽bandhuḥ prādeśamātram prādeśamātramiva hi śiro madhye saṅgṛhītam madhye🔽saṅgṛhītamiva hi śiro'thāsyopariṣṭāttryaṅgulam mukhamunnayati
analyzed: hanyuḥ iti tasmai etām puram paryaśrayan tathā eva asmai ayam etām puram pariṣrayati 🔽atha khare sādayati makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti asau eva bandhuḥ atha 🔽mṛd piṇḍam apādāya mahāvīram karoti makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti asau eva 🔽bandhuḥ prādeśa mātram prādeśa mātram iva hi śiraḥ madhye saṅgṛhītam madhye 🔽saṅgṛhītam iva hi śiraḥ tha asya upariṣṭāt tri aṅgulam mukham unnayati

original: nāsikāmevāsminnetaddadhāti taṃ niṣṭhitamabhimṛśati makhasya śiro'sīti makhasya
analyzed: nāsikām eva asmin etat dadhāti tam niṣṭhitam abhimṛśati makhasya śiraḥ asi iti makhasya
translated: He puts it on the nose; verily he bestows it on him. He touches it when it is set up, with 'Thou art the head of Makha';

original: hyetatsaumyasya śira evamitarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīṃ rauhiṇakapāle / / /
analyzed: hi etat saumyasya śiraḥ evam itarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīm rauhiṇa kapāle
translated: for this (altar) is the head of the Makha, of Soma. In like manner the other two (altars), silently the two swelling (bricks), silently the two Rauhina potsherds.

original: prajāpatirvā eṣa yajño bhavati ubhayam vā etatprajāpatirniruktaścāniruktaśca
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai eṣa yajñaḥ bhavati ubhayam vai etat prajāpatiḥ niruktaḥ ca a niruktaḥ ca
translated: This sacrifice is Prajapati. Prajapati is both: he is both defined and undefined,

original: parimitaścāparimitaśca tadyadyajuṣā karoti yadevāsya niruktam parimitaṃ rūpaṃ
analyzed: parimitaḥ ca aparimitaḥ ca tat yat yajuṣā karoti yat eva asya niruktam parimitam rūpam
translated: both limited and unlimited. In that he does (the rite) with a Yajus formula, whatever defined, limited form he has,

original: tadasya tena saṃskarotyatha yattūṣṇīṃ yadevāsyāniruktamaparimitaṃ rūpaṃ tadasya
analyzed: tat asya tena saṃskaroti atha yat tūṣṇīm yat eva asya aniruktam aparimitam rūpam tat asya
translated: that he thereby perfects. In that (he does it) silently, whatever undefined, unlimited form he has,

original: tena saṃskaroti sa ha vā etaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtsnam prajāpatiṃ saṃskaroti ya evam🔽vidvānetadevaṃ karotyathopaśayāyai piṇḍam pariśinaṣṭi prāyaścittibhyaḥ / / /🔽atha gavedhukābhirhinvati yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣarattata etā oṣadhayo
analyzed: tena saṃskaroti sa ha vai etam sarvam kṛtsnam prajāpatim saṃskaroti yaḥ evam  vidvān etat evam karoti atha upaśayāyai piṇḍam pariśinaṣṭi prāyaścittibhyaḥ  atha gavedhukābhiḥ hinvati yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat tatas etāḥ oṣadhayaḥ
translated: that he thereby perfects. He who knowing thus does this thus, perfects the whole Prajapati.🔽Then he cuts off a lump for the Upasaya, for the atonement (of sin).

original: jajñire tenaivainametadrasena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti makhāya tvā makhasya
analyzed: jajñire tena eva enam etat rasena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti makhāya tvā makhasya
translated: Then he besmears (the altar) with the Gavedhukas. The sap of the sacrifice, when its head was cut off, was spilt. From it these plants were born. With that same sap he supplies it, makes it whole. 'For Makha thee!' (with these words) he besmears (the altar); 'for Makha's head thee!'

original: tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhurevamitarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīṃ rauhiṇakapāle / / /🔽athaināndhūpayati aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmīti vṛṣā vā aśvo vīryam vai🔽vṛṣā vīryeṇaivainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti devayajane pṛthivyā makhāya🔽tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhurevamitarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣnīṃ
analyzed: tvā śīrṣṇaḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ evam itarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīm rauhiṇa kapāle  atha enān dhūpayati aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi iti vṛṣā vai aśvaḥ vīryam vai  vṛṣā vīryeṇa eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti devayajane pṛthivyāḥ makhāya  tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇaḥ iti asau eva bandhuḥ evam itarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣnīm
translated: 'Thee for the head', (with these words he anoints) the head; in the same way the other two (parts of the animal); silently the two fat-pieces; silently the two Rauhina cakes.🔽Then he fumigates it with (the verse), 'I fumigate thy hair, O horse, the strong one's, with the fragrant one' . The horse is a male, and the male is strength;🔽with strength he thus supplies it, makes it whole. 'On the altar of the earth, for Makha' .🔽'Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha' . The same explanation (applies as above). Silently the two fat-pieces; silently the two Rauhina cakes.

original: rauhiṇakapāle / / /🔽athaināñcrapayati śṛtaṃ hi devānāmiṣṭkābhiḥ śrapayatyeta vā etadakurvata🔽yathāyathaitadyajñasya śiro'cidyata tābhirevainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti🔽tadu yenaiva suśṛtāḥ syustena śrapayedatha pacanamavadhāya mahāvīramavadadhāti🔽makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva bandhurevamitarau tūṣṇīm pinvane
