original: tūṣṇīṃ rauhiṇakapāle tāndivaivopavapeddivodvapedaharhi devānām / / /
analyzed: tūṣṇīm rauhiṇa kapāle tān divā eva upavapet divā udvapet aharhi devānām
translated: He should silently put them on the Rauhina pot, on the heaven; he should take them off from the heaven, for the day belongs to the gods.

original: sa udvapati ṛjave tvetyasau vai loka ṛjuḥ satyaṃ hyṛjuḥ satyameṣa ya eṣa tavpatyeṣa
analyzed: saḥ udvapati ṛjave tvā iti asau vai lokaḥ ṛjuḥ satyam hi ṛjuḥ satyam eṣa yaḥ eṣa tavpati eṣa
translated: He takes them off, with 'For the straight one to thee!' The straight one, doubtless, is yonder (heavenly) world; for the straight one is the truth, and the straight one is yonder (world).

original: u prathamaḥ pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāharjave tveti / / /
analyzed: u prathamaḥ pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha ṛjave tvā iti
translated: This is the first Pravargya; he thus gratifies him (Agni); therefore he says, 'For the straight one to thee!'

original: sādhave tveti ayam vai sādhuryo'yam pavata eṣa hīmāṃlokāntsiddho'nupavata eṣa
analyzed: sādhave tvā iti ayam vai sādhuḥ yaḥ ayam pavate eṣa hi imān lokān siddhaḥ unupavate eṣa
translated: 'For the good one to thee!' The good one, doubtless, is he who blows here (the wind); for he blows along these worlds as one who has succeeded.

original: u dvitīyaḥ pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha sādhave tveti / / /🔽sukṣityai tveti ayam vai lokaḥ sukṣitirasminhi loke sarvāṇi bhūtāni kṣiyantyatho
analyzed: u dvitīyaḥ pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha sādhave tvā iti  su kṣityai tvā iti ayam vai lokaḥ su kṣitiḥ asmin hi loke sarvāṇi bhūtāni kṣiyanti atho
translated: This is the second Pravargya; he thus gratifies him; therefore he says, 'For the good one to thee!'

original: agnirvai sukṣitiragnirhyevāsmiṃloke sarvāṇi bhūtāni kṣiyatyeṣa u tṛtīyaḥ🔽pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha sukṣityai tveti tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīṃ🔽rauhiṇakapāle / / /
analyzed: agniḥ vai su kṣitiḥ agniḥ hi eva asmin loke sarvāṇi bhūtāni kṣiyati eṣaḥ u tṛtīyaḥ  pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha su kṣityai tvā iti tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīm  rauhiṇa kapāle
translated: 'For the well-settled to thee!' The well-settled, doubtless, is this (terrestrial) world; for in this world all beings are settled. Moreover, the well-settled is Agni; for in this world Agni settles all beings. This is the third Pravargya;🔽he thus gratifies him; therefore he says, 'For the well-settled to thee!' Silently (he puts on) the two Pinvane cups, silently (he puts on) the two Rauhina potsherds.

original: athainānācṛṇatti ajāyai payasā makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇa ityasāveva
analyzed: atha enān ācṛṇatti ajāyai payasā makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe iti asau eva
translated: He then bastes them with the milk of a she-goat, with 'For Makha to thee! for the head of Makha to thee!' The same (verse) he repeats a second time, with 'For Makha to thee! for the body of Makha to thee!' and a third time, with 'For Makha to thee! for the back of Makha to thee!'

original: bandhurevamitarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīṃ rauhiṇakapāle / / /
analyzed: bandhuḥ evam itarau tūṣṇīm pinvane tūṣṇīm rauhiṇa kapāle
translated: The other two silently on the Pinvane, silently on the Rauhina-kapala.

original: athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
translated: Now, this is the life, this is the light which enters him who either recites this (hymn) or eats (the Rauhina-kapala).

original: vratacaryā yā sṛṣṭau / / /🔽sa yadaitadātithyena pracarati atha pravargyeṇa cariṣyanpuropasado'greṇa
analyzed: vrata caryā yā sṛṣṭau  sa yadā etat ātithyena pracarati atha pravargyeṇa cariṣyan purā upasadā ugreṇa
translated: The observance of his vow is as at the creation.🔽When he proceeds with the guest-offering, then, wishing to perform the Pravargya, he strews eastward-pointed Kusa grass in front of the Garhapatya

original: gārhapatyam prācaḥ kuśāntsaṃstīrya dvandvam pātrāṇyupasādayatyupayamanīm
analyzed: gārhapatyam prācaḥ kuśān saṃstīrya dvandvam pātrāṇi upasādayati upayamanīm
translated: and places the vessels in pairs: the Upayamanî,

original: mahāvīram parīṣāsau pinvane rauhiṇakapāle rauhiṇahavanyau srucau yadu
analyzed: mahāvīram parīṣāsau pinvane rauhiṇa kapāle rauhiṇa havanyau srucau yadu
translated: the Mahâvîra, the Paribhûti, the Pinvane, the Rauhina-kapâla, the two Rauhina-hâvanî ladles, and whatever else there is.

original: cānyadbhavati taddaśa daśākṣarā vai virāḍvirāḍvai
analyzed: ca anyat bhavati tat daśa daśa akṣarā vai virāj virāj vai
translated: That makes ten. The Virâg consists of ten syllables, and the sacrifice is Virâg.

original: yajñastadvirājamevaitadyajñamabhisampādayatyatha yaddvandvamdvandvam vai
analyzed: yajñaḥ tat virājam eva etat yajñam abhisampādayati atha yat dvandvam dvandvam vai
translated: He thus makes the sacrifice complete with the Virâg. Then as to why (it is done) in pairs. Pair means strength.

original: vīryam yadā vai dvau saṃrabhete atha tau vīryaṃ kuruto dvandvam vai mithunam
analyzed: vīryam yadā vai dvau saṃrabhete atha tau vīryam kurutaḥ dvandvam vai mithunam
translated: For when two men join together, then they exert strength. Pair means a couple, procreation.

original: prajananam mithunenaivainametatprajananena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: prajananam mithunena eva enam etat prajananena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: By a couple, by procreation, he thus supplies him (Agni) and makes him complete.

original: athādhvaryuḥ prokṣaṇīrādāyopottiṣṭhannāha brahmanpracariṣyāmo
analyzed: atha adhvaryuḥ prokṣaṇīḥ ādāya upottiṣṭhan āha brahman pracariṣyāmaḥ
translated: The Adhvaryu then, taking the sprinkling water, stands up, and says, 'Brahman, we will proceed;

original: hotarabhiṣṭuhīti brahmā vai yajñasya dakṣiṇata āste'bhigoptā🔽tamevaitadāhāpramatta āssva yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhāsyāma iti hotarabhiṣṭuhīti yajño
analyzed: hotar abhiṣṭuhi iti brahmā vai yajñasya dakṣiṇatas āste abhigoptā  tam eva etat āha apramattaḥ āssva yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhāsyāmaḥ iti hotar abhiṣṭuhi iti yajñaḥ
translated: Hotri, praise!' The Brahman sits on the right (south) side of the sacrifice as its guardian;

original: vai hotā tamevaitadāha yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhehīti pratipadyate hotā / / /🔽brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāditi asau vā ādityo brahmāharahaḥ🔽purastājjāyata eṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha brahma jajñānam
analyzed: vai hotā tam eva etat āha yajñasya śiraḥ pratidhehi iti pratipadyate hotā  brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt iti asau vai ādityaḥ brahma ahar ahar  purastāt jāyate eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha brahma jajñānam
translated: to him he says, 'Sit thou heedfully: we will replace the head of the sacrifice.' 'Hotri, praise!'--the Hotri, doubtless, is the sacrifice: to him he says, 'Replace the head of the sacrifice!' The Hotri responds . . .

original: prathamam purastādityatha prokṣatyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽sa prokṣati yamāya tvetyeṣa vai yamo ya eṣa tapatyeṣa hīdaṃ sarvaṃ🔽yamayatyetenedaṃ sarvaṃ yatameṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha
analyzed: prathamam purastāt iti atha prokṣati asau eva bandhuḥ  sa prokṣati yamāya tvā iti eṣa vai yamaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa hi idam sarvam  yamayati etena idam sarvam yatamaḥ eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha
translated: 'The Brahman, the first-born, in front,'--the Brahman is yonder sun; day by day he is born in front (of us): he is the Pravargya; it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'The Brahman, the first-born, in front.' He then sprinkles (the mound): the significance of this is the same . . .

original: yamāya tveti / / /
analyzed: yamāya tvā iti
translated: He sprinkles (the mound) with , 'To Yama thee!'--he, indeed, is Yama who shines yonder, for he rules over everything here, and by him everything here is ruled: he is the Pravargya; it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'To Yama thee.' . . .🔽.

original: makhāya tveti eṣa vai makho ya eṣa tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti
analyzed: makhāya tvā iti eṣa vai makhaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti
translated: 'For Makha thee!' Makha, doubtless, is he that shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies;

original: tasmādāha makhāya tveti / / /🔽sūryasya tvā tapasa iti eṣa vai sūryo ya eṣa tapatyeṣa
analyzed: tasmāt āha makhāya tvā iti  sūryasya tvā tapase iti eṣa vai sūryaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa
translated: therefore he says, 'For Makha thee.'

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha sūryasya tvā tapasa iti / / /🔽pūrvayā dvārā sthūṇāṃ nirhṛtya dakṣiṇato niminvanti yathaināṃ
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha sūryasya tvā tapase iti  pūrvayā dvārā sthūṇām nirhṛtya dakṣiṇatas niminvanti yathā enām
translated: 'For the heat of the sun thee!' The sun, doubtless, is he that shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'For the heat of the sun thee.'

original: hotābhiṣṭuvanparāpaśyedyajño vai hotā sa evāsyāmetadyajñam pratidadhāti tathaiṣā
analyzed: hotā abhiṣṭuvan parāpaśyet yajñaḥ vai hotā saḥ eva asyām etat yajñam pratidadhāti tathā eṣā
translated: Having carried out the post by the front door, they set it up south (of the Gârhapatya fire), so that the Hotri (seated north of the fire) may look at it; for the Hotri is the sacrifice: he thus puts the sacrifice into it; and thus

original: gharmam pinvate / / /
analyzed: gharmam pinvate
translated: it swells for the Gharma.

original: agreṇāhavanīyam samrāḍāsandīm paryāhṛtya dakṣiṇataḥ prācīmāsādayatyuttarāṃ
analyzed: agreṇa āhavanīyam samrāj āsandīm paryāhṛtya dakṣiṇatas prācīm āsādayati uttarām
translated: Having carried round the imperial seat in front of the Âhavanîya, he places it south (of the Gârhapatya) with its opening to the east,

original: rājāsandyai / / /🔽audumbarī bhavati ūrgvai rasa udumbara ūrjaivainametadrasena samardhayati
analyzed: rāja āsandyai  audumbarī bhavati ūrj vai rasaḥ udumbaraḥ ūrjā eva enam etat rasena samardhayati
translated: north of the king's seat.

original: kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /🔽aṃsadaghnā bhavati aṃsayorvā idaṃ śiraḥ pratiṣthitam tadaṃsayorevaitaciraḥ
analyzed: kṛtsnam karoti  aṃsa daghnā bhavati aṃsayoḥ vai idam śiraḥ pratiṣthitam tat aṃsayoḥ
translated: It is made of Udumbara wood; for the Udumbara is nourishment, food: with nourishment, with food, he thus supplies and completes it.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayati / / /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: It reaches up to the shoulder, for on the shoulders this head is supported: he thus supports the head on the shoulders.

original: bālvajībhī rajjubhirvyutā bhavati yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣarattata etā
analyzed: rajjubhiḥ vyutā bhavati yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat tatas etā
translated: It is fastened with balbaja and ropes. When the sacrifice was beheaded, its life-sap flowed out. From that

original: oṣadhayo jajñire tenaivainametadrasena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti / / /🔽atha yaduttarata āsādayati yajño vai somaḥ śiraḥ pravargya uttaram vai🔽śirastasmāduttarata āsādayatyatho rājā vai somaḥ samrāṭ pravargya uttaram vai
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ jajñire tena eva enam etat rasena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti  atha yat uttaratas āsādayati yajñaḥ vai somaḥ śiraḥ pravargyaḥ uttaram vai  śiraḥ tasmāt uttaratas āsādayati atha u rājā vai somaḥ samrāj pravargyaḥ uttaram vai
translated: these plants were born. With that same life-sap he supplies it, makes it whole.

original: rājyātsāmrājyaṃ tasmāduttarata āsādayati / / /🔽sa yatraitāṃ hotānvāha añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā iti tadetam pracaraṇīyam
analyzed: rājyāt sāmrājyam tasmāt uttaratas āsādayati  sa yatra etām hotā anvāha añjanti yam prathayantaḥ na viprāḥ iti tat etam pracaraṇīyam
translated: And as to why he places it north (of the Gârhapatya),--Soma is the sacrifice, and the Pravargya is its head: the north is the higher (direction), and the head is higher (than the body); for this reason he places it north (of the Gârhapatya). And again, Soma is a king, and the Pravargya is a supreme king: the higher is higher than the royal, for this reason he places it north (of the Gârhapatya).

original: mahāvīramājyena samanakti devastvā savitā madhvānaktviti savitā vai devānām
analyzed: mahāvīram ājyena samanakti devaḥ tvā savitā madhvā anaktu iti savitā vai devānām
translated: When the Hotri recites this , 'Whom the priests anoint, as if stretching him,' then he besmears that Mahâvîra (vessel) for the commencement (of the rite) with ghee, with , 'May the god Savitri besmear thee with honey!' for Savitri is the impeller of the gods.

original: prasavitā sarvamvā idam madhu yadidaṃ kiṃ ca tadenamanena sarveṇa samanakti
analyzed: prasavitā sarvam vai idam madhu yat idam kim ca tat enam anena sarveṇa samanakti
translated: Now this is all honey, to wit, whatever there is here: with that he thus besmears it on all sides.

original: tadasmai savitā prasavitā prasauti tasmādāha devastvā savitā madhvānaktviti / / /
analyzed: tat asmai savitā prasavitā prasauti tasmāt āha devaḥ tvā savitā madhvā anaktu iti
translated: Savitri, the impeller, impels it for him: for this reason he says, 'May the god Savitri besmear thee with honey!'

original: athottarataḥ sikatā upakīrṇā bhavanti tadrajatam hiraṇyamadhastādupāsyati pṛthivyāḥ🔽saṃspṛśaspāhītyetadvai devā abibhayuryadvai na imamadhastādrakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā na🔽hanyurityagnervā etadreto yaddhiraṇyaṃ nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyā atho pṛthivyu🔽ha vā etasmādbibhayāṃ cakāra yadvai māyaṃ taptaḥ śuśucāno na hiṃsyāditi tadevāsyā
analyzed: atha uttaratas sikatāḥ upakīrṇāḥ bhavanti tat rajatam hiraṇyam adhastāt upāsyati pṛthivyāḥ  saṃspṛśaspāhi iti etat vai devāḥ abibhayuḥ yat vai naḥ imam adhastāt rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrāḥ na  hanyuḥ iti agneḥ vai etat retaḥ yat hiraṇyam nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai atha u pṛthivī  ha vai etasmāt bibhayām cakāra yat vai mā ayam taptaḥ śuśucānaḥ na hiṃsyāt iti tat eva asyāḥ
translated: Then sand is scattered to the north; he places the silver coin underneath with, 'Protect it from contact with the earth!' for the gods were afraid lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should destroy this (Agni) from below. Now that gold is the seed of Agni: for the sake of safety from the Rakshas, the fiends. Moreover, the earth was afraid of him, thinking, 'Lest he, being heated and glowing, should injure me!' That (gold) is his womb: in it he settles him (Agni) for the sake of safety.

original: etadantardadhāti rajatam bhavati rajataiva hīyam pṛthivī / / /
analyzed: etat antardadhāti rajatam bhavati rajatā eva hi iyam pṛthivī
translated: Then sand is scattered on the north side. He places the silver (plate) with the gold underneath, with, 'Touch not the earth!' For at that time the gods were afraid lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should destroy this (Agni) from below. Now that which is gold is Agni's seed: (it serves) for the repelling of the Rakshas, the fiends. Moreover, the earth was afraid of him, lest he, being heated and glowing, should injure her: he thus conceals that (gold) within her. It is silver, for this earth is indeed silver.

original: sa yatraitāṃ hotānvāha saṃsīdasva mahām mahām asīti tadubhayata ādīptā🔽mauñjāḥ pralavā bhavanti tānupāsya teṣu pravṛṇakti yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso🔽vyakṣarattata etā oṣadhayo jajñire tenaivainametadrasena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ
analyzed: sa yatra etām hotā anvāha saṃsīdasva mahān mahān asi iti tat ubhayatas ādīptā  mauñjāḥ pralavāḥ bhavanti tān upāsya teṣu pravṛṇakti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya  vyakṣarat tatas etāḥ oṣadhayaḥ jajñire tena eva enam etat rasena samardhayati kṛtsnam
translated: And when the Hotri recites this , 'Sit down, O great one! thou art great,' then (the Adhvaryu) puts on (the gold plate) on both sides.

original: karoti / / /
analyzed: karoti
translated: There are Mauñja blades (of grass) which are burning on both sides: he places them on (the gold plate), and puts (the gold plate) on them. The sap of the sacrifice, when its head was cut off, flowed away. From it these plants sprang up: with that same sap he thus supplies and completes it.

original: atha yadubhayata ādīptā bhavanti sarvābhya evaitaddigbhyo rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā
analyzed: atha yat ubhayatas ādīptāḥ bhavanti sarvābhyaḥ eva etat digbhyaḥ rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā
translated: And as to why they are burning on both sides, it is for the repelling of the Rakshas, the fiends, from all the quarters.

original: apahanti tasminpravṛjyamāne patnī śiraḥ prorṇute tapto vā eṣa śuśucāno bhavati
analyzed: apahanti tasmin pravṛjyamāne patnī śiraḥ prorṇute taptaḥ vai eṣa śuśucānaḥ bhavati
translated: When it is being turned round, the wife strokes its head; for it is heated and glowing.

original: nenme'yaṃ taptaḥ śuśucānaścakṣuḥ pramuṣṇāditi / / /
analyzed: na id meyam taptaḥ śuśucānaḥ cakṣuḥ pramuṣṇāt iti
translated: 'Lest this heated and glowing eye of mine should blind me.'

original: sa pravṛṇakti arcirasi śocirasi tapo'sītyeṣa vai gharmo ya eṣa tapati sarvam vā
analyzed: sa pravṛṇakti arciḥ asi śociḥ asi tapaḥ asi iti eṣa vai gharmaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati sarvam vā
translated: He turns it round, with the text , 'Thou art the flame, thou art the glow, thou art the heat.' For that Gharma is the same as he who shines yonder; and this (earth) is everything here.

original: etadeṣa tadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāhārcirasi śocirasi tapo'sīti / / /
analyzed: etat eṣa tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha arciḥ asi śociḥ asi tapaḥ asi iti
translated: He thus gratifies him (the sun) alone: therefore he says, 'Thou art the flame, thou art the glow, thou art the heat.'

original: athāsyāmāśiṣa āśāsta iyam vai yajño'syāmevaitadāśiṣa āśāste tā asmā iyaṃ sarvāḥ🔽samardhayati / / /🔽anādhṛṣṭā purastāditi anādhṛṣṭā hyeṣā
analyzed: atha asyām āśiṣaḥ āśāste iyam vai yajñaḥ usyām eva etat āśiṣaḥ āśāste tāḥ asmai iyam sarvāḥ  samardhayati  an ādhṛṣṭā purastāt iti an ādhṛṣṭā hi eṣā
translated: He then invokes blessings on it; for this sacrifice is this (earth): on this (earth) he invokes blessings, and this (earth) endows him with all those blessings.

original: purastādrakṣobhirnāṣṭrābhiragnerādhipatya ityagnimevāsyā adhipatiṃ karoti🔽nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyā āyurme dā ityāyurevātmandhatte tatho sarvamāyureti / / /
analyzed: purastāt rakṣobhiḥ nāṣṭrābhiḥ agneḥ ādhipatye iti agnim eva asyāḥ adhipatim karoti  nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai āyuḥ me dāḥ iti āyuḥ eva ātman dhatte tathā u sarvam āyuḥ eti
translated: 'Unassailable in front,'--for it is indeed unassailable in front;--'under the over-lordship of Agni,'--he thus makes Agni its over-lord;--'for the destruction of the Rakshas and evil spirits,'--he thus destroys the Rakshas and evil spirits;--'give me life,'--he thus takes life into himself, and so he attains the whole (extent of) life.

original: putravatī dakṣiṇata iti nātra tirohitamivāstīndrasyādhipatya itīndramevāsyā
analyzed: putravatī dakṣiṇatas iti na atra tirohitam iva asti indrasya ādhipatye iti indram eva asyā
translated: 'Rich in sons on the right,'--there is nothing obscure in this;--'under the over-lordship of Indra,'--he thus makes Indra its over-lord;--'for the destruction of the Rakshas and evil spirits,'--he thus destroys the Rakshas and evil spirits;--'give me life,'--he thus takes life into himself, and so he attains the whole (extent of) life.

original: adhipatiṃ karoti nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyai prajām me dā iti prajāmeva
analyzed: adhipatim karoti nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai prajām me dāḥ iti prajām eva
translated: 'Give me offspring', he says; verily he takes offspring

original: paśūnātmandhatte tatho ha putrī paśumānbhavati / / /🔽suṣadā paścādivti nātra tirohitamivāsti devasya saviturādhipatya iti devamevāsyai
analyzed: paśūn ātman dhatte tathā u ha putrī paśumān bhavati  suṣadā paścāt ivti na atra tirohitam iva asti devasya savituḥ ādhipatye iti devam eva asyai
translated: to himself; so does he become possessed of offspring and cattle.

original: savitāramadhipatiṃ karoti nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyai cakṣurme dā iti
analyzed: savitāram adhipatim karoti nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai cakṣuḥ me dāḥ iti
translated: 'The well-supported on the west', he says; there is nothing obscure about this. 'Under the overlordship of god Savitr', he says; verily he makes god Savitr his overlord, to smite away the Raksases. 'Give me sight', he says;

original: cakṣurevātmandhatte tatho ha cakṣuṣmānbhavati / / /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ eva ātman dhatte tathā u ha cakṣuṣmān bhavati
translated: verily he takes sight to himself; so does he become possessed of sight.

original: āśrutiruttarata iti āśrāvayannuttarata ityevaitadāha dhāturādhipatya iti
analyzed: āśrutiḥ uttaratas iti āśrāvayan uttaratas iti eva etat āha dhātuḥ ādhipatye iti
translated: 'The audible on the north', he says; that is, 'the invocator on the north'. 'Under the overlordship of the supporter', he says;

original: dhātāramevāsyā adhipatiṃ karoti nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyai rāyaspoṣam me dā
analyzed: dhātāram eva asyāḥ adhipatim karoti nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai rāyaspoṣam me dāḥ
translated: verily he makes the supporter his overlord, to smite away the Raksases. 'Give me increase of wealth', he says;

original: iti rayimeva puṣṭimātmandhatte tatho ha rayimānpuṣṭimānbhavati / / /
analyzed: iti rayim eva puṣṭim ātman dhatte tathā u ha rayimān puṣṭimān bhavati
translated: verily he takes to himself wealth and prosperity; so does he become possessed of wealth and prosperity.

original: vidhṛtirupariṣṭāditi vidhārayannupariṣṭādityevaitadāha bṛhaspaterādhipatya iti
analyzed: vidhṛtiḥ upariṣṭāt iti vidhārayan upariṣṭāt iti eva etat āha bṛhaspateḥ ādhipatye iti
translated: 'The supporter above', he says; that is, 'the supporter above'. 'Under the overlordship of Brhaspati', he says;

original: bṛhaspatimevāsyā adhipatiṃ karoti nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyā ojo me dā ityoja
analyzed: bṛhaspatim eva asyāḥ adhipatim karoti nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai ojaḥ me dāḥ iti ojaḥ
translated: verily he makes Brhaspati his overlord, to smite away the Raksases. 'Give me strength', he says;🔽verily he takes strength to himself;

original: evātmandhatte tathaujasvī balavānbhavati / / /
analyzed: eva ātman dhatte tathā ojasvī balavān bhavati
translated: Thus he takes to himself the self, and so becomes strong and powerful.

original: atha dakṣiṇata uttānena pāṇinā nihnute viśvābhyo mā nāṣṭrābhyaspāhīti sarvābhyo
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇatas uttānena pāṇinā nihnute viśvābhyaḥ mā nāṣṭrābhyaḥ spāhi iti sarvābhyaḥ
translated: Then he strokes (the horse) on the right side with his hand turned upwards, with (the verse), 'Protect me from all evil spirits' . With all evil spirits,

original: mārtibhyo gopāyetyevaitadāha yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa
analyzed: mā ārtibhyaḥ gopāya iti eva etat āha yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat sa
translated: with all calamities, he says this. The sap of the sacrifice, when the head was cut off, flowed away,

original: pitṝ/nagacattrayā vai pitarastairevainametatsamardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: pitṝn agacat trayāḥ vai pitaraḥ taiḥ eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: and went to the Fathers. There are three Fathers: with them he thus supplies it, he makes it whole.

original: athemāmabhimṛśya japati manoraśvāsītyaśvā ha vā iyam bhūtvā manumuvāha
analyzed: atha imām abhimṛśya japati manoḥ aśvā asi iti aśvā ha vai iyam bhūtvā manum uvāha
translated: Then, having stroked this (earth), he mutters, 'The horse of Manu' . For this (earth) was the horse, and carried Manu.

original: so'syāḥ patiḥ prajāpatistenaivainametanmithunena priyeṇa dhāmnā samardhayati🔽kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: saḥ usyāḥ patiḥ prajāpatiḥ tena eva enam etat mithunena priyeṇa dhāmnā samardhayati  kṛtsnam karoti
translated: He is her lord, Pragâpati. With that very pair, with that dear abode, he thus supplies it, he makes it whole.

original: atha vaikaṅkatau śakalau pariśrayati prāñcau svāhā marudbhiḥ pariśrīyasvetyavaraṃ🔽svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmeṣa vai svāhākāro ya eṣa tapatyeṣa u
analyzed: atha vaikaṅkatau śakalau pariśrayati prāñcau svāhā marudbhiḥ pariśrīyasva iti avaram  svāhākāram karoti parām devatām eṣa vai svāhākāraḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u
translated: Then he puts on two chips of the Vaikaṅkata (tree), pointing eastwards, with (the formula), 'Hail! be surrounded by the Maruts.' He makes the call of 'hail!' inferior,

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādavaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti darāṃ devatām / / /
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt avaram svāhākāram karoti darām devatām
translated: and the deity superior. For that 'hail!' is he who shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies. For this reason he makes the call of 'hail!' inferior, and the deity superior.

original: marudbhiḥ pariśrīyasveti viśo vai maruto viśaivaitatkṣatram paribṛṃhati tadidaṃ
analyzed: marudbhiḥ pariśrīyasva iti viśaḥ vai marutaḥ viśā eva etat kṣatram paribṛṃhati tat idam
translated: 'Be surrounded by the Maruts',--the Maruts are the people: he thus surrounds the nobility by the people, and hence this (king) is surrounded by the people.

original: kṣatramubhayato viśā paribṛḍhaṃ tūṣṇīmudañcau tūṣṇīm prāñcau tūṣṇīmudañcau🔽tūṣṇīm prāñcau / / /🔽trayodaśa sampādayati trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsara eṣa ya eṣa
analyzed: kṣatram ubhayatas viśā paribṛḍham tūṣṇīm udañcau tūṣṇīm prāñcau tūṣṇīm udañcau  tūṣṇīm prāñcau  trayodaśa sampādayati trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ eṣa yaḥ eṣa
translated: 'Be thou surrounded by the Maruts,'--the Maruts are the people: he thus surrounds the nobility by the people, and hence this nobility is surrounded on both sides by the people. Silently (he places) the two (stakes) pointing northwards, silently the two pointing eastwards, silently the two pointing northwards, silently the two pointing eastwards.

original: tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmāttrayodaśa sampādayati / / /🔽atha suvarṇaṃ hiraṇyamupariṣṭānnidadhāti divaḥ saṃspṛśaspāhītyetadvai devā🔽abibhayuryadvai na imamupariṣṭādrakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrā na hanyurityagnervā etadreto🔽yaddhiraṇyaṃ nāṣṭrāṇāṃ rakṣasāmapahatyā atho dyaurha vā etasmādbibhayāṃ cakāra
analyzed: tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt trayodaśa sampādayati  atha suvarṇam hiraṇyam upariṣṭāt nidadhāti divaḥ saṃspṛśa spāhi iti etat vai devāḥ  abibhayuḥ yat vai naḥ imam upariṣṭāt rakṣāṃsi nāṣṭrāḥ na hanyuḥ iti agneḥ vai etat retaḥ  yat hiraṇyam nāṣṭrāṇām rakṣasām apahatyai atha u dyauḥ ha vai etasmāt bibhayām cakāra
translated: He places them in such a way that they are thirteen in all;--thirteen months are a year, and the year is he (the sun) that shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is he: it is him he thus gratifies; that is why he places them in such a way that they are thirteen in all.

original: yadvai māyaṃ taptaḥ śuśucāno na hiṃsyāditi tadevāsyā etadantardadhāti haritam
analyzed: yat vai mā ayam taptaḥ śuśucānaḥ na hiṃsyāt iti tat eva asyai etat antardadhāti haritam
translated: He then places a piece of gold on the top, with , 'Touch the heaven, O Agni!' for at that time the gods were afraid lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should destroy this (Agni) of theirs from above. Now that gold is his seed: he thus keeps it from the Rakshas, the fiends. Moreover, the sky was afraid of him, thinking, 'Lest he, being heated and glowing, should injure me!' He thus appeases it, and makes it his own: hence the piece of gold.

original: bhavati hariṇīva hi dyauḥ / / /
analyzed: bhavati hariṇī iva hi dyauḥ
translated: It is green, for the sky is as it were green.

original: atha dhavitrairādhūnoti madhu madhviti triḥ prāṇo vai madhu🔽prāṇamevāsminnetaddadhāti trīṇi bhavanti trayo vai prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno
analyzed: atha dhavitraiḥ ādhūnoti madhu madhu iti tris prāṇaḥ vai madhu  prāṇam eva asmin etat dadhāti trīṇi bhavanti trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ
translated: He then fans (the Gharma) with fans, with (the words), 'Honey, honey,' thrice. Honey means breath;

original: vyānastānevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /🔽athāpasalavi trirdhūnvanti yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa
analyzed: vyānaḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti  atha apasalavi tris dhūnvanti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat sa
translated: he thus puts breath into it. There are three (repetitions), for there are three breaths, the out-breathing, the up-breathing, and the through-breathing: these he thus puts into it.🔽He then fans it thrice from left to right. The sap of the sacrifice, when its head was cut off, flowed away,

original: pitṝ/nagacattrayā vai pitarastairevainametatsamīrayati / / /
analyzed: pitṝn agacat trayāḥ vai pitaraḥ taiḥ eva enam etat samīrayati
translated: and went to the Fathers. There are three Fathers: with them he thus supplies it.

original: apa vā etebhyaḥpraṇāḥ krāmanti ye yajñe dhuvanaṃ tanvate punaḥ prasalavi
analyzed: apa vai etebhyaḥ praṇāḥ krāmanti ye yajñe dhuvanam tanvate punar prasalavi
translated: The vital airs depart from them who perform the fanning at the sacrifice. They fan it thrice from left to right,

original: trirdhūnvanti ṣaṭ sampadyante ṣaḍvā ime śīrṣanprāṇāstānevāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: tris dhūnvanti ṣaṭ sampadyante ṣaṭ vai ime śīrṣan prāṇāḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: that makes six; there are these six vital airs in the head: it is them he thus lays into it.

original: śrapayanti rauhiṇau sa yadārcirjāyate atha hiraṇyamādatte / / /
analyzed: śrapayanti rauhiṇau sa yadā arciḥ jāyate atha hiraṇyam ādatte
translated: They melt the two Rauhiṇa cakes. When the flame arises, he takes the gold.

original: sa yatraitāṃ hotānvāha apnasvatīmaśvinā vācamasme iti
analyzed: sa yatra etām hotā anvāha apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme iti
translated: When the Hotri recites that (verse), 'The inspiriting, O Asvins, is your speech to us,'

original: tadadhvaryurupottiṣṭhannāha rucito gharma iti sa yadi rucitaḥ syācreyānyajamāno
analyzed: tat adhvaryuḥ upottiṣṭhan āha rucitaḥ gharmaḥ iti sa yadi rucitaḥ syāt a creyān yajamānaḥ
translated: then the Adhvaryu, rising, says, 'The Gharma is shining.' If it is shining, the Sacrificer will prosper;

original: bhaviṣyatīti vidyādatha yadyarucitaḥ pāpīyānbhaviṣyatīti vidyādatha yadi naiva🔽rucito nārucito naiva śreyanna pāpīyānbhaviṣyatīti vidyādyathā nveva rucitaḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti vidyāt atha yadi a rucitaḥ pāpīyān bhaviṣyati iti vidyāt atha yadi na eva  rucitaḥ na a rucitaḥ na eva śreyat na pāpīyān bhaviṣyati iti vidyāt yathā nu eva rucitaḥ
translated: If he thinks, 'He will be better,' he should know, 'He will be better.' If he thinks, 'He will be worse,' he should know, 'He will be worse.' If he thinks, 'He will neither be better nor worse,' he should know, 'He will neither be better nor worse.' Just as he thinks,

original: syāttathā dhavitavyaḥ / / /
analyzed: syāt tathā dhavitavyaḥ
translated: If he thinks 'he will be prosperous', he should know 'he will be prosperous'; if he thinks 'he will be wicked', he should know 'he will be wicked'; if he thinks 'he will be neither prosperous nor wicked', he should know 'he will be neither prosperous nor wicked'. As it were, he should act in such a way that he would be prosperous.

original: athaitadvai āyretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanuvā brūte bhakṣ/🔽ayati vā tasya vratacaryā
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anuvā brūte bhakṣ  ayati vā tasya vrata caryā
translated: Now, this is the light, this is the lustre which enters him who recites after this (hymn).

original: yā sṛs/t/au / / /
analyzed: yā sṛstau
translated: He who eats it, or for whom it is eaten, his observance is🔽as it is laid down.

original: sa yadaitadadhvaryuḥ upottiṣṭhannāha rucito gharma iti
analyzed: sa yadā etat adhvaryuḥ upottiṣṭhan āha rucitaḥ gharmaḥ iti
translated: When the Adhvaryu, rising, says, 'The Gharma is approved',

original: tadupotthāyāvakāśairupatiṣṭhante prāṇā vā avakāśāḥ prāṇānevāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: tat upotthāya avakāśaiḥ upatiṣṭhante prāṇāḥ vai avakāśāḥ prāṇān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: rising up, they attend upon it with the Avakā plants; the Avakā plants are the vital airs; verily he places the vital airs in him.

original: ṣaḍupatiṣṭhante ṣaḍvā ime śīrṣanprāṇāstānevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /🔽garbho devānāmiti eṣa vai garbho devānāṃ ya eṣa tapatyeṣa hīdaṃ sarvaṃ
analyzed: ṣaṭ upatiṣṭhante ṣaṭ vai ime śīrṣan prāṇāḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti  garbhaḥ devānām iti eṣa vai garbhaḥ devānām yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa hi idam sarvam
translated: They attend upon it six times; there are these six vital airs in the head; verily he places them in him.

original: gṛhṇātyetenedaṃ sarvaṃ gṛbhītameṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha
analyzed: gṛhṇāti etena idam sarvam gṛbhītam eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha
translated: 'The embryo of the gods', he says; the embryo of the gods is he who shines yonder, for he embraces all this; by him all this is embraced; the Pravargya is he; verily him he delights; therefore he says,

original: garbho devānāmiti / / /
analyzed: garbhaḥ devānām iti
translated: 'The embryo of the gods'.

original: pitā matīnāmiti pitā hyeṣa matīnām patiḥ prajānāmiti patirhyeṣa prajānām / / /
analyzed: pitā matīnām iti pitā hi eṣa matīnām patiḥ prajānām iti patiḥ hi eṣa prajānām
translated: 'The father of thoughts', for he is indeed the father of thoughts; 'the lord of creatures', for he is indeed the lord of creatures.

original: saṃ devo devena savitrāgateti saṃ hi devo devena savitrāgata saṃ sūryeṇa rocata iti saṃ🔽hi sūryeṇa rocate / / /🔽samagniragnināgateti saṃ hyagniragnināgata saṃ daivena savitreti saṃ hi daivena
analyzed: sam devaḥ devena savitrā āgata iti sam hi devaḥ devena savitrā āgata sam sūryeṇa rocate iti sam  hi sūryeṇa rocate  sam agniḥ agninā agata iti sam hi agniḥ agninā agata sam daivena savitrā iti sam hi daivena
translated: 'The god has come together with the god Savitri', for he has indeed come together with the god Savitri; 'he has shone together with the sun', for he has indeed shone together with the sun.

original: savitrāgata saṃ sūryeṇārociṣṭeti saṃ hi sūryeṇārociṣṭa / / /
analyzed: savitrā āgata sam sūryeṇa arociṣṭa iti sam hi sūryeṇa arociṣṭa
translated: 'Agni has come together with Agni', for he has indeed come together with Agni; 'he has come together with the divine Savitri', for he has indeed come together with the divine Savitri; 'he has shone together with the sun', for he has indeed shone together with the sun.

original: svāhā samagnistapasāgateti saṃ hyagnistapasāgatāvaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ🔽devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ saṃ daivyena savitreti saṃ hi daivyena savitrāgata saṃ
analyzed: svāhā sam agniḥ tapasā agata iti sam hi agniḥ tapasā agata avaram svāhākāram karoti parām  devatām asau eva bandhuḥ sam daivyena savitrā iti sam hi daivyena savitrā agata sam
translated: 'Svâhâ! Agni has come together with heat', for he has indeed come together with heat; he makes the Svâhâ call the lower,

original: sūryeṇārūrucateti saṃ hi sūryeṇārūrucata / / /🔽te vā ete trayo'vakāśā bhavanti trayo vai prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno
analyzed: sūryeṇa arūrucata iti sam hi sūryeṇa arūrucata  te vai ete trayaḥ vakāśāḥ bhavanti trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ
translated: the deity the higher--the meaning is the same. 'He has come together with the divine Savitri', for he has indeed come together with the divine Savitri; 'he has shone together with the sun', for he has indeed shone together with the sun.

original: vyānastenaivāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: vyānaḥ tena eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: These are three openings, for there are three vital airs, the out-breathing, the up-breathing, and the through-breathing: by them he thus lays it (the fire) into him (Agni).

original: dhartā divo vibhāti tapasaspṛthivyāmiti dhartā hyeṣa divo vibhāti tapasaspṛthivyāṃ
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ vibhāti tapasas pṛthivyām iti dhartā hi eṣa divaḥ vibhāti tapasas pṛthivyām
translated: 'The supporter shines, by heat, in the heaven and on earth,'--for he, the supporter, shines, by heat, in the heaven and on earth;

original: dhartā devo devānāmamartyastapojā iti dhartā hyeṣa devo devānāmamartyastapojā🔽vācamasme niyaca devāyuvamiti yajño vai vāgyajñamasmabhyam prayaca yena
analyzed: dhartā devaḥ devānām amartyaḥ tapaḥ jāḥ iti dhartā hi eṣa devaḥ devānām amartyaḥ tapaḥ jāḥ  vācam asme niyaca devāyuvam iti yajñaḥ vai vāc yajñam asmabhyam prayaca yena
translated: 'the immortal god, the supporter of the gods, born of heat,'--for he, the supporter, is the immortal god of the gods, born of heat;

original: devānprīṇāmetyevaitadāha / / /🔽apaśyaṃ gopāmanipadyamānamiti eṣa vai gopā ya eṣa tapatyeṣa hīdaṃ sarvaṃ
analyzed: devān prīṇāma iti eva etat āha  apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam iti eṣa vai gopāḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa hi idam sarvam
translated: 'give us speech, friendly to the gods,'--speech doubtless is sacrifice: 'give us the sacrifice,' he thereby says, 'by which we may gratify the gods.'

original: gopāyatyatho na nipadyate tasmādāhāpaśyam gopāmanipadyamānamiti / / /
analyzed: gopāyati atha u na nipadyate tasmāt āha apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam iti
translated: 'I have seen the guardian not resting,'--he, doubtless, is the guardian who shines yonder, for he guards everything here; and he does not rest: therefore he says, 'I have seen the guardian not resting.'

original: ā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantamiti ā ca hyeṣa parā ca devaiḥ pathibhiścarati sa
analyzed: ā ca parā ca pathibhiḥ carantam iti ā ca hi eṣa parā ca devaiḥ pathibhiḥ carati sa
translated: 'Moving on the paths hither and thither,'--for he moves on the paths of the gods hither and thither;

original: sadhrīcīḥ sa viśūcīrvasāna iti sadhrīcīśca hyeṣa viśūcīśca diśo vaste'tho
analyzed: sadhrīcīḥ sa viśūcīḥ vasānaḥ iti sadhrīcīḥ ca hi eṣa viśūcīḥ ca diśaḥ vastethaḥ
translated: 'clothing himself in the near and the remote,'--for he clothes himself in the near and the remote regions;

original: raśmīnāvarīvartti bhuvaneṣvantariti punaḥpunarhyeṣa eṣu lokeṣu
analyzed: raśmīn āvarīvarti bhuvaneṣu antar iti punar punar hi eṣaḥ eṣu lokeṣu
translated: 'he moves in the worlds, turning hither and thither,'--for he moves again and again in these worlds,

original: varīvartyamānaścarati / / /
analyzed: varīvartyamānaḥ carati
translated: turning hither and thither.

original: viśvāsām bhuvām pate viśvasya manasaspate viśvasya vacasaspate sarvasya
analyzed: viśvāsām bhuvām pate viśvasya manasaspate viśvasya vacasaspate sarvasya
translated: Lord of all worlds of trust, lord of all mind, lord of all speech, lord of all

original: vacasaspata ityetasya sarvasya pata ityetaddevaśruttvaṃ deva gharma devo
analyzed: vacasaspate iti etasya sarvasya pate iti etat deva śrut tvam deva gharma deva
translated: speech, lord of all this, that is, lord of all this. O divine Gharma, heard by the gods, O god,

original: devānpāhīti nātra tirohitamivāsti / / /🔽atra prāvīranu vāṃ devavītaya iti aśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau vā etadyajñasya śiraḥ
analyzed: devān pāhi iti na atra tirohitam iva asti  atra prāvīḥ anu vām deva vītaye iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau vai etat yajñasya śiraḥ
translated: protect the gods. There is nothing obscure here, it seems.

original: pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāhātra prāvīranu vām devavītaya iti / / /
analyzed: pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha atra prāvīḥ anu vām deva vītaye iti
translated: Here, the divine feasts have come to you. He says this referring to the Ashvins, for the Ashvins then put back the head of the sacrifice. He delights them with this, therefore he says, Here the divine feasts have come to you.

original: madhu mādhvībhyām madhu mādhūcībhyāmiti dadhyaṅ ha vā ābhyāmātharvaṇo
analyzed: madhu mādhvībhyām madhu mādhūcībhyām iti dadhyaṅ ha vai ābhyām ātharvaṇaḥ
translated: Honey for the honey-loving ones, honey for the honey-drinking ones. Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan,

original: madhu nāma brāhmaṇamuvāca tadenayoḥ priyaṃ dhāma tadevainayoretenopagacati
analyzed: madhu nāma brāhmaṇam uvāca tat enayoḥ priyam dhāma tat eva enayoḥ etena upagacati
translated: told them the Brahman called Honey. That is their dear abode. With that he approaches them.

original: tasmādāha madhu mādhvībhyām madhu mādhūcībhyāmiti / / /🔽hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā ūrdhvo adhvaraṃ divi deveṣu dhehīti nātra
analyzed: tasmāt āha madhu mādhvībhyām madhu mādhūcībhyām iti  hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā ūrdhvaḥ adhvaram divi deveṣu dhehi iti na atra
translated: Therefore he says, Honey for the honey-loving ones, honey for the honey-drinking ones.

original: tirohitamivāsti / / /
analyzed: tirohitam iva asti
translated: To the heart, to the mind, to the sky, to the sun, place the sacrifice upward in the sky among the gods. There is nothing obscure here, it seems.

original: pitā no'si pitā no bodhīti eṣa vai pitā ya eṣa tapatyeṣa u
analyzed: pitā na asi pitā naḥ bodhi iti eṣa vai pitā yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u
translated: You are our father, O father, understand. He who shines yonder is indeed the father. He

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha pitā no'si pitā no bodhīti namaste astu
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha pitā na asi pitā naḥ bodhi iti namaḥ te astu
translated: 'Thou art our father, do thou bethink thee of us', he says; 'may there be reverence to thee, do thou injure me not'; he thereby invokes a blessing.

original: mā mā hiṃsīrityāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /
analyzed: mā mā hiṃsīḥ iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste
translated: 'Do thou injure me not', he says; he thereby invokes a blessing.

original: atha patnyai śiro'pavṛtya mahāvīramīkṣamāṇām vācayati tvaṣṭṛmantastvā sapemeti
analyzed: atha patnyai śiraḥ upavṛtya mahāvīram īkṣamāṇām vācayati tvaṣṭṛmantaḥ tvā sapema iti
translated: Then, turning the head of the wife away, he makes her say, while looking at the Mahâvîra, 'With Tvashtri we worship thee.'

original: vṛṣā vai pravargyo yoṣā patnī mithunamevaitatprajananaṃ kriyate / / /
analyzed: vṛṣā vai pravargyaḥ yoṣā patnī mithunam eva etat prajananam kriyate
translated: The Pravargya, doubtless, is a male, and the wife is a female: a productive union is thus effected.

original: athaitadvai āyuretjjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamu vā brūtebhkṣ/
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ ett jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam u vā
translated: Now, he who either explains this (Pravargya) or eats of it,

original: ayati vā tasya bratacaryā yā🔽sṛs/t/au / / /
analyzed: ayati vā tasya brata caryā yā  sṛstau
translated: his observances are the same as those of a sacrificer.

original: athāto rohiṇau juhoti ahaḥ ketunā juṣatāṃ sujyotirjyotiṣā svāhetyubhāvetena yajuṣā🔽prātā rātriḥ ketunā juṣatāṃ sujyotirjyotiṣā svāhetyubhāvetena yajuṣā sāyam / / /
analyzed: atha atas rohiṇau juhoti ahar ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā iti ubhau etena yajuṣā  prātā rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā iti ubhau etena yajuṣā sāyam
translated: Now, therefore, he offers the two Rohita oblations. 'May the day accept the oblation with the banner, with good light, with light, Svâhâ!' with this one Yagus he offers both (the day and the night oblations).🔽'May the night accept the oblation with the banner, with good light, with light, Svâhâ!' with this one Yagus he offers both (the day and the night oblations) in the evening.

original: tadyadrohiṇau juhoti agniśca ha vā ādityaśca rauhiṇāvetābhyāṃ hi devatābhyāṃ
analyzed: tat yat rohiṇau juhoti agniḥ ca ha vai ādityaḥ ca rauhiṇau etābhyām hi devatābhyām
translated: The reason why he offers the two Rohita oblations is this. The two Rohitas, doubtless, are Agni and Âditya;

original: yajamānāḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ rohanti / / /
analyzed: yajamānāḥ svargam lokam rohanti
translated: by means of these two deities sacrificers ascend to the heavenly world.

original: atho ahorātre vai rauhiṇau ādityaḥ pravargyo'muṃ tadādityamahorātrābhyām
analyzed: atha u ahar rātre vai rauhiṇau ādityaḥ pravargyaḥ umum tat ādityam ahar rātrābhyām
translated: Now, the two Rauhina (cakes) are the day and the night, the Pravargya is the sun; verily he places yonder sun on the day and the night, on the quarters.

original: parigṛhṇāti tasmādeṣo'horātrābhyām parigṛhītaḥ / / /🔽atho imau vai lokau rauhiṇau ādityaḥ pravargyo'muṃ tadādityamābhyāṃ lokābhyām
analyzed: parigṛhṇāti tasmāt eṣa uhar rātrābhyām parigṛhītaḥ  atha u imau vai lokau rauhiṇau ādityaḥ pravargya umum tat ādityam ābhyām lokābhyām
translated: Now, the two Rauhina (cakes) are the day and the night, the Pravargya is the sun; he thus encloses that sun on both sides with the day and the night; therefore he is enclosed on both sides by the day and the night.

original: parigṛhṇāti tasmādeṣa ābhyāṃ lokābhyām parigṛhītaḥ / / /
analyzed: parigṛhṇāti tasmāt eṣaḥ ābhyām lokābhyām parigṛhītaḥ
translated: Now, the two Rauhina (cakes) are these two worlds, the Pravargya is the sun; he thus encloses that sun on both sides by these two worlds; therefore he is enclosed on both sides by these two worlds.

original: atho cakṣuṣī vai rauhiṇau śiraḥ pravargyaḥ śīrṣaṃstaccakṣurdadhāti / / /
analyzed: atha u cakṣuṣī vai rauhiṇau śiraḥ pravargyaḥ śīrṣan tat cakṣuḥ dadhāti
translated: Now, the two Rauhina (cakes) are the eyes, the Pravargya is the head; he thus puts the eyes into the head.

original: atha rajjumādatte devebhyastvā savituḥ prasave'śvinorbāhubhyām pūṣṇo🔽hastābhyāmādade rāsnāsītyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽atha gāmāhvayati jaghanena gārhapatyaṃ yanniḍa ehyadita ehi sarasvatyehītīḍā hi
analyzed: atha rajjum ādatte devebhyaḥ tvā savituḥ prasava īśvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ  hastābhyām ādade rāsnā asi iti asau eva bandhuḥ  atha gām āhvayati jaghanena gārhapatyam yat niḍe ehi adite ehi sarasvati ehi iti iḍā hi
translated: He then takes the rope, with , 'For the gods thee, on the impulse of the Savitri, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan I take,'--the meaning of this has been told;--'the girdle thou art!'--the significance of this has been explained.

original: gauraditirhi gauḥ sarasvatī hi gauratho tairāhvayati nāmnāsāvehyasāvehīti triḥ / / /
analyzed: gauḥ aditiḥ hi gauḥ sarasvatī hi gauḥ atha u taiḥ āhvayati nāmnā asau ehi asau ehi iti tris
translated: He then calls for the cow, behind the Gârhapatya; with , 'Come hither, Nîla! come hither, Aditi! come hither, Sarasvatî!'--for the cow is indeed Nîla (the blue one), the cow is Aditi, the cow is Sarasvatî; and then he calls her by name, 'So-and-so! come hither! So-and-so! come hither!'--thrice.

original: tāmāgatāmabhidadhāti adityai rāsnāsīndrāṇyā uṣṇīṣa itīndrāṇī ha vā indrasya priyā
analyzed: tām āgatām abhidadhāti adityai rāsnā asi indrāṇyai uṣṇīṣe iti indrāṇī ha vai indrasya priyā
translated: When she has come, he touches her, with , 'Thou art the girdle of Aditi, the turban of Indrânî;' for Indrânî is dear to Indra,

original: patnī tasyā uṣṇīṣo viśvarūpatamaḥ so'sīti tadāha tamevainametatkaroti / / /
analyzed: patnī tasyāḥ uṣṇīṣaḥ viśva rūpatamaḥ saḥ asi iti tat āha tam eva enam etat karoti
translated: His wife is the turban, the most beautiful of all forms; he says, 'Thou art that'; he thereby makes him that (Agni).

original: atha vatsamupārjati pūṣāsītyayam vai pūṣā yoyam pavata eṣa hīdaṃ sarvam
analyzed: atha vatsam upārjati pūṣā asi iti ayam vai pūṣā yaḥ uyam pavate eṣa hi idam sarvam
translated: He then puts the calf to the udder; 'Pusan art thou', (with these words) he takes it; Pusan is he who blows here, for he supports all this (universe);

original: puṣyatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha pūṣāsīti / / /
analyzed: puṣyati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha pūṣā asi iti
translated: he is the Pravargya; verily he delights him; therefore he says, 'Pusan art thou.'

original: athonnayati gharmāya dīṣvetyeṣa vā atra gharmo raso bhavati yameṣā pinvate
analyzed: atha unnayati gharmāya dīṣva iti eṣa vai atra gharmaḥ rasaḥ bhavati yam eṣā pinvate
translated: He then pours (the milk) out for the hot (liquor); 'For the hot (liquor) be thou milked', he says; for here that is the hot (liquor), the essence, which it fills;

original: tasyai dayasvetyevaitadāha / / /🔽atha pinvane pinvayati aśvibhyām pinvasvetyaśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau vā
analyzed: tasyai dayasva iti eva etat āha  atha pinvane pinvayati aśvibhyām pinvasva iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau vā
translated: 'Be thou kind to it', he thereby says.

original: etadyajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāhāśvibhyām pinvasveti / / /
analyzed: etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha aśvibhyām pinvasva iti
translated: He then causes the two milk pails to be filled; 'Be thou filled for the Asvins', he says; he thereby means the Asvins. The Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice; verily he delights them; therefore he says, 'Be thou filled for the Asvins.'

original: sarasvatyai pinvasveti vāgvai sarasvatī vācā vā etadaśvinau yajñasya śiraḥ
analyzed: sarasvatyai pinvasva iti vāc vai sarasvatī vācā vai etat aśvinau yajñasya śiraḥ
translated: 'Be thou filled for Sarasvatî', (with these words) he says; Sarasvatî is speech; by speech the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice;

original: pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha sarasvatyai pinvasveti / / /
analyzed: pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha sarasvatyai pinvasva iti
translated: verily he delights them; therefore he says, 'Be thou filled for Sarasvatî.'

original: indrāya pinvasveti indro vai yajñasya devatā sā yaiva yajñasya devatā
analyzed: indrāya pinvasva iti indraḥ vai yajñasya devatā sā yā eva yajñasya devatā
translated: 'Be thou filled for Indra', he says; Indra is the deity of the sacrifice; that which is the deity of the sacrifice

original: tayaivaitadaśvinau yajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāhendrāya🔽pinvasveti / / /🔽atha vipruṣo'bhimantrayate svāhendravatsvāhendravaditīndro vai yajñasya devatā sā
analyzed: tayā eva etat aśvinau yajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha indrāya  pinvasva iti  atha vipruṣaḥ abhimantrayate svāhā indravat svāhā indravat iti indraḥ vai yajñasya devatā sā
translated: By that (verse) the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice: he thus gratifies those two (deities) when he says, 'For Indra swell!'

original: yaiva yajñasya devatā tāmevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha svāhendravatsvāhendravaditi
analyzed: yā eva yajñasya devatā tām eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha svāhā indra vat svāhā indra vat iti
translated: He then murmurs the drops (of Soma), with, 'Hail, Indra-like! Hail, Indra-like!' Indra, doubtless, is the deity of the sacrifice: it is her whom he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'Hail, Indra-like! Hail, Indra-like!'

original: triṣkṛtva āha trivṛddhi yajño'varaṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athāsyai stanamabhipadyate yaste stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūriti yaste stano nihito🔽guhāyāmityevaitadāha yo ratnadhā vasuvidyaḥ sudatra iti yo dhanānāṃ dātā🔽vasuvitpaṇāvya ityevaitadāha yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇīti yena sarvāndevāntsarvāṇi
analyzed: triṣkṛtvaḥ āha trivṛt hi yajñaḥ varam svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ  atha asyai stanam abhipadyate yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayaḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ iti yaḥ te stanaḥ nihitaḥ  guhāyām iti eva etat āha yaḥ ratna dhāḥ vasu vidyaḥ su datraḥ iti yaḥ dhanānām dātā  vasu vid paṇāvyaḥ iti eva etat āha yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi iti yena sarvān devān sarvāṇi
translated: Thrice he says it, for threefold is the sacrifice. The first 'Hail!' he makes for the lower (world), and the last for the higher deity. The significance of this (will be explained) hereafter .

original: bhūtāni bibharṣītyevaitadāha sarasvati tamiha dhātave'kariti vāgvai sarasvatī saiṣā
analyzed: bhūtāni bibharṣi iti eva etat āha sarasvati tam iha dhātava ekaḥ iti vāc vai sarasvatī sā eṣā
translated: He then touches her (Vâk's) breast, with , 'That breast of thine which is full of milk, which is full of honey,'--that is, 'that breast of thine which is hidden in the cave;'--'which bestows treasures, which finds wealth, which is bountiful,'--that is, 'which is the giver of treasures, which finds wealth, which is a good bargain;'--'whereby thou supportest all good things,'--that is, 'whereby thou supportest all the gods, all beings;'--'O Sarasvatî, make that here for our support!'--Sarasvatî, doubtless, is speech: this (earth) is indeed the support of that (speech).

original: gharmadughā yajño vai vāgyajñamasmabhyam prayaca yena
analyzed: gharma dughāḥ yajñaḥ vai vāc yajñam asmabhyam prayaca yena
translated: 'The Gharma-milk', (with the words), 'The sacrifice is speech; give us the sacrifice, wherewith',

original: devānprīṇāmetyevaitadāhātha
analyzed: devān prīṇāma iti eva etat āha atha
translated: he says this, 'we shall gratify the gods.'

original: gārhapatyasyārdhamaityurvantarikṣamanvemītyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽atha śaphāvādatte gāyatraṃ cando'si traiṣṭubhaṃ cando'sīti gāyatreṇa🔽caivaināvetattraiṣṭubhena ca candasādatte dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ tvā parigṛhṇāmītīme
analyzed: gārhapatyasya ardham aiti uru antarikṣam anvemi iti asau eva bandhuḥ  atha śaphau ādatte gāyatram candaḥ asi traiṣṭubham candaḥ asi iti gāyatreṇa  ca eva enau etat traiṣṭubhena ca candasā ādatte dyāvāpṛthivībhyām tvā parigṛhṇāmi iti ime
translated: He comes to the half of the Garhapatya, with (the words), 'I go along the broad atmosphere'; the meaning of this has been explained.🔽He then takes the two spades, with (the words), 'Thou art the Gâyatra metre; thou art the Trishtubh metre.' With the Gâyatra and the Trishtubh metre he thus takes them. 'I take thee with the two heavens', he says;

original: vai dyāvāpṛthivī parīśāsāvādityaḥ pravargyo'muṃ tadādityamābhyāṃ
analyzed: vai dyāvāpṛthivī parīśā asau ādityaḥ pravargyaḥ umum tat ādityam ābhyām
translated: these two heavens are the two spades; the Pravargya is yonder sun; he thus takes yonder sun with these two heavens

original: dyāvāpṛthivībhyām parigṛhṇātyatha mauñjena vedenopamārṣṭyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athodayamanyopagṛhṇāti antarikṣeṇopayacāmītyantarikṣam vā🔽upayamanyantarikṣeṇa hīdaṃ sarvamupayatamato udaram vā upayamanyudareṇa
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivībhyām parigṛhṇāti atha mauñjena vedena upamārṣṭi asau eva bandhuḥ  atha udayam anyā upagṛhṇāti antarikṣeṇa upayacāmi iti antarikṣam vā  upayamanī antarikṣeṇa hi idam sarvam upayatam atas udaram vai upayamanī udareṇa
translated: and encloses him within these two heavens. He then cleanses (the spades) with a darbha-blade; the meaning of this has been explained.🔽He then takes the Upavyâja, with (the words), 'I take thee with the atmosphere.' The Upavyâja is the atmosphere;

original: hīdaṃ sarvamannādyamupayataṃ tasmādāhāntarikṣeṇopayacāmīti / / /
analyzed: hi idam sarvam annādyam upayatam tasmāt āha antarikṣeṇa upayacāmi iti
translated: for by the atmosphere everything here is taken up. The Upavyâja is the belly; for by the belly all food is taken up here: therefore he says, 'I take thee with the atmosphere.'

original: athājākṣīramānayati tapto vā eṣa śuśucāno bhavati tamevaitacamayati tasmiñcānte
analyzed: atha ajā kṣīram ānayati taptaḥ vai eṣa śuśucānaḥ bhavati tam eva etat camayati tasmin ca ante
translated: He then brings the goat's milk; for it is heated and glowing (that is brought); he thus soothes it, and in it he then brings the cow's milk.

original: gokṣīramānayati / / /🔽indrāśvineti indro vai yajñasya devatā sā yaiva yajñasya devatā
analyzed: go kṣīram ānayati  indra aśvinā iti indraḥ vai yajñasya devatā sā yā eva yajñasya devatā
translated: He brings the cow's milk in it.

original: tāmevaitatprīṇātyaśvinetyaśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau vā etadyajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattāṃ
analyzed: tām eva etat prīṇāti aśvinā iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau vai etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattām
translated: 'To Indra and the Asvins,'--Indra is the deity of the sacrifice: it is him he thus gratifies;--'to the Asvins,' he says, for the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice;

original: tāvevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāhendrāśvineti / / /
analyzed: tau eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha indra aśvinā iti
translated: it is them he thus gratifies: therefore he says, 'To Indra and the Asvins.'

original: madhunaḥ sāraghasyeti etadvai madhu sāraghaṃ gharmam pāteti rasam
analyzed: madhunaḥ sāraghasya iti etat vai madhu sāragham gharmam pāta iti rasam
translated: 'Of the honey of the Sârasvatî,'--this honey of the Sârasvatî is the Gharma;--'pour ye into the ladle,'--that is, 'pour ye into the juice;'

original: pātetyevaitadāha vasava ityete vai vasava ete hīdaṃ sarvam vāsayante yajata vāḍiti🔽tadyathā vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ hutamevamasyaitadbhavati / / /
analyzed: pāta iti eva etat āha vasavaḥ iti ete vai vasavaḥ ete hi idam sarvam vāsayante yajata vāṭ iti  tat yathā vaṣaṭkṛtam hutam evam asya etat bhavati
translated: 'the Vasus,'--they are indeed the Vasus, for they make all this to be (vas). 'Sacrifice!'--this is as in the call of 'Vashat.'

original: svāhā sūryasya raśmaye vṛṣṭivanaya iti sūryasya ha vā eko raśmirvṛṣṭivanirnāma
analyzed: svāhā sūryasya raśmaye vṛṣṭivanaye iti sūryasya ha vai ekaḥ raśmiḥ vṛṣṭivaniḥ nāma
translated: 'Hail to the ray of the sun, the rain-winner!'--the sun indeed has one ray called 'rain-winner,'

original: yenemāḥ sarvāḥ prajā bibharti tamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha svāhā sūryasya raśmaye
analyzed: yena imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ bibharti tam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha svāhā sūryasya raśmaye
translated: by which it supports all these creatures: it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'Hail to the ray of the sun, the rain-winner!'

original: vṛṣṭivanaya ityavaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣ/
analyzed: vṛṣṭi vanaye iti avaram svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ  atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣ
translated: He makes the lower Svâhâ call to the rain-cloud, the higher one to the deity; the meaning of this is the same as before.🔽Now, he who either recites this (hymn) after (another) or eats (the food) of him who recites it,

original: ayati vā tasya
analyzed: ayati vā tasya
translated: enters that life, that light.

original: vratacaryā ya //
analyzed: vrata caryā ya
translated: His observance is this:

original: sṛs/t/au / / /
analyzed: sṛstau
translated: he must not look on (anything) disagreeable.

original: sa yatraitāṃ hotānvāha praitu brahmaṇaspatiḥ pra devyetu sūnṛteti tadadhvaryuḥ🔽prāṅudāyanvātanāmāni juhotyetadvai devā abibhayuryadvai na imamantarā rakṣāṃsi
analyzed: sa yatra etām hotā anvāha praitu brahmaṇaspatiḥ pra devī etu sūnṛtā iti tat adhvaryuḥ  prāṅ udāyan vātanāmāni juhoti etat vai devāḥ abibhayuḥ yat vai naḥ imam antarā rakṣāṃsi
translated: When the Hotri recites this (verse), 'Let the lord of prayer advance, let the goddess advance to truth,' then the Adhvaryu,

original: nāṣṭrā na hanyuriti tametatpuraivāhavanīyātsvāhākāreṇājuhavustaṃ hutameva
analyzed: nāṣṭrāḥ na hanyuḥ iti tam etat purā eva āhavanīyāt svāhākāreṇa ajuhavuḥ tam hutam eva
translated: having gone forward, offers the Vâtanî oblations. For at that time the gods were afraid, thinking, 'Lest the Rakshas, the fiends, slay him (Agni) here between (the two fires).' They offered him beforehand, with the Svâhâ call, away from the Âhavanîya; and,

original: santamagnāva juhuvustatho evainameṣa etatpuraivāhavanīyātsvāhākāreṇa juhoti taṃ
analyzed: santam agnau juhuvuḥ tathā u eva enam eṣaḥ etat purā eva āhavanīyāt svāhākāreṇa juhoti tam
translated: having offered him, they offered him in the fire. And in like manner does this (Sacrificer) now offer him beforehand, with the Svâhâ call, away from the Âhavanîya; and,

original: hutameva santamagnau juhoti / / /🔽samudrāya tvā vātāya svāheti ayam vai samudro yo'yam pavata etasmādvai
analyzed: hutam eva santam agnau juhoti  samudrāya tvā vātāya svāhā iti ayam vai samudraḥ yaḥ ayam pavate etasmāt vai
translated: having offered him, he offers him in the fire.

original: samudrātsarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni samuddravanti tasmā evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāha
analyzed: samudrāt sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni samuddravanti tasmai eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha
translated: 'To the ocean thee, to the wind, Hail!' For that ocean, doubtless, is this blower (the wind): from that ocean all the gods and all beings flow out; to him (the wind) he offers it: for this reason he says this.

original: samudrāya tvā vātāya svāhā / / /🔽sarirāya tvā vātāya svāheti ayam vai sariro yo'yam pavata etasmādvai sarirātsarve
analyzed: samudrāya tvā vātāya svāhā  sarirāya tvā vātāya svāhā iti ayam vai sariraḥ yaḥ yam pavate etasmāt vai sarirāt sarve
translated: To the ocean for thee, to the wind, hail!

original: devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni saherate tasmā evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāha sarirāya tvā vātāya🔽svāhā / / /🔽anādhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhāpratidhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāheti ayam vā
analyzed: devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni saherate tasmai eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha sarirāya tvā vātāya  svāhā  anādhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā apratidhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā iti ayam vā
translated: To the river for thee, to the wind, hail! This is the river, this which blows; from this river all the gods, all beings endure; to it he offers it; therefore he says, 'To the river for thee, to the wind, hail!'

original: anādhṛṣyo'pratidhṛṣyo yo'yam pavate tasmā evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāhānādhṛṣyāya🔽tvā vātāya svāhāpratidhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāheti / / /🔽avasyave tvā vātāya svāhāśimidāya tvā vātāya svāheti ayam vā avasyuraśimido yo'yam
analyzed: an ādhṛṣya upratidhṛṣyaḥ yaḥ ayam pavate tasmai eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha an ādhṛṣyāya  tvā vātāya svāhā apratidhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā iti  avasyave tvā vātāya svāhā a śimidāya tvā vātāya svāhā iti ayam vai avasyuḥ a śimidaḥ yaḥ uyam
translated: To the irresistible for thee, to the wind, hail! To the unresistible for thee, to the wind, hail! This one is irresistible, unresistible, which blows; to it he offers it; therefore he says, 'To the irresistible for thee, to the wind, hail! To the unresistible for thee, to the wind, hail!'

original: pavate tasmā evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāhāvasyave tvā vātāya svāhāśimidāya tvā vātāya🔽svāheti / / /
analyzed: pavate tasmai eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha avasyave tvā vātāya svāhā a śimidāya tvā vātāya  svāhā iti
translated: To the dependent for thee, to the wind, hail! To the all-destroying for thee, to the wind, hail! This one is dependent, all-destroying, which blows; to it he offers it; therefore he says, 'To the dependent for thee, to the wind, hail! To the all-destroying for thee, to the wind, hail!'

original: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate svāheti ayam vā indro yo'yam pavate tasmā evainaṃ
analyzed: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate svāhā iti ayam vai indraḥ yaḥ yam pavate tasmai eva enam
translated: To Indra for thee, to him who has the Vasus and Rudras, hail! This is Indra, this which blows; to it he offers it;

original: juhoti tasmādāhendrāya tveti vasumate rudravata iti tadindramevānu vasūṃśca
analyzed: juhoti tasmāt āha indrāya tvā iti vasumate rudravate iti tat indram eva anu vasūn ca
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Vasus.' He allots to Indra the Vasus and Rudras. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.

original: rudrāṃścābhajatyatho prātaḥsavanasya caivaitanmādhyandinasya ca savanasya rūpaṃ🔽kriyate / / /🔽indrāya tvādityavate svāheti ayam vā indro yo'yam pavate tasmā evainaṃ juhoti
analyzed: rudrān ca ābhajati atha u prātaḥsavanasya ca eva etat mādhyandinasya ca savanasya rūpam  kriyate  indrāya tvā ādityavate svāhā iti ayam vai indraḥ yaḥ yam pavate tasmai eva enam juhoti
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Rudras.' He allots to Indra the Rudras. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.🔽He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Adityas.' He allots to Indra the Adityas. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.🔽He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Maruts.' He allots to Indra the Maruts. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.🔽He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the All-gods.' He allots to Indra the All-gods. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.

original: tasmādāhendrāya tvetyādityavata iti tadindramevānvādityānābhajatyatho🔽tṛtīyasavanasyaivaitadrūpaṃ kriyate / / /
analyzed: tasmāt āha indrāya tvā iti ādityavate iti tat indram eva anvādityān ābhajati atha u  tṛtīyasavanasya eva etat rūpam kriyate
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Visve devāh.' He allots to Indra the Visve devāh. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.

original: indrāya tvābhimātighne svāheti ayam vā indro yo'yam pavate tasmā evainaṃ juhoti🔽tasmādāhendrāya tvetyabhimātighna iti sapatno vāabhimātirindrāya tvā sapatnaghna
analyzed: indrāya tvā abhimāti ghne svāhā iti ayam vai indraḥ yaḥ yam pavate tasmai eva enam juhoti  tasmāt āha indrāya tvā iti abhimāti ghne iti sapatnaḥ vai abhimātiḥ indrāya tvā sapatna ghna
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Pitrs.' He allots to Indra the Pitrs. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.🔽He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Rṣis.' He allots to Indra the Rṣis. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.

original: ityevaitadāha so'syoddhāro yathā śreṣṭhasyoddhāra evamasyaiṣa ṛte devebhyaḥ / / /
analyzed: iti eva etat āha saḥ usya uddhāraḥ yathā śreṣṭhasya uddhāraḥ evam asya eṣa ṛte devebhyaḥ
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Ugras.' He allots to Indra the Ugras. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.🔽He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Maruts.' He allots to Indra the Maruts. Then he makes the form of the morning pressing and the midday pressing.

original: savitre tva ṛbhumate vibhumate vājavate svāheti ayam vai savitā yo'yam pavate
analyzed: savitre tvaḥ ṛbhumate vibhumate vājavate svāhā iti ayam vai savitā yaḥ uyam pavate
translated: He offers, therefore he says, 'To Indra, the possessor of wealth, accompanied by the Vasus.' He allots to Indra the Vasus and Rudras. Then he makes the form

original: tasmā evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāha savitre tvetyṛbhumate vibhumate vājavata iti🔽tadasminviśvāndevānanvābhajati / / /🔽bṛhaspataye tvā viśvadevyāvate svāheti ayam vai bṛhaspatiryo'yam pavate tasmā
analyzed: tasmai eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha savitre tvā iti ṛbhumate vibhumate vājavate iti  tat asmin viśvān devān anvābhajati  bṛhaspataye tvā viśvadevyāvate svāhā iti ayam vai bṛhaspatiḥ yaḥ iyam pavate tasmai
translated: To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee, to him who is approved by the Rbus, to him who is approved by the Vibhus, to him who is approved by Vâja.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'

original: evainaṃ juhoti tasmādāha bṛhaspataye tveti viśvadevyāvata iti🔽tadasminviśvāntsarvāndevānnvābhajati / / /
analyzed: eva enam juhoti tasmāt āha bṛhaspataye tvā iti viśvadevyāvate iti  tat asmin viśvān sarvān devān nu ābhajati
