analyzed: yamāya tvā aṅgirasvate pitṛmate svāhā iti ayam vai yamaḥ yaḥ yam pavate tasmai eva enam  juhoti tasmāt āha yamāya tvā iti aṅgirasvate pitṛmate iti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya
translated: To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'

original: vyakṣaratsa pitṝ/
analyzed: vyakṣarat sa pitṝ
translated: To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'

original: nagacattrayā vai pitarastānevaitadanvābhajati / / /🔽dvādaśaitāni nāmāni bhavanti dvādaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsara eṣa ya
analyzed: nagacattrayāḥ vai pitaraḥ tān eva etat anvābhajati  dvādaśa etāni nāmāni bhavanti dvādaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ eṣa yaḥ
translated: To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'

original: eṣa tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmāddvādaśa bhavanti / / /
analyzed: eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt dvādaśa bhavanti
translated: To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'🔽To him he offers it, therefore he says, 'To Savitri thee.'

original: athopayamanyā mahāvīra ānayati svāhā gharmāyetyeṣa vai gharmo ya eṣa
analyzed: atha upayamanyāḥ mahāvīre ānayati svāhā gharmāya iti eṣa vai gharmaḥ yaḥ eṣa
translated: He then brings the Upabhrit from the Maha-vira to the Gharma, with 'Hail to the Gharma!' for that (Gharma) is indeed the Gharma which is yonder (sun).

original: tapatyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha svāhā gharmāyetyavaraṃ
analyzed: tapati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha svāhā gharmāya iti avaram
translated: He then brings up the Upavyâchâ (Âgya-spoon) to the Mahâvîra (with the words), 'Svâhâ to the Gharma!'--for that Gharma is he who shines yonder, and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies, and therefore he says, 'Svâhâ to the Gharma.'

original: svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: He makes the Svâhâ-call before (the Vasat-call),--the significance of this is the same as before .

original: ānīte japati svāhā gharmaḥ pitra iti yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa
analyzed: ānīte japati svāhā gharmaḥ pitre iti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat sa
translated: When it has been brought up, he mutters, 'Svâhâ! Gharma to the Fathers!'--when the sacrifice had its head cut off, its life-sap flowed away,

original: pitṝ/nagacattrayā vai pitarastānevaitatprīṇātyavaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ🔽devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽nānuvākyāmanvāha sakṛdu hyeva parāñcaḥ
analyzed: pitṝn agacat trayāḥ vai pitaraḥ tān eva etat prīṇāti avaram svāhākāram karoti parām  devatām asau eva bandhuḥ  na anuvākyām anvāha sakṛt u hi eva parāñcaḥ
translated: and went to the Fathers; it is them he thus gratifies. He makes the Svâhâ-call before (the Vasat-call),--the significance of this is the same as before .

original: pitarastasmānnānuvākyāmanvāhātikramyāśrāvyāha gharmasya yajeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti / / /🔽viśvā āśā dakṣiṇasaditi sarvā āśā dakṣiṇasadityevaitadāha viśvāndevānayāḍiheti
analyzed: pitaraḥ tasmāt na anuvākyām anvāha atikramya āśrāvya āha gharmasya yaja iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti  viśvāḥ āśāḥ dakṣiṇa sad iti sarvāḥ āśāḥ dakṣiṇa sad iti eva etat āha viśvān devān ayāṭ iha iti
translated: He does not repeat the invitatory prayer , for once only the Fathers went away from the gods; therefore he does not repeat the invitatory prayer. Having stepped across (to the south side of the fire) and called for the Sraushat, he says (to the Hotri), 'Pronounce the offering prayer to the Gharma!' and offers as the Vashat is uttered.

original: sarvāndevānayākṣīdihetyevaitadāha svāhākṛtasya gharmasya madhoḥ
analyzed: sarvān devān ayākṣīt iha iti eva etat āha svāhākṛtasya gharmasya madhoḥ
translated: 'All the regions (of the sky) sit on the south side,'--that is, 'all the regions sit on this side;'--'he has invited all the gods here,'--that is, 'he has invited all the gods hither;'--'to the Gharma, to the sweet (libation) Svâhâ!'

original: pibatamaśvinetyaśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau hyetadyajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattāṃ
analyzed: pibatam aśvinā iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau hi etat yajñasya śiraḥ pratyadhattām
translated: 'Drink ye, O Asvins,'--he thereby means the Asvins; for the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice;

original: tāvevaitatprīṇātyavaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: tau eva etat prīṇāti avaram svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: he thus gratifies them. He pronounces the Svâhâ-call first, and the deity last: the significance of this is the same as before.

original: atha hutvordhvamutkampayati divi dhā imaṃ yajñamimaṃ yajñam divi dhā ityasau
analyzed: atha hutvā ūrdhvam utkampayati divi dhāḥ imam yajñam imam yajñam divi dhāḥ iti asau
translated: Having offered, he shakes (the Gharma) upwards, with , 'In the sky place this sacrifice, this sacrifice in the sky!'

original: vā ādityo gharmo yajño divi vā eṣa hito divi pratiṣṭhitastamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha🔽divi dhā imaṃ yajñamimaṃ yaiñaṃ divi dhā ityanuvaṣaṭkṛte juhoti / / /
analyzed: vai ādityaḥ gharmaḥ yajñaḥ divi vai eṣa hitaḥ divi pratiṣṭhitaḥ tam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha  divi dhāḥ imam yajñam imam yaiñam divi dhāḥ iti anuvaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
translated: The Gharma is yonder sun, and the sacrifice is the sky; for it is in the sky that he (the sun) is placed, and in the sky that he is established: it is him he thus gratifies, and therefore he says,🔽'In the sky place this sacrifice, this sacrifice in the sky!' After the Vashat has been uttered, he offers.

original: svāhāgnaye yajñiyāyeti tatsviṣṭakṛdbhājanamagnirhi sviṣṭakṛcaṃ yajurbhya iti
analyzed: svāhā agnaye yajñiyāya iti tat sviṣṭakṛt bhājanam agniḥ hi sviṣṭakṛcam yajurbhyaḥ iti
translated: 'Hail to Agni, the sacrificial!'--this is the share of the Svishtakrit (Agni, the maker of good offering); for Agni is the Svishtakrit.--'To the Yagus,'

original: yajurbhirhyeṣo'smiṃloke pratiṣṭhitastānyevaitatprīṇātyavaraṃ svāhākāraṃ karoti
analyzed: yajurbhiḥ hi eṣaḥ asmin loke pratiṣṭhitaḥ tāni eva etat prīṇāti avaram svāhākāram karoti
translated: for by the Yagus he is established in this world: it is them he thus gratifies. He pronounces the Svâhâ-call first,

original: parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽atha brahmānumantrayate brahmā vā ṛtvijām bhiṣaktamastadya evartvijām
analyzed: parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ  atha brahmā anumantrayate brahmā vai ṛtvijām bhiṣaktamaḥ tat yaḥ eva ṛtvijām
translated: and the deity last: the significance of this is the same as before.🔽He then makes the Brahman (priest) recite (the verse), 'The Brahman is the best of us,'--the Brahman is the best of the priests; and inasmuch as he is the best of the priests,

original: bhiṣaktamastenaivainametadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /
analyzed: bhiṣaktamaḥ tena eva enam etat yajñam bhiṣajyati
translated: he thereby heals this sacrifice by him (the Brahman).

original: aśvinā gharmam pātamiti aśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau hyetadyajñasya śiraḥ
analyzed: aśvinā gharmam pātam iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau hi etat yajñasya śiraḥ
translated: 'Drink the hot beverage, O Asvins', he says; verily he says this to the Asvins, for the Asvins are the head of the sacrifice.

original: pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti / / /
analyzed: pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti
translated: 'O Asvins, drink the hot (milk)', he says; verily he says this to the Asvins, for the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice. He delights them.

original: hārdvānamahardivābhirūtibhiriti aniruktaman rukto vai prajāpatiḥ
analyzed: hārdvānam ahardiva abhirūtibhiḥ iti aniruktam an ruktaḥ vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: 'The one of the heart with the rays of the day', he says; the indistinct with the indistinct, for Prajapati is indistinct.

original: prajāpatiryajñastatprajāpatimevaitadyajñaṃ bhiṣajyati / / /🔽tantrāyiṇa iti eṣa vai tantrāyī ya eṣa tapatyeṣa
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ tat prajāpatim eva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati  tantrāyiṇaḥ iti eṣa vai tantrāyī yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa
translated: Verily he thus heals Prajapati, the sacrifice.

original: hīmāṃlokāṃstantramivānusañcaratyeṣa u pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha
analyzed: hi imān lokān tantram iva anusañcarati eṣaḥ u pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha
translated: 'The one of the thread', he says; the one of the thread is he who shines yonder, for he moves along these worlds as it were on a thread; he is the Pravargya; verily he delights him; therefore he says,

original: tantrāyiṇa iti / / /
analyzed: tantrāyiṇaḥ iti
translated: 'The one of the thread'.

original: namo dyāvāpṛthivībhyāmiti tadābhyāṃ dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ nihnute yayoridaṃ🔽sarvamadhi / / /
analyzed: namaḥ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām iti tat ābhyām dyāvāpṛthivībhyām nihnute yayoḥ idam  sarvam adhi
translated: 'Adoration to heaven and earth', he says; verily he appeases these two, heaven and earth, on which all this rests.

original: atha yajamānaḥ yajño vai yajamāno yajñenevaitadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /🔽apātāmaśvinā gharmamiti aśvināvevaitadāhāśvinau hyetadyajñasya śiraḥ
analyzed: atha yajamānaḥ yajñaḥ vai yajamānaḥ yajñena iva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati  apātām aśvinā gharmam iti aśvinau eva etat āha aśvinau hi etat yajñasya śiraḥ
translated: Then the sacrificer; the sacrificer is the sacrifice; verily he heals the sacrifice with the sacrifice.

original: pratyadhattāṃ tāvevaitatprīṇāti / / /
analyzed: pratyadhattām tau eva etat prīṇāti
translated: 'The Asvins have drunk the hot (milk)', he says; verily he says this to the Asvins, for the Asvins then restored the head of the sacrifice. He delights them.

original: anudyāvāpṛthivī amaṃsātāmiti tadime dyāvāpṛthivī āha yayoridaṃ sarvamadhīhaiva
analyzed: anu dyāvāpṛthivī amaṃsātām iti tat ime dyāvāpṛthivī āha yayoḥ idam sarvam adhi iha eva
translated: 'The heaven and the earth have not been satisfied', he says; that is to say, these two, heaven and earth, on which everything here is contained.

original: rātayaḥ santvitīhaiva no dhanāni santvityevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: rātayaḥ santu iti iha eva naḥ dhanāni santu iti eva etat āha
translated: 'May the gifts be here', he says; that is to say, 'may the riches be here for us.'

original: atha pinvamānamanumantrayate iṣe pinvasveti vṛṣṭyai tadāha yadāheṣe
analyzed: atha pinvamānam anumantrayate iṣe pinvasva iti vṛṣṭyai tat āha yat āha iṣe
translated: He then recites over the swelling (cow) , 'For food swell!' he says for rain;

original: pinvasvetyūrje pinvasveti yo vṛṣṭādūrgraso jāyate tasmai tadāha brahmaṇe pinvasveti
analyzed: pinvasva iti ūrje pinvasva iti yaḥ vṛṣṭāt ūrgrasaḥ jāyate tasmai tat āha brahmaṇe pinvasva iti
translated: 'for strength swell!' he says; for that food which is produced from rain he says that. 'For the Brahman swell!'

original: tadbrahmaṇa āha kṣatrāya pinvasveti tatkṣatrāyāha dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pinvasveti
analyzed: tat brahmaṇe āha kṣatrāya pinvasva iti tat kṣatrāya āha dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pinvasva iti
translated: he says that for the Brahman; 'for the Kshatra swell!' he says that for the Kshatra; 'for heaven and earth swell!'

original: tadābhyāṃ dyāvāpṛthivībhyāmāha yayoridaṃ sarvamadhi / / /
analyzed: tat ābhyām dyāvāpṛthivībhyām āha yayoḥ idam sarvam adhi
translated: he says that for these two, heaven and earth, on which everything here is contained.

original: sa yadūrdhvaḥ pinvate tadyajamānāya pinvate yatprāṅtaddevebhyo yaddakṣiṇā
analyzed: sa yat ūrdhvaḥ pinvate tat yajamānāya pinvate yat prāṅ tat devebhyaḥ yat dakṣiṇā
translated: When he swells upwards, he swells for the sacrificer; when he swells forwards, he swells for the gods;

original: tatpitṛbhyo yatpratyaṅ tatpaśubhyo yadudaṅ tatprajāyā anaparāddhaṃ nveva
analyzed: tat pitṛbhyaḥ yat pratyaṅ tat paśubhyaḥ yat udaṅ tat prajāyai an aparāddham nu eva
translated: when he swells to the south, he swells for the fathers; when he swells to the west, he swells for the cattle; when he swells to the north, he swells for offspring. He does no wrong,

original: yajamānasyordhvo hyeva pinvatyātha yāṃ diśam pinvate tām pinvate yadā śāmyanti
analyzed: yajamānasya ūrdhvaḥ hi eva pinvati ā atha yām diśam pinvate tām pinvate yadā śāmyanti
translated: for he swells upwards for the sacrificer; then he swells in whatever direction he swells. When they cease to swell,🔽the drops.

original: vipruṣaḥ / / /
analyzed: vipruṣaḥ
translated: Drops.🔽.🔽

original: atha prāṅivodaṅṅutkrāmati dharmāsi sudharmetyeṣa vai dharmo ya eṣa tapatyeṣa
analyzed: atha prāṅ iva udaṅ utkrāmati dharma asi su dharma iti eṣa vai dharmaḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣa
translated: He then steps out as if to the north-east, with (the words), 'Thou art the right, the good right.' The right, the good right, doubtless, is he that shines yonder.

original: hīdaṃ sarvaṃ dhārayatyetenedaṃ sarvaṃ dhṛtameṣa u
analyzed: hi idam sarvam dhārayati etena idam sarvam dhṛtam eṣaḥ u
translated: He then steps out as if to the east, north, with (the words), 'Thou art the right, the good right.' The right, the good right, doubtless, is he who shines yonder, for he supports everything here, and by him everything here is supported;

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha dharmāsi sudharmeti / / /
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha dharma asi su dharma iti
translated: and the Pravargya also is that (sun): it is him he thus gratifies; therefore he says, 'Thou art the right, the good right.'

original: atha khare sādayati amenyasme nṛmṇāni dhārayetyakrudhyanno dhanāni
analyzed: atha khare sādayati ameni asme nṛmṇāni dhāraya iti a krudhyan naḥ dhanāni
translated: He then deposits (the vessel) on the mound with (the words), 'Be thou propitious to us for manly powers.' 'Be thou propitious to us for wealth,' he thereby says;

original: dhārayetyevaitadāha brahma dhāraya kṣatraṃ dhāraya viśaṃ dhārayetyetatsarvaṃ🔽dhārayetyevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: dhāraya iti eva etat āha brahma dhāraya kṣatram dhāraya viśam dhāraya iti etat sarvam  dhārayā iti eva etat āha
translated: 'support the Brahman,' 'support the Kshatra,' 'support the Vis,' he thereby says, 'support everything.'

original: atha śākalairjuhoti prāṇā vai śākalāḥ prāṇānevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: atha śākalaiḥ juhoti prāṇāḥ vai śākalāḥ prāṇān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: He then makes offering with the Sâkalas. The Sâkalas, doubtless, are the vital airs: it is the vital airs he thus lays into him.

original: svāhā pūṣṇe śarasa iti ayam vai pūṣā yo'yam pavata eṣa hīdaṃ sarvam puṣyatyeṣa
analyzed: svāhā pūṣṇe śarase iti ayam vai pūṣā yaḥ iyam pavate eṣa hi idam sarvam puṣyati eṣa
translated: 'Hail to Pûshan, the lord of the paths!' Pûshan, doubtless, is he who blows here (the wind), for he preserves (pus) everything here;

original: u prāṇaḥ prāṇamevāsminnetaddadhāti tasmādāha svāhā pūṣṇe śarasa ityavaraṃ
analyzed: u prāṇaḥ prāṇam eva asmin etat dadhāti tasmāt āha svāhā pūṣṇe śarase iti avaram
translated: and the breath also is that (wind): it is the breath he thus lays into him; therefore he says, 'Hail to Pûshan, the lord of the paths.'

original: svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva bandhurhutvā madhyame paridhāupaśrayati / / /
analyzed: svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva bandhuḥ hutvā madhyame paridhau upaśrayati
translated: The call of 'hail!' he places first, and the deity last. The significance of this is the same (as before). Having offered, he sits down on the back (of the mound) between the two enclosing sticks.

original: svāhā grāvabhya iti prāṇā vai grāvāṇaḥ prāṇānevāsminnetaddadhāti hutvā madhyame🔽paridhāupaśrayati / / /
analyzed: svāhā grāvabhyaḥ iti prāṇāḥ vai grāvāṇaḥ prāṇān eva asmin etat dadhāti hutvā madhyame  paridhā upaśrayati
translated: 'Hail to the stones!'--the stones are the vital airs: it is the vital airs he thus bestows upon him. Having offered, he leans (the guhû) on the middle enclosing stick.

original: svāhā pratiravebhya iti prāṇā vai pratiravāḥ prāṇānhīdaṃ sarvam pratiratam
analyzed: svāhā pratiravebhyaḥ iti prāṇāḥ vai pratiravāḥ prāṇān hi idam sarvam pratiratam
translated: 'Hail to the echoes!'--the echoes are the vital airs: for by the vital airs everything here is echoed;

original: prāṇānevāsminnetaddadhāti hutvā madhyame paridhāupaśrayati / / /
analyzed: prāṇān eva asmin etat dadhāti hutvā madhyame paridhau upaśrayati
translated: it is the vital airs he thus bestows upon him. Having offered, he leans (the guhû) on the middle enclosing stick.

original: svāhā pitṛbhya ūrdhvabarhirbhyo gharmapāvabhya iti ahutvaivodaṅṅīkṣamāṇo
analyzed: svāhā pitṛbhyaḥ ūrdhva barhirbhyaḥ gharma pāvabhyaḥ iti a hutvā eva udaṅ īkṣamāṇaḥ
translated: 'Hail to the Fathers, whose fuel is the upward-streaming (smoke), and who have Gharma for their drink!'--without offering (he takes the guhû) and looks towards the north;

original: dakṣiṇārdhe barhiṣa upagūhati yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa🔽pitṝ/nagacattrayā vai pitarastānevaitatprīṇātyatha yanna prekṣate sakṛdu hyeva
analyzed: dakṣiṇa ardhe barhiṣaḥ upagūhati yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat sa  pitṝn agacat trayāḥ vai pitaraḥ tān eva etat prīṇāti atha yat na prekṣate sakṛt u hi eva
translated: he takes it up on the right side of the sacrificial grass, for the sap of the sacrifice, when its head was cut off, flowed away;

original: parāñcaḥ pitaraḥ / / /🔽svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyāmiti prāṇodānau vai
analyzed: parāñcaḥ pitaraḥ  svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām iti prāṇa udānau vai
translated: it went to the Fathers: he thus gratifies those very Fathers. And as to his not looking at it,--once for all the Fathers have departed.

original: dyāvāpṛthivīprāṇodānāvevāsminnetaddadhāti hutvā madhyame paridāupaśrayati / / /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī prāṇa udānau eva asmin etat dadhāti hutvā madhyame
translated: 'Hail to Heaven and Earth!'--Heaven and Earth are the out- and-in-breathing: it is the out- and-in-breathing he thus bestows upon him. Having offered, he leans (the guhû) on the middle enclosing stick.

original: svāhā viśvebhyo devebhya iti prāṇā vai viśve devāḥ prāṇānevāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: svāhā viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ iti prāṇāḥ vai viśve devāḥ prāṇān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: 'Hail to the All-gods!'--the All-gods are the vital airs: it is the vital airs he thus bestows upon him.

original: hutvā
analyzed: hutvā
translated: Having offered, he leans (the guhû) on the middle enclosing stick.

original: madhyame paridhāupaśrayati / / /
analyzed: madhyame paridhau upaśrayati
translated: He places it on the middle enclosing stick.

original: svāhā rudrāya rudrahūtaya iti ahutvaiva dakṣiṇekṣamāṇaḥ pratiprasthātre prayacati
analyzed: svāhā rudrāya rudra hūtaye iti a hutvā eva dakṣiṇā īkṣamāṇaḥ pratiprasthātre prayacati
translated: With Svâhâ! to Rudra, to the invocations of Rudra, he hands it to the Pratiprasthâtri, looking towards the south, without having offered it.

original: taṃ sa uttarataḥ śālāyā udañcaṃ nirasyatyeṣā hyetasya devasya
analyzed: tam saḥ uttaratas śālāyāḥ udañcam nirasyati eṣā hi etasya devasya
translated: He (the Pratiprasthâtri) throws it north of the Sâlâgrâma stone, for that is the region of that god.

original: dikṣvāyāmevainametaddiśi prīṇātyatha yanna prekṣate nenmā rudro hinasaditi / / /
analyzed: dikṣu āyām eva enam etat diśi prīṇāti atha yat na prekṣate na id mā rudraḥ hinasat iti
translated: In whatever region he (Rudra) is, he gratifies him in that region. And as to why he does not look at it, (it is) lest Rudra should injure him.

original: saptaitā āhutayo bhvanti sapta vā ime śīrṣanprāṇāstānevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: sapta etāḥ āhutayaḥ bhvanti sapta vai ime śīrṣan prāṇāḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: These are seven oblations; for there are seven vital airs in the head: it is them he thus lays into him.

original: atha mahāvīrādupayamanyām pratyānayati svāhā saṃ jyotiṣā jyotiriti jyotirvā
analyzed: atha mahāvīrāt upayamanyām pratyānayati svāhā sam jyotiṣā jyotiḥ iti jyotiḥ vā
translated: He then pours (the ghee) back from the Mahâvîra into the Upabhrit, with , 'Hail! let the light unite with the light!'

original: itarasminpayo bhavati jyotiritarasyāṃ te hyetadubhe jyotiṣī saṅgacete avaraṃ
analyzed: itarasmin payaḥ bhavati jyotiḥ itarasyām te hi etat ubhe jyotiṣī saṅga cete avaram
translated: For there is light in the one (the Mahâvîra), and light in the other (the Upabhrit): these two lights he thus unites.

original: svāhākāraṃ karoti parāṃ devatāmasāveva banduḥ / / /🔽atha rauhiṇau juhoti ahaḥ ketunā juṣatāṃ sujyotirjyotiṣā svāhetyasāveva bandhū
analyzed: svāhākāram karoti parām devatām asau eva banduḥ  atha rauhiṇau juhoti ahar ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā iti asau eva bandhū
translated: He pronounces the Svâhâ-call in the lower (oblation), and the deity in the higher: the meaning of this is the same as before.🔽He then offers the two Rauhina (cakes), with , 'Day, rejoicing in the banner, with good light, with light, Hail!' the meaning of this is the same as before.

original: rātriḥ ketunā juṣatāṃ sujyotirjyotiṣā svāhetyasāveva bandhuḥ / / /
analyzed: rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā iti asau eva bandhuḥ
translated: 'Night, rejoicing in the banner, with good light, with light, Hail!' the meaning of this is the same as before.

original: atha yajamānāya gharmociṣṭam prayacati sa upahavamiṣṭvā bhakṣayati madhu🔽hutamindratame agnāviti madhu hutamindriyavattame'gnāvityevaitadāhāśyāma te
analyzed: atha yajamānāya gharmociṣṭam prayacati sa upahavam iṣṭvā bhakṣayati madhu  hutam indratame agnau iti madhu hutam indriyavattame ignau iti eva etat āha aśyāma te
translated: He then gives to the sacrificer the residue of the Gharma. Having made an offering to the Upahavya, he (the sacrificer) drinks it, with the verse, 'The sweet oblation in the most impetuous fire' . 'The sweet oblation in the most impetuous fire,' he says, 'may we be sharers in thee'

original: deva gharma namaste astu mā mā hiṃsīrityāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /🔽atha dakṣiṇataḥ sikatā upakīrṇā bhavanti tanmārjayante ya eva mārjālīye bandhuḥ
analyzed: deva gharma namaḥ te astu mā mā hiṃsīḥ iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste  atha dakṣiṇatas sikatāḥ upakīrṇāḥ bhavanti tat mārjayante yaḥ eva mārjālīye bandhuḥ
translated: He then gives to the sacrificer the residue of the Gharma to drink. Having invited (the gods to the feast), he drinks it with (the verse), 'The sweet oblation in the most indra-like fire' . 'The sweet oblation in the most powerful fire,' this is what he thereby says. 'May we enjoy thee, O god Gharma! Honour to thee! Harm me not!' Thus he prays for a blessing.

original: so'trānupraharati śākalānathopasadā carantyetadu yajñasya śiraḥ saṃskṛtaṃ
analyzed: sotrā anupraharati śākalān atha upasadā caranti etat u yajñasya śiraḥ saṃskṛtam
translated: Then sand is scattered on the south side. They cleanse themselves there. The relation (which the Gharma has to the gods) which belongs to the Marjaliya (ploughing) he transfers to this (cleansing). He throws (the sand) on the Sâkvara (ploughing). They then perform the Upasads. This head of the sacrifice has been restored as it were,

original: yathāyathainaṃ tadaśvinau pratyadhattām / / /
analyzed: yathā yathā enam tat aśvinau pratyadhattām
translated: as the two Asvins restored it to him.

original: taṃ na prathamayajñe pravṛñjyāt enasyaṃ hi tadatho nenma indraḥ śiraścinadaditi🔽dvitīye vaiva tṛtīye vāpaśīrṣṇā hyevāgre yajñena devā arcantaḥ
analyzed: tam na prathama yajñe pravṛñjyāt enasyam hi tat atha u na id me indraḥ śiraḥ cinadat iti  dvitīye vā eva tṛtīye vā apaśīrṣṇā hi eva agre yajñena devāḥ arcantaḥ
translated: Let him not perform the Pravargya at the first sacrifice, for that would be a failure. Or let him not (perform it), lest Indra should cut off his head.

original: śrāmyantaścerustasmāddvitīye vaiva tṛtīye vātho tapto vā eṣa śuśucāno bhavati / / /
analyzed: śrāmyantaḥ ceruḥ tasmāt dvitīye vā eva tṛtīye vā atha u taptaḥ vai eṣa śuśucānaḥ bhavati
translated: At the second or the third (sacrifice he may perform it). For with a headless sacrifice the gods in the beginning worshipped, toiled, and wandered about. Therefore at the second or the third (sacrifice he may perform it). Or rather (he may perform it) at the fourth (sacrifice), for he (the sacrificer) is heated, is burning.

original: taṃ yatprathamayañe pravṛñjyāt eṣo'sya taptaḥ śuśucānaḥ prajāṃ ca paśūṃśca
analyzed: tam yat prathama yañe pravṛñjyāt eṣaḥ usya taptaḥ śuśucānaḥ prajām ca paśūn ca
translated: If he were to perform the Pravargya at the first sacrifice, that heated and glowing (Pravargya) would burn his offspring and cattle,

original: pradahedatho āyuḥ pramāyuko yajamānaḥ syāttasmāddvitīye vaiva tṛtīye vā / / /🔽taṃ na sarvasmā iva pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai pravargyo netsarvasmā iva sarvaṃ
analyzed: pradahet atha u āyuḥ pramāyukaḥ yajamānaḥ syāt tasmāt dvitīye vā eva tṛtīye vā  tam na sarvasmai iva pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai pravargyaḥ na id sarvasmai iva sarvam
translated: and also his life; the sacrificer would be short-lived. Therefore, at the second or third (sacrifice).

original: karavāṇīti yo nveva jñatastasmai pravṛñjyādyo vāsya priyaḥ syādyo
analyzed: karavāṇi iti yaḥ nu eva jñataḥ tasmai pravṛñjyāt yaḥ vā asya priyaḥ syāt yaḥ
translated: One should not perform the Pravargya for just anyone; the Pravargya is everything. 'Should I do everything for just anyone?' One should perform it for one who is known, or for one who is dear to him.

original: vānūcāno'nūktenainam prāpnuyāt / / /🔽sahasre pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai sahasraṃ sarvameṣa sarvavedase pravṛñjyātsarvam vai🔽sarvavedasaṃ sarvameṣa viśvajiti sarvapṛṣthe pravṛñjyātsarvam vai
analyzed: vā anūcānā unūktena enam prāpnuyāt  sahasre pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai sahasram sarvam eṣa sarvavedase pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai  sarvavedasam sarvam eṣa viśvajiti sarva pṛṣthe pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai
translated: One who is learned would obtain it through his learning.

original: viśvajitsarvapṛṣṭhaḥ sarvameṣa vājapeye rājasūye pravṛñjyātsarvaṃ hi tatsattre
analyzed: viśvajit sarva pṛṣṭhaḥ sarvam eṣa vājapeye rājasūye pravṛñjyāt sarvam hi tat sattre
translated: One should perform the Pravargya at a thousand (cows as sacrificial fee); a thousand is everything, and this (Pravargya) is everything. One should perform it at a sacrifice where everything is given as the sacrificial fee; everything is given at a sacrifice where everything is given as the sacrificial fee, and this (Pravargya) is everything. One should perform it at the Vishvajit sacrifice with all the Prsthas; the Vishvajit with all the Prsthas is everything, and this (Pravargya) is everything. One should perform it at the Vajapeya and Rajasuya; all that is included in them.

original: pravṛñjyātsarvam vai sattraṃ sarvameṣa etānyasya pravarjanānyato nānyatra / / /
analyzed: pravṛñjyāt sarvam vai sattram sarvam eṣaḥ etāni asya pravarjanāni atas na anyatra
translated: One should perform it at a Sattra; a Sattra is everything, and this (Pravargya) is everything. These are the occasions for the Pravargya; not elsewhere.

original: tadāhuḥ yadapaśirā apravargyo'tha kenāsyāgnihotraṃ
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat apaśirāḥ a pravargyaḥ utha kena asya agnihotram
translated: They say, 'If the Pravargya is without the head, then by what is his Agnihotra?'

original: śīrṣaṇvadbhavatītyāhavanīyeneti brūyātkathaṃ darśapūrṇamāsāvityājyena ca🔽puroḍāśena ceti brūyātkathaṃ cāturmāsyānīti payasyayeti brūyātkatham paśubandha
analyzed: śīrṣaṇvat bhavati iti āhavanīyena iti brūyāt katham darśa pūrṇamāsau iti ājyena ca  puroḍāśena ca iti brūyāt katham cāturmāsyāni iti payasyayā iti brūyāt katham paśubandha
translated: If one says, It becomes endowed with a head, one should say, With the Ahavaniya fire. If one says, How are the new and full moon sacrifices? one should say, With ghee🔽and sacrificial cake. If one says, How are the four-monthly sacrifices? one should say, With milk. If one says, How is the animal sacrifice? one should say, With the sacrificial post.

original: iti paśunā ca puroḍāśena ceti brūyātkathaṃ saumyo'dhvara iti havirdhāneneti brūyāt / / /
analyzed: iti paśunā ca puroḍāśena ca iti brūyāt katham saumyaḥ udhvaraḥ iti havirdhānena iti brūyāt
translated: If one should say, It becomes possessed of a head, one should say, By the Āhavanīya fire. If one should say, How are the New and Full Moon sacrifices? one should say, By the Ājyabhāga and Puronuvākyā. If one should say, How are the four-monthly sacrifices? one should say, By the Payasya. If one should say, How is the animal sacrifice? one should say, By the animal and the cake. If one should say, How is the Soma sacrifice? one should say, By the Havirdhāna.

original: atho āhuḥ yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya śira etaddevāḥ pratyadadhuryadātithyaṃ na ha vā
analyzed: atha u āhuḥ yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya śiraḥ etat devāḥ pratyadadhuḥ yat ātithyam na ha vā
translated: Then they say, This is the head which the gods put back on the sacrifice when its head was cut off, namely the Atithya sacrifice.

original: asyāpaśīrṣṇā kena cana yajñeneṣṭam bhavati ya evametadveda / / /🔽tadāhuḥ yatpraṇītāḥ praṇayanti yajñe'tha kasmādatra na praṇayatīti śiro vā
analyzed: asya apaśīrṣṇā kena cana yajñena iṣṭam bhavati yaḥ evam etat veda  tat āhuḥ yat praṇītāḥ praṇayanti kasmāt atra na praṇayati iti śiraḥ vā
translated: For no sacrifice is performed without a head by one who knows this.

original: etadyajñāsya yatpraṇītāḥ śiraḥ pravargyo necirasā śiro'bhyārohayāṇīti / / /🔽tadāhuḥ yatprayājānuyājā anyatra bhavantyatha kasmādatra na bhavantīti prāṇā vai
analyzed: etat yajña asya yat praṇītāḥ śiraḥ pravargyaḥ śiraḥ abhyārohayāṇi iti  tat āhuḥ yat prayāja anuyājāḥ anyatra bhavanti atha kasmāt atra na bhavanti iti prāṇāḥ vai
translated: They say, When they lead the Pranītā waters forward in a sacrifice, why are they not led forward here? The Pranītā waters are the head of the sacrifice, the Pravargya is the head; he should not place the head on the head.

original: prayājānuyājāḥ prāṇā avakāśāḥ prāṇāḥ śākala netprāṇaiḥ prāṇānabhyārohayāṇīti / / /
analyzed: prayāja anuyājāḥ prāṇāḥ avakāśāḥ prāṇāḥ śākala na id prāṇaiḥ prāṇān abhyārohayāṇi iti
translated: They say, When the Prayāja and Anuyāja offerings are made elsewhere, why are they not made here? The Prayāja and Anuyāja offerings are the vital breaths, the spaces are the vital breaths, the Śākala (verses) are the vital breaths; he should not place the vital breaths on the vital breaths.

original: tadāhuḥ yadājyabhāgāvanyatra juhvatyatha kasmādatra na juhotīti cakṣuṣī vā ete
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat ājyabhāgau anyatra juhvati atha kasmāt atra na juhoti iti cakṣuṣī vai ete
translated: As to this they say, 'Since elsewhere they offer the two butter-portions, why does he not offer them here?'--These two, doubtless, are the eyes of the sacrifice;

original: yajñasya yadājyabhāgau cakṣuṣī rauhiṇau neccakṣuṣā cakṣurabhyārohayāṇīti / / /
analyzed: yajñasya yat ājyabhāgau cakṣuṣī rauhiṇau na id cakṣuṣā cakṣuḥ abhyārohayāṇi iti
translated: As to this they say, 'Since he offers the two butter-portions elsewhere, why does he not offer them here?' The two butter-portions are the eyes of the sacrifice, and the two Rauhina (cakes) are the eyes: 'Lest I should put eye into eye,' he thinks, and therefore he does not offer them.

original: tadāhuḥ yadvānaspatyairdevebhyo juhvatyatha kasmādetam mṃmayenaiva juhotīti
analyzed: tat āhuḥ yat vānaspatyaiḥ devebhyaḥ juhvati atha kasmāt etam mṃ mayena eva juhoti iti
translated: As to this they say, 'Since he offers to the gods with (cakes) made of wood, why does he offer this one with one made of clay?'

original: yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya raso vyakṣaratsa ime dyāvāpṛthivī agacadyanmṛdiyaṃ
analyzed: yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya rasaḥ vyakṣarat saḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī agacat yat mṛdiyam
translated: The sap of the sacrifice, when its head was cut off, flowed away; it went to these two, heaven and earth; what is water is this (earth),

original: tadyadāpo'sau tanmṛdaścāpāṃ ca mahāvīrāḥ kṛtā bhavanti tenaivainametadrasena🔽samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /🔽sa yadvānaspatyaḥ syāt pradahyeta yaddhiraṇmayaḥ syātpralīyeta yallohamayaḥ🔽syātprasicyeta yadayasmayaḥ syātpradahetparīśāsāvathaiṣa evaitasmāatiṣṭhata
analyzed: tat yat āpaḥ usau tat mṛdaḥ ca apām ca mahāvīrāḥ kṛtāḥ bhavanti tena eva enam etat rasena  samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti  sa yat vānaspatyaḥ syāt pradahyeta yat hiraṇmayaḥ syāt pralīyeta yat loha mayaḥ  syāt prasicyeta yat ayasmayaḥ syāt pradahet pari īśā asau atha eṣaḥ eva etasmai atiṣṭhata
translated: and what is water is yonder (sky). The two Mahâvîra (dishes) are made of clay and water: with that sap he thus supplies and completes it.

original: tasmādetam mṛnmayenaiva juhoti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt etam mṛd mayena eva juhoti
translated: If it were (made) of wood, it would burn; if of gold, it would melt; if of iron, it would rust; if of copper, it would burn. The two Mahâvîra (dishes) are made of clay: therefore he offers this one with one made of clay.

original: athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣ/
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣ
translated: Now, that light enters him who either explains this (sacrifice) to another, or partakes of it with another.

original: ayati vā tasya
analyzed: ayati vā tasya
translated: He becomes like unto it,

original: vratacaryā yā sṛs/t/au / / /
analyzed: vrata caryā yā sṛstau
translated: The observance of the vow is the release from...

original: sa vai tṛtīye'han ṣaṣṭhe vā dvādaśe vā pravargyopasadau samasya
analyzed: sa vai tṛtīya īhan ṣaṣṭhe vā dvādaśe vā pravargya upasadau samasya
translated: He combines the Pravargya and Upasad on the third, sixth, or twelfth day.

original: pravargyamutsādayatyutsannamiva hīdaṃ śirastadyadetamabhito bhavati tatsarvaṃ
analyzed: pravargyam utsādayati utsannam iva hi idam śiraḥ tat yat etam abhitas bhavati tat sarvam
translated: He spreads out the Pravargya. For this (head) is as if spread out. Whatever is around it,

original: samādāyāgreṇa śālāmantarvedyupasamāyanti / / /
analyzed: samādāya agreṇa śālām antarvedi upasamāyanti
translated: he takes all that and goes to the front of the hall within the Vedi.

original: athāgnīdhraḥ āhavanīye trīñcālākānupakalpayate teṣāmekamujjvalayya
analyzed: atha āgnīdhraḥ āhavanīye trīn ca alākān upakalpayate teṣām ekam ujjvalayya
translated: Then the Agnidhra prepares three fire-sticks on the Ahavaniya. Having kindled one of them,

original: mukhadaghne dhārayamāṇo juhoti yajñasya śīrṣacinnasya🔽śugudakrāmatsemāṃlokānāviśattayaivainametacucā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /🔽atha yanmukhadaghne uparīva vai tadyanmukhadaghnamuparīva tadyadasau
analyzed: mukha daghne dhārayamāṇaḥ juhoti yajñasya śīrṣa cinnasya  śuc udakrāmat sā imān lokān āviśat tayā eva enam etat cucā samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti  atha yat mukha daghne upari iva vai tat yat mukha daghnam upari iva tat yat asau
translated: holding it at the height of the mouth, he offers. The ghee of the sacrifice,🔽when the head was cut off, fled away. It entered these worlds. With that same ghee he thus supplies it, makes it whole.🔽Then as to why (he holds it) at the height of the mouth. What is at the height of the mouth is as it were above, and this world is as it were above.

original: lokastadyāmuṃ lokaṃ śugāviśattayaivainametacucā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /
analyzed: lokaḥ tat yā amum lokam śuc āviśat tayā eva enam etat cucā samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: With that same ghee he thus supplies it, makes it whole.

original: yā te gharma divyā śugiti yaiva divyā śugyā gāyatryāṃhavirdhāna iti yaiva gāyatryāṃ
analyzed: yā te gharma divyā śuc iti yā eva divyā śuc yā gāyatryām havirdhāne iti yā eva gāyatryām
translated: 'That heavenly dart of thine, O Gharma', (with these words) he offers that dart of his which is in the heaven. 'Which in the Gayatri the oblation-holder', (with these words) he offers that dart of his which is in the Gayatri.

original: havirdhāne sā ta āpyāyatāṃ niṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāheti nātra tirohitamivāsti / / /
analyzed: havirdhāne sā te āpyāyatām niṣṭyāyatām tasyai te svāhā iti na atra tirohitam iva asti
translated: Let that of thine which is in the Havirdhâna swell and increase: to it, to thee, Svâhâ! There is nothing obscure in this.

original: atha dvitīyamujjvalayya nābhidaghne dhārayamāṇo juhoti madhyamiva vai🔽tadyannābhidaghnaṃ madhyamivāntarikṣalokastadyāntarikṣalokaṃ
analyzed: atha dvitīyam ujjvalayya nābhi daghne dhārayamāṇaḥ juhoti madhyam iva vai  tat yat nābhi daghnam madhyam iva antarikṣa lokaḥ tat yā antarikṣa lokam
translated: He then kindles the second (fire), and holding it at the height of the navel, he offers with, 'The middle, as it were,'--

original: śugāviśattayaivainametacucā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti / / /🔽yāte gharmāntarikṣe śugiti yaivāntarikṣe śugyā triṣṭubhyāgnīdhra iti yaiva🔽triṣṭubhyāgnīdhre sā ta āpyāyatāṃ niṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāheti nātra tirohitamivāsti / / /
analyzed: śuc āviśat tayā eva enam etat cucā samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti  yāte gharma antarikṣe śuc iti yā eva antarikṣe śuc yā triṣṭubhyā āgnīdhre iti yā eva  triṣṭubhyā āgnīdhre sā te āpyāyatām niṣṭyāyatām tasyai te svāhā iti na atra tirohitam iva asti
translated: for what is at the height of the navel is as it were the middle; and the air-world is as it were the middle: he thus supplies and completes it with that same heat which entered the air-world.🔽'The heat which is in the air,'--that which is in the air;--'the heat which is in the Trishtubh, in the Âgnîdhra,'--that which is in the Trishtubh, in the Âgnîdhra;--'let that of thine swell and increase: to it, to thee, Svâhâ!' There is nothing obscure in this.

original: atha tṛtīyamabhyādhāya tasminnāsīno juhotyadhaiva vai tadyadāsīno'dhaiva
analyzed: atha tṛtīyam abhyādhāya tasmin āsīnaḥ juhoti adha eva vai tat yat āsīnaḥ udha eva
translated: He then raises the third (fire), and sitting thereon he offers with, 'The lower, as it were,'--for what is lower is as it were the lower world;

original: tadyadayaṃ lokastadyemaṃ lokaṃ śugāviśattayaivainametacucā samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ🔽karoti / / /
analyzed: tat yat ayam lokaḥ tat yā imam lokam śuc āviśat tayā eva enam etat cucā samardhayati kṛtsnam  karoti
translated: and this world is as it were the lower world: he thus supplies and completes it with that same heat which entered this world.

original: yā te gharma pṛthivyāṃ śugiti yaiva pṛthivyāṃ śugyā jagatyāṃ sadasyeti yaiva
analyzed: yā te gharma pṛthivyām śuc iti yā eva pṛthivyām śuc yā jagatyām sadasyā iti yā eva
translated: 'The heat which is in the earth,'--that which is in the earth;--'the heat which is in the Gagatî, in the Sadas,'--that which is in the Gagatî, in the Sadas;--'let that of thine swell and increase: to it, to thee, Svâhâ!' There is nothing obscure in this.

original: jagatyāṃ sadasyā sā taāpyāyatāṃ niṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāheti nātra tirohitamivāsti / / /🔽athopaniṣkrāmati kṣatrasya tvā paraspāyetyetadvai daivaṃ kṣatraṃ ya eṣa🔽tapatyasya tvā mānuṣasya kṣatrasya paraspatvāyetyevaitadāha brahmaṇastanvam🔽pāhīti brahmaṇa ātmānaṃ gopāyetyevaitadāha viśastvā dharmaṇā vayamiti yajño vai
analyzed: jagatyām sadasyā sā te āpyāyatām niṣṭyāyatām tasyai te svāhā iti na atra tirohitam iva asti  atha upaniṣkrāmati kṣatrasya tvā paraspāya iti etat vai daivam kṣatram yaḥ eṣa  tapatyasya tvā mānuṣasya kṣatrasya paraspatvāya iti eva etat āha brahmaṇaḥ tanvam  pāhi iti brahmaṇaḥ ātmānam gopāya iti eva etat āha viśastvā dharmaṇā vayam iti yajñaḥ vai
translated: In the Jagati, may she be seated for thee, may she be extended for thee, to her thee Svâhâ! There is nothing obscure in this.

original: viḍyajñasya tvāriṣṭyā ityevaitadāmānukrāmāma suvitāya navyasa iti yajñasya🔽tvāriṣṭyā ahvalāyā ityevaitadāha / / /🔽athāha sāma gāyeti sāma brūhīti vā gāyeti tveva brūyādgāyanti hi sāma tadyatsāma
analyzed: viś yajñasya tvā ariṣṭyai iti eva etat āma anukrāmāma suvitāya navyase iti yajñasya  tvā ariṣṭyai ahvalāyai iti eva etat āha  atha āha sāma gāya iti sāma brūhi iti vā gāya iti tu eva brūyāt gāyanti hi sāma tat yat sāma
translated: He then steps out (of the cart-shed), with (the verse), For the protection of the Kshatra (nobility) of thee (O shed),--the Kshatra of the gods, doubtless, is he who shines yonder (the sun);--for the protection of thy human Kshatra,--that is, for the protection of thy nobility among men; protect the body of the Brahman (priesthood),--that is, guard the soul of the Brahman; we, according to the law, thee, the people,--the people, doubtless, is the sacrifice;--for the safety of the sacrifice,--that is, for the security of the sacrifice; we will follow thee for fresh prosperity,--that is, for the security and safety of the sacrifice.

original: gāyati nedimānbahirdhā yajñācarīrānnāṣṭrā rakṣāṃsi hinasanniti sāma hi nāṣṭrāṇāṃ🔽rakṣasāmapahantā / / /
analyzed: gāyati na id imān bahirdhā nāṣṭrāḥ rakṣāṃsi hinasan iti sāma hi nāṣṭrāṇām  rakṣasām apahantā
translated: He then says, 'Sing the Sâman!' or 'Recite the Sâman!' but let him rather say, 'Sing,' for they sing the Sâman. The reason why he sings the Sâman is that he thereby keeps those bodies of his (Agni's) outside the sacrifice, lest the evil spirits should injure them. For the Sâman is a repeller of the evil spirits and fiends.

original: āgneyyāṃ gāyati agnirhi rakṣasāmapahantāticandasi gāyatyeṣā vai sarvāṇi candāṃsi
analyzed: āgneyyām gāyati agniḥ hi rakṣasām apahantā ati candasi gāyati eṣā vai sarvāṇi candāṃsi
translated: He sings it in the Âgrayana (cup), for Agni is a repeller of the evil spirits and fiends. He sings it in the Atikhandas (metre), for this (Atikhandas) is all the metres.

original: yadavticandāstasmādaticandasi gāyati / / /
analyzed: yat avticandāḥ tasmāt aticandasi gāyati
translated: In that it is the Atichandas, therefore he sings in the Atichandas.

original: sa gāyati agniṣṭapati pratidahatyahāvo'hāva iti tannāṣṭrā vai
analyzed: sa gāyati agniṣṭapati pratidahati ahāva uhāva iti tat nāṣṭrāḥ vai
translated: He sings, Agni burns, he burns back, 'Aha! Aha!' That is for the Rakshas,

original: tadrakṣāṃsyato'pahanti / / /
analyzed: tat rakṣāṃsi atas upahanti
translated: he drives them away from here.

original: ta udañco niṣkrāmanti jaganena cātvālamagreṇāgnīdhrameṣā hi yajñasya dvāḥ sa
analyzed: te udañcaḥ niṣkrāmanti jaganena cātvālam agreṇa āgnīdhram eṣā hi yajñasya dvār sa
translated: They go out to the north, with the Jagati, in front of the pit, in front of the Agnidhra. This is the door of the sacrifice.

original: yasyāṃ tato diśyāpo bhavanti tadyanti / / /🔽tam vai pariṣyanda utsādayet tapto vā eṣa śuśucāno bhavati taṃ
analyzed: yasyām tatas diśi āpaḥ bhavanti tat yanti  tam vai pariṣyande utsādayet taptaḥ vai eṣa śuśucānaḥ bhavati tam
translated: They go to where the water is in that direction.🔽He should place it on the sloping ground. It is heated and glowing.

original: yadasyāmutsādayedimāmasya śugṛcedyadapsūtsādayedapo'sya śugṛcedatha
analyzed: yat asyām utsādayet imām asya śuc ṛced yat apsu utsādayet apa usya śuc ṛced atha
translated: If he were to place it on this (earth), its heat would enter this (earth); if he were to place it in the water, its heat would enter the water.

original: yatpariṣyanda utsādayati tatho ha naivāpo hinasti nemāṃ yadahāpsu na prāsyati
analyzed: yat pariṣyande utsādayati tathā u ha na eva apaḥ hinasti na imām yat aha apsu na prāsyati
translated: When he places it on the sloping ground, then indeed he does not injure either the water or this (earth). In that he does not throw it into the water,

original: tenāpo na hinastyatha yatsamantamāpaḥ pariyanti śāntirvā āpasteno imāṃ na hinasti
analyzed: tena apaḥ na hinasti atha yat samantam āpaḥ pariyanti śāntiḥ vai āpaḥ tena u imām na hinasti
translated: he does not injure the water. Then in that the water flows around on all sides, and water is peace, thus he does not injure this (earth).

original: tasmātpariṣyanda utsādayet / / /
analyzed: tasmāt pariṣyande utsādayet
translated: Therefore he should place it on the sloping ground.

original: uttaravedau tvevotsādayet yajño vā uttaravediḥ śiraḥ pravargyo yajña evataciraḥ
analyzed: uttaravedau tu eva utsādayet yajñaḥ vai uttaravediḥ śiraḥ pravargyaḥ yajñaḥ evataciraḥ
translated: But he should place it on the Uttaravedi. The Uttaravedi is the sacrifice, the Pravargya is the head. In the sacrifice itself he puts the head back.

original: pratidadhāti / / /
analyzed: pratidadhāti
translated: He places it.

original: uttaranābhyā saṃspṛṣṭam prathamam pravargyamutsādayati vāgvā uttaranābhiḥ
analyzed: uttaranābhyā saṃspṛṣṭam prathamam pravargyam utsādayati vāc vai uttaranābhiḥ
translated: He throws out the first Pravargya stone, touching it with his navel; the upper navel is speech;

original: śiraḥ pravargyaḥ śīrṣaṃstadvācaṃ dadhāti / / /
analyzed: śiraḥ pravargyaḥ śīrṣan tat vācam dadhāti
translated: the Pravargya is the head; he thus puts speech into the head.

original: catuḥsraktiriti eṣa vai catuḥsraktirya eṣa tapati diśo hyetasya sraktayastasmādāha
analyzed: catur sraktiḥ iti eṣa vai catur sraktiḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati diśaḥ hi etasya sraktayaḥ tasmāt āha
translated: 'Four-cornered', he says; for he who shines yonder is indeed four-cornered, for the quarters are his corners; therefore he says,

original: catuḥsraktiriti / / /
analyzed: catur sraktiḥ iti
translated: 'Four-cornered.'

original: nābhirṛtasya saprathā iti satyam vā ṛtaṃ satyasya nābhiḥ saprathā ityevaitadāha sa no
analyzed: nābhiḥ ṛtasya saprathāḥ iti satyam vai ṛtam satyasya nābhiḥ saprathāḥ iti eva etat āha sa naḥ
translated: 'The navel of the truth, the spreading', he says; truth is the truth; the navel of the truth is the spreading; thus he says. 'May it be to us

original: viśvāyuḥ saprathā iti sa naḥ sarvāyuḥ saprathā ityevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: viśva āyuḥ saprathāḥ iti sa naḥ sarva āyuḥ saprathāḥ iti eva etat āha
translated: for all life, the spreading', he says; 'may it be to us for all life, the spreading', thus he says.

original: apa dveṣo apa hvara iti nātra tirohitamivāstyanyavratasya saścimetyanyadvā etasya
analyzed: apa dveṣaḥ apa hvaraḥ iti na atra tirohitam iva asti anya vratasya saścima iti anyat vai etasya
translated: 'Away hatred, away contempt', he says; there is nothing obscure in this. 'May we be united with him of other vows', he says; his vow is one,

original: vratamanyanmanuṣyāṇāṃ tasmādāhānyavratasya saścimetyevamitarau prāñcau
analyzed: vratam anyat manuṣyāṇām tasmāt āha anya vratasya saścima iti evam itarau prāñcau
translated: men's is another; therefore he says, 'May we be united with him of other vows.' In like manner the other two (stones) to the east.

original: tattrivṛttrivṛddhīdaṃ śiraḥ / / /
analyzed: tat trivṛt trivṛt hi idam śiraḥ
translated: That makes three sets of three; this is the head (of the altar).

original: purastādupaśayām mṛdam māṃsamevāsminnetaddadhāti tadabhitaḥ parīśāsau bāhū
analyzed: purastāt upaśayām mṛdam māṃsam eva asmin etat dadhāti tat abhitas parīśā asau bāhū
translated: In front (he throws) the clay of the Upasamhṛdī; he thus puts flesh into it. On both sides the two Pariśrīṣ;

original: evāsminnetaddadhātyabhitaḥ pare rauhiṇahavanyau srucau
analyzed: eva asmin etat dadhāti abhitas pare rauhiṇa havanyau srucau
translated: he thus puts arms into it. On both sides the two Rauhina-offering ladles;

original: hastāvevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: hastau eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: He puts them into his (Agni's) hands, for they are his members.

original: uttarato'bhrim taddhi tasyā āyatanaṃ dakṣiṇataḥ samrāḍāsandīṃ taddhi tasyā
analyzed: uttaratas bhrim tat hi tasyāḥ āyatanam dakṣiṇatas samrāj āsandīm tat hi tasyāḥ
translated: The hoe on the north side, for that is its place. On the south side the imperial throne, for that is its place.

original: āyatanamuttarataḥ kṛṣṇājinaṃ taddhi tasyāyatanaṃ sarvato dhavitrāṇi prāṇā vai🔽dhavitrāṇi prāṇānevāsminnetaddadāti trīṇi bhavanti trayo vai prāṇāḥ pr /ṇa udāno
analyzed: āyatanam uttaratas kṛṣṇājinam tat hi tasya āyatanam sarvatas dhavitrāṇi prāṇāḥ vai  dhavitrāṇi prāṇān eva asmin etat dadāti trīṇi bhavanti trayaḥ vai prāṇāḥ prṇaḥ udānaḥ
translated: On the north side the black antelope skin, for that is its place. On all sides the fans. The fans are the vital airs;🔽he thus bestows the vital airs on him. There are three (fans), for there are three vital airs, the out-breathing, the in-breathing, and the through-breathing;

original: vyānastānevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: vyānaḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: he thus puts those into him.

original: athaitadrajjusandānam upayamanyāmādhāya🔽paścātprācīmāsādayatyudaramevāsminnetaddadhāti tadabhitaḥ pinvane🔽āṇḍāvevāsminnetaddadhātyāṇḍābhyāṃ hi vṛṣā pinvate paścātsthūṇāmayūkhamūrū
analyzed: atha etat rajju sandānam upayamanyām ādhāya  paścāt prācīm āsādayati udaram eva asmin etat dadhāti tat abhitas pinvane  āṇḍau eva asmin etat dadhāti āṇḍābhyām hi vṛṣā pinvate paścāt sthūṇā mayūkham ūrū
translated: He then puts the rope-halter on the support,🔽and places it behind (the black antelope skin) with its ends to the east. He thus puts the belly into him. On both sides of it the two bags,🔽he thus puts the two testicles into him; for by means of the testicles the male swells. Behind (he places) the post-peg,

original: evāsminnetaddadhāti paścādrauhiṇakapāle jānunī evāsminnetaddadhāti te
analyzed: eva asmin etat dadhāti paścāt rauhiṇa kapāle jānunī eva asmin etat dadhāti te
translated: the thighs into him. Behind (he places) the two Rauhina-plates,

original: yadekakapāle bhavata ekakapāle iva hīme jānunī paścāddhṛṣṭī
analyzed: yat eka kapāle bhavataḥ eka kapāle iva hi ime jānunī paścāt hṛṣṭī
translated: the knees into him. They are made of one (part only), for the knees are as it were of one (part only). Behind (he places) the two spits,

original: pādāvevāsminnetaddadhāti pādābhyāṃ hi dhṛṣṭam praharatyuttarataḥ kharau
analyzed: pādau eva asmin etat dadhāti pādābhyām hi dhṛṣṭam praharati uttaratas kharau
translated: the feet into him; for by means of the feet one strikes with the spit. On the north side the two chopping-boards,

original: pracaraṇīyau taddhi tayorāyatanaṃ dakṣiṇato mārjālīyaṃ taddhi tasyāyatanam / / /🔽athāsminpaya ānayati gharmaitatte purīṣamityannam vai🔽purīṣamannamevāsminnetaddadhāti tena vardhasva cā ca pyāyasveti nātra
analyzed: pracaraṇīyau tat hi tayoḥ āyatanam dakṣiṇatas mārjālīyam tat hi tasya āyatanam  atha asmin payaḥ ānayati gharma etat te purīṣam iti annam vai  purīṣam annam eva asmin etat dadhāti tena vardhasva ca ā ca pyāyasva iti na atra
translated: The two (fires) are to be carried forward; for that is their abode. The Mârjâliya (fire) is on the south side; for that is its abode.

original: tirohitamivāsti vardhiṣīmahi ca vayamā ca pyāsiṣīmahītyāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /🔽sa vai na sarvamivānayet nedyajamānātparāgannamasadityardham vā bhūyo vā🔽pariṣinaṣṭi tasminnaparāhṇe yajamānāya vratamabhyutsicya prayacati tadyajamāna
analyzed: tirohitam iva asti vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste  sa vai na sarvam iva ānayet na id yajamānāt parāgannam asat iti ardham vā bhūyaḥ vā  pariṣinaṣṭi tasmin aparāhṇe yajamānāya vratam abhyutsicya prayacati tat yajamāna
translated: He then pours milk into it (the Gârhapatya) with, 'This, O Gharma, is thy filling,'--filling means food; he thus puts food into it. 'Grow thou great thereby, and wax strong!'--there is nothing obscure in this. 'May we grow great, and wax strong,'--he thereby invokes a blessing.

original: evaitadannādyaṃ dadhāti tatho ha yajamānānna parāgannam bhavati / / /🔽athainamadbhiḥ pariṣiñcati śāntirvā āpaḥ śamayatyevainametatsarvataḥ pariṣiñcati
analyzed: eva etat annādyam dadhāti tathā u ha yajamāna anna parāgannam bhavati  atha enam adbhiḥ pariṣiñcati śāntiḥ vai āpaḥ śamayati eva enam etat sarvatas pariṣiñcati
translated: Let him not pour in all (the milk), lest food should be wanting to the sacrificer. Either half or more he pours out again; and in the afternoon he pours out for the sacrificer what remains over of the vow-milk, and gives it to him. He thus bestows food on the sacrificer, and so food does not fail to the sacrificer.

original: sarvata evainametacamayati triṣkṛtvaḥ pariṣiñcati trivṛddhi yajñaḥ / / /
analyzed: sarvatas eva enam etat camayati triṣkṛtvaḥ pariṣiñcati trivṛt hi yajñaḥ
translated: He then sprinkles it (the Gârhapatya) with water; for water means appeasement: he thus appeases it. He sprinkles it on every side: on every side he thus appeases it. Three times he sprinkles it; for threefold is the sacrifice.

original: athāha vārṣāharaṃ sāma gāyati eṣa vai vṛṣā harirya eṣa tapatyeṣa u
analyzed: atha āha vārṣāharam sāma gāyati eṣa vai vṛṣā hariḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati eṣaḥ u
translated: He then sings the Vārṣāhara Sāman. This indeed is the bull, the tawny one, who shines yonder. He is the lord of the rain.

original: pravargyastadetamevaitatprīṇāti tasmādāha vārṣāharaṃ sāma gāyati / / /🔽atha cātvāle mārjayante sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santvityañjalināpa upācati vajro
analyzed: pravargyaḥ tat etam eva etat prīṇāti tasmāt āha vārṣāharam sāma gāyati  atha cātvāle mārjayante su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu iti añjalinā apaḥ upācati
translated: He then sings the Vârshâhara Sâman. The Vârshâhara (rain-bringing) Sâman is this very (sun), for he who shines yonder is the male (vrisha) and the tawny one (harî): he is the Pravargya. It is him he thus gratifies; therefore he sings the Vârshâhara Sâman.

original: vā āpo vajreṇaivaitanmitradheyaṃ kurute durmitriyāstasmai santu yo'smāndveṣṭi yaṃ🔽ca vayaṃ dviṣma iti yāmasya diśaṃ dveṣyaḥ syāttāṃ diśaṃ parāsiñcettenaiva tam🔽parābhāvayati / / /🔽atha prāṅivodaṅṅutkrāmati udvayaṃ tamasasparīti pāpmā vai tamaḥ pāpmānameva🔽tamo'pahate svaḥ paśyanta uttaramityayam vai loko'dbhya uttaro'sminneva loke
analyzed: vai āpaḥ vajreṇa eva etat mitradheyam kurute durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ usmān dveṣṭi yam  ca vayam dviṣmaḥ iti yām asya diśam dveṣyaḥ syāt tām diśam parāsiñcet tena eva tam  parābhāvayati  atha prāṅ iva udaṅ utkrāmati ud vayam tamasaḥ pari iti pāpmā vai tamaḥ pāpmānam eva  tama upahate svar paśyantaḥ uttaram iti ayam vai lokaḥ udbhyaḥ uttaraḥ asmin eva loke
translated: They then cleanse themselves at the pit, with (the verse), 'May the waters and plants be kind to us.' With his joined hands he addresses the waters; for the waters are a thunderbolt: by means of the thunderbolt he thus makes that (earth) his friend. 'Unfriendly to him be they who hate us, and whom we hate!' he says; and if there be one whom he hates in that direction in which the sun sets, he should pour (the water) out in that direction, and by that (act) he overpowers him.

original: pratitiṣṭhati devaṃ devatrā sūryamaganma jyotiruttamamiti svargo vai lokaḥ sūryo
analyzed: pratitiṣṭhati devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam iti svargaḥ vai lokaḥ sūryaḥ
translated: He then steps forward towards the north-east, with (the verse), 'We have gone up from darkness to light,'--darkness being evil, he thus keeps away from him the evil, the darkness;--'we have gone up to the heavenly light,'--the heavenly world being the world of the gods, he thus establishes himself in the world of the gods;--'we have gone up to the highest light,'--the highest light, doubtless, is the heavenly world;--'we have gone up to the god Sûrya,'--Sûrya being the heavenly world;--'we have gone up to the highest light,'--the highest light, doubtless, is the heavenly world;--'we have gone up to the gods, to the god Sûrya,'--the gods, doubtless, are the breaths;--'to the highest light,'--the highest light, doubtless, is the heavenly world.

original: jyotiruttamaṃ svarga eva loke'ntataḥ pratitiṣṭhatyanapekṣametyāhavanīye
analyzed: jyotiḥ uttamam svarge eva loke intataḥ pratitiṣṭhati an apekṣam eti āhavanīye
translated: The highest light, indeed, heaven, finally rests on the Āhavanīya fire, independent.

original: samidhamabhyādadhāti samidasi tejo'si tejo mayi dhehītyāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /
analyzed: samidham abhyādadhāti samidh asi tejaḥ asi tejaḥ mayi dhehi iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste
translated: He puts a piece of wood on the Āhavanīya fire, with the formula, 'Thou art a piece of wood; thou art brilliance; bestow brilliance on me.' He thereby invokes a blessing.

original: atha prasute dadhigharmeṇa caranti yajño vai somaḥ śiraḥ pravargyo yajña
analyzed: atha prasute dadhi gharmeṇa caranti yajñaḥ vai somaḥ śiraḥ pravargyaḥ yajña
translated: Then, when the pressing (of Soma juice) has begun, they perform the Dadhigharma rite. Soma is the sacrifice, the Pravargya is the head.

original: evaitaciraḥ pratidadhāti mādhyandine savana etadvā indrasya niṣkevalyaṃ savanaṃ
analyzed: eva etaciraḥ pratidadhāti mādhyandine savane etat vai indrasya niṣkevalyam savanam
translated: He thus restores the head to the sacrifice. At the midday pressing. This is Indra's exclusive pressing.

original: yanmādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ sva evainametadbhāge prīṇāti stute mādhyandine
analyzed: yat mādhyandinam savanam sve eva enam etat bhāge prīṇāti stute mādhyandine
translated: The midday pressing is his own share. He delights him in his own share.

original: pavamāne prāṇo vai mādhyandinaḥ pavamānaḥ🔽prāṇamevāsminnetaddadhātyagnihotrahavaṇyā mukham vā etadyajñānāṃ
analyzed: pavamāne prāṇaḥ vai mādhyandinaḥ pavamānaḥ  prāṇam eva asmin etat dadhāti agnihotrahavaṇyāḥ mukham vai etat yajñānām
translated: When the midday Pavamāna (stotra) has been chanted, the midday Pavamāna is the breath.

original: yadagnihotraṃ śīrṣaṃstanmukhaṃ dadhāti / / /🔽sa ānīyamāna āha hotarvadasva yatte vādyamiti vadate hyatra
analyzed: yat agnihotram śīrṣan tat mukham dadhāti  saḥ ānīyamānaḥ āha hotar vadasva yat te vādyam iti vadate hi atra
translated: He thus puts breath into him. With the Agnihotra ladle. The Agnihotra is the mouth of sacrifices.🔽He thus puts the mouth into the head.🔽When it is being brought (to the Sadas), he says to the Hotṛ, 'Speak what thou hast to speak.' For he speaks here.

original: hotāthopottiṣṭhannāha śrātaṃ haviriti śrātaṃ hi bhavatyatikramyāśrāvyāha
analyzed: hotā atha upottiṣṭhan āha śrātam haviḥ iti śrātam hi bhavati atikramya āśrāvya āha
translated: Then, rising up, he says, 'The oblation has been cooked.' For it has been cooked. Having stepped across and having caused to announce, he says,

original: dadhigharmasya yajeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhotyanuvaṣaṭkṛta āharati bhakṣaṃ taṃ
analyzed: dadhigharmasya yaja iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti anuvaṣaṭkṛte āharati bhakṣam tam
translated: 'To the Dadhigharma I offer', he says, and offers at the Vasat-call; after the second Vasat he brings the draught. He hands it to

original: yajamānāya prayacati / / /🔽sa upahavamiṣṭvā bhakṣayati mayi tyadindriyam bṛhadityetadvā indriyam bṛhadya
analyzed: yajamānāya prayacati  saḥ upahavam iṣṭvā bhakṣayati mayi tyad indriyam bṛhat iti etat vai indriyam bṛhat yad
translated: the sacrificer.🔽Having responded, he drinks it with 'In me the great power', for this is the great power

original: eṣa tapati mayi dakṣo mayi kraturiti kratūdakṣāvevātmandhatte
analyzed: eṣa tapati mayi dakṣaḥ mayi kratuḥ iti kratu dakṣau eva ātman dhatte
translated: that shines. 'In me the skill, in me the will', he says; verily he places in himself skill and will.

original: gharmastriśugvirājatīti gharmo hyeṣa triśugvirājati virājā jyotiṣā saheti virājā hyeṣa🔽jyotiṣā saha brahmaṇā tejasā saheti brahmaṇā hyeṣa tejasā saha payaso reta🔽ābhṛtamiti payaso hyetadreta ābhṛtaṃ tasya dohamaśīmahyuttarāmuttarāṃ
analyzed: gharmaḥ tri śuc virājati iti gharmaḥ hi eṣa tri śuc virājati virājā jyotiṣā saha iti virājā hi eṣa  jyotiṣā saha brahmaṇā tejasā saha iti brahmaṇā hi eṣa tejasā saha payasaḥ retaḥ  ābhṛtam iti payasaḥ hi etat retaḥ ābhṛtam tasya doham aśīmahi uttarām uttarām
translated: 'The Gharma, the three-striped, shines', he says, for this Gharma, the three-striped, shines; 'with the radiance of the Viraj', for with the radiance of the Viraj

original: samāmityāśiṣamevaitadāśāste'tha cātvāle mārjayante'sāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athāto dakṣiṇānām suvarṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ śatamānam brahmaṇe dadātyāsīno vai brahmā
analyzed: samām iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste tha cātvāle mārjayante asau eva bandhuḥ  atha atas dakṣiṇānām suvarṇam hiraṇyam śata mānam brahmaṇe dadāti āsīnaḥ vai brahmā
translated: he (shines); 'with the Brahman, with the splendour', for with the Brahman, with the splendour, he (shines); 'the seed of the milk', for this is the seed of the milk; 'may we obtain the milk of it', he says; 'the next, the next', he says; verily he invokes this blessing. They sprinkle themselves at the cātvāla; the significance of this is the same (as before).🔽Now then of the sacrificial fees. He gives to the Brahman a piece of gold weighing a hundred (grains). The Brahman sits;

original: yaśaḥ śayānaṃ hiraṇyaṃ tasmātsuvarṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ śatamānam brahmaṇe dadāti / / /
analyzed: yaśaḥ śayānam hiraṇyam tasmāt suvarṇam hiraṇyam śata mānam brahmaṇe dadāti
translated: glory is lying; gold is lying; therefore he gives to the Brahman a piece of gold weighing a hundred (grains).

original: atha yaiṣā gharmadughā tāmadhvaryave dadāti taptaiva vai
analyzed: atha yā eṣā gharma dughā tām adhvaryave dadāti taptā eva vai
translated: Now as to why he gives the milch-cow to the Adhvaryu. The Adhvaryu, assuredly, is the sacrificer's self.

original: gharmastaptamivādhvaryurniṣkrāmati tasmāttāmadhvarya ve dadāti / / /🔽atha yaiṣā yajamānasya vratadughā tāṃ hotre dadāti yajño vai hotā yajño
analyzed: gharmaḥ taptam iva adhvaryuḥ niṣkrāmati tasmāt tām adhvarya ve dadāti  atha yā eṣā yajamānasya vrata dughā tām hotre dadāti yajñaḥ vai hotā yajñaḥ
translated: Now as to why he gives that milch-cow of the Gharma to the Adhvaryu. The Gharma, doubtless, is heated, and the Adhvaryu goes out (from the Sadas) as if heated: for this reason he gives it to the Adhvaryu.

original: yajamānastasmāttāṃ hotre dadāti / / /🔽atha yaiṣā patnyai vratadughā tāmudgātṛbhyo dadāti patnīkarmeva vā ete'tra
analyzed: yajamānaḥ tasmāt tām hotre dadāti  atha yā eṣā patnyai vrata dughā tām udgātṛbhyaḥ dadāti patnī karma iva vai etā itra
translated: Now as to why he gives that milch-cow of the sacrificer's vow to the Hotri. The Hotri, doubtless, is the sacrifice, and the sacrificer is the sacrifice: for this reason he gives it to the Hotri.

original: kurvanti yadudgātārastasmāttāmudgātṛbhyo dadāti / / /
analyzed: kurvanti yat udgātāraḥ tasmāt tām udgātṛbhyaḥ dadāti
translated: Now as to why he gives that milch-cow of the wife's vow to the Udgâtris. The Udgâtris, doubtless, perform the wife's office on this occasion: for this reason he gives it to the Udgâtris.

original: athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
translated: Now, he who either recites this (hymn) or eats (the food) of him who recites it, enters that life and that light.

original: vratacaryā yā sṛṣṭau / / /🔽sarveṣām vā eṣa bhūtānām sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā yadyajñastasya samṛddhimanu
analyzed: vrata caryā yā sṛṣṭau  sarveṣām vai eṣa bhūtānām sarveṣām devānām ātmā yat yajñaḥ tasya samṛddhim anu
translated: The observance of his vow is the same as at the creation.

original: yajamānaḥ prajayā paśubhirṛdhyate vi vā eṣa prajayā paśubhirṛdhyate yasya gharmo🔽vidīryate tatra prāyaścittiḥ / / /
analyzed: yajamānaḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ ṛdhyate vi vai eṣa prajayā paśubhiḥ ṛdhyate yasya gharmaḥ 🔽vidīryate tatra prāyaścittiḥ
translated: The sacrifice is the self of all beings and of all gods: in accordance with its perfection the sacrificer prospers with offspring and cattle. But he who prospers with offspring and cattle, his Gharma breaks. The expiation for that (is as follows).

original: pūrṇāhutiṃ juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇaṃ sarveṇaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ
analyzed: pūrṇāhutim juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇam sarveṇa eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍham
translated: He offers a full oblation; the full means everything: with everything he heals whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: yajñasya / / /🔽svāhā prāṇebhyaḥ sādhipatikebhya iti mano vai prāṇānāmadhipatirmanasi hi sarve
analyzed: yajñasya  svāhā prāṇebhyaḥ sa adhipatikebhyaḥ iti manaḥ vai prāṇānām adhipatiḥ manasi hi sarve
translated: To the sacrifice svâhâ!

original: prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāstanmanasaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ tat manasā eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: To the out-breathings, with the lord of the out-breathings, svâhâ! The mind is the lord of the out-breathings, for in the mind all the out-breathings are established: he thus heals by the mind whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: pṛthivyai svāheti pṛthivī vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā iti pṛthivī vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam
translated: To the earth, svâhâ! The earth is the abode of all the gods:

original: tatsarvābhirevaitaddevatābhirbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: tat sarvābhiḥ eva etat devatābhiḥ bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: he thus heals by all the deities whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: agnaye svāheti agnirvai sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā
analyzed: agnaye svāhā iti agniḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā
translated: To Agni, svâhâ! Agni is the self of all the gods:

original: tatsarvābhirevaitaddevatābhirbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍaṃ yajñasya / / /🔽antarikṣāya svāheti antarikṣam vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ tatsarvā / / /🔽vāyave svāheti vāyurvai sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā tatsarvā / / /
analyzed: tat sarvābhiḥ eva etat devatābhiḥ bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍam yajñasya  antarikṣāya svāhā iti antarikṣam vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam tat sarvā  vāyave svāhā iti vāyuḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā tat sarvā
translated: he thus heals by all the deities whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.🔽To the atmosphere, svâhâ! The atmosphere is the abode of all the gods: he thus heals by all the deities whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.🔽To Vâyu, svâhâ! Vâyu is the self of all the gods: he thus heals by all the deities whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: dive svāheti dyaurvai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ tatsarvā / / /
analyzed: dive svāhā iti dyauḥ vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam tat sarvā
translated: To the sky, svâhâ! The sky is the abode of all the gods: he thus heals by all the deities whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: sūryāya svāheti sūryo vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā tatsarvā / / /🔽digbhyaḥ svāheti diśo vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ tatsarvā / / /🔽candrāya svāheti candro vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā tatsarvā / / /
analyzed: sūryāya svāhā iti sūryaḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā tat sarvā  digbhyaḥ svāhā iti diśaḥ vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam tat sarvā  candrāya svāhā iti candraḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā tat sarvā
translated: To Surya svâhâ! Surya is the self of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.🔽To the Quarters svâhâ! The quarters are the abode of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.🔽To the Moon svâhâ! The Moon is the self of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.

original: nakṣatrebhyaḥ svāheti nakṣatrāṇi vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ tatsarvā / / /🔽adbhyaḥ svāheti āpo vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ tatsarvā / / /
analyzed: nakṣatrebhyaḥ svāhā iti nakṣatrāṇi vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam tat sarvā  adbhyaḥ svāhā iti āpaḥ vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam tat sarvā
translated: To the Stars svâhâ! The stars are the abode of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.🔽To the Waters svâhâ! The waters are the abode of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.

original: varuṇāya svāheti varuṇo vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā tatsarvā / / /
analyzed: varuṇāya svāhā iti varuṇaḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā tat sarvā
translated: To Varuna svâhâ! Varuna is the self of all the gods: he thus heals all the deities.

original: nābhyai svāhā pūtāya svāheti aniruktamanirukto vai prajāpatiḥ
analyzed: nābhyai svāhā pūtāya svāhā iti aniruktam aniruktaḥ vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: To the navel svâhâ! To the purified svâhâ! The indistinct (verse) is indistinct, Pragâpati is indistinct;

original: prajāpatiryajñastatprajāpatimevaitadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ tat prajāpatim eva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati
translated: Pragâpati is the sacrifice: it is Pragâpati, the sacrifice, he thus heals.

original: trayodaśaitā āhutayo bhavanti trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ
analyzed: trayodaśa etāḥ āhutayaḥ bhavanti trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ
translated: These are thirteen oblations; for there are thirteen months in the year, and the year is Pragâpati;

original: prajāpatiḥ prajāpatiryajñastatprajāpatimevaitadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ tat prajāpatim eva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati
translated: Pragâpati is the sacrifice: it is Pragâpati, the sacrifice, he thus heals.

original: vāce svāheti mukhamevāsminnetaddadhāti prāṇāya svāhā prāṇāya svāheti nāsike🔽evāsminnetaddadhāti cakṣuṣe svāhā cakṣuṣe svāhetyakṣiṇī evāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: vāce svāhā iti mukham eva asmin etat dadhāti prāṇāya svāhā prāṇāya svāhā iti nāsike  eva asmin etat dadhāti cakṣuṣe svāhā cakṣuṣe svāhā iti akṣiṇī eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: 'To Speech hail!'--the mouth he thereby puts into him;--'to Breath hail! to Breath hail!'--the nostrils he thereby puts into him;--'To the Eye hail! to the Eye hail!'--the eyes he thereby puts into him;

original: śrotrāya svāhā śrotrāya svāheti karṇāvevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: śrotrāya svāhā śrotrāya svāhā iti karṇau eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: 'To Speech hail!'--the mouth he thereby bestows upon him;--'to the Out-breath hail! to the In-breath hail!'--the nostrils he thereby bestows upon him;--'to the Eye hail! to the Ear hail!'--the eyes he thereby bestows upon him;--'to the Ear hail! to the Mind hail!'--the ears he thereby bestows upon him.

original: saptaitā āhutayo bhavanti sapta vā ime śīrṣanprāṇāstānevāsminnetaddadhāti🔽pūrṇāhutimuttamāṃ juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇaṃ sarveṇaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: sapta etāḥ āhutayaḥ bhavanti sapta vai ime śīrṣan prāṇāḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti  pūrṇāhutim uttamām juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇam sarveṇa eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca
translated: These are seven oblations: seven are these (channels of the) vital airs in the head; it is them he thus lays into him.

original: vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /🔽manasaḥ kāmamākūtimiti manasā vā idaṃ sarvamāptaṃ tanmanasaivaitadbhiṣajyati
analyzed: vivṛḍham yajñasya  manasaḥ kāmam ākūtim iti manasā vai idam sarvam āptam tat manasā eva etat bhiṣajyati
translated: The last oblation he offers full (to the brim); the full means everything: by everything he thus heals whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.🔽The mind's desire, the purpose ,

original: yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: by the mind everything here is obtained: by the mind he thus heals whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.🔽The truth of speech may I obtain ,

original: vācaḥ satyamaśīyeti vācā vā idaṃ sarvamāptaṃ tadvācaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: vācaḥ satyam aśīya iti vācā vai idam sarvam āptam tat vācā eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca
translated: by speech everything here is obtained: by speech he thus heals whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya paśūnāṃ rūpamannasya raso yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatām mayi
analyzed: vivṛḍham yajñasya paśūnām rūpam annasya rasaḥ yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatām mayi
translated: The form of cattle, the essence of food, glory and prosperity may rest in me!

original: svāhetyāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /
analyzed: svāhā iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste
translated: 'Hail!'--by this he invokes a blessing.

original: atha taṃ copaśayāṃ ca piṣṭvā mārtsnayā mṛdā saṃsṛjyāvṛtā karotyāvṛtā
analyzed: atha tam ca upaśayām ca piṣṭvā mārtsnayā mṛdā saṃsṛjya āvṛtā karoti āvṛtā
translated: Then he should grind that (cake) and the Upasad, mix it with fine clay, and make a lump of it. He should cover it,

original: pacatyutsādanārthamatha ya upaśayayordṛḍhaḥ syāttena pracaret / / /
analyzed: pacati utsādana artham atha yaḥ upaśayayoḥ dṛḍhaḥ syāt tena pracaret
translated: and bake it for the purpose of swelling. Then he should perform with that which is firmer of the two Upasads.

original: saṃvatsaro vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The Pravargya is the year; the year is everything, the Pravargya is everything.

original: yatpravṛktastadvasanto yadrucitastadgrīṣmo yatpinvitastadvarṣā yadā vai varṣāh
analyzed: yat pravṛktaḥ tat vasantaḥ yat rucitaḥ tat grīṣmaḥ yat pinvitaḥ tat varṣāḥ yadā vai varṣāḥ
translated: When it is turned up, that is spring; when it is shining, that is summer; when it is swollen, that is the rainy season. For when the rains

original: pinvante'thaināḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvante ha vāasmai varṣā ya
analyzed: pinvante itha enāḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvante ha vā asmai varṣāḥ ya
translated: swell, then all the gods and all beings depend on them. The rains swell for him

original: evametadveda / / /
analyzed: evam etat veda
translated: who knows this thus.

original: ime vai lokāḥ pravargyaḥ sarvam vā ime lokāḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: ime vai lokāḥ pravargyaḥ sarvam vai ime lokāḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The Pravargya is these worlds; these worlds are everything, the Pravargya is everything.

original: yatpravṛktastadayaṃ loko yadrucitastadantarikṣaloko yatpinvitastadasau loko yadā vā
analyzed: yad pravṛktaḥ tat ayam lokaḥ yad rucitaḥ tat antarikṣa lokaḥ yad pinvitaḥ tat asau lokaḥ yadā vā
translated: When it is turned up, that is this world; when it is shining, that is the world of the atmosphere; when it is swollen, that is the world of yonder sun. For when that world of yonder sun swells,
