translated: He then carried the breath beyond it; and when it was freed from death, it became this wind; and this wind blows beyond death.

original: atha cakṣuratyavahat tadyadā mṛtyumatyamucyata sa ādityo'bhavatso'sāvādityaḥ
analyzed: atha cakṣuḥ atyavahat tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata saḥ ādityaḥ bhavat saḥ usau ādityaḥ
translated: Then the eye carried him across. When it had carried him across death, it became the sun. That is this sun.

original: pareṇa mṛtyumatikrāntastapati / / /
analyzed: pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ tapati
translated: It shines beyond death.

original: atha śrotramatyavahat tadyadā mṛtyumatyamucyata tā diśo'bhavaṃstā imā diśaḥ
analyzed: atha śrotram atyavahat tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata tāḥ diśaḥ bhavan tāḥ imāḥ diśaḥ
translated: Then the ear carried him across. When it had carried him across death, it became the quarters. These are these quarters.

original: pareṇa mṛtyumatikrāntāḥ / / /
analyzed: pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntāḥ
translated: They are beyond death.

original: atha mano'tyavahat tadyadā mṛtyumatyamucyata sa candramā abhavatso'sau candraḥ
analyzed: atha manaḥ utyavahat tat yadā mṛtyum atyamucyata sa candramāḥ abhavat sa usau candraḥ
translated: Then the mind carried him across. When it had carried him across death, it became the moon. That is this moon.

original: pareṇa mṛtyumatikrānto bhātyevaṃ ha vā enameṣā devatā mṛtyumativahati ya evam🔽veda / / /
analyzed: pareṇa mṛtyum atikrāntaḥ bhāti evam ha vai enam eṣā devatā mṛtyum ativahati yaḥ evam  veda
translated: It shines beyond death. Thus, indeed, does this deity carry him beyond death, who knows thus.

original: athātmane'nnādyamāgāyat yaddhi kiṃ cānnamadyate'nenaiva tadadyata iha
analyzed: atha ātmanā idna adyam āgāyat yat hi kim ca annam adyate enena eva tat adyate iha
translated: Then he sang for himself the food-gift. Whatever food is eaten is eaten by him here.

original: pratitiṣṭhati / / /
analyzed: pratitiṣṭhati
translated: It abides.

original: te devā abruvan etāvadvā idaṃ sarvaṃ yadannaṃ tadātmana āgāsīranu no'sminnanna
analyzed: te devāḥ abruvan etāvat vai idam sarvam yat annam tat ātmane āgāsīḥ anu na usmin anna
translated: The gods said, 'This all is indeed food. You have made it your own. Share it with us in this food.

original: ābhajasveti te vai mābhisamviśateti tatheti taṃ samantam pariṇyaviśanta
analyzed: ābhajasva iti te vai mā abhisamviśata iti tathā iti tam samantam pariṇyaviśanta
translated: Share it with us.' 'Let us enter into it together,' he said. 'So be it.' They entered into it together.

original: tasmādyadanenānnamatti tenaitāstṛpyantyevaṃ ha vā enaṃ svā abhisamviśanti bhartā
analyzed: tasmāt yat anena annam atti tena etāḥ tṛpyanti evam ha vai enam svāḥ abhisamviśanti bhartā
translated: Therefore, when he eats food with it, they are satisfied. Thus, indeed, do his own people enter into him, as the supporter.

original: svānāṃ śreṣṭhaḥ puraetā bhavatyannādo'dhipatirya evam veda / / /
analyzed: svānām śreṣṭhaḥ puraetā bhavati anna āda odhipatiḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus becomes the best of his own people, the leader, the provider of food, the lord.

original: ya u haivamvidam sveṣu pratipratirbubhūṣati na haivālam bhāryebhyo bhavatyatha
analyzed: yaḥ u ha evamvidam sveṣu pratipratiḥ bubhūṣati na ha eva alam bhāryebhyaḥ bhavati atha
translated: He who, knowing thus, seeks to be the chief of his own people, is never in want of wives.

original: ya evaitamanu bhavati yo vaitamanu bhāryānbubhūrṣati sa haivālam bhāryebhyo🔽bhavati / / /
analyzed: yaḥ eva etam anu bhavati yaḥ vā etam anu bhāryān bubhūrṣati sa ha eva alam bhāryebhyaḥ  bhavati
translated: But he who follows him, who seeks to be the chief of his wives after him, is in want of wives.

original: so'yāsya āṅiraso aṅgānāṃ hi rasaḥ prāṇo vā aṅgānāṃ rasaḥ prāṇo hi vā aṅgānāṃ🔽rasastasmādyasmātkasmāccāṅgātprāṇa utkrāmati tadeva tacuṣyatyeṣa hi vā aṅgānāṃ
analyzed: aṅgānām hi rasaḥ prāṇaḥ vai aṅgānām rasaḥ prāṇaḥ hi vai aṅgānām  rasaḥ tasmāt yasmāt kasmāt ca aṅgāt prāṇaḥ utkrāmati tat eva tacuṣyati eṣa hi vai aṅgānām
translated: He is the life-sap of the limbs, for the life-sap of the limbs is breath, for the life-sap of the limbs is breath.

original: rasaḥ / / /
analyzed: rasaḥ
translated: Therefore, from whatever limb the breath departs, that very limb dries up, for this is the life-sap of the limbs.

original: eṣa u eva bṛhaspatiḥ vāgvai bṛhatī tasyā eṣa patistasmādu bṛhaspatiḥ / / /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva bṛhaspatiḥ vāc vai bṛhatī tasyāḥ eṣa patiḥ tasmāt u bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: He is also Brihaspati. The great one is speech, and he is its lord, therefore he is Brihaspati.

original: eṣa u eva brahmaṇaspatiḥ vāgvai brahma tasyā eṣa patistasmādu ha brahmaṇaspatiḥ / / /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva brahmaṇaspatiḥ vāc vai brahma tasyāḥ eṣa patiḥ tasmāt u ha brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: He is also Brahmanaspati. Brahman is speech, and he is its lord, therefore he is Brahmanaspati.

original: eṣa u eva sāma vāgvai sāmaiṣa sā cāmaśceti tatsāmnaḥ sāmatvaṃ yadveva samaḥ
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva sāma vāc vai sāma eṣa sā ca amaḥ ca iti tat sāmnaḥ sāma tvam yat u eva samaḥ
translated: He is also the Saman. The Saman is speech, and he is the Saman, therefore he is the Saman.

original: pluṣiṇā samo maśakena samo nāgena sama ebhistribhirlokaiḥ samo'nena sarveṇa
analyzed: pluṣiṇā samaḥ maśakena samaḥ nāgena samaḥ ebhiḥ tribhiḥ lokaiḥ samaḥ unena sarveṇa
translated: He is equal to a Plushi insect, equal to a mosquito, equal to an elephant, equal to these three worlds, equal to all this.

original: tasmādveva sāmāśnute sāmnaḥ sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ ya evametatsāma veda / / /
analyzed: tasmāt u eva sāma aśnute sāmnaḥ sāyujyam salokatām yaḥ evam etat sāma veda
translated: Therefore, he attains the union with the Saman, the state of the same world, he who knows this Saman thus.

original: eṣa u vā udgīthaḥ prāṇo vā utprāṇena hīdaṃ sarvamuttabdham vāgeva gīthocca
analyzed: eṣaḥ u vai udgīthaḥ prāṇaḥ vai ud prāṇena hi idam sarvam uttabdham vāc eva gīthā ucca
translated: This, indeed, is the Udgitha. The breath is the Udgitha, for by the breath all this is blown up. Speech itself is the Githa, the singing.

original: gīthā ceti sa udgīthaḥ / / /🔽taddhāpi brahmadattaścaikitāneyo rājānam bhakṣayannuvācāyaṃ tyasya rājā
analyzed: gīthā ca iti saḥ udgīthaḥ  tat ha api brahmadattaḥ caikitāneyaḥ rājānam bhakṣayan uvāca ayam tyasya rājā
translated: It is both the Githa and the Udgitha, hence it is the Udgitha.

original: mūrdhānam vipātayatādyadito'yāsya āṅgiraso'nyenodagāyaditi vācā ca hyeva sa🔽prāṇena codagāyaditi / / /
analyzed: mūrdhānam vipātayata adya itas yā asya āṅgirasaḥ unyena udagāyat iti vācā ca hi eva sa  prāṇena ca udagāyat iti
translated: Now, Brahmadatta Chaikitayana, while eating the king, said: Let the head of this king be cut off, if from here, from this world, Angiras has sung with something else. For he has sung with both speech and breath.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ svam veda bhavati hāsya svaṃ tasya vai svara eva svaṃ🔽tasmādārtvijyaṃ kariṣyanvāci svaramiceta tayā vācā svarasampannayārtvijyaṃ🔽kuryāttasmādyajñe svaravantaṃ didṛkṣanta evātho yasya svam bhavati bhavati hāsya
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ svam veda bhavati ha asya svam tasya vai svaraḥ eva svam  tasmāt ārtvijyam kariṣyan vāci svaram iceta tayā vācā svara sampannayā ārtvijyam  kuryāt tasmāt yajñe svaravantam didṛkṣante eva atha u yasya svam bhavati bhavati ha asya
translated: He, indeed, who knows the self of this Saman, becomes the self. The self belongs to him. The self of it is indeed the tone.

original: svam ya evametatsāmanaḥ svam veda / / /
analyzed: svam yaḥ evam etat sāmanaḥ svam veda
translated: Therefore, one who is going to perform a priestly office should desire the tone in speech. With that speech endowed with tone one should perform the priestly office. Therefore, in a sacrifice they desire to see one who has tone. And to him whose self is the tone, the self belongs. The self belongs to him who thus knows the self of this Saman.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ suvarṇam veda bhavati hāsya suvarṇaṃ tasya vai svara eva🔽suvarṇam bhavati hāsya suvarṇaṃ ya evametatsāmnaḥ suvarṇam veda / / /
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ suvarṇam veda bhavati ha asya suvarṇam tasya vai svaraḥ eva  suvarṇam bhavati ha asya suvarṇam yaḥ evam etat sāmnaḥ suvarṇam veda
translated: Now, he who knows the gold of this Sāman becomes possessed of gold. For its gold is indeed🔽its own tone. He becomes possessed of gold. He who knows thus the gold of this Sāman.

original: tasya haitasya sāmno yaḥ pratiṣṭhām veda prati ha tiṣṭhati tasya vai vāgeva
analyzed: tasya ha etasya sāmnaḥ yaḥ pratiṣṭhām veda prati ha tiṣṭhati tasya vai vāc eva
translated: Now, he who knows the support of this Sāman finds support. For its support is indeed

original: pratiṣṭhā vāci hi khalveṣa etatprāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhito gīyate'nna ityu haika āhuḥ / / /🔽athātaḥ pavamānānāmevābhyārohaḥ sa vai khalu prastotā sāma prastauti sa yatra
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā vāci hi khalu eṣaḥ etat prāṇaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ gīyate id naḥ iti u ha eke āhuḥ  atha atas pavamānānām eva abhyārohaḥ sa vai khalu prastotā sāma prastauti sa yatra
translated: its own speech. For in speech this breath is indeed supported, it is sung as food. Some, however, say that it is food.

original: prastyuāttadetāni japedasato mā sadgamaya tamaso mā jyotirgamaya mṛtyormāmṛtaṃ🔽gamayeti / / /
analyzed: japet asataḥ mā sat gamaya tamasaḥ mā jyotiḥ gamaya mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam  gamaya iti
translated: Now, then, the ascent of the Pavamānas. The Prastotri priest chants the Sāman. When he begins to chant, he should murmur these (verses): 'From non-being lead me to being, from darkness to light, from death to immortality.'

original: sa yadāhāsato mā sadgamayeti mṛtyurvā asatsadamṛtam mṛtyormāmṛtaṃ🔽gamayāmṛtam mā kurvityevaitadāha / / /
analyzed: sa yat āha asataḥ mā sat gamaya iti mṛtyuḥ vai asat sat amṛtam mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam  gamaya amṛtam mā kuru iti eva etat āha
translated: When he says, 'From non-being lead me to being,' non-being is indeed death, and being is immortality. 'From non-being lead me to being,'--'from death lead me to immortality,' he says.

original: tamaso mā jyotirgamayeti mṛtyurvai tamo jyotiramṛtam mṛtyormāmṛtaṃ
analyzed: tamasaḥ mā jyotiḥ gamaya iti mṛtyuḥ vai tamaḥ jyotiḥ amṛtam mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam
translated: 'From darkness lead me to light,'--darkness is indeed death, and light is immortality. 'From darkness lead me to light,'--'from death lead me to immortality,' he says.

original: gamayāmṛtam mā kurvityevaitadāha mṛtyormāmṛtaṃ gamayeti nātra tirohitamivāsti / / /
analyzed: gamaya amṛtam mā kuru iti eva etat āha mṛtyoḥ mā amṛtam gamaya iti na atra tirohitam iva asti
translated: 'Lead me to immortality', he says, 'lead me to immortality from death'; there is nothing obscure in this.

original: atha yānītarāṇi stotrāṇi teṣvātmane'nnādyamāgāyettasmādu teṣu varam vṛṇīta yam
analyzed: atha yāni itarāṇi stotrāṇi teṣu ātmanā id nādyam āgāyet tasmāt u teṣu varam vṛṇīta yam
translated: Now, in the other hymns of praise, he should sing for himself food and drink; therefore, in them, one should ask for a boon,

original: kāmaṃ kāmayeta taṃ sa eṣa evamvidudgātātmane vā yajamānāya vā yaṃ kāmaṃ🔽kāmayate tamāgāyati taddhaitallokajideva na haivālokyatāyā āśāsti ya evametatsāma
analyzed: kāmam kāmayeta tam saḥ eṣaḥ evamvid udgātā ātmane vā yajamānāya vā yam kāmam  kāmayate tam āgāyati tat ha etat loka jit eva na ha eva a lokya tāyai āśāsti yaḥ evam etat sāma
translated: whatever wish one may have. He who knows this, the Udgātṛ, sings for himself or for the sacrificer whatever wish

original: veda / / /
analyzed: veda
translated: he may have. That is indeed the attainment of the world, for one who knows this Sāman thus; there is no fear of not seeing the light.

original: ātmaivedamagra āsīt puruṣavidhaḥ so'nuvīkṣya
analyzed: ātmā eva idam agre āsīt puruṣavidhaḥ saḥ unuvīkṣya
translated: The Self alone existed here in the beginning, in the form of a person. He, looking around,

original: nānyadātmano'paśyatso'hamasmītyagrevyāharattato'haṃnāmābhavattasmādapyetarhyā
analyzed: na anyat ātmanā paśyatsaḥ ham asmi iti agre vyāharat tatas haṃnāmā bhavat tasmāt api etarhyā
translated: saw nothing else but the Self. He said, 'I am' in the beginning. From that he became called 'I'. Therefore even now,

original: mantrito'hamayamityevāgra uktvāthānyannāma prabrūte yadasya bhavati / / /🔽sa yatpūrvo'smāt sarvasmātsarvānpāpmana auṣattasmātpuruṣa oṣati ha vai sa taṃ
analyzed: mantritaḥ uham ayam iti eva agre uktvā atha anyat nāma prabrūte yat asya bhavati  sa yat pūrvaḥ sarvasmāt sarvān pāpmanaḥ auṣat tasmāt puruṣaḥ oṣati ha vai sa tam
translated: when one is addressed, one first says 'I am' and then mentions another name that one has.

original: yo'smātpūrvo bubhūṣati ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: yaḥ usmāt pūrvaḥ bubhūṣati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He, being the first of all this, removed all evil from all. Therefore, the person removes evil. He who wishes to be the first of all this, who knows this thus,🔽removes evil.

original: so'bibhet tasmādekākī bibheti sa hāyamīkṣāṃ cakre yanmadanyannāsti kasmānnu
analyzed: saḥ bibhet tasmāt ekākī bibheti sa ha ayam īkṣām cakre yat mat anyat na asti kasmāt nu
translated: He was afraid. Therefore, one who is alone is afraid. He considered this: Since there is nothing else but me, from what

original: bibhemīti tata evāsya bhayam vīyāya kasmāddhyabheṣyaddvitīyadvai bhayam
analyzed: bibhemi iti tatas eva asya bhayam vīyāya kasmāt hi abheṣyat dvitīyat vai bhayam
translated: He was afraid. Therefore, one who is alone is afraid. He considered this: 'Since there is nothing else but me, why am I afraid?' Then his fear left him. For what would he have been afraid, since fear is of a second?

original: bhavati / / /🔽sa vai naiva reme tasmādekākī na ramate sa dvitīyamaicatsa haitāvānāsa yathā
analyzed: bhavati  sa vai na eva reme tasmāt ekākī na ramate sa dvitīyam aicat sa ha etāvān āsa yathā
translated: He was not satisfied.🔽He was not satisfied with that. He desired a second. He became as large as a man with out-stretched arms.

original: strīpumāṃsau sampariṣvaktau / / /
analyzed: strī pumāṃsau sampariṣvaktau
translated: He did not rejoice. Therefore, one who is alone does not rejoice. He desired a second. He became just so much as a man and a woman embracing each other.🔽...

original: sa imamevātmānaṃ dvedhāpātayat tataḥ patiśca patnī cābhavatāṃ
analyzed: saḥ imam eva ātmānam dvedhā apātayat tatas patiḥ ca patnī ca abhavatām
translated: He split this self in two. Then there were husband and wife.🔽Therefore, Yajnavalkya said, 'This (self) is as if cut in half.' Therefore, this space is filled with a woman.

original: tasmādidamardhavṛgalamiva sva iti ha smāha yājñavalkyastasmādayamākāśa striyā
analyzed: tasmāt idam ardha vṛgalam iva svaḥ iti ha sma āha yājñavalkyaḥ tasmāt ayam ākāśaḥ striyā
translated: ...🔽They united. Then humans were born.

original: pūryata eva tāṃ samabhavattato manuṣyā ajāyanta / / /
analyzed: pūryataḥ eva tām samabhavat tatas manuṣyāḥ ajāyanta
translated: It was filled up, and then it became that. From that, humans were born.

original: so heyamīkṣāṃ cakre katham nu mātmana eva janayitvā sambhavati hanta
analyzed: saḥ ha iyam īkṣām cakre katham nu mā ātmanaḥ eva janayitvā sambhavati hanta
translated: He considered this: 'How can I be born from myself? Let me disappear.'

original: tiro'sānīti / / /
analyzed: tirosāni iti
translated: To disappear...🔽🔽

original: sā gaurabhavat vṛṣabha itarastāṃ samevābhavattato gāvo'jāyanta / / /
analyzed: sā gauḥ abhavat vṛṣabhaḥ itaraḥ tām sam eva abhavat tatas gāvaḥ jāyanta
translated: She became a cow, the other a bull. They united. Then cows were born.🔽...

original: vaḍavetarābhavat aśvavṛṣa itaro gardabhītarā gardabha itarastāṃ samevābhavattata
analyzed: vaḍavā itarā bhavat aśvavṛṣaḥ itaraḥ gardabhītarā gardabhaḥ itaraḥ tām sam eva abhavat tata
translated: The other became a mare, the other a stallion. The other became a she-ass, the other a donkey. They united. Then

original: ekaśaphamajāyata / / /
analyzed: ekaśapham ajāyata
translated: The one-hoofed was born from the goat.

original: ajetarābhavat vasta itaro'viritaro meṣa itarastāṃ
analyzed: ajā itarā bhavat meṣaḥ itaraḥ tām
translated: The goat became the ewe, the other became the sheep, the other became the ram.

original: samevābhvattato'jāvayo'jāyantaivameva yadidaṃ kiṃ ca mithunamā
analyzed: sam eva abhvat tatas jāvayaḥ ujāyanta evam eva yat idam kim ca mithunam ā
translated: They ate together. From that the goats and sheep were born. In the same way, whatever pairs there are,

original: pipīlikābhyastatsarvamasṛjata / / /
analyzed: pipīlikābhyaḥ tat sarvam asṛjata
translated: from the ants, he created all that.

original: so'vet aham vāva sṛṣṭirasmyahaṃ hīdaṃ sarvamasṛkṣīti tataḥ sṛṣṭirabhavatsṛṣṭyāṃ
analyzed: sā uvet aham vāva sṛṣṭiḥ asmi aham hi idam sarvam asṛkṣi iti tatas sṛṣṭiḥ abhavat sṛṣṭyām
translated: He knew: Verily, I am the creation. I have created all this. Therefore, creation came into being.

original: hāsyaitasyām bhavati ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: ha asya etasyām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In this creation, he has a share who knows thus.

original: athetyabhyamanthat sa mukhācca yonerhastābhyāṃ cāgnimasṛjata
analyzed: atha iti abhyamanthat sa mukhāt ca yoneḥ hastābhyām ca agnim asṛjata
translated: Then he churned. From his mouth, womb, and hands, he created Agni.

original: tasmādetadubhayamalomakamantarato'lomakā hi yonirantarataḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt etat ubhayam alomakam antarataḥ lomakā hi yoniḥ antarataḥ
translated: Therefore, these two are hairless inside, for the womb is hairless inside.

original: tadyadidamāhuḥ amuṃ yajāmuṃ yajetyekaikaṃ devametasyaiva sā visṛṣṭireṣa u
analyzed: tat yat idam āhuḥ amum yaja amum yaja iti ekaikam devam etasya eva sā visṛṣṭiḥ eṣaḥ u
translated: Now, what they say: We worship that one, we worship that one, each deity, that is his creation. For he

original: hyeva sarve devāḥ / / /
analyzed: hi eva sarve devāḥ
translated: is indeed all the deities.

original: atha yatkiṃ cedamārdram tadretaso'sṛjata tadu soma etāvadvā idaṃ sarvamannaṃ
analyzed: atha yat kim ca idam ārdram tat retasā usṛjata tat u somaḥ etāvat vai idam sarvam annam
translated: Now, whatever here is moist, that he created from semen. That is Soma. For this much indeed is all food,

original: caivānnādaśca soma evānnamagnirannādaḥ / / /
analyzed: ca eva anna ādaḥ ca somaḥ eva annam agniḥ anna ādaḥ
translated: and Soma is food, and Agni is the eater of food.

original: saiṣā brahmaṇo'tisṛṣṭiḥ yacreyaso devānasṛjatātha yanmartyaḥ sannamṛtānasṛjata
analyzed: sā eṣā brahmaṇā utisṛṣṭiḥ yat creyasaḥ devān asṛjata atha yat martyaḥ san amṛtān asṛjata
translated: This is the over-creation of Brahman, when he created the gods who are better, and when he created the mortals who are not better.

original: tasmādatisṛṣṭiratisṛṣṭyāṃ hāsyaitasyām bhavati ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: tasmāt atisṛṣṭiḥ atisṛṣṭyām ha asya etasyām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Therefore it is an over-creation. In this over-creation he has a share who knows this.

original: taddhedaṃ tarhyavyākṛtamāsīt tannāmarūpābhyāmeva🔽vyākriyatāsaunāmāyamidaṃrūpa iti tadidamapyetarhi nāmarūpābhyāmeva
analyzed: tat ha idam tarhi a vyākṛtam āsīt tat nāma rūpābhyām eva  vyākriyata asau nāmā ayam idaṃrūpaḥ iti tat idam api etarhi nāma rūpābhyām eva
translated: Now at that time this (universe) was undefined. It was defined by name and form.🔽'This is his name, this is his form.' It is defined even now by name and form.

original: vyākriyate'saunāmāyamidaṃrūpa iti / / /
analyzed: vyākriyate asau nāmā ayam idaṃrūpaḥ iti
translated: 'This is his name, this is his form.'

original: sa eṣa iha praviṣṭaḥ ā nakhāgrebhyo yathā kṣuraḥ kṣuradhāne'vahitaḥ
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ iha praviṣṭaḥ ā nakha agrebhyaḥ yathā kṣuraḥ kṣura dhānā vahitaḥ
translated: He has entered here, even to the tips of the nails. He is like a razor hidden in a razor-case,

original: syādviśvambharo vā viśvambharakulāye taṃ na paśyantyakṛtsno hi saḥ / / /🔽prāṇanneva prāṇo nāma bhavati vadanvākpaśyaṃścakṣuḥ śṛṇvañcrotram manvāno
analyzed: syāt viśvambharaḥ vā viśvambhara kulāye tam na paśyanti akṛtsnaḥ hi saḥ  prāṇan eva prāṇaḥ nāma bhavati vadan vāc paśyan cakṣuḥ śṛṇvan crotram manvānaḥ
translated: or like a spider in its web. They do not see him, for he is incomplete.

original: manastānyasyaitāni karmanāmānyeva sa yo'ta ekaikamupāste na sa vedākṛtsno
analyzed: manaḥ tāni asya etāni karma nāmāni eva sa yaḥ uta ekaikam upāste na sa veda akṛtsnaḥ
translated: While breathing, he is called 'breath'; while speaking, 'speech'; while seeing, 'sight'; while hearing, 'hearing'; while thinking, 'mind.' These are the names of his actions. He who worships them one by one does not know,

original: hyeṣo'ta ekaikena bhavati / / /
analyzed: hi eṣā uta ekaikena bhavati
translated: for he becomes incomplete by one of them.

original: ātmetyevopāsīta atra hyete sarva ekam bhavanti tadetatpadanīyamasya sarvasya
analyzed: ātmā iti eva upāsīta atra hi ete sarve ekam bhavanti tat etat padanīyam asya sarvasya
translated: One should worship only as 'the Self,' for in this all these become one. This is the food of all this,

original: yadayamātmānena hyetatsarvam veda yathā ha vai padenānuvindedevaṃ kīrtiṃ
analyzed: yat ayam ātmā anena hi etat sarvam veda yathā ha vai padena anuvindet evam kīrtim
translated: For by this Self one knows all this. As one would find by a foot, so one finds fame

original: ślokam vindate ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: ślokam vindate yaḥ evam veda
translated: and glory, who knows this.

original: tadetatpreyaḥ putrāt preyo vittātpreyo'nyasmātsarvasmādantarataraṃ yadayamātmā sa🔽yo'nyamātmanaḥ priyam bruvāṇam brūyātpriyaṃ rotsyatītīśvaro ha tathaiva
analyzed: tat etat preyaḥ putrāt preyaḥ vittāt preyaḥ nyasmāt sarvasmāt antarataram yat ayam ātmā sa  yonyam ātmanaḥ priyam bruvāṇam brūyāt priyam rotsyati iti īśvaraḥ ha tathā eva
translated: This is dearer than a son, dearer than wealth, dearer than anything else, more intimate than these, that this Self.🔽He who would say to one who speaks of what is dear to the Self, 'You will obtain what is dear,' the Lord would be so

original: syādātmānameva priyamupāsīta sa ya ātmānameva priyamupāste na hāsya priyam
analyzed: syāt ātmānam eva priyam upāsīta sa yaḥ ātmānam eva priyam upāste na ha asya priyam
translated: indeed. One should worship only what is dear to the Self. He who worships only what is dear to the Self, to him what is dear

original: pramāyukam bhavati / / /🔽tadāhuḥ yadbrahmavidyayā sarvam bhaviṣyanto manuṣyā manyante kimu
analyzed: pramāyukam bhavati  tat āhuḥ yat brahma vidyayā sarvam bhaviṣyantaḥ manuṣyāḥ manyante kimu
translated: does not perish.🔽They say: When men think that by the knowledge of Brahman everything will be, what is that Brahman

original: tadbrahmāvedyasmāttatsarvamabhavaditi / / /
analyzed: tat brahma avet yasmāt tat sarvam abhavat iti
translated: of which, when it was known, everything became?

original: brahma vā idamagra āsīt tadātmānamevāvedaham brahmāsmīti
analyzed: brahma vai idam agre āsīt tat ātmānam eva avet aham brahma asmi iti
translated: Brahman indeed was this in the beginning. It thought, 'Let me be many. Let me procreate myself.'

original: tasmāttatsarvamabhavattadyoyo devānām pratyabudhyata sa eva
analyzed: tasmāt tat sarvam abhavat tat yaḥ yaḥ devānām pratyabudhyata saḥ eva
translated: Therefore it became all this. He who among the gods understood it, he became that.

original: tadabhavattatharṣīṇāṃ tathā manuṣyāṇām / / /
analyzed: tat abhavat tathā ṛṣīṇām tathā manuṣyāṇām
translated: So also among the seers and men.

original: taddhaitatpaśyannṛṣirvāmadevaḥ pratipede aham manurabhavaṃ sūryaśceti
analyzed: tat ha etat paśyan ṛṣiḥ vāmadevaḥ pratipede aham manuḥ abhavam sūryaḥ ca iti
translated: Seeing this, the seer Vamadeva declared, 'I was Manu, I was the sun.'

original: tadidamapyetarhi ya evam vedāham brahmāsmīti sa idaṃ sarvam bhavati tasya ha na🔽devāścanābhūtyā īśata ātmā hyeṣāṃ sa bhavatyatha yo'nyāṃ
analyzed: tat idam api etarhi yaḥ evam veda aham brahma asmi iti saḥ idam sarvam bhavati tasya ha na  devāḥ cana ābhūtyai īśate ātmā hi eṣām sa bhavati atha yonyām
translated: This is also true now. He who knows thus, 'I am Brahman,' becomes all this. To him🔽the gods do not rule through lack of being, for he becomes their self. But he who worships

original: devatāmupāste'nyo'sāvanyo'hamasmīti na sa veda yathā paśurevaṃ sa devānāṃ yathā
analyzed: devatām upāste inyaḥ usau anyaḥ aham asmi iti na sa veda yathā paśuḥ evam sa devānām yathā
translated: another god, thinking 'He is one, I am another,' does not know. As a beast, so is he to the gods.

original: ha vai bahavaḥ paśavo manuṣyam bhuñjyurevamekaikaḥ puruṣo
analyzed: ha vai bahavaḥ paśavaḥ manuṣyam bhuñjyuḥ evam ekaikaḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: Just as many beasts might enjoy a human being, so does each individual human being

original: devānbhunaktyekasminneva paśāvādīyamāne'priyam bhavati kimu bahuṣu
analyzed: devān bhunakti ekasmin eva paśau ādīyamāne priyam bhavati kimu bahuṣu
translated: enjoy the gods. When only one beast is being enjoyed, it becomes unpleasant. How much more so with many!

original: tasmādeṣāṃ tanna priyam yadetanmanuṣyā vidyuḥ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt eṣām tat na priyam yat etat manuṣyāḥ vidyuḥ
translated: Therefore, that is not pleasing to them, that humans should know this.

original: brahma vā idamagra āsīt ekameva tadekaṃ sanna vyabhavattacreyo rūpamatyasṛjata
analyzed: brahma vai idam agre āsīt ekam eva tat ekam sat na vyabhavat tat creyaḥ rūpam atyasṛjata
translated: Brahman indeed was this in the beginning, one only. That, being one, did not flourish. It created the form of excellence.

original: kṣatraṃ yānyetāni devatrā kṣatrāṇīndro varuṇaḥ somo rudraḥ parjanyo yamo
analyzed: kṣatram yāni etāni devatrā kṣatrāṇi indraḥ varuṇaḥ somaḥ rudraḥ parjanyaḥ yamaḥ
translated: Those which are the divine ruling powers, Indra, Varuṇa, Soma, Rudra, Parjanya, Yama,

original: mṛtyurīśāna iti tasmātkṣatrātparaṃ nāsti tasmādbrāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyamadhastādupāste
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ īśānaḥ iti tasmāt kṣatrāt param na asti tasmāt brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyam adhastāt upāste
translated: Mṛtyu, Īśāna - therefore there is nothing higher than the ruling power. Therefore the Brahmin worships the Kshatriya below.

original: rājasūye kṣatra eva tadyaśo dadhāti saiṣā kṣatrasya yoniryadbrahma tasmādyadyapi
analyzed: rājasūye kṣatre eva tat yaśaḥ dadhāti sā eṣā kṣatrasya yoniḥ yat brahma tasmāt yadi api
translated: In the Rajasuya, he bestows that glory on the Kshatriya alone. This is the womb of the Kshatriya, namely Brahman. Therefore, even if

original: rājā paramatāṃ gacati brahmaivāntata upaniśrayati svāṃ yoniṃ ya u enaṃ hinasti svāṃ
analyzed: rājā parama tām gacati brahma eva antatas upaniśrayati svām yonim yaḥ u enam hinasti svām
translated: a king attains the highest state, he ultimately resorts to Brahman, his own womb. He who injures him injures his own

original: sa yonimṛcati sa pāpīyānbhavati yathā śreyāṃsaṃ hiṃsitvā / / /
analyzed: sa yonim ṛcati sa pāpīyān bhavati yathā śreyāṃsam hiṃsitvā
translated: womb. He becomes worse, just as one becomes worse by injuring a superior person.

original: sa naiva vyabhavat sa viśamasṛjata yānyetāni devajātāni gaṇaśa ākhyāyante vasavo
analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat sa viśam asṛjata yāni etāni deva jātāni gaṇaśas ākhyāyante vasavaḥ
translated: It did not become differentiated. It created the Visah, those groups that are called the gods, the Vasus,

original: rudrā ādityā viśve devā maruta iti / / /
analyzed: rudrāḥ ādityāḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ iti
translated: Rudras, Adityas, Visve Devas, and Maruts.

original: sa naiva vyabhavat sa śaudram varṇamasṛjata pūṣaṇamiyam vai pūṣeyaṃ hīdaṃ
analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat sa śaudram varṇam asṛjata pūṣaṇam iyam vai pūṣā iyam hi idam
translated: It did not become differentiated. It created the Sudra caste, Pushan. This is Pushan. This all

original: sarvam puṣyati yadidaṃ kiṃ ca / / /
analyzed: sarvam puṣyati yat idam kim ca
translated: pushes, whatever there is.

original: sa naiva vyabhavat tacreyo rūpamatyasṛjata dharmaṃ tadetatkṣatrasya kṣatraṃ🔽yaddharmastasmāddharmātparaṃ nāstyatho abalīyānbalīyāṃsmam //
analyzed: sa na eva vyabhavat tat reyaḥ rūpam atyasṛjata dharmam tat etat kṣatrasya kṣatram  yat dharmaḥ tasmāt dharmāt param na asti atha u a balīyān balīyān
translated: It did not become differentiated. It created the form of the superior, Dharma. That is the Kshatriya's Kshatra,

original: śaṃsate dharmeṇa
analyzed: śaṃsate dharmeṇa
translated: Dharma. Therefore, there is nothing higher than Dharma. Then the weaker one praises the stronger one by Dharma.🔽As a king, so one who praises by Dharma.

original: yathā rājñaivaṃ yo vai sa dharmaḥ satyam vai tattasmātsatyam
analyzed: yathā rājñā evam yaḥ vai sa dharmaḥ satyam vai tat tasmāt satyam
translated: Whatever that Dharma is, that is indeed truth. Therefore, truth

original: vadantamāhurdharmam vadatīti dharmam vā vadantaṃ satyam
analyzed: vadantam āhuḥ dharmam vadati iti dharmam vā vadantam satyam
translated: One who speaks is said to be speaking Dharma, or one who speaks the truth.

original: vadatītyetaddhyevaitadubhayam bhavati / / /🔽tadetadbrahma kṣatram viṭ śūdraḥ tadagninaiva deveṣu brahmābhavadbrāhmaṇo
analyzed: vadati iti etat hi eva etat ubhayam bhavati  tat etat brahma kṣatram viś śūdraḥ tat agninā eva deveṣu brahma abhavat brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: They call him who speaks the truth 'one who speaks Dharma', and him who speaks Dharma 'one who speaks the truth'. For this is both of them.

original: manuṣyeṣu kṣatriyeṇa kṣatriyo vaiśyena vaiśyaḥ śūdreṇa śūdrastasmādagnāveva
analyzed: manuṣyeṣu kṣatriyeṇa kṣatriyaḥ vaiśyena vaiśyaḥ śūdreṇa śūdraḥ tasmāt agnau eva
translated: This is Brahman, Kshatriya, Vaishya, Shudra. By Agni he became Brahman among the gods, by Kshatriya among men, by Vaishya among Vaishyas, by Shudra among Shudras. Therefore,

original: deveṣu lokamicante brāhmaṇe manuṣyeṣvetābhyāṃ hi rūpābhyām brahmābhavat / / /
analyzed: deveṣu lokam icante brāhmaṇe manuṣyeṣu etābhyām hi rūpābhyām brahmā abhavat
translated: among the gods they seek heaven in Agni, among men in the Brahmana, for by these two forms he became Brahman.

original: atha yo ha vā asmāllokātsvaṃ lokamadṛṣṭvā praiti sa enamavidito na bhunakti yathā
analyzed: atha yaḥ ha vai asmāt lokāt svam lokam a dṛṣṭvā praiti saḥ enam aviditaḥ na bhunakti yathā
translated: Now, he who departs from this world without seeing his own world, he, unknown, does not enjoy it, just as

original: vedo vānanūkto'nyadvā karmākṛtam yadi ha vā apyanevamvinmahatpuṇyaṃ karma🔽karoti taddhāsyāntataḥ kṣīyata evātmānameva lokamupāsīta sa ya ātmānameva
analyzed: vedaḥ vā an anūktaḥ anyat vā karma a kṛtam yadi ha vai api anevamvid mahat puṇyam karma  karoti tat ha asya antatas kṣīyate eva ātmānam eva lokam upāsīta sa yaḥ ātmānam eva
translated: the Veda, if not recited, or any other rite, if not performed. If, indeed, one who knows thus performs even a great meritorious rite,🔽it is exhausted for him in the end. One should worship only one's own self as one's world. He who worships only his own self

original: lokamupāste na hāsya karma kṣīyate'smāddhyevātmano yadyatkāmayate tattatsṛjate / / /
analyzed: lokam upāste na ha asya karma kṣīyate ismāt hi eva ātmanaḥ yat yat kāmayate tat tat sṛjate
translated: as his world, his rite is not exhausted, for from this very self he creates whatever he desires.

original: atho ayam vā ātmā sarveṣām bhūtānāṃ lokaḥ sa yajjuhoti yadyajate tena devānāṃ🔽loko'tha yadanubrūte tenarṣīṇāmatha yatprajāmicate yatpitṛbhyo nipṛṇāti tena
analyzed: atha u ayam vai ātmā sarveṣām bhūtānām lokaḥ sa yat juhoti yat yajate tena devānām  lokaḥ utha yat anubrūte tena ṛṣīṇām atha yat prajām icate yat pitṛbhyaḥ nipṛṇāti tena
translated: Now, this Self is the world of all beings. In that he offers oblations and performs sacrifices, thereby (he secures a place) in the world of the gods.🔽In that he recites the Veda, thereby (he secures a place) in the world of the Rishis. In that he begets offspring and offers oblations to the manes, thereby (he secures a place) in the world of the manes.

original: pitṝṇāmatha yanmanuṣyānvāsayate yadebhyo'śanaṃ dadāti tena manuṣyāṇāmatha🔽yatpaśubhyastṛṇodakam vindati tena paśūnāṃ yadasya gṛheṣu śvāpadā vayāṃsyā
analyzed: pitṝṇām atha yat manuṣyān vāsayate yat ebhyaḥ ośanam dadāti tena manuṣyāṇām atha  yat paśubhyaḥ tṛṇa udakam vindati tena paśūnām yat asya gṛheṣu śvāpadā vayāṃsyā
translated: In that he provides for men and gives them food, thereby (he secures a place) in the world of men.🔽In that he finds grass and water for the cattle, thereby (he secures a place) in the world of cattle. In that the dogs, birds,

original: pipīlikābhya upajīvanti tena teṣāṃ loko yathā ha vai svāya lokāyāriṣṭimicedevaṃ
analyzed: pipīlikābhyaḥ upajīvanti tena teṣām lokaḥ yathā ha vai svāya lokāya ariṣṭim icet evam
translated: ants and other creatures in his house subsist, thereby (he secures a place) in their world. Just as one would not injure one's own world,

original: haivamvide sarvadā sarvāṇi bhūtānyariṣṭimicanti tadvā etadviditam mīmāṃsitam / / /
analyzed: ha evamvide sarvadā sarvāṇi bhūtāni ariṣṭim icanti tat vai etat viditam mīmāṃsitam
translated: so do all beings not injure him who knows this. This has been known and considered.

original: ātmaivedamagra āsīt eka eva so'kāmayata jāyā me syādatha prajāyeyātha vittam me🔽syādatha karma kurvīyetyetānvāvai kāmo necaṃścanāto bhūyo
analyzed: ātmā eva idam agre āsīt ekaḥ eva saḥ u kāmayata jāyā me syāt atha prajāyeya atha vittam me  syāt atha karma kurvīya iti etān vāvai kāmaḥ na ican cana atas bhūyas
translated: This Self alone existed in the beginning, one only. He desired, 'May I exist.' He performed austerities. From his austerities sprang water.🔽He thought, 'What shall I be? What shall I become?' He became this entire (universe).🔽He desired, 'May I have a wife. May I beget offspring. May I have wealth.

original: vindettasmādapyetarhyekākī kāmayate jāyā me syādatha prajāyeyātha vittam me
analyzed: vindet tasmāt api etarhi ekākī kāmayate jāyā me syāt atha prajāyeya atha vittam me
translated: May I perform actions.' Verily, these are the desires. One should not find anything greater than these. Therefore, even now, a solitary man desires, 'May I have a wife. May I beget offspring. May I have wealth.

original: syādatha karma kurvīyeti sa yāvadapyeteṣāmekaikaṃ na prāpnotyakṛtsna eva
analyzed: syāt atha karma kurvīya iti sa yāvat api eteṣām ekaikam na prāpnoti akṛtsnaḥ eva
translated: 'Now I will perform a rite,' he thinks. As long as he does not attain any one of these, he is incomplete.

original: tāvanmanyate tasyo kṛtsnatā / / /
analyzed: tāvat manyate tasya u kṛtsna tā
translated: Then he thinks, 'How can I attain completeness?'

original: mana evāsyātmā vāgjāyā prāṇaḥ prajā cakṣurmānuṣam vittam cakṣuṣā hi
analyzed: manaḥ eva asya ātmā vāc jāyā prāṇaḥ prajā cakṣuḥ mānuṣam vittam cakṣuṣā hi
translated: His mind is his self, speech is his wife, breath is his offspring, the eye is his human wealth, for by the eye

original: tadvindati śrotraṃ daivaṃ śrotreṇa hi tacṛṇotyātmaivāsya karmātmanā hi karma karoti
analyzed: tat vindati śrotram daivam śrotreṇa hi tat ṛṇoti ātmā eva asya karma ātmanā hi karma karoti
translated: he obtains that. The ear is his divine wealth, for by the ear he hears that. The self is his action, for by the self one performs action.

original: sa eṣa pāṅkto yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pāṅktaḥ puruṣaḥ pāṅktamidaṃ kiṃ ca tadidaṃ
analyzed: saḥ eṣa pāṅktaḥ yajñaḥ pāṅktaḥ paśuḥ pāṅktaḥ puruṣaḥ pāṅktam idam kim ca tat idam
translated: This sacrifice is fivefold, the animal is fivefold, man is fivefold, and whatever this is, it is all fivefold.

original: sarvamāpnoti yadidaṃ kiṃ ca ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: sarvam āpnoti yat idam kim ca yaḥ evam veda
translated: He obtains all this whatever there is, who knows this thus.

original: yatsaptānnāni medhayā tapasājanayatpitā ekamasya sādhāraṇam dve devānabhājayat
analyzed: yat sapta annāni medhayā tapasā ajanayat pitā ekam asya sādhāraṇam dve devān abhājayat
translated: The seven kinds of food which the father generated by his mind and austerities, one of them is common to all, two he allotted to the gods,

original: trīṇyātmane'kuruta paśubhya ekam prāyacat tasmintsarvam pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca
analyzed: trīṇi ātmanekuruta paśubhyaḥ ekam prāyacat tasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca
translated: three he made for his own self, one he gave to the cattle. In it everything is established, that which

original: prāṇiti yacca na kasmāttāni na kṣīyante'dyamānāni sarvadā yo vai tāmakṣitim veda
analyzed: prāṇiti yat ca na kasmāt tāni na kṣīyantedyamānāni sarvadā yaḥ vai tām akṣitim veda
translated: breathes and that which does not. Why do those not perish when being used all the time? He who knows that imperishability,

original: so'nnamatti pratīkena sa devānapigacati sa ūrjamupajīvatīti ślokāḥ / / /
analyzed: saḥ unnamatti pratīkena sa devān apigacati saḥ ūrjam upajīvati iti ślokāḥ
translated: he eats food by the forepart. He goes even to the gods. He subsists on strength. These are the verses.

original: yatsaptānnāni medhayā tapasājanayatpiteti medhayā hi tapasājanayatpitaikamasya🔽sādhāraṇamitīdamevāsya tatsādhāraṇamannaṃ yadidamadyate sa ya etadupāste na sa
analyzed: yat sapta annāni medhayā tapasā ajanayat pitā iti medhayā hi tapasā ajanayat pitā ekam asya  sādhāraṇam iti idam eva asya tat sādhāraṇam annam yat idam adyate sa yaḥ etat upāste na sa
translated: 'The seven kinds of food which the Father produced by mind and penance', for by mind and penance the Father produced them; 'one of them is common to all', that is this, to wit, what is eaten; he who reverences this, him they carry about, as it were, on this common food.

original: pāpmano vyāvartate miṣraṃ hyetat / / /🔽dve devānabhājayaditi hutaṃ ca prahutaṃ ca tasmāddevebhyo juhvati ca pra ca
analyzed: pāpmanaḥ vyāvartate miṣram hi etat  dve devān abhājayat iti hutam ca prahutam ca tasmāt devebhyaḥ juhvati ca pra ca
translated: 'The seven kinds of food which the father produced by meditation and penance', for by meditation and penance the father produced them; 'one of them is common to all', that is this, to wit, food which is eaten; he who reverences that, does not turn away from evil, for that is mixed.

original: juhvatyatho āhurdarśapūrṇamāsāviti tasmānneṣṭiyājukaḥ syāt / / /
analyzed: juhvati atha u āhuḥ darśapūrṇamāsau iti tasmāt na iṣṭi yājukaḥ syāt
translated: 'Two he assigned to the gods', (to wit) the offered (oblation) and the poured (libation); therefore they offer to the gods both the offered and the poured (oblation). And some say the New and Full-moon sacrifices; therefore one should not be a sacrificer who neglects the New and Full-moon sacrifices.

original: paśubhya ekam prāyacaditi tatpayaḥ payo hyevāgre manuṣyāśca paśavaścopajīvanti
analyzed: paśubhyaḥ ekam prāyacat iti tat payaḥ payaḥ hi eva agre manuṣyāḥ ca paśavaḥ ca upajīvanti
translated: 'One he gave to the beasts', that is milk; for men and beasts first live upon milk.

original: tasmātkumāraṃ jātaṃ ghṛtam vaivāgre pratilehayanti stanam vānudhāpyanti / / /
analyzed: tasmāt kumāram jātam ghṛtam vā eva agre pratilehayanti stanam vā anudhāpyanti
translated: Therefore, when a child is born, they first make it suck ghee or they make it suck the breast.

original: atha vatsaṃ jātamāhuḥ atṛṇāda iti tasmintsarvam pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca prāṇiti yacca neti
analyzed: atha vatsam jātam āhuḥ a tṛṇa ādaḥ iti tasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca prāṇiti yat ca na iti
translated: Then they say to him, 'The calf is born, but not the grass'; on that everything here rests, both what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: payasi hīdaṃ sarvam pratiṣṭhitaṃ yacca prāṇiti yacca na / / /
analyzed: payasi hi idam sarvam pratiṣṭhitam yat ca prāṇiti yat ca na
translated: For on milk everything here rests, both what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: tadyadidamāhuḥ samvatsaram payasā juhvadapa punarmṛtyuṃ jayatīti na tathā
analyzed: tat yat idam āhuḥ samvatsaram payasā juhvat apa punarmṛtyum jayati iti na tathā
translated: Now, as to what they say, 'By offering for a year with milk, he conquers even death again,' that is not so.

original: vidyādyadahareva juhoti tadahaḥ punarmṛtyumāpajayatyevam vidvāntsarvaṃ hi
analyzed: vidyāt yat ahar eva juhoti tat ahar punarmṛtyum āpajayati evam vidvān sarvam hi
translated: Now, as to what they say, 'By offering (oblations) of milk for a year, one conquers death again and again,' let him not do so, for he who knows this conquers death day by day, for he who offers day by day conquers death day by day.

original: devebhyo'nnādyam prayacati kasmāttāni na kṣīyante'dyamānāni sarvadeti / / /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ unnādyam prayacati kasmāt tāni na kṣīyante idyamānāni sarvadā iti
translated: Knowing this, he gives to the gods all food; why then do they not perish, being eaten day after day?

original: puruṣo vā akṣitiḥ sa hīdamannam punaḥpunarjanayate yo vai tāmakṣitim vedeti🔽puruṣo vā akṣitiḥ sa hīdamannaṃ dhiyādhiyā janayate karmabhiryaddhaitanna
analyzed: puruṣaḥ vai akṣitiḥ sa hi idam annam punar punar janayate yaḥ vai tām akṣitim veda iti  puruṣaḥ vai akṣitiḥ sa hi idam annam dhiyā dhiyā janayate karmabhiḥ yat ha etat na
translated: Man is imperishable; for he again and again produces this food. He who knows that imperishable (man),

original: kuryātkṣīyeta ha so'nnamatti pratīkeneti mukham pratīkam mukhenetyetatsa
analyzed: kuryāt kṣīyeta ha saḥ unnamatti pratīkena iti mukham pratīkam mukhena iti etat sa
translated: man is imperishable; for he produces this food by his thoughts, by his acts. If he did not do this, he would perish. He eats food by his mouth;

original: devānapigacati sa ūrjamupajīvatīti praśaṃsā / / /
analyzed: devān apigacati saḥ ūrjam upajīvati iti praśaṃsā
translated: by his mouth, that is to say. He goes even to the gods, and he subsists on strength. This is praise.

original: trīṇyātmane'kuruteti mano vācam prāṇaṃ tānyātmane'kurutānyatramanā abhūvaṃ
analyzed: trīṇi ātmanekuruta iti manaḥ vācam prāṇam tāni ātmanekuruta anyatramanāḥ abhūvam
translated: He makes three for his self, mind, speech, and breath; he makes these for his self. Elsewhere I was without mind,

original: nādarśamanyatramanā abhūvaṃ nāśrauṣamiti manasā hyeva paśyati manasā śṛṇoti / / /
analyzed: na adarśam anyatramanāḥ abhūvam na aśrauṣam iti manasā hi eva paśyati manasā śṛṇoti
translated: I saw not, elsewhere I was without mind, I heard not; for by the mind one sees, by the mind one hears.

original: kāmaḥ saṅkalpo vicikitsā śraddhāśraddhā dhṛtiradhṛtirhrīrdhīrbhīrityetatsarvam
analyzed: kāmaḥ saṅkalpaḥ vicikitsā śraddhā aśraddhā dhṛtiḥ adhṛtiḥ hrīḥ dhīḥ bhīḥ iti etat sarvam
translated: Desire, resolve, doubt, faith, want of faith, firmness, unfirmness, modesty, shame, and fear—all this

original: mana eva tasmādapi pṛṣṭhata upaspṛṣṭo manasā vijānāti / / /
analyzed: manaḥ eva tasmāt api pṛṣṭhatas upaspṛṣṭaḥ manasā vijānāti
translated: is mind. Therefore, even when touched on the back, one knows through the mind.

original: yaḥ kaśca śabdo vāgeva saiṣā hyantamāyattaiṣā hi na prāṇo'pāno vyāna udānaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ kaḥ ca śabdaḥ vāc eva sā eṣā hi antam āyattā eṣā hi na prāṇa upānaḥ vyānaḥ udānaḥ
translated: Whatever sound there is, that is speech. It is this, for it is dependent on the end. It is not the out-breath, in-breath, through-breath, up-breath,

original: samāno'na ityetatsarvam prāṇa evaitanmanyo vā ayamātmā vāṅmayo manomayaḥ
analyzed: samāna ūnaḥ iti etat sarvam prāṇaḥ eva etat manyaḥ vai ayam ātmā vāc mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ
translated: or cross-breath. All this is breath. This self is indeed the mind, consisting of speech, consisting of mind,

original: prāṇamayaḥ / / /
analyzed: prāṇa mayaḥ
translated: consisting of breath.

original: trayo lokā eta eva vāgevāyaṃ loko mano'ntarikṣalokaḥ prāṇo'sau lokaḥ / / /
analyzed: trayaḥ lokāḥ ete eva vāc eva ayam lokaḥ manaḥ ntarikṣa lokaḥ prāṇaḥ asau lokaḥ
translated: These are the three worlds. Speech is this world, mind is the atmosphere world, and breath is the world yonder.

original: trayo vedā eta eva vāgevargvedo mano yajurvedaḥ prāṇaḥ sāmavedaḥ / / /
analyzed: trayaḥ vedāḥ ete eva vāc eva ṛgvedaḥ manaḥ yajurvedaḥ prāṇaḥ sāmavedaḥ
translated: These are the three Vedas. Speech is the Ṛg Veda, mind is the Yajur Veda, and breath is the Sāma Veda.

original: devāḥ pitaro manuṣyā eta eva vāgeva devā manaḥ pitaraḥ prāṇo manuṣyāḥ / / /
analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ ete eva vāc eva devāḥ manaḥ pitaraḥ prāṇaḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: These are the gods, ancestors, and humans. Speech is the gods, mind is the ancestors, and breath is humans.

original: pitā mātā prajaita eva mana eva pitā vāṅgmātā prāṇaḥ prajā / / /
analyzed: pitā mātā prajā ete eva manaḥ eva pitā vāc mātā prāṇaḥ prajā
translated: These are the father, mother, and offspring. Mind is the father, speech is the mother, and breath is the offspring.

original: vijñātam vijijñāsyam avijñātameta eva yatkiṃ ca vijñātam vācastadrūpam vāgghi
analyzed: vijñātam vijijñāsyam a vijñātam ete eva yat kim ca vijñātam vācaḥ tat rūpam vāc hi
translated: The known, the to-be-known, and the unknown—all this is speech. Whatever is known, that is the form of speech, for speech

original: vijñātā vāgenaṃ tadbhūtvāvati / / /
analyzed: vijñātā vāc enam tat bhūtvā avati
translated: is the known. Having become that, speech protects him.

original: yatkiṃ ca vijijñāsyam manastadrūpam mano hi vijijñāsyam mana eva tadbhūtvāvati / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca vijijñāsyam manaḥ tat rūpam manaḥ hi vijijñāsyam manaḥ eva tat bhūtvā avati
translated: Whatever is to be known, that is of the nature of mind; for mind is to be known. Having become that very mind, it prospers.

original: yatkiṃ cāvijñātam prāṇasya tadrūpam prāṇo hyavijñātaḥ prāṇa eva tadbhūtvāvati / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca a vijñātam prāṇasya tat rūpam prāṇaḥ hi a vijñātaḥ prāṇaḥ eva tat bhūtvā avati
translated: Whatever is not known, that is of the nature of breath; for breath is not known. Having become that very breath, it prospers.

original: tasyai vācaḥ pṛthivī śarīram jyotī rūpamayamagnistadyāvatyeva vāktāvatī pṛthivī
analyzed: tasyai vācaḥ pṛthivī śarīram jyotiḥ rūpam ayam agniḥ tat yāvatī eva vāc tāvatī pṛthivī
translated: The body of that speech is earth, its form is light, and this is fire. As great as speech is, so great is earth,

original: tāvānayamagniḥ / / /
analyzed: tāvān ayam agniḥ
translated: and so great is this fire.

original: athaitasya manaso dyauḥ śarīraṃ jyotī rūpamasāvādityastadyāvadeva manastāvatī
analyzed: atha etasya manasaḥ dyauḥ śarīram jyotiḥ rūpam asau ādityaḥ tat yāvat eva manaḥ tāvatī
translated: Now, the body of that mind is heaven, its form is light, and this is the sun. As great as the mind is,

original: dyaustāvānasāvādityastau mithunaṃ samaitāṃ tataḥ prāṇo'jāyata sa indraḥ sa
analyzed: dyauḥ tāvān asau ādityaḥ tau mithunam samaitām tatas prāṇaḥ ujāyata saḥ indraḥ sa
translated: so great is heaven, and so great is this sun. Those two united. From them was born breath, that is Indra.

original: eṣo'sapatno dvitīyo vai sapatno nāsya sapatno bhavati ya evam veda / / /
analyzed: eṣaḥ sapatnaḥ dvitīyaḥ vai sapatnaḥ na asya sapatnaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He is the non-enemy. A second one is indeed an enemy. He who knows thus does not have an enemy.

original: athaitasya prāṇasyāpaḥ śarīraṃ jyotī rūpamasau candrastadyāvā neva prāṇastāvatya
analyzed: atha etasya prāṇasya āpaḥ śarīram jyotiḥ rūpam asau candraḥ tat yāvā na iva prāṇaḥ tāvatyaḥ
translated: Now, the body of that breath is water, its form is light, and this is the moon. As great as breath is,

original: āpastāvānasau candraḥ / / /
analyzed: āpaḥ tāvān asau candraḥ
translated: so great are the waters, and so great is this moon.

original: ta ete sarva eva samāḥ sarve'nantāḥ sa yo haitānantavata upāste'ntavataṃ sa lokaṃ
analyzed: te ete sarve eva samāḥ sarva inantāḥ sa yaḥ ha etān anantavataḥ upāsta intavatam sa lokam
translated: These all are equal, all infinite. He who worships them as infinite attains a world that is infinite,

original: jayatyatha yo haitānanantānupāste'nantaṃ sa lokaṃ jayati / / /
analyzed: jayati atha yaḥ ha etān anantān upāstena antam sa lokam jayati
translated: He who reverences these infinite (worlds) as infinite wins the infinite world.🔽This year, Prajapati, is of sixteen parts. Its fifteen parts are the nights,

original: sa eṣa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśakalastasya rātraya eva pañcadaśa kalā🔽dhruvaivāsya ṣoḍaśī kalā sa rātribhirevā ca pūryate'pa ca kṣīyate so'māvāsyāṃ
analyzed: saḥ eṣa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśa kalaḥ tasya rātrayaḥ eva pañcadaśa kalā  dhruvā eva asya ṣoḍaśī kalā sa rātribhiḥ eva ā ca pūryate ipa ca kṣīyate somāvāsyām
translated: and the sixteenth part is the fixed (dhruva) (day). It is filled by the nights and diminished by them. On the new moon day

original: rātrimetayā ṣoḍaśyā kalayā sarvamidam prāṇabhṛdanupraviśya tataḥ prātarjāyate
analyzed: rātrim etayā ṣoḍaśyā kalayā sarvam idam prāṇabhṛt anupraviśya tatas prātar jāyate
translated: it enters with this sixteenth part into all these living beings, and from there it is born again in the morning.

original: tasmādetāṃ rātrim prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇaṃ na vicindyādapi kṛkalāsasyaitasyā eva devatāyā
analyzed: tasmāt etām rātrim prāṇabhṛtaḥ prāṇam na vicindyāt api kṛkalāsasya etasyāḥ eva devatāyāḥ
translated: Therefore one should not cut off the life of any living being on that night, even of a lizard, lest he should diminish that deity.

original: apacityai / / /🔽yo vai sa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśakalo'yameva sa yo'yamevaṃvitpuruṣastasya🔽vittameva pañcadaśa kalā ātmaivāsya ṣoḍaśī kalā sa vittenaivā ca pūryate'pa ca🔽kṣīyate tadetannabhyaṃ yadayamātmā pradhirvittaṃ tasmādyadyapi sarvajyāniṃ
analyzed: apacityai  yaḥ vai sa saṃvatsaraḥ prajāpatiḥ ṣoḍaśa kalaḥ yam eva sa yaḥ yam evaṃvid puruṣaḥ tasya  vittam eva pañcadaśa kalāḥ ātmā eva asya ṣoḍaśī kalā sa vittena eva ā ca pūryatepa ca  kṣīyate tat etat nabhyam yat ayam ātmā pradhiḥ vittam tasmāt yadi api sarva jyānim

original: atha trayo vāva lokāḥ manuṣyalokaḥ pitṛloko devaloka iti so'yam manuṣyalokaḥ
analyzed: atha trayaḥ vāva lokāḥ manuṣya lokaḥ pitṛ lokaḥ deva lokaḥ iti saḥ ayam manuṣya lokaḥ
translated: Now, there are three worlds indeed: the world of men, the world of the fathers, and the world of the gods. This world of men

translated: is to be conquered by a son alone, not by any other rite. The world of the fathers by knowledge. The world of the gods is the best of the worlds.

original: śreṣṭhastasmādvidyām praśaṃsanti / / /🔽athātaḥ samprattiḥ yadā praiṣyanmanyate'tha putramāha tvam brahma tvaṃ
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ tasmāt vidyām praśaṃsanti  atha atas samprattiḥ yadā praiṣyan manyatetha putram āha tvam brahma tvam
translated: Therefore, they praise knowledge.

original: yajñastvaṃ loka iti sa putraḥ pratyāhāham brahmāhaṃ yajño'haṃ loka iti / / /
analyzed: yajñaḥ tvam lokaḥ iti sa putraḥ pratyāha aham brahmā aham yajñaḥ ham lokaḥ iti
translated: Now, therefore, the passing on. When he thinks he is about to depart, then he says to his son: 'You are Brahman, you are the sacrifice, you are the world.' The son replies: 'I am Brahman, I am the sacrifice, I am the world.'

original: yadvai kiṃ cānūktam tasya sarvasya brahmetyekatā ye vai ke ca yajñāsteṣāṃ🔽sarveṣāṃ yajña ityekatā ye vai ke ca lokāsteṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ loka ityekataitāvadvā idaṃ

translated: Whatever has been said, of all that Brahman is the oneness. Whatever sacrifices there are, of all of them

analyzed: sarvam etat mā sarvam san ayam itas bhunajat iti tasmāt putram anuśiṣṭam
translated: the sacrifice is the oneness. Whatever worlds there are, of all of them the world is the oneness. This much indeed is all. May he, being all, enjoy all from here.' Therefore, they call the son who has been instructed

original: lokyamāhustasmādenamanuśāsati sa yadaivaṃvidasmāllokātpraityathaibhireva prāṇaiḥ
analyzed: lokyam āhuḥ tasmāt enam anuśāsati sa yadā evaṃvid asmāt lokāt praiti atha ebhiḥ eva prāṇaiḥ
translated: worthy of the world. Therefore, he instructs him. When he, knowing thus, departs from this world, then with these very vital breaths

original: saha putramāviśati sa yadyanena kiṃcidakṣṇayākṛtam bhavati tasmādenaṃ
analyzed: saha putram āviśati sa yadi anena kiṃcid akṣṇayākṛtam bhavati tasmāt enam
translated: He enters with his son. If he has done anything wrong through him, then

original: sarvasmātputro muñcati tasmātputro nāma sa putreṇaivāsmiṃloke
analyzed: sarvasmāt putraḥ muñcati tasmāt putraḥ nāma sa putreṇa eva asmin loke
translated: his son delivers him from all that. Therefore he is called a son. By his son he finds support in this world.

original: pratitiṣṭhatyathainamete daivāḥ prāṇā amṛtā āviśanti / / /
analyzed: pratitiṣṭhati atha enam ete daivāḥ prāṇāḥ amṛtāḥ āviśanti
translated: Then these divine vital airs, immortal, enter him.

original: pṛthivyai cainamagneśca daivī vāgāviśati sā vai daivī vāgyayā yadyadeva vadati
analyzed: pṛthivyai ca enam agneḥ ca daivī vāc āviśati sā vai daivī vāgyayā yat yat eva vadati
translated: The divine speech enters him, of earth and of Agni. That, indeed, is the divine speech, by which whatever one speaks

original: tattadbhavati / / /
analyzed: tat tat bhavati
translated: that comes to be.

original: divaścainamādityācca daivam mana āviśati tadvai daivam mano yenānandyeva
analyzed: divaḥ ca enam ādityāt ca daivam manaḥ āviśati tat vai daivam manaḥ yena ānandya iva
translated: The divine mind enters him, of heaven and of the sun. That, indeed, is the divine mind, by which one becomes joyful

original: bhavatyatho na śocati / / /
analyzed: bhavati atha u na śocati
translated: and does not grieve.

original: adbhyaścainaṃ candramasaśca daivaḥ prāṇa āviśati sa vai daivaḥ prāṇo yaḥ🔽saṃcaraṃścāsaṃcaraṃśca na vyathate'tho na riśyati sa eṣa evaṃvitsarveṣām🔽bhūtānāmātmā bhavati yathaiṣā devataivaṃ sa yathaitāṃ devatāṃ sarvāṇi
analyzed: adbhyaḥ ca enam candramasaḥ ca daivaḥ prāṇaḥ āviśati sa vai daivaḥ prāṇaḥ yaḥ  saṃcaran ca a saṃcaran ca na vyathatetho na riśyati saḥ eṣaḥ evaṃvid sarveṣām  bhūtānām ātmā bhavati yathā eṣā devatā evam sa yathā etām devatām sarvāṇi
translated: The divine vital air enters him, of the waters and of the moon. That, indeed, is the divine vital air, by which one

original: bhūtānyavantyevaṃ haivaṃvidaṃ sarvāṇi bhūtānyavanti yadu kiṃ cemāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: bhūtāni avanti evam ha evaṃvidam sarvāṇi bhūtāni avanti yat u kim ca imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: is not pained, whether moving or unmoving, and does not perish. He who knows this becomes the self of all beings, as this divinity is. As all beings depend on this divinity, so all beings depend on one who knows this. Whatever these creatures🔽are,

original: śocantyamaivāsāṃ tadbhavati puṇyamevāmuṃ gacati na ha vai devānpāpaṃ gacati / / /
analyzed: śocanti amā eva āsām tat bhavati puṇyam eva amum gacati na ha vai devān pāpam gacati
translated: To them it becomes only sorrow, and only merit goes to him. Evil never goes to the gods.

original: athāto vratamīmāṃsā prajāpatirha karmāṇi sasṛje tāni sṛṣṭānyanyo'nyenāspardhanta
analyzed: atha atas vrata mīmāṃsā prajāpatiḥ ha karmāṇi sasṛje tāni sṛṣṭāni anyonyena aspardhanta
translated: Now, then, the examination of the vow. Prajapati created the acts. Those created by him competed with each other.

original: vadiṣyāmyevāhamiti vāgdadhre drakṣyāmyahamiti cakṣuḥ śroṣyāmyahamiti
analyzed: vadiṣyāmi eva aham iti vāc dadhre drakṣyāmi aham iti cakṣuḥ śroṣyāmi aham iti
translated: Speech thought, I shall speak. The eye thought, I shall see. The ear thought, I shall hear.

original: śrotramevamanyāni karmāṇi yathākarma / / /
analyzed: śrotram evam anyāni karmāṇi yathākarma
translated: In the same way, the other acts, according to their respective functions.

original: tāni mṛtyuḥ śramo bhūtvopayeme tānyāpnottānyāptvā mṛtyuravārunddha
analyzed: tāni mṛtyuḥ śramaḥ bhūtvā upayeme tāni āpnot tāni āptvā mṛtyuḥ avārunddha
translated: Death, becoming fatigue, approached them. He obtained them. Having obtained them, death seized them.

original: tasmācrāmyatyeva vākśrāmyati cakṣuḥ śrāmyati śrotramathemameva nāpnodyo'yam
analyzed: tasmāt ācrāmyati eva vāc śrāmyati cakṣuḥ śrāmyati śrotram atha imam eva na āpnot yaḥ ayam
translated: Therefore, speech tires, the eye tires, the ear tires. But he did not obtain this one,

original: madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ / / /
analyzed: madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ
translated: this middle breath.

translated: They thought to know him, This one is the best among us, who, moving and not moving,

translated: In whatever family he is born who knows this. He who strives in rivalry with one who knows this, dries up and

translated: dies in the end. Thus, in regard to the self.

original: athādhidevataṃ jvaliṣyāmyevāhamityagnirdadhre tapsyāsyahamityādityo🔽bhāsyāmyahamiti candramā evamanyā devatā yathādevataṃ sa yathaiṣām prāṇānām
analyzed: atha adhidevatam jvaliṣyāmi eva aham iti agniḥ dadhre tapsyāsi aham iti ādityaḥ  bhāsyāmi aham iti candramāḥ evam anyāḥ devatāḥ yathādevatam sa yathā eṣām prāṇānām
translated: Now, in regard to the deities. Agni conceived, I shall blaze. Āditya conceived, I shall heat.🔽The moon conceived, I shall shine. The other deities did likewise, according to their deity. Just as the middle vital breath is among these vital breaths,

original: madhyamaḥ prāṇa evametāsāṃ devatānāṃ vāyurmlocanti hyanyā devatā na vāyuḥ
analyzed: madhyamaḥ prāṇaḥ evam etāsām devatānām vāyuḥ mlocanti hi anyāḥ devatāḥ na vāyuḥ
translated: so is Vāyu among these deities. For the other deities wane, but not Vāyu.

original: saiṣānastamitā devatā yadvāyuḥ / / /
analyzed: sā eṣā an astamitā devatā yat vāyuḥ
translated: This Vāyu is the deity that does not set.

original: athaiṣa śloko bhavati yataścodeti sūryo'staṃ yatra ca gacatīti prāṇādvā eṣa udeti🔽prāṇe'stameti taṃ devāścakrire dharmaṃ sa evādya sa u śva iti yadvā
analyzed: atha eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati yatas ca udeti sūryoḥ tam yatra ca gacati iti prāṇāt vai eṣaḥ udeti  prāṇeḥ tam eti tam devāḥ cakrire dharmam saḥ eva adya saḥ u śvas iti yat vā
translated: Now, there is this verse: From which the sun rises and into which it sets. From the vital breath it rises🔽and into the vital breath it sets. The gods made this rule, He is today and he will be tomorrow. Those

analyzed: ete imuḥ hi adhriyanta tat eva api adya kurvanti tasmāt ekam eva vratam
translated: who transgress this, the gods punish. Therefore, one should observe only one vow,

analyzed: caret samāpipayiṣet tena u etasyai devatāyai sāyujyam salokatām jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He should move and drink with it. By that he wins union with and co-existence with that deity, who knows thus.

original: trayaṃ vā idaṃ nāma rūpaṃ karma teṣāṃ nāmnāṃ vāgityetadeṣāmukthamato hi🔽sarvāṇi nāmānyuttiṣṭhantyetadeṣāṃ sāmaitaddhi sarvairnāmabhiḥ samametadeṣām
analyzed: trayam vai idam nāma rūpam karma teṣām nāmnām vāc iti etat eṣām uktham atas hi  sarvāṇi nāmāni uttiṣṭhanti etat eṣām sāma etat hi sarvaiḥ nāmabhiḥ samam etat eṣām
translated: This is threefold: name, form, and action. Of those names, speech is this, for from it

analyzed: brahma etat hi sarvāṇi nāmāni bibharti  atha rūpāṇām cakṣuḥ iti etat eṣām uktham atas hi sarvāṇi rūpāṇi uttiṣṭhanti etat eṣām
translated: all names arise. This is their Udgītha; for this is common to all names. This is their Sāman; for this is common to all names. This is their Brahman; for this bears all names.

original: sāmaitaddhi sarvai rūpaiḥ samametadeṣām brahmaitaddhi sarvāṇi rūpāṇi bibharti / / /🔽atha karmaṇām ātmetyetadeṣāmukthamato hi sarvāṇi karmāṇyuttiṣṭhantyetadeṣāṃ
analyzed: sāma etat hi sarvaiḥ rūpaiḥ samam etat eṣām brahma etat hi sarvāṇi rūpāṇi bibharti  atha karmaṇām ātmā iti etat eṣām uktham atas hi sarvāṇi karmāṇi uttiṣṭhanti etat eṣām
translated: Now of forms, the eye is this; this is their Udgītha; for from it all forms arise. This is their Sāman; for this is common to all forms. This is their Brahman; for this bears all forms.

original: sāmaitaddhi sarvaiḥ karmabhiḥ samametadeṣām brahmaitaddhi sarvāṇi karmāṇi
analyzed: sāma etat hi sarvaiḥ karmabhiḥ samam etat eṣām brahma etat hi sarvāṇi karmāṇi
translated: Now of actions, the self is this; this is their Udgītha; for from it all actions arise. This is their Sāman; for this is common to all actions. This is their Brahman; for this bears all actions.

original: bibharti tadetattrayaṃ sadekamayamātmātmo ekaḥ sannetattrayaṃ tadetadamṛtaṃ
analyzed: bibharti tat etat trayam sat eka mayam ātmā ātmā ekaḥ san etat trayam tat etat amṛtam
translated: That which is this threefold is one, the self. Being one, it is this threefold. That is the immortal,

translated: The life-breath is covered by truth, and truth is the name of immortality. This life-breath is covered by name and form.

original: dṛptabālākirhānūcāno gārgya āsa sa hovācājātaśatruṃ kāśyam brahma te bravāṇīti sa
analyzed: dṛptabālākiḥ ha anūcānaḥ gārgyaḥ āsa sa ha uvāca ajātaśatrum kāśyam brahma te bravāṇi iti sa
translated: The proud young Gargya Ānūcāna said this. He said to Ajātaśatru of Kāśi, I will tell you about Brahman.

original: hovācājātaśatruḥ sahasrametasyāṃ vāci dadmo janako janaka iti vai janā dhāvantīti / / /
analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ sahasram etasyām vāci dadmaḥ janakaḥ janakaḥ iti vai janāḥ dhāvanti iti
translated: Ajātaśatru said, We will give a thousand cows for this speech. Janaka, Janaka, indeed people run away.

original: sa hovāca gārgyo ya evāsāvāditye puruṣa etamevāham brahmopāsa iti sa
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva asau āditye puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti sa
translated: Gargya said, The person who is in the sun, I meditate on him as Brahman.

original: hovācājātaśatrurmā maitasmintsaṃvadiṣṭhā atiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām mūrdhā🔽rājeti vā ahametamupāsa iti sa yaetamevamupāste'tiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām
analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ atiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām mūrdhā  rājā iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ etam evam upāsta ītiṣṭhāḥ sarveṣām bhūtānām
translated: Ajātaśatru said, Do not dispute with me about this. He is the head of all beings,🔽the king. I meditate on him as such. He who meditates on him as such becomes the head of all beings,

original: mūrdhā rājā bhavati / / /

translated: Gargya said, The person who is in the moon, I meditate on him as Brahman.

original: hovācājātaśatrurmā maitasmintsaṃvadiṣṭhā bṛhanpāṇḍaravāsāḥ somo rājeti vā
analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ bṛhan pāṇḍara vāsāḥ somaḥ rājā iti vā
translated: Ajātaśatru said, Do not dispute with me about this. He is the great, the white-robed, Soma the king.

original: ahametamupāsa iti sa ya etamevamupāste'haraharha sutaḥ prasuto bhavati nāsyānnaṃ
analyzed: aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ etam evam upāsta ihar ahar ha sutaḥ prasutaḥ bhavati na asya annam
translated: I worship him thus.' He who worships him thus becomes pressed and well-pressed day by day. His food is not exhausted.

original: kṣīyate / / /
analyzed: kṣīyate
translated: 'I worship Him as the Day.' He who worships Him as such becomes day after day pressed out and well pressed out; his food is not exhausted.

original: sa hovāca gārgyo ya evāyaṃ vidyuti puruṣa etamevāham brahmopāsa iti sa
analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam vidyuti puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti sa
translated: Gargi said, 'The person who is in lightning, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

original: hovācājātaśatrurmā maitasmintsaṃvadiṣṭhāstejasvīti vā ahametamupāsa iti sa ya
analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ tejasvī iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not argue with me about this. I meditate on him as full of light.'

original: etamevamupāste tejasvī ha bhavati tejasvinī hāsya prajā bhavati / / /
analyzed: etam evam upāste tejasvī ha bhavati tejasvinī ha asya prajā bhavati
translated: He who worships him as such becomes full of light, and his offspring becomes full of light.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam ākāśe puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti sa
translated: Gargi said, 'The person who is in space, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ pūrṇam a pravarti iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not argue with me about this. I meditate on him as full and overflowing.'

original: sa ya etamevamupāste pūryate prajayā paśubhirnāsyāsmāllokātprajodvartate / / /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etam evam upāste pūryate prajayā paśubhiḥ na asya asmāt lokāt prajā udvartate
translated: He who worships him as such becomes filled with offspring and cattle, and his offspring does not turn away from this world.

analyzed: sa ha uvāca gārgyaḥ yaḥ eva ayam vāyau puruṣaḥ etam eva aham brahma upāse iti sa
translated: Gargi said, 'The person who is in the wind, on him I meditate as Brahman.'

translated: Gargi said, 'The person who is in the fire, him I worship as Brahman.'

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ viṣāsahiḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this. I worship him as he who conquers poison. He who

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ pratirūpaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this. I worship him as he who is of the form of the reflection. He who

translated: Gargi said, 'The person who is in the mirror, him I worship as Brahman.'🔽Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this. I worship him as he who shines. He who

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ rociṣṇuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ dvitīyaḥ ūnapagaḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not argue with me about this. I worship him as the second, the imperishable.'

translated: attains the full life-span in this world, and the vital breath does not abandon it before its time.

original: sa hovāca gārgyo ya evāyaṃ cāyāmayaḥ puruṣa etamevāham brahmopāsa iti sa

analyzed: ha uvāca ajātaśatruḥ mā mā etasmin saṃvadiṣṭhāḥ mṛtyuḥ iti vai aham etam upāse iti sa yaḥ
translated: Ajatasatru said, 'Do not dispute with me about this. I worship him as Death.'
