translated: One should speak with respect for one's mother, father, and teacher. Thus did Akalya speak. He said, The heart indeed is Brahman. For what would be of one who has no heart? He said to you, Its abode, its foundation,

original: me'bravīdityekapādvā etatsamrāḍiti / / /
analyzed: mā bravīt iti eka pād vai etat samrāj iti
translated: One should speak with respect for one's mother, father, and teacher. Thus, Akalya said, The heart, indeed, is Brahman. For what would be of one who has no heart? He said, But I have not told you its abode and support.🔽That is the one-footed sovereignty.

original: sa vai no brūhi yājñavalkya hṛdayamevāyatanamākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhā🔽sthitirityenadupāsīta kā sthititā yājñavalkya hṛdayameva samrāḍiti hovāca hṛdayaṃ
analyzed: sa vai naḥ brūhi yājñavalkya hṛdayam eva āyatanam ākāśaḥ pratiṣṭhā  sthitiḥ iti enat upāsīta kā sthiti tā yājñavalkya hṛdayam eva samrāj iti ha uvāca hṛdayam
translated: Tell us that, Yajnavalkya. The heart itself is the abode, space is the support.

original: vai samrāṭ sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā hṛdayena hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratitiṣṭhanti
analyzed: vai samrāj sarveṣām bhūtānām pratiṣṭhā hṛdayena hi sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratitiṣṭhanti
translated: Thus one should worship it as the support. What is the support? The heart itself is the sovereign, he said. The heart, indeed, is the sovereign, the support of all beings. For by the heart all beings are supported.

original: hṛdayaṃ vai samrāṭ paramam brahma nainaṃ hṛdayaṃ jahāti sarvāṇyenam🔽bhūtānyabhikṣaranti / / /
analyzed: hṛdayam vai samrāj paramam brahma na enam hṛdayam jahāti sarvāṇi enam  bhūtāni abhikṣaranti
translated: The heart, indeed, is the supreme Brahman. The heart does not abandon him. All beings gather around him.

original: devo bhūtvā devānapyeti ya evaṃ vidvānetadupāste hastyṛṣabhaṃ sahasraṃ dadāmīti
analyzed: devaḥ bhūtvā devān apyeti yaḥ evam vidvān etat upāste hasti ṛṣabham sahasram dadāmi iti
translated: Having become a god, he goes even to the gods, he who, knowing this, worships it thus. I would give a thousand cows with bulls,

original: hovāca janako vaidehaḥ sa hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ pitā me'manyata nānanuśiṣya
analyzed: ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ pitā memanyata na an anuśiṣya
translated: said Janaka of Videha. Yajnavalkya said, 'My father thought that one should not take away a wife without (the consent of) the teacher.

original: hareteti / / /
analyzed: hareta iti
translated: Thus (he spoke).

original: atha ha janako vaidehaḥ kūrcādupāvasarpannuvāca namaste yājñavalkyānu mā
analyzed: atha ha janakaḥ vaidehaḥ kūrcāt upāvasarpan uvāca namaḥ te yājñavalkya anu mā
translated: Then Janaka, the king of Videha, approaching from the Kūrcas, said: Salutations to you, Yājñavalkya.

original: śādhīti sa hovāca yathā vai samrāṇmahāntamadhvānameṣyanrathaṃ vā nāvaṃ vā
analyzed: śādhi iti sa ha uvāca yathā vai samrāj mahāntam adhvānam eṣyan ratham vā nāvam vā
translated: Instruct me. He said: Just as, Your Majesty, one who is about to undertake a long journey would prepare a chariot or a boat,

original: samādadītaivamevaitābhirupaniṣadbhiḥ samāhitātmāsyevaṃ vṛndāraka āḍhyaḥ
analyzed: samādadīta evam eva etābhiḥ upaniṣadbhiḥ samāhita ātmā asi evam vṛndārakaḥ āḍhyaḥ
translated: in the same way, with a mind composed by these Upaniṣads, one should be like a wealthy Vṛndārakā.

original: sannadhītaveda uktopaniṣatka ito vimucyamānaḥ kva gamiṣyasīti nāhaṃ
analyzed: san adhīta vedaḥ ukta upaniṣatkaḥ itas vimucyamānaḥ kva gamiṣyasi iti na aham
translated: Having studied the Vedas and learned the Upaniṣads, when one is released from here, where will one go? I do not know that,

original: tadbhagavanveda yatra gamiṣyāmītyatha vai te'haṃ tadvakṣyāmi yatra gamiṣyasīti
analyzed: tat bhagavan veda yatra gamiṣyāmi iti atha vai tat iham tat vakṣyāmi yatra gamiṣyasi iti
translated: Sir, where I will go. Then I will tell you where you will go.

original: bravītu bhagavāniti / / /🔽sa hovāca indho vai nāmaiṣa yo'yaṃ dakṣiṇe'kṣanpuruṣastaṃ vā etamindhaṃ
analyzed: bravītu bhagavān iti  sa ha uvāca indhaḥ vai nāma eṣa yaḥ yam dakṣiṇa īkṣan puruṣaḥ tam vai etam indham
translated: Let the Lord speak.

original: santamindra ityācakṣate paro'kṣeṇeva paro'kṣapriyā iva hi devāḥ pratyakṣadviṣaḥ / / /🔽athaitadvāme'kṣiṇi puruṣarūpam eṣāsya patnī virāṭ tayoreṣa saṃstāvo ya
analyzed: santam indraḥ iti ācakṣate parokṣeṇa iva parokṣa priyāḥ iva hi devāḥ pratyakṣa dviṣaḥ  atha etat vāma īkṣiṇi puruṣa rūpam eṣā asya patnī virāj tayoḥ eṣa saṃstāvaḥ yaḥ
translated: He said: This person who is in the right eye is called Indra, as if by a secret name, for the gods love secrets and hate the obvious.

original: eṣo'ntarhṛdaya ākāśo'thainayoretadannaṃ ya eṣo'ntarhṛdaye
analyzed: eṣaḥ antar hṛdaye ākāśaḥ utha enayoḥ etat annam yaḥ eṣaḥ antar hṛdaye
translated: Now this form of a person in the left eye is his wife, Virāj. Their union is this space in the heart. And this food is for them, which is in the heart.

original: lohitapiṇḍo'thainayoretatprāvaraṇaṃ yadetadantarhṛdaye jālakamivāthainayoreṣā sṛtiḥ🔽satī saṃcaraṇī yaiṣā hṛdayādūrdhvāṃ nāḍyuccarati / / /
analyzed: lohita piṇḍā utha enayoḥ etat prāvaraṇam yat etat antar hṛdaye jālakam iva atha enayoḥ eṣā sṛtiḥ  satī saṃcaraṇī yā eṣā hṛdayāt ūrdhvām nāḍī uccarati
translated: which is the moving channel that rises from the heart.

original: tā vā asyaitāḥ hitā nāma nāḍyo yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinna etābhirvā
analyzed: tāḥ vai asya etāḥ hitāḥ nāma nāḍyaḥ yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnaḥ etābhiḥ vā
translated: These are his channels called 'hita', like a hair split a thousand ways. By them

original: etamāsravadāsravati tasmādeṣa praviviktāhāratara iva bhavatyasmācārīrādātmanaḥ / / /
analyzed: etam āsravat āsravati tasmāt eṣa pravivikta āhārataraḥ iva bhavati asmāt ācārīrāt ātmanaḥ
translated: he flows out, he flows out. Therefore, he becomes more separate from this body.

original: tasyā vā etasya puruṣasya prācī dikprāñcaḥ prāṇā dakṣiṇā digdakṣiṇāḥ prāṇāḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ vai etasya puruṣasya prācī diś prāñcaḥ prāṇāḥ dakṣiṇā diś dakṣiṇāḥ prāṇāḥ
translated: Of that person, the eastern direction is the eastern vital breaths, the southern direction is the southern vital breaths,

original: pratīcī dikpratyañcaḥ prāṇā udīcī digudañcaḥ prāṇā ū ūrdhvā digūrdhvāḥ prāṇā🔽avācī
analyzed: pratīcī diś pratyañcaḥ prāṇāḥ udīcī diś udañcaḥ prāṇāḥ u ūrdhvā diś ūrdhvāḥ prāṇā  avācī
translated: the western direction is the western vital breaths, the northern direction is the northern vital breaths, the upward direction is the upward vital breaths,

original: digavāñcaḥ prāṇā sarvā diśaḥ sarve prāṇāḥ / / /
analyzed: diś avāñcaḥ prāṇā sarvāḥ diśaḥ sarve prāṇāḥ
translated: the downward direction is the downward vital breaths, all directions are all vital breaths.

original: sa eṣa neti netyātmā agṛhyo na hi gṛhyate'śīryo na hi śīryate'saṅgo'sito na sajyate na
analyzed: saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā a gṛhyaḥ na hi gṛhyate īśīryaḥ na hi śīryate isaṅga usitaḥ na sajyate na
translated: That Self is to be described by 'not' and 'not'. It is ungraspable, for it cannot be grasped. It is undecaying, for it does not decay. It is unattached, for it does not stick. It is unfettered, for it does not get entangled.

original: vyathate'bhayaṃ vai janaka prāpto'sīti hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ sa hovāca janako vaideho
analyzed: vyathata ibhayam vai janaka prāptaḥ asi iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ sa ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ
translated: It does not suffer, O Janaka, you have attained fearlessness,' said Yajnavalkya. He said: Janaka of Videha,

original: namaste yājñavalkyābhayaṃ tvāgacatādyo no bhagavannabhayaṃ vedayasa ime videhā
analyzed: namaḥ te yājñavalkya abhayam tvā agacata āt yaḥ naḥ bhagavan abhayam vedayase ime videhā
translated: Salutations to you, Yajnavalkya. May you grant us fearlessness today, O revered one, since you make us know what is fearless. These are the Videhas.

original: ayamahamasmīti / / /🔽janakaṃ ha vaidehaṃ yājñavalkyo jagāma samenena vadiṣya ityatha ha yajjanakaśca
analyzed: ayam aham asmi iti  janakam ha vaideham yājñavalkyaḥ jagāma sam enena vadiṣye iti atha ha yat janakaḥ ca
translated: This am I.

original: vaideho yājñavalkyaścāgnihotre samūdatustasmai ha yājñavalkyo varaṃ dadau sa ha🔽kāmapraśnameva vavre taṃ hāsmai dadau taṃ ha samrāḍeva pūrvaḥ papraca / / /
analyzed: vaidehaḥ yājñavalkyaḥ ca agnihotre samūdatuḥ tasmai ha yājñavalkyaḥ varam dadau sa ha  kāma praśnam eva vavre tam ha asmai dadau tam ha samrāj eva pūrvaḥ papraca
translated: Yajnavalkya went to Janaka of Videha, thinking, I will speak with him. Then it happened that Janaka of Videha and Yajnavalkya met at the Agnihotra. To him, Yajnavalkya, gave a boon.🔽He chose the boon of asking questions as he wished. Yajnavalkya granted it to him. Then the emperor himself asked the first question.

original: yājñavalkya kiṃjyotirayam puruṣa iti ādityajyotiḥ samrāḍiti hovācādityenaivāyaṃ
analyzed: yājñavalkya kiṃjyotiḥ ayam puruṣaḥ iti āditya jyotiḥ samrāj iti ha uvāca ādityena eva ayam
translated: Yajnavalkya, what is the light of this person? The light of the sun, O emperor, he said. By the light of the sun,

original: jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute uiparyetītyevamevaitadyājñavalkya / / /🔽astamita āditye yājñavalkya kiṃjyotirevāyam puruṣa iti candrajyotiḥ samrāḍiti
analyzed: jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute uiparyeti iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya  astamite āditye yājñavalkya kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti candra jyotiḥ samrāj iti
translated: this one shines, moves about, performs actions, and returns. Thus indeed, Yajnavalkya, it is.🔽When the sun has set, Yajnavalkya, what is the light of this person? The light of the moon, O emperor, he said. By the light of the moon,

original: hovāca candreṇaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute
analyzed: ha uvāca candreṇa eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute
translated: this one shines, moves about, performs actions,

original: viparyetītyevamevaitadyājñavalkya / / /
analyzed: viparyeti iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: and returns. Thus indeed, Yajnavalkya, it is.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasyastamite kiṃjyotirevāyam puruṣa
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣa
translated: When the sun has set, Yājñavalkya, and the moon has set, and the fire has gone out, on what does this person here rest when he dreams?

original: ityagnijyotiḥ samrāḍiti hovācāgninaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute
analyzed: iti agni jyotiḥ samrāj iti ha uvāca agninā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute
translated: On the light of the self, O King, he said. On the light of the self, indeed, he rests when he dreams, moves about, does his work, and returns.

original: viparyetītyevamevaitadyājñavalkya / / /
analyzed: viparyeti iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: Even so, Yājñavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasyastamite śānte'gnau kiṃjyotirevāyam puruṣa🔽iti vāgjyotiḥ samrāḍiti hovāca vācaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste palyayate karma kurute
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite śānta ignau kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣa  iti vāc jyotiḥ samrāj iti ha uvāca vācā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste palyayate karma kurute
translated: When the sun has set, Yājñavalkya, and the moon has set, and the fire has gone out, and speech has ceased, on what light does this person here rest when he is in deep sleep?

original: viparyetīti tasmādvai samrāḍapi yatra svaḥ pāṇirna vinirjñāyate'tha yatra🔽vāguccaratyupaiva tatra ṇyetītyevamevaitadyājñavalkya / / /
analyzed: viparyeti iti tasmāt vai samrāj api yatra svaḥ pāṇiḥ na vinirjñāyate itha yatra  vāc uccarati upa eva tatra ṇyeti iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya
translated: On the light of speech, O King, he said. On the light of speech, indeed, he rests when he is in deep sleep, moves about, does his work, and returns. Therefore, O King, even where one's own hand is not distinguished, where speech is uttered, there one approaches. Even so, Yājñavalkya.

original: astamita āditye yājñavalkya candramasyastamite śānte'gnau śāntāyāṃ vāci🔽kiṃjyotirevāyam puruṣa ityātmajyotiḥ samrāḍiti hovācātmanaivāyaṃ jyotiṣāste
analyzed: astamite āditye yājñavalkya candramasi astamite śānta ignau śāntāyām vāci  kiṃjyotiḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti ātma jyotiḥ samrāj iti ha uvāca ātmanā eva ayam jyotiṣā āste
translated: When the sun has set, Yājñavalkya, and the moon has set, and the fire has gone out, and speech has ceased,

original: palyayate karma kurute viparyetīti / / /
analyzed: palyayate karma kurute viparyeti iti
translated: on what light does this person here rest when he is in deep sleep? On the light of the self, O King, he said. On the light of the self, indeed, he rests when he is in deep sleep, moves about, does his work, and returns.🔽Even so, Yājñavalkya.

original: katama ātmeti yo'yaṃ vijñānamayaḥ puruṣaḥ prāṇeṣu hṛdyantarjyotiḥ sa samānaḥ🔽sannubhau lokau saṃcarati dhyāyatīva lelāyatīva sadhīḥ svapno bhūtvemaṃ
analyzed: katamaḥ ātmā iti yaḥ ayam vijñāna mayaḥ puruṣaḥ prāṇeṣu hṛdi antar jyotiḥ sa samānaḥ  san ubhau lokau saṃcarati dhyāyati iva lelāyati iva sa dhīḥ svapnaḥ bhūtvā imam
translated: What is the Self? He who is this person consisting of consciousness, who is in the breaths, in the heart, within the light, is the same as that.

original: lokamatikrāmati / / /
analyzed: lokam atikrāmati
translated: Having become such, he moves between the two worlds, as if thinking, as if wavering, as if with mind, having become dream, he passes beyond this world.

original: sa vā ayam puruṣo jāyamānaḥ śarīramabhisampadyamānaḥ pāpmabhiḥ saṃsṛjyate sa
analyzed: sa vai ayam puruṣaḥ jāyamānaḥ śarīram abhisampadyamānaḥ pāpmabhiḥ saṃsṛjyate sa
translated: He, this person, being born, being united with the body, is united with evils.

original: utkrāmanmriyamāṇaḥ pāpmano vijahāti mṛtyo rūpāṇi / / /
analyzed: utkrāman mriyamāṇaḥ pāpmanaḥ vijahāti mṛtyoḥ rūpāṇi
translated: Departing, dying, he leaves the evils, the forms of death.

original: tasya vā etasya puruṣasya dve eva sthāne bhavata idaṃ ca paralokasthānaṃ ca🔽saṃdhyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ svapnasthānaṃ tasmintsaṃdhye sthāne tiṣṭhannubhe sthāne
analyzed: tasya vai etasya puruṣasya dve eva sthāne bhavataḥ idam ca para loka sthānam ca  saṃdhyam tṛtīyam svapna sthānam tasmin saṃdhye sthāne tiṣṭhan ubhe sthāne
translated: Of him, of this person, there are indeed two abodes, this one and the abode of the other world,

original: paśyatīdaṃ ca paralokasthānaṃ ca / / /🔽atha yathākramo'yam paralokasthāne bhavati tamākramamākramyobhayānpāpmana
analyzed: paśyati idam ca para loka sthānam ca  atha yathā ākramaḥ ūyam para loka sthāne bhavati tam ākramam ākramya ubhayān pāpmanaḥ
translated: and the third, the abode of sleep, is between the two. Standing in that intermediate abode, he sees both abodes, this one and the abode of the other world.🔽 Then, as the steps of the other world are arranged, having mounted those steps, he sees both evils and pleasures. Where he sleeps, having taken the measure of this whole world,

original: ānandāṃśca paśyati sa yatrāyam prasvapityasya lokasya sarvāvato mātrāmapādāya
analyzed: ānandān ca paśyati sa yatra ayam prasvapiti asya lokasya sarvāvataḥ mātrām apādāya
translated: he goes to that place of Brahman, which is the abode of the other world, which is full of light, which is truth.

original: svayaṃ vihatya svayaṃ nirmāya svena bhāsā svena jyotiṣā prasvapityatrāyam puruṣaḥ
analyzed: svayam vihatya svayam nirmāya svena bhāsā svena jyotiṣā prasvapiti atra ayam puruṣaḥ
translated: This person, having himself destroyed and himself created, sleeps with his own light, with his own radiance, here.

original: svayaṃjyotirbhavati / / /
analyzed: svayam jyotiḥ bhavati
translated: He becomes self-luminous.

original: na tatra rathā na rathayogā na panthāno bhavanti atha rathānrathayogānpathaḥ🔽sṛjate na tatrānandā mudaḥ pramudo bhavantyathānandānmudaḥ pramudaḥ sṛjate na
analyzed: na tatra rathāḥ na ratha yogāḥ na panthānaḥ bhavanti atha rathān ratha yogān pathaḥ  sṛjate na tatra ānandāḥ mudaḥ pramudaḥ bhavanti atha ānandān mudaḥ pramudaḥ sṛjate na
translated: There are no chariots, no yokings of chariots, no paths there. Then he creates chariots, yokings of chariots, and paths.🔽There are no joys, delights, or great delights there. Then he creates joys, delights, and great delights.

original: tatra veśāntāḥ sravantyaḥ puṣkariṇyo bhavantyatha veśāntāḥ sravantīḥ puṣkariṇīḥ
analyzed: tatra veśāntāḥ sravantyaḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ bhavanti atha veśāntāḥ sravantīḥ puṣkariṇīḥ
translated: There are no flowing streams or ponds there. Then he creates flowing streams and ponds.

original: sṛjate sa hi kartā / / /
analyzed: sṛjate sa hi kartā
translated: For he is the creator.

original: tadapyete ślokāḥ svapnena śārīramabhiprahatyāsuptaḥ suptānabhicākaśīti
analyzed: tat api ete ślokāḥ svapnena śārīram abhiprahatya a suptaḥ suptān abhicākaśīti
translated: There are also these verses: Having struck the embodied being with sleep, the one who is not asleep observes the sleepers.

original: śukramādāya punaraiti sthānaṃ hiraṇmayaḥ pauruṣa ekahaṃsaḥ / / /
analyzed: śukram ādāya punar aiti sthānam hiraṇmayaḥ pauruṣaḥ eka haṃsaḥ
translated: Taking the semen, the golden man, the one-man-swan returns to his abode.

original: prāṇena rakṣannaparaṃ kulāyam bahiṣkulāyādamṛtaścaritvā sa īyate amṛto
analyzed: prāṇena rakṣan aparam kulāyam bahis kulāyāt amṛtaḥ caritvā saḥ īyate amṛtaḥ
translated: Protecting the other nest with his breath, having moved about as an immortal outside the nest, he goes, immortal,

original: yatrakāmaṃ hiraṇmayaḥ pauruṣa ekahaṃsaḥ / / /
analyzed: yatrakāmam hiraṇmayaḥ pauruṣaḥ eka haṃsaḥ
translated: to wherever he desires, the golden man, the one-man-swan.

original: svapnānta uccāvacamīyamāno rūpāṇi devaḥ kurute bahūniuteva strībhiḥ saha
analyzed: svapna ante uccāvacam īyamānaḥ rūpāṇi devaḥ kurute bahūni uta iva strībhiḥ saha
translated: The god, moving up and down in the end of sleep, creates many forms, as if with women.

original: modamāno jakṣadutevāpi bhayāni paśyan / / /
analyzed: modamānaḥ jakṣat uta iva api bhayāni paśyan
translated: Rejoicing, as it were, eating, beholding terrors,🔽. . . .

original: ārāmamasya paśyanti na taṃ kaścana paśyatīti taṃ nāyatam
analyzed: ārāmam asya paśyanti na tam kaścana paśyati iti tam na āyatam
translated: They see his pasture, but no one sees him. . . .

original: bodhayedityāhurdurbhiṣajyaṃ hāsmai bhavati yameṣa na pratipadyate / / /🔽atho khalvāhuḥ jāgaritadeśa evāsyaiṣa yāni hyeva jāgratpaśyati tāni supta ityatrāyam
analyzed: bodhayet iti āhuḥ durbhiṣajyam ha asmai bhavati yam eṣa na pratipadyate  atha u khalu āhuḥ jāgarita deśaḥ eva asya eṣa yāni hi eva jāgrat paśyati tāni suptaḥ iti atra ayam
translated: . . . . They say of him, 'He is hard to cure whom this (soul) does not enter.'

original: puruṣaḥ svayaṃjyotirbhavatītyevamevaitadyājñavalkya so'ham bhagavate sahasraṃ
analyzed: puruṣaḥ svayam jyotiḥ bhavati iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya saḥ ūham bhagavate sahasram
translated: Now, on the other hand, they say, 'This (soul) is in the region of the waking state, for what one sees when awake that one sees when asleep.' Here this person is self-luminous. Even so, Yajnavalkya. I give to the revered one a thousand cows.

original: dadāmyata ūrdhvaṃ vimokṣāyaiva brūhīti / / /
analyzed: dadāmi atas ūrdhvam vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: Speak on for the sake of final release.'

original: sa vā eṣa etasmintsvapnānte ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ🔽pratinyāyam pratiyonyādravati buddhāntāyaiva sa yadatra
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin svapna ante ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar  pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati buddha antāya eva sa yat atra
translated: He, verily, having sported and travelled about in this dream-state and seen good and evil,

original: kiṃcitpaśyatyananvāgatastena bhavatyasaṅgo hyayam puruṣa
analyzed: kiṃcid paśyati an anvāgataḥ tena bhavati a saṅgaḥ hi ayam puruṣa
translated: again hastens back by the same way to the place from which he had come, to the waking state. Whatever he sees there, he is not affected by it, for this person is unattached.

original: ityevamevaitadyājñavalkya so'ham bhagavate sahasraṃ dadāmyata ūrdhvaṃ
analyzed: iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi atas ūrdhvam
translated: Even so, Yajnavalkya. I give to the revered one a thousand cows.

original: vimokṣāyaiva brūhīti / / /
analyzed: vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: Speak on for the sake of final release.'🔽. . . .

original: tadyathā mahāmatsyaḥ ubhe kūle anusaṃcarati pūrvaṃ cāparaṃ caivamevāyam
analyzed: tat yathā mahā matsyaḥ ubhe kūle anusaṃcarati pūrvam ca aparam ca evam eva ayam
translated: Just as a large fish moves from one shore to the other, so does this [person].

original: puruṣa etā ubhāvantāvanusaṃcarati svapnāntaṃ ca buddhāntaṃ ca / / /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ etau ubhau antau anusaṃcarati svapna antam ca buddha antam ca
translated: Just as a great fish, moving along both banks, the eastern and the western, so does this person move along both ends, the end of sleep and the end of waking.

original: tadyathāsminnākāśe śyeno vā suparṇo vā viparipatya śrāntaḥ saṃhatya pakṣau🔽sallayāyaiva dhriyata evamevāyam puruṣa etasmā antāya dhāvati yatra supto na kaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā asmin ākāśe śyenaḥ vā suparṇaḥ vā viparipatya śrāntaḥ saṃhatya pakṣau  sat layāya eva dhriyate evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ etasmai antāya dhāvati yatra suptaḥ na kam
translated: Just as a hawk or an eagle, flying in the sky, wearied, folding its wings,

original: cana kāmaṃ kāmayate na kaṃ cana svapnam paśyati / / /🔽tā vā asyaitā hitā nāma nāḍyo yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnastāvatāṇimnā tiṣṭhanti
analyzed: cana kāmam kāmayate na kam cana svapnam paśyati  tāḥ vai asya etāḥ hitāḥ nāma nāḍyaḥ yathā keśaḥ sahasradhā bhinnaḥ tāvatā aṇimnā tiṣṭhanti
translated: rests on its breast, even so this person runs to that end, where, asleep, he desires no desire, sees no dream.🔽Now, these are his so-called vital channels, named Hridaya, Visva, and Prajna, which are as fine as the filament of a lotus-root, and extend as far as the navel.

original: śuklasya nīlasya piṅgalasya haritasya lohitasya pūrṇā atha yatrainaṃ ghnantīva
analyzed: śuklasya nīlasya piṅgalasya haritasya lohitasya pūrṇāḥ atha yatra enam ghnanti iva
translated: They are filled with white, blue, yellow, green, and red. Then, where they strike him as if killing,

original: jinantīva hastīva vicāyayati gartamiva patati yadeva jāgradbhayam paśyati
analyzed: jinanti iva hastī iva vicāyayati gartam iva patati yat eva jāgrat bhayam paśyati
translated: as if conquering, as if an elephant were dragging him, as if falling into a pit, whatever fear he sees while awake,

original: tadatrāvidyayā bhayam manyate'tha yatra rājeva devaivāhamevedaṃ sarvamasmīti
analyzed: tat atra avidyayā bhayam yatra rājā iva deva eva aham eva idam sarvam asmi iti
translated: he thinks that fear to be due to ignorance here. Then, where he is like a king, like a god, thinking 'I alone am all this',

original: manyate so'sya paramo loko'tha yatra supto na kaṃ cana kāmaṃ kāmayate na kaṃ🔽cana svapnam paśyati / / /
analyzed: manyate saḥ usya paramaḥ lokaḥ utha yatra suptaḥ na kam cana kāmam kāmayate na kam  cana svapnam paśyati
translated: He thinks, 'This is my highest world.' Then, when he is asleep, he desires no desire, he sees no dream.

original: tadvā asyaitat ātmakāmamāptakāmamakāmaṃ rūpaṃ tadyathā priyayā striyā🔽sampariṣvakto na bāhyaṃ kiṃ cana veda nāntaramevamevāyaṃ śārīra ātmā
analyzed: tat vai asya etat ātma kāmam āpta kāmam akāmam rūpam tat yathā priyayā striyā  sampariṣvaktaḥ na bāhyam kim cana veda na antaram evam eva ayam śārīraḥ ātmā
translated: That is his form as the Self, which has attained its desire, which is desireless, just as a man embraced by his beloved wife knows nothing outside or inside.

original: prājñenātmanā sampariṣvakto na bāhyaṃ kiṃ cana veda nāntaram / / /
analyzed: prājñena ātmanā sampariṣvaktaḥ na bāhyam kim cana veda na antaram
translated: Even so, this embodied Self, embraced by the wise Self, knows nothing outside or inside.

original: tadvā asyaitat aticando'pahatapāpmābhayaṃ rūpamaśokāntaramatra pitāpitā bhavati
analyzed: tat vai asya etat aticanda upahata pāpma abhayam rūpam aśoka antaram atra pitā a pitā bhavati
translated: That is his form, beyond the metres, free from sin, fearless, free from sorrow, where the father is not the father,

original: mātāmātā lokā alokā devā adevā vedā avedā yajñā ayajñā atra steno'steno bhavati🔽bhrūṇahābhrūṇahā paulkaso'paulkasaścāṇḍālo cāṇḍālaḥ śramaṇo'śramaṇastāpaso
analyzed: mātā a mātā lokāḥ a lokāḥ devāḥ a devāḥ vedāḥ a vedāḥ yajñāḥ a yajñāḥ atra stenoḥ stenaḥ bhavati  bhrūṇa hā abhrūṇa hā cāṇḍālaḥ śramaṇaḥ śramaṇaḥ tāpasaḥ
translated: the mother is not the mother, the worlds are not the worlds, the gods are not the gods, the Vedas are not the Vedas, the sacrifices are not the sacrifices, where the thief is not the thief,

original: tāpaso'nanvāgataḥ puṇyenānvāgataḥ pāpena tīrṇo hi tadā sarvāñcokānhṛdayasya🔽bhavati / / /
analyzed: tāpasān anvāgataḥ puṇyena anvāgataḥ pāpena tīrṇaḥ hi tadā sarvān cokān hṛdayasya  bhavati
translated: the murderer of a foetus is not the murderer of a foetus, the outcast is not the outcast, the ascetic is not the ascetic, the anchorite is not the anchorite, he is not followed by merit, he is not followed by sin, for then he has crossed over all sorrows of the heart.🔽That which he does not see when he sees, indeed, that is to be seen; but he does not see it, for

original: yadvai tanna paśyati paśyanvai taddraṣṭavyaṃ na paśyati na hi
analyzed: yat vai tat na paśyati paśyan vai tat draṣṭavyam na paśyati na hi
translated: the seer is not the seen.

original: draṣṭurdṛṣṭerviparilopo vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ
analyzed: draṣṭuḥ dṛṣṭeḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam
translated: There is no destruction of the seer's seeing, because of its imperishability. But there is no second thing separate from that

original: yatpaśyet / / /🔽yadvai tanna jighrati jighranvai tadghrātavyaṃ na jighrati na hi
analyzed: yat paśyet  yat vai tat na jighrati jighran vai tat ghrātavyam na jighrati na hi
translated: which he could see.🔽That which he does not smell, indeed, smelling that, he does not smell the smell. For there is no destruction of the smeller's smelling,

original: ghrāturghrāṇādviparilopo vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ
analyzed: ghrātuḥ ghrāṇāt viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam
translated: because of its imperishability. But there is no second thing separate from that

original: yajjighret / / /
analyzed: yat jighret
translated: which he could smell.

original: yadvai tanna rasayati vijānanvai tadrasaṃ na rasayati na hi rasayitū rasādviparilopo
analyzed: yat vai tat na rasayati vijānan vai tat rasam na rasayati na hi rasayituḥ rasāt viparilopaḥ
translated: That which he does not taste, indeed, knowing that, he does not taste the taste. For there is no destruction of the taster's tasting,

original: vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ yadrasayet / / /
analyzed: vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam yat rasayet
translated: because of its imperishability. But there is no second thing separate from that🔽which he could taste.

original: yadvai tanna vadati vadanvai tadvaktavyaṃ na vadati na hi vakturvaco viparilopo
analyzed: yat vai tat na vadati vadan vai tat vaktavyam na vadati na hi vaktuḥ vacaḥ viparilopaḥ
translated: That which he does not speak, indeed, speaking that, he does not speak the speakable. For there is no destruction of the speaker's speaking,

original: vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ yadvadet / / /
analyzed: vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam yat vadet
translated: because of its imperishability. But there is no second thing separate from that🔽which he could speak.

original: yadvai tanna śṛṇoti śṛṇvanvai tacrotavyaṃ na śṛṇoti na hi śrotuḥ śruterviparilopo
analyzed: yat vai tat na śṛṇoti śṛṇvan vai tat crotavyam na śṛṇoti na hi śrotuḥ śruteḥ viparilopaḥ
translated: That which he does not hear, indeed, hearing that, he does not hear the hearable. For there is no destruction of the hearer's hearing,

original: vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ yacṛṇuyāt / / /
analyzed: vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam yat cṛṇuyāt
translated: It exists, because of its imperishability. But there is no second apart from that, separate, which it could touch.

original: yadvai tanna manute manvāno vai tanmantavyaṃ na manute na hi
analyzed: yat vai tat na manute manvānaḥ vai tat mantavyam na manute na hi
translated: What indeed it does not think, thinking, indeed, that should be thought. It does not think. For

original: manturmaterviparilopo vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamastitato'nyadvibhaktaṃ
analyzed: mantuḥ mateḥ viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam
translated: there is no cessation of the thinking of the thinker, because of its imperishability. But there is no second apart from that, separate,

original: yanmanvīta / / /
analyzed: yat manvīta
translated: which it could think.

original: yadvai tanna spṛśati spṛśanvai tatspraṣṭavyaṃ na spṛśati na hi spraṣṭu
analyzed: yat vai tat na spṛśati spṛśan vai tat spraṣṭavyam na spṛśati na hi spraṣṭu
translated: What indeed it does not touch, touching, indeed, that should be touched. It does not touch. For🔽there is no cessation of the touching of the toucher, because of its imperishability. But there is no second apart from that, separate,

original: spṛṣṭerviparilopo'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ yatspṛśet / / /
analyzed: spṛṣṭeḥ viparilopaḥ vināśi tvāt na tu tad dvitīyam asti tatonyat vibhaktam yat spṛśet
translated: which it could touch.

original: yadvai tanna vijānāti vijānanvai tadvijñeyaṃ na vijānāti na hi
analyzed: yat vai tat na vijānāti vijānan vai tat vijñeyam na vijānāti na hi
translated: What indeed it does not know, knowing, indeed, that should be known. It does not know. For

original: vijñāturvijñānādviparilopo vidyate'vināśitvānna tu taddvitīyamasti
analyzed: vijñātuḥ vijñānāt viparilopaḥ vidyate vināśi tvāt na tu tat dvitīyam asti
translated: there is no cessation of the knowing of the knower, because of its imperishability. But there is no second apart from that,

original: tato'nyadvibhaktaṃ yadvijānīyāt / / /
analyzed: tatonyat vibhaktam yat vijānīyāt
translated: separate, which it could know.

original: salila eko draṣṭādvaito bhavati eṣa brahmalokaḥ samrāḍiti hainamuvācaiṣāsya
analyzed: salilaḥ ekaḥ draṣṭā advaitaḥ bhavati eṣa brahma lokaḥ samrāj iti ha enam uvāca eṣā asya
translated: He becomes one who sees water, free from duality. This is the world of Brahman, the emperor. Thus he said to him. This is his🔽highest world. This is his highest bliss. The other beings are

original: paramo loka eṣo'sya parama ānanda etasyaivānandasyānyāni bhūtāni
analyzed: paramaḥ lokaḥ eṣaḥ usya paramaḥ ānandaḥ etasya eva ānandasya anyāni bhūtāni
translated: in this bliss alone.

original: mātrāmupajīvanti / / /
analyzed: mātrām upajīvanti
translated: They live on their mothers.

original: sa yo manuṣyāṇāṃ ruddhaḥ samṛddho bhavati anyeṣāmadhipatiḥ
analyzed: sa yaḥ manuṣyāṇām ruddhaḥ samṛddhaḥ bhavati anyeṣām adhipatiḥ
translated: He who among men is shut in, prosperous, a lord over others,

original: sarvairmānuṣyakaiḥ kāmaiḥ sampannatamaḥ sa manuṣyāṇām parama ānandaḥ / / /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ mānuṣyakaiḥ kāmaiḥ sampannatamaḥ sa manuṣyāṇām paramaḥ ānandaḥ
translated: most fully endowed with all human pleasures, he is the highest bliss of men.

original: atha ye śatam manuṣyāṇāmānandāḥ sa ekaḥ pitṝṇāṃ jitalokānāmānandaḥ / / /
analyzed: atha ye śatam manuṣyāṇām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ pitṝṇām jita lokānām ānandaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of men is the bliss of the Pitrs who have conquered the worlds.

original: atha ye śatam pitṝṇāṃ jitalokānāmānandāḥ sa ekaḥ karmadevānāmānando ye🔽karmaṇā
analyzed: atha ye śatam pitṝṇām jita lokānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ karma devānām ānandaḥ ye  karmaṇā
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of the Pitrs who have conquered the worlds is the bliss of the Karma-gods, those who

original: devatvamabhisampadyante / / /
analyzed: deva tvam abhisampadyante
translated: attain godhood by their deeds.

original: atha ye śataṃ karmadevānāmānandāḥ sa eka ājānadevānāmānando yaśca
analyzed: atha ye śatam karma devānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ ājāna devānām ānandaḥ yaḥ ca
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of the Karma-gods is the bliss of the Ajāta-gods, and of the one who

original: śrotriyo'vṛjino'kāmahataḥ / / /
analyzed: śrotriyaḥ u vṛjinaḥ kāma hataḥ
translated: is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

original: atha ye śatamājānadevānāmānandāḥ sa eko devaloka ānando yaśca
analyzed: atha ye śatam ājāna devānām ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ deva loke ānandaḥ yaḥ ca
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of the Ajāta-gods is the bliss of the world of the gods, and of the one who

original: śrotriyo'vṛjino'kāmahataḥ / / /
analyzed: śrotriyaḥ u vṛjinaḥ kāma hataḥ
translated: is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

original: atha ye śataṃ devaloka ānandāḥ sa eko gandharvaloka ānando yaśca
analyzed: atha ye śatam deva loke ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ gandharva loke ānandaḥ yaḥ ca
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of the world of the gods is the bliss of the world of the Gandharvas, and of the one who

original: śrotriyo'vṛjino'kāmahataḥ / / /
analyzed: śrotriyaḥ u vṛjinaḥ kāma hataḥ
translated: is a learned Brahmin, free from bonds, and free from desire.

original: atha ye śataṃ gandharvaloka ānandāḥ sa ekaḥ prajāpatiloka ānandāḥ sa eko
analyzed: atha ye śatam gandharva loke ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ prajāpati loke ānandāḥ saḥ ekaḥ
translated: Now, a hundred times the bliss of the world of the Gandharvas is the bliss of the world of Prajāpati, and of the one who

original: brahmaloka ānando yaśca śrotriyo'vṛjino'kāmahata eṣa brahmalokaḥ samrāḍiti
analyzed: brahma loke ānandaḥ yaḥ ca eṣa brahma lokaḥ samrāj iti
translated: The world of Brahman is the world of the Vedic scholar who is free from sin and untouched by desire. This is the world of Brahman, the emperor.

original: hainamanuśaśāsaitadamṛtaṃ so'ham bhagavate sahasraṃ dadāmyata ūrdhvaṃ
analyzed: ha enam anuśaśāsa etat amṛtam saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi atas ūrdhvam
translated: He instructed him thus: This is immortality. I give the Blessed One a thousand cows. Beyond this,

original: vimokṣāyaiva brūhīti / / /
analyzed: vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: please teach for the sake of liberation.

original: sa vā eṣa etasmintsamprasāde ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvaiva puṇyaṃ ca pāpaṃ ca punaḥ🔽pratinyāyam pratiyonyādravati buddhāntāyaiva sa yadatra
analyzed: sa vai eṣaḥ etasmin samprasāde ratvā caritvā dṛṣṭvā eva puṇyam ca pāpam ca punar  pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati buddha antāya eva sa yat atra
translated: Having dwelt in this bliss, having moved about and seen both good and evil, he

original: kiṃcitpaśyatyananvāgatastena bhavatyasaṅgo hyayam puruṣa
analyzed: kiṃcid paśyati an anvāgataḥ tena bhavati a saṅgaḥ hi ayam puruṣa
translated: returns by the same path, by the same way, to the end of cognition, for the sake of liberation. Whatever he sees here, he is not affected by it. For this person is unattached,

original: ityevamevaitadyājñavalkya so'ham bhagavate sahasraṃ dadāmyata ūrdhvaṃ
analyzed: iti evam eva etat yājñavalkya saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi atas ūrdhvam
translated: indeed, Yajnavalkya, I give the Blessed One a thousand cows. Beyond this,

original: vimokṣāyaiva brūhīti / / /
analyzed: vimokṣāya eva brūhi iti
translated: please teach for the sake of liberation.

original: atra ha yājñavalkyo bibhayāṃ cakāra medhāvī rājā sarvebhyo māntebhya🔽udarautsīditi sa yatrāṇimānaṃ nyeti jarayā vopatapatā vāṇimānaṃ nigacati yathāmraṃ
analyzed: atra ha yājñavalkyaḥ bibhayām cakāra medhāvī rājā sarvebhyaḥ mā antebhyaḥ  udarautsīt iti sa yatra aṇimānam nyeti jarayā vā upatapatā vā aṇimānam nigacati yathā āmram
translated: Here Yajnavalkya became afraid. The king is wise and has mastered all the Vedas.🔽He will surpass me. Where it goes to invisibility, whether through old age or through being consumed, like a mango

original: vodumbaraṃ vā pippalaṃ vā bandhanātpramucyetaivamevāyaṃ śārīra
analyzed: vā udumbaram vā pippalam vā bandhanāt pramucyeta evam eva ayam śārīra
translated: or an udumbara fruit or a pippala fruit is freed from its bonds, in the same way this embodied soul

original: ātmaibhyo'ṅgebhyaḥ sampramucya punaḥ pratinyāyam pratiyonyādravati prāṇāyaiva / / /🔽tadyathānaḥ susamāhitam utsarjadyāyādevamevāyaṃ śārīra ātmā
analyzed: ātmā ebhyaḥ oṅgebhyaḥ sampramucya punar pratinyāyam pratiyoni ādravati prāṇāya eva  tat yathā anaḥ su samāhitam utsarjat yāyāt evam eva ayam śārīraḥ ātmā
translated: Having become separated from these limbs, he runs back again by the same way he came, to the very source of the life-breath.🔽Just as a man, having well-directed his steps, goes on his way, so does this embodied Self,

original: prājñenātmanānvārūḍha utsarjadyāti / / /
analyzed: prājñena ātmanā anvārūḍhaḥ utsarjat yāti
translated: mounted on the wise Self, go on his way, having become separated.

original: tadyathā rājānamāyantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūtagrāmaṇyo'nnaiḥ pānairāvasathaiḥ
analyzed: tat yathā rājānam āyantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūta grāmaṇyaḥ onnaiḥ pānaiḥ āvasathaiḥ
translated: Just as when a king is coming, the fierce enemies, the charioteers and village chiefs, prepare for him food, drink, and lodging,

original: pratikalpante'yamāyātyayamāgacatītyevaṃ haivaṃvidaṃ sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratikalpanta
analyzed: pratikalpante iyam āyāti ayam āgacati iti evam ha evaṃvidam sarvāṇi bhūtāni pratikalpanta
translated: saying, Here he comes, here he comes, so do all beings prepare for one who knows thus,

original: idam brahmāyātīdamāgacatīti / / /
analyzed: idam brahma āyāti idam āgacati iti
translated: saying, Here comes Brahman, here he comes.

original: tadyathā rājānam prayiyāsantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūtagrāmaṇya upasamāyantyevaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā rājānam prayiyāsantam ugrāḥ pratyenasaḥ sūta grāmaṇyaḥ upasamāyanti evam
translated: Just as when a king is departing, the fierce enemies, the charioteers and village chiefs, assemble around him,

original: haivaṃvidaṃ sarve prāṇā upasamāyanti yatraitadūrdhvocvāsī bhavati / / /
analyzed: ha evaṃvidam sarve prāṇāḥ upasamāyanti yatra etat ūrdhvocvāsī bhavati
translated: so do all the vital breaths assemble around one who knows thus, where he dwells above and below.

original: sa yatrāyaṃ śārīra ātmābalyaṃ nītya sammohamiva nyetyathainamete prāṇā
analyzed: sa yatra ayam śārīraḥ ātmā abalyam nītya sammoham iva nyeti atha enam ete prāṇā
translated: When this embodied Self, having become weak, falls into a swoon as it were, then these vital breaths

original: abhisamāyanti sa etāstejomātrāḥ samabhyādadāno hṛdayamevānvavakrāmati / / /
analyzed: abhisamāyanti saḥ etāḥ tejaḥ mātrāḥ samabhyādadānaḥ hṛdayam eva anvavakrāmati
translated: assemble around him, taking with them these measures of light, and enter into the heart.

original: sa yatraiṣa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣaḥ parāṅ paryāvartate'thārūpajo bhavatyekībhavati na🔽paśyatītyāhurekībhavati na rasayatītyāhurekībhavati na vadatītyāhurekībhavati na🔽śṛṇotītyāhurekībhavati na manuta ityāhurekībhavati na spṛśatītyāhurekībhavati na
analyzed: sa yatra eṣa cākṣuṣaḥ puruṣaḥ parāṅ paryāvartata ithārūpa jaḥ bhavati ekībhavati na  paśyati iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na rasayati iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na vadati iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na  śṛṇoti iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na manute iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na spṛśati iti āhuḥ ekībhavati na
translated: When this man in the eye turns away, then he becomes formless, becomes one,

original: vijānātītyāhuḥ / / /
analyzed: vijānāti iti āhuḥ
translated: they say. He becomes one and does not see, they say. He becomes one and does not taste, they say. He becomes one and does not speak, they say. He becomes one and does not hear, they say. He becomes one and does not think, they say. He becomes one and does not touch, they say. He becomes one and does not know, they say.

original: tasya haitasya hṛdayasyāgram pradyotate tena pradyotenaiṣa ātmā niṣkrāmati
analyzed: tasya ha etasya hṛdayasya agram pradyotate tena pradyotena eṣaḥ ātmā niṣkrāmati
translated: The tip of this heart shines. By that light this Self goes out,

original: cakṣuṣṭo vā mūrdhno vānyebhyo vā śarīradeśebhyastamutkrāmantam
analyzed: cakṣuṣṭas vā mūrdhnaḥ vā anyebhyaḥ vā śarīra deśebhyaḥ tam utkrāmantam
translated: either through the eye, or through the head, or through other parts of the body. When it goes out,

original: prāṇo'nūtkrāmati prāṇamanūtkrāmantaṃ sarve prāṇā anūtkrāmanti
analyzed: prāṇaḥ unūtkrāmati prāṇam anūtkrāmantam sarve prāṇāḥ anūtkrāmanti
translated: the vital breath follows it out. When the vital breath follows it out, all the vital breaths follow it out.

original: saṃjñānamevānvavakrāmati sa eṣa jñaḥ savijñāno bhavati taṃ vidyākarmaṇī
analyzed: saṃjñānam eva anvavakrāmati saḥ eṣa jñaḥ sa vijñānaḥ bhavati tam vidyā karmaṇī
translated: Consciousness alone follows it. He becomes one who knows, one who has knowledge. Knowledge and action

original: samanvārabhete pūrvaprajñā ca / / /
analyzed: samanvārabhete pūrva prajñā ca
translated: take hold of him, and also the wisdom of the past.

original: tadyathā tṛṇajalāyukā tṛṇasyāntaṃ gatvātmānamupasaṃharatyevamevāyam puruṣa
analyzed: tat yathā tṛṇajalāyukā tṛṇasya antam gatvā ātmānam upasaṃharati evam eva ayam puruṣa
translated: Just as a water-born creature, having reached the end of the grass, withdraws itself, so this person,

original: idaṃ śarīraṃ nihatyāvidyāṃ gamayitvātmānamupasaṃharati / / /
analyzed: idam śarīram nihatya avidyām gamayitvā ātmānam upasaṃharati
translated: having destroyed this body and cast off ignorance, withdraws itself.

original: tadyathā peśaskārī peśaso mātrāmapādāyānyannavataraṃ kalyāṇataraṃ rūpaṃ tanuta
analyzed: tat yathā peśaskārī peśasaḥ mātrām apādāya anyat navataram kalyāṇataram rūpam tanuta
translated: Just as a weaver, having taken up a thread, weaves another thread, a newer and better form,

original: evamevāyam puruṣa idaṃ śarīraṃ nihatyāvidyāṃ gamayitvānyannavataraṃ rūpaṃ
analyzed: evam eva ayam puruṣaḥ idam śarīram nihatya avidyām gamayitvā anyat navataram rūpam
translated: in the same way, this person, having destroyed this body and having gone beyond ignorance, weaves another newer form,

original: tanute pitryaṃ vā gandharvaṃ vā brāhmaṃ vā prājāpatyaṃ vā daivaṃ vā mānuṣaṃ
analyzed: tanute pitryam vā gandharvam vā brāhmam vā prājāpatyam vā daivam vā mānuṣam
translated: whether it be of the father, or of the Gandharva, or of Brahman, or of Prajapati, or of the gods,

original: vānyebhyo vā bhūtebhyaḥ / / /
analyzed: vā anyebhyaḥ vā bhūtebhyaḥ
translated: or of men, or of other beings.

original: sa vā ayamātmā brahma vijñānamayo manomayo vāṅmayaḥ
analyzed: sa vai ayam ātmā brahma vijñāna mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ vāc mayaḥ
translated: This Self is Brahman, consisting of knowledge, consisting of mind, consisting of speech,

original: prāṇamayaścakṣurmayaḥ śrotramaya ākāśamayo vāyumayastejomaya āpomayaḥ
analyzed: prāṇa mayaḥ cakṣuḥ mayaḥ śrotra mayaḥ ākāśa mayaḥ vāyu mayaḥ tejaḥ mayaḥ āpaḥ mayaḥ
translated: consisting of breath, consisting of eye, consisting of ear, consisting of space, consisting of air, consisting of fire, consisting of water,

original: pṛthivīmayaḥ krodhamayo'krodhamayo harṣamayo'harṣamayo
analyzed: pṛthivī mayaḥ krodha mayaḥ krodha mayaḥ harṣa mayaḥ harṣa mayaḥ
translated: consisting of earth, consisting of anger, consisting of non-anger, consisting of joy, consisting of non-joy,

original: dharmamayo'dharmamayaḥ sarvamayastadyadedammayo'domaya iti yathākārī
analyzed: dharma mayaḥ dharma mayaḥ sarva mayaḥ tat yadā idam mayaḥ udaḥ mayaḥ iti yathākārī
translated: consisting of dharma, consisting of adharma, consisting of all. As one acts,

original: yathācārī tathā bhavati sādhukārī sādhurbhavati pāpakārī pāpo bhavati puṇyaḥ
analyzed: yathā ācārī tathā bhavati sādhu kārī sādhuḥ bhavati pāpa kārī pāpaḥ bhavati puṇyaḥ
translated: as one conducts oneself, so does one become. One who acts well becomes good. One who acts badly becomes bad.

original: puṇyena karmaṇā bhavati pāpaḥ pāpeneti / / /
analyzed: puṇyena karmaṇā bhavati pāpaḥ pāpena iti
translated: One becomes good through good deeds, and bad through bad deeds.🔽Now, they also say that this person consists of desire. As one desires,

original: atho khalvāhuḥ kāmamaya evāyam puruṣa iti sa yathākāmo bhavati
analyzed: atha u khalu āhuḥ kāma mayaḥ eva ayam puruṣaḥ iti sa yathākāmaḥ bhavati
translated: so one becomes.

original: tathākraturbhavati yathākraturbhavati tatkarma kurute yatkarma kurute🔽tadabhisampadyata iti / / /
analyzed: tathākratuḥ bhavati yathākratuḥ bhavati tat karma kurute yat karma kurute  tat abhisampadyate iti
translated: So one becomes according to one's will. Whatever one does, one attains that.

original: tadeṣa śloko bhavati tadeva sattatsaha karmaṇaiti liṅgam mano yatra niṣaktamasya
analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati tat eva sat tat saha karmaṇā eti liṅgam manaḥ yatra niṣaktam asya
translated: This verse is about that: That alone follows him, that is the sign, the mind where his is fixed.

original: prāpyāntaṃ karmaṇastasya yatkiṃ ceha karotyayam tasmāllokātpunaraityasmai lokāya
analyzed: prāpya antam karmaṇaḥ tasya yat kim ca iha karoti ayam tasmāt lokāt punar aiti asmai lokāya
translated: Having reached the end of that action, whatever he does here, from that world he returns to this world.

original: karmaṇa iti nu kāmayamāno'thākāmayamāno yo'kāmo niṣkāma ātmakāma āptakāmo
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ iti nu kāmayamānaḥ utha a kāmayamānaḥ yaḥ kāmaḥ niṣkāmaḥ ātma kāmaḥ āpta kāmaḥ
translated: Thus, one who desires action, then one who does not desire, one who is desireless, free from desires, whose desire is the Self, whose desire is fulfilled,

original: bhavati na tasmātprāṇā utkrāmantyatraiva samavanīyante brahmaiva sanbrahmāpyeti / / /
analyzed: bhavati na tasmāt prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti atra eva samavanīyante brahma eva san brahma apyeti
translated: from him the vital breaths do not depart. They merge right here. Becoming Brahman itself, he attains Brahman.

original: tadeṣa śloko bhavati yadā sarve pramucyante kāmā ye'sya hṛdi sthitāḥ atha
analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ bhavati yadā sarve pramucyante kāmāḥ hṛdi sthitāḥ atha
translated: This verse is about that: When all the desires that lie within the heart are freed,

original: martyo'mṛto bhavatyatra brahma samaśnuta iti / / /
analyzed: martyaḥ umṛtaḥ bhavati atra brahma samaśnute iti
translated: then the mortal becomes immortal. Here he attains Brahman.

original: tadyathāhinirlvayanī valmīke mṛtā pratyastā śayītaivamevedaṃ śarīraṃ
analyzed: tat yathā ahi nirlvayanī valmīke mṛtā pratyastā śayīta evam eva idam śarīram
translated: Just as a snake sloughs off its skin and lies dead in an anthill, so does this body lie.

original: śete'thāyamanasthiko'śarīraḥ prājña ātmā brahmaiva loka eva samrāḍiti hovāca
analyzed: śetetha ayam an asthikaḥ śarīraḥ prājñaḥ ātmā brahma eva lokaḥ eva samrāj iti ha uvāca
translated: But this boneless, bodiless wise Self, Brahman itself, is the very world, the emperor, he said.

original: yājñavalkyaḥ so'ham bhagavate sahasraṃ dadāmīti hovāca janako vaidehaḥ / / /
analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ saḥ ham bhagavate sahasram dadāmi iti ha uvāca janakaḥ vaidehaḥ
translated: Yajnavalkya said, I give to the Blessed Lord a thousand (cows). Janaka of Videha said:

original: tadapyete ślokāḥ aṇuḥ panthā vitaraḥ purāṇo māṃspṛṣṭo'nuvitto mayaiva tena dhīrā
analyzed: tat api ete ślokāḥ aṇuḥ panthāḥ vitaraḥ purāṇaḥ mām spṛṣṭaḥ anuvittaḥ mayā eva tena dhīrā
translated: There are also these verses: The ancient path, subtle, expansive, is touched by the wise, is known by me alone. By that

original: apiyanti brahmavida utkramya svargaṃ lokamito vimuktāḥ / / /
analyzed: apiyanti brahma vidaḥ utkramya svargam lokam itas vimuktāḥ
translated: The knowers of Brahman, having gone beyond, depart to the heavenly world, being liberated from this.

original: tasmiñcuklamuta nīlamāhuḥ piṅgalaṃ haritaṃ lohitaṃ caeṣa panthā brahmaṇā
analyzed: tasmin cuklam uta nīlam āhuḥ piṅgalam haritam lohitam ca eṣa panthāḥ brahmaṇā
translated: And in that (path) they say there is white and also blue, tawny, green, and red. This is the path

original: hānuvittastenaiti brahmavittaijasaḥ puṇyakṛcca / / /
analyzed: ha anuvittaḥ tena eti brahma vid taijasaḥ puṇya kṛt ca
translated: Which is known by Brahman. By that the wise one goes, and also the one who has done meritorious deeds, knowing Brahman.

original: andhaṃ tamaḥ praviśanti ye'sambhūtimupāsate tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u
analyzed: andham tamaḥ praviśanti ye sambhūtim upāsate tatas bhūyas iva te tamaḥ ye u
translated: Those who worship non-being enter into blinding darkness. Even greater darkness than that

original: sambhūtyāṃ ratāḥ / / /
analyzed: sambhūtyām ratāḥ
translated: Do those who delight in being (attain).

original: asuryā nāma te lokāḥ andhena tamasāvṛtāḥ tāṃste pretyāpigacantyavidvāṃso'budhā
analyzed: asuryāḥ nāma te lokāḥ andhena tamasā āvṛtāḥ tān te pretya apigacanti a vidvāṃsaḥ budhā
translated: Those worlds are called Asura, enveloped in blinding darkness. Those ignorant, unwise people

original: janāḥ / / /
analyzed: janāḥ
translated: Go to them after death.

original: tadeva santastadu tadbhavāmo na cedavedī mahatī vinaṣṭiḥye tadviduramṛtāste
analyzed: tat eva santaḥ tat u tat bhavāmaḥ na ced avedī mahatī vinaṣṭiḥ ye tat viduḥ amṛtāḥ te
translated: We are that, and we shall become that again. If we did not know it, there would be great destruction. Those who know that become immortal.

original: bhavantyathetare duḥkhamevopayanti / / /
analyzed: bhavanti atha itare duḥkham eva upayanti
translated: The others attain only sorrow.

original: ātmānaṃ cedvijānīyādayamasmīti puruṣaḥ kimicankasya kāmāya śarīramanu🔽saṃcaret / / /
analyzed: ātmānam ced vijānīyāt ayam asmi iti puruṣaḥ kimican kasya kāmāya śarīram anu  saṃcaret
translated: If a person knows the Self as 'I am this', what would he desire and for whose sake would he wander in the body?

original: yasyānuvittaḥ pratibuddha ātmāsmintsaṃdehe gahane praviṣṭaḥ sa viśvakṛtsa ha
analyzed: yasya anuvittaḥ pratibuddhaḥ ātmā asmin saṃdehe gahane praviṣṭaḥ sa viśva kṛt sa ha
translated: He whose Self, known and awakened, has entered this doubt and this dense (world), he is the creator of the universe,

original: sarvasya kartā tasya lokaḥ sa u loka eva / / /
analyzed: sarvasya kartā tasya lokaḥ saḥ u lokaḥ eva
translated: he is the maker of all. His world is indeed the highest world.

original: yadaitamanupaśyati ātmānaṃ devamañjasā īśānam bhūtabhavyasya na tadā vicikitsati / / /
analyzed: yadā etam anupaśyati ātmānam devam añjasā īśānam bhūta bhavyasya na tadā vicikitsati
translated: When one sees this Self, the divine one, directly, as the Lord of the past and the future, then one does not doubt.

original: yasminpañca pañcajanāḥ ākāśaśca pratiṣṭhitaḥ tameva manya ātmānaṃ
analyzed: yasmin pañca pañcajanāḥ ākāśaḥ ca pratiṣṭhitaḥ tam eva manye ātmānam
translated: In whom the five groups of people and also space are established, him alone, the Self,

original: vidvānbrahmāmṛto'mṛtam / / /
analyzed: vidvān brahma amṛtaḥ mṛtam
translated: knowing as Brahman, one becomes immortal, having attained immortality.

original: yasmādarvākṣaṃvatsaro'hobhiḥ parivartate taddevā jyotiṣāṃ
analyzed: yasmāt arvāk saṃvatsarā uhobhiḥ parivartate tat devāḥ jyotiṣām
translated: From whom the year, consisting of days, revolves in a downward direction, to that light of lights,

original: jyotirāyurhyopāsate'mṛtam / / /
analyzed: jyotiḥ āyuḥ hi opāsate imṛtam
translated: the gods go for immortality.

original: prāṇasya prāṇam uta cakṣuṣaścakṣuruta śrotrasya śrotramannasyānnam manaso ye🔽mano viduḥ te nicikyurbrahma purāṇamagryam manasaivāptavyaṃ neha nānāsti kiṃ
analyzed: prāṇasya prāṇam uta cakṣuṣaḥ cakṣuḥ uta śrotrasya śrotram annasya annam manasaḥ ye  manaḥ viduḥ te nicikyuḥ brahma purāṇam agryam manasā eva āptavyam na iha nānā asti kim
translated: Those who know the breath of the breath, the eye of the eye, the ear of the ear, the food of the food, and the mind of the mind,

original: cana / / /
analyzed: cana
translated: they have discerned the ancient, foremost Brahman. It is to be attained by the mind alone. There is nothing diverse here at all.

original: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyumāpnoti ya iha nāneva paśyati
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati
translated: He who sees diversity here attains death from death.

original: manasaivānudraṣṭavyametadapramayaṃ dhruvam / / /
analyzed: manasā eva anudraṣṭavyam etat apramayam dhruvam
translated: This should be seen by the mind alone, it is certainly beyond doubt.

original: virajaḥ para ākāśāt aja ātmā mahā dhruvaḥ tameva dhīro vijñāya prajñāṃ kurvīta
analyzed: virajaḥ paras ākāśāt aja ātmā mahā dhruvaḥ tam eva dhīraḥ vijñāya prajñām kurvīta
translated: The pure, supreme, unborn Self, the great and firm one, is beyond space. The wise one, having known Him, should fix his wisdom on Him.

original: brāhmaṇaḥ nānudhyāyādbahūñcabdānvāco viglāpanaṃ hi taditi / / /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ na anudhyāyāt bahūn cabdān vācaḥ viglāpanam hi tat iti
translated: A Brahmin should not meditate on many words, for that is the distraction of speech.

original: sa vā ayamātmā sarvasya vaśī sarvasyeśānaḥ sarvasyādhipatiḥ sarvamidam praśāsti
analyzed: sa vai ayam ātmā sarvasya vaśī sarvasya īśānaḥ sarvasya adhipatiḥ sarvam idam praśāsti
translated: This Self is the controller of all, the lord of all, the overlord of all. He rules over all this, whatever there is.

original: yadidaṃ kiṃ ca sa na sādhunā karmaṇā bhūyānno'evāsādhunā kanīyāneṣa
analyzed: yat idam kim ca sa na sādhunā karmaṇā bhūyāt no eva asādhunā kanīyān eṣa
translated: He does not become greater by good deeds, nor does he become less by bad deeds.

original: bhūtādhipatireṣa lokeśvara eṣa lokapālaḥ sa seturvidharaṇa eṣāṃ
analyzed: bhūta adhipatiḥ eṣa loka īśvaraḥ eṣa lokapālaḥ sa setuḥ vidharaṇaḥ eṣām
translated: He is the lord of beings, the lord of the world, the protector of the world. He is the bridge, the support of these worlds,

original: lokānāmasambhedāya / / /
analyzed: lokānām a sambhedāya
translated: to prevent their confusion.

original: tametaṃ vedānuvacanena vividiṣanti brahmacaryeṇa tapasā śraddhayā
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena vividiṣanti brahmacaryeṇa tapasā śraddhayā
translated: By the study of the Vedas, by celibacy, austerity, and faith,

original: yajñenānāśakena caitameva viditvā munirbhavatyetameva pravrājino lokamīpsantaḥ
analyzed: yajñena anāśakena ca etam eva viditvā muniḥ bhavati etam eva pravrājinaḥ lokam īpsantaḥ
translated: by sacrifice, and by fasting, they seek to know Him. Having known Him alone, one becomes a sage. Desiring this very world of the wandering ascetics,

original: pravrajanti / / /
analyzed: pravrajanti
translated: they wander forth.

original: etaddha sma vai tatpūrve brāhmaṇāḥ anūcānā vidvāṃsaḥ prajāṃ na kāmayante kim
analyzed: etat ha sma vai tat pūrve brāhmaṇāḥ anūcānāḥ vidvāṃsaḥ prajām na kāmayante kim
translated: This is what the ancient Brahmins, the students, the wise ones, did not desire offspring. What

original: prajayā kariṣyāmo yeṣāṃ no'yamātmāyaṃ loka iti te ha sma putraiṣaṇāyāśca🔽vittaiṣaṇāyāśca lokaiṣaṇāyāśca vyutthāyātha bhikṣācaryaṃ caranti yā hyeva
analyzed: prajayā kariṣyāmaḥ yeṣām na uyam ātmā ayam lokaḥ iti te ha sma putra eṣaṇāyāḥ ca  vitta eṣaṇāyāḥ ca loka eṣaṇāyāḥ ca vyutthāya atha bhikṣā caryam caranti yā hi eva
translated: 'We will create offspring, for this our self is this world.' They, having turned away from the desire for sons,

original: putraiṣaṇā sā vittaiṣaṇā yā vittaiṣaṇā sā lokaiṣaṇobhe hyete eṣaṇe eva bhavataḥ / / /
analyzed: putra eṣaṇā sā vitta eṣaṇā yā vitta eṣaṇā sā loka eṣaṇā ubhe hi ete eṣaṇe eva bhavataḥ
translated: from the desire for wealth, and from the desire for worlds, then wander about as mendicants. For the desire for sons is the desire for wealth, and the desire for wealth is the desire for worlds. Both of these are indeed desires.

original: sa eṣa neti netyātmā agṛhyo na hi gṛhyate'śīryo na hi śīryate'saṅgo'sito na sajyate na
analyzed: saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā a gṛhyaḥ na hi gṛhyate īśīryaḥ na hi śīryate isaṅga usitaḥ na sajyate na
translated: This self is indeed 'neti neti' (not this, not this). It cannot be grasped, for it is not grasped. It is not perishable, for it does not perish. It is unattached, unstained, and does not stick.

original: vyathata ityataḥ pāpamakaravamityataḥ kalyāṇamakaravamityubhe ubhe hyeṣa ete
analyzed: vyathate iti atas pāpam akaravam iti atas kalyāṇam akaravam iti ubhe ubhe hi eṣaḥ ete
translated: It is not afflicted. Therefore, 'I have done evil' or 'I have done good' - both of these are not applicable to it, for both of these are indeed these.

original: taratyamṛtaḥ sādhvasādhunī nainaṃ kṛtākṛte tapato nāsya kena cana karmaṇā loko🔽mīyate / / /
analyzed: tarati amṛtaḥ sādhu asādhunī na enam kṛta akṛte tapataḥ na asya kena cana karmaṇā  mīyate
translated: He who knows this crosses over evil and good. He is not burned by what is done or not done. His world is not affected by any action at all.

original: tadetadṛcābhyuktam eṣa nityo mahimā brāhmaṇasya na karmaṇā vardhate no
analyzed: tat etat ṛcā abhyuktam eṣa nityaḥ mahimā brāhmaṇasya na karmaṇā vardhate no
translated: This is stated in the Ṛc: 'This is the eternal greatness of the brāhmaṇa. It does not increase by action, nor does it diminish.

original: kanīyān tasyaiva syātpadavittaṃ vidvitvā na karmaṇā lipyate pāpakeneti
analyzed: kanīyān tasya eva syāt pada vittam vidvitvā na karmaṇā lipyate pāpakena iti
translated: One should know that to be his abode, having known which one is not tainted by evil action.'🔽This is stated in the Ṛc:

original: tasmādevaṃvicrānto dānta uparatastitikṣuḥ śraddhāvitto bhūtvātmanyevātmānam
analyzed: tasmāt evam vicrāntaḥ dāntaḥ uparataḥ titikṣuḥ śraddhā vittaḥ bhūtvā ātmani eva ātmānam
translated: Therefore, one who is thus restrained, self-controlled, tranquil, patient, and endowed with faith, having become so, should see the Self in the Self.

original: paśyetsarvamenam paśyati sarvo'syātmā bhavati sarvasyātmā bhavati sarvam
analyzed: paśyet sarvam enam paśyati sarvaḥ sya ātmā bhavati sarvasya ātmā bhavati sarvam
translated: He sees everything in him; everything becomes his Self; he becomes the Self of everything.

original: pāpmānaṃ tarati nainam pāpmā tarati sarvam pāpmānaṃ tapati nainam pāpmā tapati
analyzed: pāpmānam tarati na enam pāpmā tarati sarvam pāpmānam tapati na enam pāpmā tapati
translated: He crosses over all evil; evil does not cross over him; he burns up all evil; evil does not burn him.

original: vipāpo vijaro vijighatso'pipāso brāhmaṇo bhavati ya evaṃ veda / / /🔽sa vā eṣa mahānaja ātmā annādo vasudānaḥ sa yo haivametam
analyzed: vipāpaḥ vijaraḥ vijighatsaḥ upipāsaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda  sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā anna ādaḥ vasu dānaḥ sa yaḥ ha evam etam
translated: The Brahmin becomes free from sin, free from old age, free from hunger and thirst, who knows this.

original: mahāntamajamātmānamannādaṃ vasudānaṃ veda vindatevasu / / /
analyzed: mahāntam ajam ātmānam anna ādam vasu dānam veda vindatevasu
translated: This great unborn Self is the eater of food, the giver of wealth. One who knows this great unborn Self as the eater of food, the giver of wealth, obtains wealth.

original: sa vā eṣa mahānaja ātmā ajaro'maro'bhayo'mṛto brahmābhayaṃ vai janaka🔽prāpto'sīti hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ so'ham bhagavate videhāndadāmi māṃ cāpi saha
analyzed: sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā ajara umara ubhaya umṛtaḥ brahma abhayam vai janaka  prāptaḥ asi iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ saḥ ham bhagavate videhān dadāmi mām ca api saha
translated: This great unborn Self is free from old age, free from death, free from fear, immortal, Brahman. O Janaka, you have attained fearlessness, indeed.

original: dāsyāyeti / / /🔽sa vā eṣa mahānaja ātmā ajaro'maro'bhayo'mṛto brahmābhayaṃ vai brahmābhayaṃ
analyzed: dāsyāya iti  sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā ajara umara ubhaya umṛtaḥ brahma abhayam vai brahma abhayam
translated: Yajnavalkya said, I give you my kingdom and myself as your slave.🔽This great unborn Self is free from old age, free from death, free from fear, immortal, Brahman. Brahman, indeed, becomes fearless

original: hi vai brahma bhavati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: hi vai brahma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: for one who knows this.

original: atha ha yājñavalkyasya dve bhārye babhūvatuḥ maitreyī ca kātyāyanī ca tayorha
analyzed: atha ha yājñavalkyasya dve bhārye babhūvatuḥ maitreyī ca kātyāyanī ca tayoḥ ha
translated: Now, Yajnavalkya had two wives: Maitreyi and Katyayani. Of them,

original: maitreyī brahmavādinī babhūva strīprajñeva kātyāyanī
analyzed: maitreyī brahma vādinī babhūva strī prajñā iva kātyāyanī
translated: Maitreyi was a speaker of Brahman, while Katyayani was like a woman of little understanding.

original: so'nyadvṛttamupākariṣyamāṇaḥ / / /
analyzed: saḥ anyat vṛttam upākariṣyamāṇaḥ
translated: He, about to take up another way of life,

original: yājñavalkyo maitreyīti hovāca pravrajiṣyanvā are'hamasmātsthānādasmi hanta
analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ maitreyi iti ha uvāca pravrajiṣyan vai are ham asmāt sthānāt asmi hanta
translated: Yajnavalkya said to Maitreyi: My dear, I am about to leave this place. Come,

original: te'nayā kātyāyanyāntaṃ karavāṇīti / / /
analyzed: kātyāyanyā antam karavāṇi iti
translated: let us make an end with this Katyayani.

original: sā hovāca maitreyī yannu ma iyam bhagoḥ sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syātsyāṃ
analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī yat nu me iyam sarvā pṛthivī vittena pūrṇā syāt syām
translated: She said, If this entire earth filled with wealth were mine, would I be immortal?

original: nvahaṃ neti neti hovāca yājñavalkyo yathaivopakaraṇavatāṃ jīvitaṃ
analyzed: nu aham tena amṛtā aho na iti na iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ yathā eva upakaraṇavatām jīvitam
translated: No, said Yajnavalkya, your life would be like that of those who have means,

original: tathaiva te jīvitaṃ syādamṛtatvasya tu nāśāsti vitteneti / / /🔽sā hovāca maitreyī yenāhaṃ nāmṛtā syāṃ kimahaṃ tena kuryāṃ yadeva bhagavānveda
analyzed: tathā eva te jīvitam syāt amṛta tvasya tu na āśā asti vittena iti  sā ha uvāca maitreyī yena aham na amṛtā syām kim aham tena kuryām yat eva bhagavān veda
translated: but there is no hope of immortality through wealth.

original: tadeva me brūhīti / / /
analyzed: tat eva me brūhi iti
translated: Maitreyi said, What should I do with that by which I would not be immortal? Tell me that very thing which you know, sir.

original: sa hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ priyā khalu no bhavatī satī priyamavṛtaddhanta khalu
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ priyā khalu naḥ bhavatī satī priyam avṛtat hanta khalu
translated: Yajnavalkya said, You are dear to me, and being dear, you have asked what is dear.🔽But, indeed,

original: bhavati te'haṃ tadvakṣyāmi vyākhyāsyāmi te vācaṃ tu me vyācakṣāṇasya
analyzed: bhavati tat iha tat vakṣyāmi vyākhyāsyāmi te vācam tu me vyācakṣāṇasya
translated: I will tell you that, I will explain to you. But while I am explaining,

original: nididhyāsasveti bravītu bhagavāniti / / /🔽sa hovāca yājñavalkyo na vā are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavatyātmanastu
analyzed: nididhyāsasva iti bravītu bhagavān iti  sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ na vai are patyuḥ kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati ātmanaḥ tu
translated: listen attentively.

original: kāmāya patiḥ priyo bhavati devāḥ priyā bhavanti na vā are vedānāṃ kāmāya vedāḥ
analyzed: kāmāya patiḥ priyaḥ bhavati devāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti na vai are vedānām kāmāya vedāḥ
translated: He said, Verily, O son of Mitrāvaruṇa, a husband is not dear for the sake of the wife, but a husband is dear for one's own sake. The gods are dear, not for the sake of the Vedas,

original: priyā bhavantyātmanastu kāmāya vedāḥ priyā bhavanti na vā are yajñānāṃ kāmāya
analyzed: priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya vedāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti na vai are yajñānām kāmāya
translated: but the Vedas are dear for one's own sake. The sacrifices are dear, not for the sake of the sacrifices,

original: yajñāḥ priyā bhavantyātmanastu kāmāya yajñāḥ priyā bhavanti na vā are bhūtānāṃ🔽kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavantyātmanastu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti na vā are
analyzed: yajñāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya yajñāḥ priyāḥ bhavanti na vai are bhūtānām  kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya bhūtāni priyāṇi bhavanti na vai are
translated: but the sacrifices are dear for one's own sake. The beings are dear, not for the sake of the beings,

original: sarvasya kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavatyātmanastu kāmāya sarvam priyam
analyzed: sarvasya kāmāya sarvam priyam bhavati ātmanaḥ tu kāmāya sarvam priyam
translated: but the beings are dear for one's own sake. All is dear, not for the sake of all,

original: bhavatyātmā nvare draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyo mantavyo nididhyāsitavyo maitreyyātmani
analyzed: bhavati ātmā nu are draṣṭavyaḥ śrotavyaḥ mantavyaḥ nididhyāsitavyaḥ maitreyi ātmani
translated: but all is dear for one's own sake. Verily, O son of Mitrāvaruṇa, the self is to be seen, to be heard, to be thought, to be reflected upon.

original: vā are dṛṣṭe śrute mate vijñāta idaṃ sarvaṃ viditam / / /🔽brahma tam parādāt yo'nyatrātmano devānveda vedāstam parāduryo'nyatrātmano
analyzed: vai are dṛṣṭe śrute mate vijñāte idam sarvam viditam  brahma tam parādāt yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ devān veda vedāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ
translated: In the seen, heard, thought, and known, all this is known. ..

original: vedānveda yajñāstam parāduryonyatrātmano yajñānveda bhūtāni tam🔽parāduryo'nyatrātmano bhūtāni veda sarvam tam parādādyo'nyatrātmanaḥ sarvaṃ
analyzed: vedān veda yajñāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nī atra ātmanaḥ yajñān veda bhūtāni tam  parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ bhūtāni veda sarvam tam parādāt yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ sarvam
translated: Brahma gave him up who knows the gods other than the Self. The Vedas gave him up who knows the Vedas other than the Self. The sacrifices gave him up who knows the sacrifices other than the Self. The beings gave him up who knows the beings other than the Self.

original: vededam brahmedaṃ kṣatramime lokā ime devā ime vedā ime yajñā imāni
analyzed: veda idam brahma idam kṣatram ime lokāḥ ime devāḥ ime vedāḥ ime yajñāḥ imāni
translated: All gave him up who knows all other than the Self. This is Brahman, this is Kshatra, these are the worlds, these are the gods, these are the Vedas, these are the sacrifices,

original: bhūtānīdaṃ sarvaṃ yadayamātmā / / /🔽sa yathā dundubherhanya / / /
analyzed: bhūtāni idam sarvam yat ayam ātmā  sa yathā dundubheḥ hanya
translated: these are the beings, all this is he, who is this Self. ..🔽As of a drum when beaten. ..

original: sa yathā vīṇāyai / / /
analyzed: sa yathā vīṇāyai
translated: As of a lute. ..

original: sa yathā śaṅkhasya / / /🔽sa yathārdraidhāgnera sūtrāṇyanuvyākhyānāni vyākhyānāni dattaṃ hutamāśitam
analyzed: sa yathā śaṅkhasya  sa yathā ārdra edha agneḥ sūtrāṇi anuvyākhyānāni vyākhyānāni dattam hutam āśitam
translated: As of a conch shell. ..

original: pāyitamayaṃ ca lokaḥ paraśca lokaḥ sarvāṇi ca bhūtānyasyaivaitāni sarvāṇi niśvasitāni / / /
analyzed: pāyitam ayam ca lokaḥ paraḥ ca lokaḥ sarvāṇi ca bhūtāni asya eva etāni sarvāṇi niśvasitāni
translated: The given, the offered, the eaten, the drunk, this world, the other world, and all beings, all these are but the out-breathings of him. ..

original: sa yathā sarvāsāmapāṃ samudra ekāyana / / /
analyzed: sa yathā sarvāsām apām samudre ekāyana
translated: As of all waters the ocean is the one destination. ..🔽. ..

original: sa yathā saindhavaghano anantaro'bāhyaḥ kṛtsno rasaghana eva syādevaṃ vā ara
analyzed: sa yathā saindhava ghanaḥ anantaraḥ bāhyaḥ kṛtsnaḥ rasa ghanaḥ eva syāt evam vai ara
translated: As this salt-piece, without an inside or an outside, is all of it a mass of taste, even so, my dear,

original: idam mahadbhūtamanantamapāraṃ kṛtsnaḥ prajñānaghana evaitebhyo bhūtebhyaḥ
analyzed: idam mahat bhūtam anantam apāram kṛtsnaḥ prajñāna ghanaḥ eva etebhyaḥ bhūtebhyaḥ
translated: this great Being is infinite, without an end or middle, all of it a mass of knowledge.

original: samutthāya tānyevānuvinaśyati na pretya saṃjñāstītyare bravīmīti hovāca
analyzed: samutthāya tāni eva anuvinaśyati na pretya saṃjñā asti iti are bravīmi iti ha uvāca
translated: Having risen from these elements, it perishes after them. After death there is no consciousness, my dear, I declare to you.

original: yājñavalkyaḥ / / /
analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ
translated: Thus spoke Yajnavalkya.

original: sā hovāca maitreyī atraiva mā bhagavānmohāntamāpīpadanna vā ahamidaṃ vijānāmi
analyzed: sā ha uvāca maitreyī atra eva mā bhagavān moha antam āpīpadat na vai aham idam vijānāmi
translated: Maitreyi said: Here, O revered one, do not consign me to the state of utter delusion. I do not understand this,

original: na pretya saṃjñāstīti / / /
analyzed: na pretya saṃjñā asti iti
translated: that after death there is no consciousness.

original: sa hovāca yājñavalkyo na vā are'ham moham bravīmyavināśī vā are
analyzed: sa ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ na vai are ham moham bravīmi avināśī vai are
translated: Yajnavalkya said: I do not speak of delusion, my dear. The Self is indestructible, my dear.

original: yamātmānuccittidharmā mātrāsaṃsargastvasya bhavati / / /
analyzed: yam ātmā an uccitti dharmā mātrā saṃsargaḥ tu asya bhavati
translated: Its contact with the body is only as long as the body lasts.
