translated: In the middle is the untruth; that untruth is surrounded by truth; it becomes full of truth.

original: naivaṃvidvāṃsamanṛtaṃ hinasti / / /🔽tadyattatsatyam asau sa ādityo ya eṣa etasminmaṇḍale puruṣo yaścāyaṃ
analyzed: na evam vidvāṃsam anṛtam hinasti  tat yat tat satyam asau saḥ ādityaḥ yaḥ eṣaḥ etasmin maṇḍale puruṣaḥ yaḥ ca ayam
translated: Untruth does not injure him who knows thus.

original: dakṣiṇe'kṣanpuruṣastāvetāvanyo'nyasminpratiṣṭhitau raśmibhirvā
analyzed: dakṣiṇa īkṣan puruṣaḥ tau etau anyonyasmin pratiṣṭhitau raśmibhiḥ vā
translated: Now, that truth is yonder sun, and that person who is in this orb, and that person who is in the right eye, these two are established in each other, either by the rays

original: eṣo'sminpratiṣṭhitaḥ prāṇairayamamuṣminsa yadotkramiṣyanbhavati
analyzed: eṣaḥ usmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ prāṇaiḥ ayam amuṣmin sa yadā utkramiṣyan bhavati
translated: or by the vital airs. He is established in this one, and this one in him. When he is about to depart,

original: śuddhamevaitanmaṇḍalam paśyati nainamete raśmayaḥ pratyāyanti / / /
analyzed: śuddham eva etat maṇḍalam paśyati na enam ete raśmayaḥ pratyāyanti
translated: he sees this orb as pure; these rays do not enter into him.

original: ya eṣa etasminmaṇḍale puruṣaḥ tasya bhūriti śira ekaṃ śira ekametadakṣaram
analyzed: yaḥ eṣaḥ etasmin maṇḍale puruṣaḥ tasya bhūḥ iti śiraḥ ekam śiraḥ ekam etat akṣaram
translated: That person who is in this orb, his head is the syllable bhūḥ, the head is this syllable.

original: bhuva iti bāhū dvau bāhū dve ete akṣare svariti pratiṣṭhā dve pratiṣṭhe dve ete
analyzed: bhuvaḥ iti bāhū dvau bāhū dve ete akṣare svar iti pratiṣṭhā dve pratiṣṭhe dve ete
translated: The arms are the syllable bhuvaḥ, the arms are these two syllables. The feet are the syllable svaḥ, the feet are these two syllables.

original: akṣare tasyopaniṣadahariti hanti pāpmānaṃ jahāti ca ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: akṣare tasya upaniṣad ahar iti hanti pāpmānam jahāti ca yaḥ evam veda
translated: The Upaniṣad of that is ahaha. He destroys evil and abandons it, who knows thus.

original: atha yo'yaṃ dakṣiṇe'kṣanpuruṣaḥ tasya bhūriti śira ekaṃ śira ekametadakṣaram
analyzed: atha yaḥ yam dakṣiṇa īkṣan puruṣaḥ tasya bhūḥ iti śiraḥ ekam śiraḥ ekam etat akṣaram
translated: Now, that person who is in the right eye, his head is the syllable bhūḥ, the head is this syllable.

original: bhuva iti bāhū dvau bāhū dve ete akṣare svariti pratiṣṭhā dve pratiṣṭhe dve ete
analyzed: bhuvaḥ iti bāhū dvau bāhū dve ete akṣare svar iti pratiṣṭhā dve pratiṣṭhe dve ete
translated: Bhuva is the two arms, there are two of these syllables. Sva is the two feet, there are two of these syllables.

original: akṣare tasyopaniṣadahamiti hanti pāpmānaṃ jahāti ca ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: akṣare tasya upaniṣad aham iti hanti pāpmānam jahāti ca yaḥ evam veda
translated: The Upanishad of that is Aham. He destroys evil and leaves it behind who knows thus.

original: vidyudbrahmetyāhuḥ vidānādvidyudvidyatyenaṃ sarvasmātpāpmano ya evaṃ veda
analyzed: vidyut brahma iti āhuḥ vidānāt vidyut vidyati enam sarvasmāt pāpmanaḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: They say that lightning is Brahman, because of knowing, lightning knows him from all evil, who knows thus.

original: vidyudbrahmeti vidyuddhyeva brahma / / /
analyzed: vidyut brahma iti vidyut hi eva brahma
translated: Lightning is Brahman, for lightning indeed is Brahman.

original: manomayo'yam puruṣo bhāḥsatyastasminnantarhṛdaye yathā vrīhirvā yavo
analyzed: manaḥ mayaḥ ayam puruṣaḥ bhās satyaḥ tasmin antar hṛdaye yathā vrīhiḥ vā yavaḥ
translated: This person is made of mind, his light is truth. In him, in the inner heart, like a rice grain or barley grain,

original: vaivamayamantarātmanpuruṣaḥ sa eṣa sarvasya vaśī sarvasyeśānaḥ sarvasyādhipatiḥ
analyzed: vā evam ayam antarātman puruṣaḥ saḥ eṣa sarvasya vaśī sarvasya īśānaḥ sarvasya adhipatiḥ
translated: Thus is this person in the inner self. He is the lord of all, the lord of all, the overlord of all.

original: sarvamidam praśāsti yadidaṃ kiṃ ca ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: sarvam idam praśāsti yat idam kim ca yaḥ evam veda
translated: He rules over all this, whatever there is. He who knows thus.

original: vācaṃ dhenumupāsīta tasyāścatvāra stanāḥ svāhākāro vaṣaṭkāro hantakāraḥ
analyzed: vācam dhenum upāsīta tasyāḥ catvāraḥ stanāḥ svāhākāraḥ vaṣaṭkāraḥ hantakāraḥ
translated: One should meditate on speech as a cow. It has four teats. Svâhâ, Vaṣaṭ, Hantum,

original: svadhākārastasyai dvau stanau devā upajīvanti svāhākāraṃ ca vaṣaṭkāraṃ ca
analyzed: svadhākāraḥ tasyai dvau stanau devāḥ upajīvanti svāhākāram ca vaṣaṭkāram ca
translated: Svâhâ, and Vaṣaṭ. The gods live on two of its teats, Svâhâ and Vaṣaṭ.

original: hantakāram manuṣyāḥ svadhākāram pitarastasyāḥ prāṇa ṛṣabho mano vatsaḥ / / /
analyzed: hantakāram manuṣyāḥ svadhākāram pitaraḥ tasyāḥ prāṇaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ manaḥ vatsaḥ
translated: Men on Hantum, and the fathers on Svâhâ. Its bull is the breath, and the mind is its calf.

original: ayamagnirvaiśvānaro yo'yamantaḥ puruṣe yenedamannam pacyate yadidamadyate
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ yaḥ yam antar puruṣe yena idam annam pacyate yat idam adyate
translated: This Agni Vaiśvānara is that which is within man, by which this food is cooked which is eaten.

original: tasyaiṣa ghoṣo bhavati yametatkarṇāvapidhāya śṛṇoti sa yadotkramiṣyanbhavati
analyzed: tasya eṣa ghoṣaḥ bhavati yam etat karṇau apidhāya śṛṇoti sa yadā utkramiṣyan bhavati
translated: This is the sound which he hears by closing his ears to it. When he is about to depart,

original: naitaṃ ghoṣaṃ śṛṇoti / / /🔽etadvai paramaṃ tapo yadvyāhitastapyate paramaṃ haiva lokaṃ jayati ya evaṃ
analyzed: na etam ghoṣam śṛṇoti  etat vai paramam tapaḥ yat vyāhitaḥ tapyate paramam ha eva lokam jayati yaḥ evam
translated: he does not hear that sound.🔽This, indeed, is the highest austerity, that one is tormented when afflicted. He who knows this conquers the highest world.

original: vedaitadvai paramaṃ tapo yam pretamaraṇyaṃ haranti paramaṃ haiva lokaṃ jayati ya🔽evaṃ vedaitadvai paramaṃ tapo yam pretamagnāvabhyādadhati paramaṃ haiva lokaṃ
analyzed: veda etat vai paramam tapaḥ yam pretam araṇyam haranti paramam ha eva lokam jayati yaḥ  evam veda etat vai paramam tapaḥ yam pretam agnau abhyādadhati paramam ha eva lokam
translated: This, indeed, is the highest austerity, that they carry him away to the forest when dead. He who knows this conquers the highest world.

original: jayati ya evaṃ veda / / /🔽yadā vai puruṣo asmāllokātpraiti sa vāyumāgacati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte yathā🔽rathacakrasya khaṃ tena sa ūrdhva ākramate sa ādityamāgacati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte
analyzed: jayati yaḥ evam veda  yadā vai puruṣaḥ asmāt lokāt praiti sa vāyum āgacati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte yathā  ratha cakrasya kham tena saḥ ūrdhve ākramate saḥ ādityam āgacati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte
translated: This, indeed, is the highest austerity, that they place him on the fire when dead. He who knows this conquers the highest world.🔽When a man departs from this world, he goes to the wind. There he is stretched out as in the hole of a chariot wheel. By that he ascends upwards. He goes to the sun. There he is stretched out🔽as in the hole of a drum. By that he ascends upwards. He goes to the moon. There he is stretched out

original: yathāḍambarasya khaṃ tena sa ūrdhva ākramate sa candramasamāgacati tasmai sa
analyzed: yathā āḍambarasya kham tena saḥ ūrdhve ākramate sa candramasam āgacati tasmai sa
translated: as in the hole of a chariot wheel. By that he ascends upwards. He goes to the sun.

original: tatra vijihīte yathā dundubheḥ khaṃ tena sa ūrdhva ākramate sa
analyzed: tatra vijihīte yathā dundubheḥ kham tena saḥ ūrdhvaḥ ākramate sa
translated: There he rests, as it were, in the sky of the drum. By that he ascends upwards. He

original: lokamāgacatyaśokamahimaṃ tasminvasati śaśvatīḥ samāḥ / / /🔽annam brahmetyeka āhuḥ tanna tathā pūyati vā annamṛte prāṇātprāṇo brahmetyeka
analyzed: lokam āgacati aśoka mahimam tasmin vasati śaśvatīḥ samāḥ  annam brahma iti eke āhuḥ tat na tathā pūyati vai annam ṛte prāṇāt prāṇaḥ brahma iti eka
translated: comes to the world free from grief and glory. He dwells there for endless years.🔽Some say that food is Brahman. That is not so. For food decays, indeed, without breath. Some

original: āhustanna tathā śuṣyati vai prāṇa ṛte'nnādete ha tveva devate ekadhābhūyam bhūtvā
analyzed: āhuḥ tat na tathā śuṣyati vai prāṇaḥ ṛte nāt ete ha tu eva devate ekadhābhūyam bhūtvā
translated: say that breath is Brahman. That is not so. For breath dries up, indeed, without food. But these two deities, having become one,

original: paramatāṃ gacataḥ / / /
analyzed: parama tām gacataḥ
translated: attain the highest state.

original: taddha smāha prātṛdaḥ pitaram kiṃ svidevaivaṃ viduṣe sādhu kuryātkimevāsmā
analyzed: tat ha sma āha prātṛdaḥ pitaram kim svid eva evam viduṣe sādhu kuryāt kim eva asmai
translated: Now, Prātrīd, asked his father, What, indeed, would one who knows this do well for one who knows thus? And what,

original: asādhu kuryāditi sa ha smāha pāṇinā mā prātṛda kastvenayorekadhābhūyam bhūtvā
analyzed: asādhu kuryāt iti sa ha sma āha pāṇinā mā prātṛda kaḥ tu enayoḥ ekadhābhūyam bhūtvā
translated: indeed, would he do ill for him? He said, Do not touch me with your hand, Prātrīd. Who, indeed, having become one,

original: paramatāṃ gacatīti / / /🔽tasmā u haitaduvāca vītyannaṃ vai vyanne hīmāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni viṣṭāni ramiti
analyzed: parama tām gacati iti  tasmai u ha etat uvāca vi iti annam vai vi anne hi imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni viṣṭāni ram iti
translated: attains the highest state?🔽To him he said this, Vīti. For food is vīti, indeed, all these beings are distributed in food. Raṃ. For breath is raṃ,

original: prāṇo vai ram prāṇe hīmāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni ratāni sarvāṇi ha vā asminbhūtāni🔽viśante
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai ram prāṇe hi imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni ratāni sarvāṇi ha vai asmin bhūtāni  viśante
translated: indeed, all these beings are delighted in breath. All beings, indeed, enter into him,

original: sarvāṇi bhūtāni ramante ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: sarvāṇi bhūtāni ramante yaḥ evam veda
translated: and all beings delight in him who knows thus.

original: uktham prāṇo vā uktham prāṇo hīdaṃ sarvamutthāpayatyuddhāsmā
analyzed: uktham prāṇaḥ vai uktham prāṇaḥ hi idam sarvam utthāpayati ud ha asmai
translated: The Uktha is the breath, for the Uktha is all this (universe); the breath indeed raises all these beings; they are raised up for him;

original: ukthavidvīrastiṣṭhatyukthasya sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: uktha vid vīraḥ tiṣṭhati ukthasya sāyujyam salokatām jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: the hero stands as one who knows the Uktha; he wins union with and the same world as the Uktha, who knows thus.

original: prāṇo vai yajuḥ prāṇo hīmāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni yujyante yujyante hāsmai sarvāṇi
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai yajuḥ prāṇaḥ hi imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni yujyante yujyante ha asmai sarvāṇi
translated: The Yajus is the breath, for by the breath all these beings are joined together; they are joined together for him

original: bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya yajuṣaḥ sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: bhūtāni śraiṣṭhyāya yajuṣaḥ sāyujyam salokatām jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: for supremacy; he wins union with and the same world as the Yajus, who knows thus.

original: sāma prāṇo vai sāma prāṇo hīmāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni samyañci hāsmintsarvāṇi bhūtāni
analyzed: sāma prāṇaḥ vai sāma prāṇaḥ hi imāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni samyañci ha asmin sarvāṇi bhūtāni
translated: The Saman is the breath, for by the breath all these beings are brought together; all beings are brought together for him

original: śraiṣṭhyāya kalpante sāmnaḥ sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: śraiṣṭhyāya kalpante sāmnaḥ sāyujyam salokatām jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: for supremacy; he wins union with and the same world as the Saman, who knows thus.

original: kṣatram prāṇo vai kṣatram prāṇo hi vai kṣatraṃ trāyate hainam prāṇaḥ kṣaṇitoḥ
analyzed: kṣatram prāṇaḥ vai kṣatram prāṇaḥ hi vai kṣatram trāyate ha enam prāṇaḥ kṣaṇitoḥ
translated: The Kshatra is the breath, for the Kshatra is indeed the breath; the breath indeed protects him from being cut off;

original: pra kṣatramātramāpnoti kṣatrasya sāyujyaṃ salokatāṃ jayati ya evaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: pra kṣatra mātram āpnoti kṣatrasya sāyujyam salokatām jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: he attains the measure of the Kshatra; he wins union with and the same world as the Kshatra, who knows thus.

original: bhūmirantarikṣaṃ dyauriti aṣṭāvakṣarāṇyaṣṭākṣaraṃ ha vā ekaṃ gāyatryai
analyzed: bhūmiḥ antarikṣam dyauḥ iti aṣṭau akṣarāṇi aṣṭa akṣaram ha vai ekam gāyatryai
translated: The earth, the atmosphere, the sky - there are eight syllables; the Gayatri has eight syllables;

original: padametadu hāsyā etatsa yāvadeṣu lokeṣu tāvaddha jayati yo'syā etadevam padaṃ
analyzed: padam etat u ha asyāḥ etat sa yāvat eṣu lokeṣu tāvat ha jayati yaḥ usyāḥ etat evam padam
translated: He who thus knows this place of hers conquers as much as these worlds.

original: veda / / /
analyzed: veda
translated: He conquers as much as these worlds extend who knows this, the fourth, the manifest foot of hers.

original: ṛco yajūṃṣi sāmānīti aṣṭāvakṣarāṇyaṣṭākṣaraṃ ha vā ekaṃ gāyatryai padametadu
analyzed: ṛcaḥ yajūṃṣi sāmāni iti aṣṭau akṣarāṇi aṣṭa akṣaram ha vai ekam gāyatryai padam etat u
translated: The Richs, the Yajuses, the Samans, these are eight syllables; and an eight-syllabled verse is one foot of the Gayatri. This, indeed, is that (foot) of hers.

original: haivāsyā etatsa yāvatīyaṃ trayī vidyā tāvaddha jayati yo'syā etadevam padaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: ha eva asyai etat sa yāvatī iyam trayī vidyā tāvat ha jayati yaḥ syāḥ etat evam padam veda
translated: He conquers as much as this threefold science extends who knows this, the fourth, the manifest foot of hers.

original: prāṇo'pāno vyāna iti aṣṭāvakṣarāṇyaṣṭākṣaraṃ ha vā ekaṃ gāyatrai padametadu
analyzed: prāṇa upānaḥ vyānaḥ iti aṣṭau akṣarāṇi aṣṭa akṣaram ha vai ekam gāyatrai padam etat u
translated: The out-breathing, the in-breathing, the through-breathing, these are eight syllables; and an eight-syllabled verse is one foot of the Gayatri. This, indeed, is that (foot) of hers.

original: haivāsyā etatsa yāvadidam prāṇi tāvaddha jayati yo'syā etadevam padaṃ veda / / /🔽athāsyā etadeva turīyaṃ darśatam padam parorajā ya eṣa tapati yadvai caturthaṃ
analyzed: ha eva asyāḥ etat sa yāvat idam prāṇi tāvat ha jayati yaḥ usyāḥ etat evam padam veda  atha asyāḥ etat eva turīyam darśatam padam parorajāḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati yat vai caturtham
translated: He conquers as much as this living (world) extends who knows this, the fourth, the manifest foot of hers.

original: tatturīyaṃ darśatam padamiti dadṛśa iva hyeṣa parorajā iti sarvamu hyeṣa raja
analyzed: tat turīyam darśatam padam iti dadṛśe iva hi eṣa parorajāḥ iti sarvam u hi eṣa rajaḥ
translated: Now, this, her fourth, the manifest foot, is yonder burning (sun); what is fourth, that is the manifest foot. 'The manifest,' (he says), for he (the sun) is as if seen. 'The highest region,' (he says), for he is above all this region.

original: uparyupari tapatyevaṃ haiva śriyā yaśasā tapati yo'syā etadevam padaṃ veda / / /
analyzed: upari upari tapati evam ha eva śriyā yaśasā tapati yaḥ usyāḥ etat evam padam veda
translated: He burns above above (thus), and so does he burn with glory and fame who knows this, the fourth, the manifest foot of hers.

original: saiṣā gāyatryetasmiṃsturīye darśate pade parorajasi pratiṣṭhitā tadvai tatsatye🔽pratiṣṭhitā cakṣurvai satyaṃ cakṣurhi vai satyaṃ tasmādyadidānīṃ dvau
analyzed: sā eṣā gāyatrī etasmin turīye darśate pade parorajasi pratiṣṭhitā tat vai tat satye  pratiṣṭhitā cakṣuḥ vai satyam cakṣuḥ hi vai satyam tasmāt yat idānīm dvau
translated: This Gāyatrī is established in that fourth, seen place, in the highest light. That, indeed, is established in truth. The eye, indeed, is truth, for the eye is truth. Therefore, if now two men were to dispute about anything,

original: vivadamānāveyātāmahamadrākṣamahamaśrauṣamiti ya eva brūyādahamadrākṣamiti🔽tasmā eva śraddadhyāt / / /
analyzed: vivadamānāveyātām aham adrākṣam aham aśrauṣam iti yaḥ eva brūyāt aham adrākṣam iti  tasmai eva śraddadhyāt
translated: This Gâyatrî is established in that fourth, highest, light, in the truth. Verily, that (light) is established in truth. The truth is the eye, for the eye is the truth. Therefore, if now two persons were to come who were disputing, (saying), 'I have seen it,' 'I have heard it,' one should believe the one who says, 'I have seen it.'

original: tadvai tatsatyam bale pratiṣṭhitam prāṇo vai balaṃ tatprāṇe pratiṣṭhitaṃ
analyzed: tat vai tat satyam bale pratiṣṭhitam prāṇaḥ vai balam tat prāṇe pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Verily, that (light) is established in strength. Strength is the breath; it is established in the breath.

original: tasmādāhurbalaṃ satyādojīya ityevamveṣā gāyatryadhyātmam pratiṣṭhitā / / /
analyzed: tasmāt āhuḥ balam satyāt ojīyaḥ iti evam u eṣā gāyatrī adhyātmam pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Therefore they say, 'Strength is mightier than truth.' Thus, indeed, this Gâyatrî is established in the self.

original: sā haiṣā gayāṃstatre prāṇā vai gayāstatprāṇāṃstatretadyadgayāṃstatre tasmādgāyatrī
analyzed: sā ha eṣā gayān tatre prāṇāḥ vai gayāḥ tat prāṇān tatra itat yat gayān tatre tasmāt gāyatrī
translated: Verily, it was for the Gâyas that it was spread out. The Gâyas are the vital airs; it was for the vital airs that it was spread out. Because it was spread out for the Gâyas, therefore it is called Gâyatrî.

original: nāma sa yāmevāmūmanvāhaiṣaiva sā sa yasmā anvāha tasya prāṇāṃstrāyate / / /
analyzed: nāma sa yām eva amūm anvāha eṣā eva sā sa yasmai anvāha tasya prāṇān trāyate
translated: That which is recited is this (earth); that which is recited is for the protection of the vital airs of him who recites it.

original: tāṃ haike sāvitrīmanuṣṭubhamanvāhurvāganuṣṭubetadvācamanubrūma iti na tathā
analyzed: tām ha eke sāvitrīm anuṣṭubham anvāhuḥ vāc anuṣṭubh etat vācam anubrūmaḥ iti na tathā
translated: Some, indeed, recite the Sâvitrî in the Anushtubh metre, saying, 'The Anushtubh is speech; we will recite that speech.' Not so (should it be done),

original: kuryādgāyatrīmevānubrūyādyadi ha vā api bahviva pratigṛhṇāti na haiva tadgāyatryā
analyzed: kuryāt gāyatrīm eva anubrūyāt yadi ha vai api bahu iva pratigṛhṇāti na ha eva tat gāyatryā
translated: He should recite the Gayatri verse only. If he were to accept much, then not even one word of the Gayatri

original: ekaṃ cana padam prati / / /
analyzed: ekam cana padam prati
translated: would be left over for him.

original: sa ya imāṃstrīṃlokān pūrṇānpratigṛhṇīyātso'syā etatprathamam padamāpnuyādatha🔽yāvatīyaṃ trayī vidyā yastāvatpratigṛhṇīyātso'syā etaddvitīyam padamāpnuyādatha
analyzed: sa yaḥ imān trīn lokān pūrṇān pratigṛhṇīyāt saḥ usyāḥ etat prathamam padam āpnuyāt atha  yāvatī iyam trayī vidyā yaḥ tāvat pratigṛhṇīyāt saḥ u ayāḥ etat dvitīyam padam āpnuyāt atha
translated: One who would accept these three worlds full (of wealth) would obtain this first step of it. Then🔽one who would accept as much as this threefold knowledge (of the Vedas) would obtain this second step of it. Then

original: yāvadidam prāṇi yastāvatpratigṛhṇīyātso'syā etattṛtīyam padamāpnuyādathāsyā
analyzed: yāvat idam prāṇi yaḥ tāvat pratigṛhṇīyāt saḥ usyāḥ etat tṛtīyam padam āpnuyāt atha asyāḥ
translated: one who would accept as much as all this moving and unmoving (universe) would obtain this third step of it. Then

original: etadeva turīyaṃ darśatam padam parorajā ya eṣa tapati naiva kena canāpyaṃ kuta u
analyzed: etat eva turīyam darśatam padam parorajāḥ yaḥ eṣa tapati na eva kena cana āpyam kutas u
translated: this fourth, luminous step of it, which is yonder burning (sun), is not to be obtained by any one at all. How much less

original: etāvatpratigṛhṇīyāt / / /🔽tasyā upasthānam gāyatryasyekapadī dvipadī tripadī catuṣpadyapadasi na hi🔽padyase namaste turīyāya darśatāya padāya parorajase'sāvado mā prāpaditi yaṃ
analyzed: etāvat pratigṛhṇīyāt  tasyāḥ upasthānam gāyatrī asi ekapadī dvipadī tripadī catuṣpadī a padasi na hi  padyase namaḥ te turīyāya darśatāya padāya parorajase sāvadaḥ mā prāpat iti yam
translated: could one accept as much as that?

original: dviṣyādasāvasmai kāmo mā samardhīti vā na haivāsmai sa kāmaḥ samṛdhyate yasmā
analyzed: dviṣyāt asau asmai kāmaḥ mā samardhi iti vā na ha eva asmai sa kāmaḥ samṛdhyate yasmai
translated: The worship of it: O Gayatri, with one foot, two feet, three feet, four feet, you are footless, for you do not step on anything. Salutations to you, to the fourth, luminous step, beyond the dust. May it not reach him whom I hate, or, May his desire not be fulfilled towards me. That desire of his is not fulfilled towards him from whom he hates it.

original: evamupatiṣṭhate'hamadaḥ prāpamiti vā / / /🔽etaddha vai tajjanako vaideho buḍilamāśvatarāśvimuvāca yannu ho
analyzed: evam upatiṣṭhate iha adaḥ prāpam iti vā  etat ha vai tat janakaḥ vaidehaḥ buḍilam āśvatarāśvim uvāca yat nu ho
translated: Thus he worships, thinking 'I have attained the I-principle.'

original: tadgāyatrīvidabrūthā atha kathaṃ hastī bhūto vahasīti mukhaṃ hyasyāḥ samrāṇna
analyzed: tat gāyatrī vida abrūthāḥ atha katham hastī bhūtaḥ vahasi iti mukham hi asyāḥ samrāj na
translated: Janaka, the king of Videha, said to Buḍila Āśvatarāśvi: 'What you have said about one who knows Gāyatrī, how then do you carry an elephant?' 'For its mouth is not known to me,' he said.

original: vidāṃ cakareti hovāca / / /
analyzed: vidām cakara iti ha uvāca
translated: 'I have made its mouth known to you.'

original: tasyā agnireva mukham yadi ha vā api bahvivāgnāvabhyādadhati sarvameva
analyzed: tasyāḥ agniḥ eva mukham yadi ha vai api bahu iva agnau abhyādadhati sarvam eva
translated: Its mouth is indeed Agni. For if one puts even a lot of things into the fire, it burns them all.

original: tatsaṃdahatyevaṃ haivaivaṃvidyadyapi bahviva pāpaṃ karoti sarvameva tatsampsāya
analyzed: tat saṃdahati evam ha eva evaṃvid yadi api bahu iva pāpam karoti sarvam eva tat sampsāya
translated: Thus, one who knows this, even if one does a lot of evil, burns it all up.

original: śuddhaḥ pūto'jaro'mṛtaḥ sambhavati / / /🔽śvetaketurha vā āruṇeyaḥ pañcālānām pariṣadamājagāma sa ājagāma jaivalam
analyzed: śuddhaḥ pūtaḥ ujaraḥ mṛtaḥ sambhavati  śvetaketuḥ ha vai āruṇeyaḥ pañcālānām pariṣadam ājagāma saḥ ājagāma jaivalam
translated: One becomes pure, cleansed, immortal, and reborn as one who has attained immortality.

original: pravāhaṇam paricārayamāṇaṃ tamudīkṣyābhyuvāda iti sa iti
analyzed: pravāhaṇam paricārayamāṇam tam udīkṣya abhyuvāda kumārāḥ iti sa bho iti
translated: Śvetaketu Āruṇeyi went to the assembly of the Pañcālas. He came to Pravāhaṇa Jaibali, who was serving. Seeing him, he addressed him: 'Sir!'

original: pratiśuśrāvānuśiṣṭo nvasi pitretyomiti hovāca / / /
analyzed: pratiśuśrāva anuśiṣṭaḥ nu asi pitrā iti om iti ha uvāca
translated: He responded. 'Are you instructed by your father?' 'Yes,' he said.

original: vettha yathemāḥ prajāḥ prayatyo iti neti hovāca vettha yathemaṃ
analyzed: vettha yathā imāḥ prajāḥ prayatyaḥ vipratipadyāntai iti na iti ha uvāca vettha yathā imam
translated: 'Do you know how these creatures depart?' 'No,' he said. 'Do you know how this

original: lokam iti neti haivovāca vettha yathāsau loka evam bahubhiḥ punaḥ
analyzed: lokam punar āpadyāntaḥ iti na iti ha eva uvāca vettha yathā asau lokaḥ evam bahubhiḥ punar
translated: 'The world', he said. 'Do you know how that world is?' 'No', he said, 'but tell me how it is.'

original: punaḥ prayadbhirna iti neti haivovāca / / /
analyzed: punar prayadbhiḥ na sampūryate iti na iti ha eva uvāca
translated: The world, he said, is not so. Do you know how this world is? he said. By many who strive again and again, it is not so, he said.

original: vettha yatithyāmāhutyāṃ hutāyām āpaḥ puruṣavāco bhūtvā samutthāya iti
analyzed: vettha yatithyām āhutyām hutāyām āpaḥ puruṣa vācaḥ bhūtvā samutthāya vadantī iti
translated: He said, Do you know in what manner, when the oblation is offered, the waters rise up, having become the voices of men?

original: neti haivovāca vettho devayānasya vā pathaḥ pratipadam pitṛyāṇasya vā yatkṛtvā
analyzed: na iti ha eva uvāca vetthaḥ deva yānasya vā pathaḥ pratipadam pitṛyāṇasya vā yat kṛtvā
translated: He said, Not so. Do you know the first step of the path of the gods or of the path of the fathers? Having done what,

original: devayānaṃ vā panthānam pratipadyate pitṛyāṇaṃ vā / / /
analyzed: deva yānam vā panthānam pratipadyate pitṛyāṇam vā
translated: does one enter the path of the gods or the path of the fathers?

original: api hi na ṛṣervacaḥ śrutam dve sṛtī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇāmahaṃ devānāmuta martyānāṃ
analyzed: api hi naḥ ṛṣeḥ vacaḥ śrutam dve sṛtī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇām aham devānām uta martyānām
translated: For I have heard the words of the Rishi: I have heard of two courses, of the fathers and of the gods and of mortals.

original: tābhyāmidaṃ viśvamejatsameti yadantarā pitaram mātaraṃ ceti nāhamata ekaṃ cana
analyzed: tābhyām idam viśvam ejat sameti yat antarā pitaram mātaram ca iti na aham atas ekam cana
translated: By them this whole moving world is joined together. He who is between the father and the mother, I do not know even one of them.

original: vedeti hovāca / / /
analyzed: veda iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, I know not.

original: atha hainaṃ vasatyopamantrayāṃ cakre anādṛtya vasatiṃ kumāraḥ pradudrāva sa
analyzed: atha ha enam vasatyā upamantrayām cakre an ādṛtya vasatim kumāraḥ pradudrāva sa
translated: Then Vasati sought to instruct him. Disregarding Vasati, the youth ran away. He

original: ājagāma pitaraṃ taṃ hovāceti vāva kila no bhavānpurānuśiṣṭānavoca iti kathaṃ
analyzed: ājagāma pitaram tam ha uvāca iti vāva kila naḥ bhavān purā anuśiṣṭān avocaḥ iti katham
translated: came to his father and said to him, Surely, sir, you have spoken to us of what you were instructed in before. How?

original: sumedha iti pañca mā praśnānrājanyabandhuraprākṣīttato naikaṃ cana vedeti
analyzed: su medhaḥ iti pañca mā praśnān rājanyabandhuḥ aprākṣīt tatas na ekam cana veda iti
translated: The son of a Kshatriya asked five questions, O Sumedhas, and he knew not one of them.'

original: hovāca katame ta itīma iti ha pratīkānyudājahāra / / /🔽sa hovāca tathā nastvaṃ tāta jānīthā yathā yadahaṃ kiṃ ca veda sarvamahaṃ
analyzed: ha uvāca katame te iti ime iti ha pratīkāni udājahāra  sa ha uvāca tathā naḥ tvam tāta jānīthāḥ yathā yat aham kim ca veda sarvam aham
translated: He said, 'What are they?' and he recited the names of the five questions.

original: tattubhyamavocam prehi tu tatra pratītya brahmacaryaṃ vatsyāva iti bhavāneva
analyzed: tat tubhyam avocam prehi tu tatra pratītya brahmacaryam vatsyāvaḥ iti bhavān eva
translated: He said, 'Know, dear sir, that I have told you all that I know. Go there, and having obtained his permission, we will live the religious life under him.'

original: gacatviti / / /
analyzed: gacatu iti
translated: 'You go,' he said.

original: sa ājagāma gautamo yatra pravāhaṇasya jaivalerāsa tasmā
analyzed: saḥ ājagāma gautamaḥ yatra pravāhaṇasya jaivaleḥ āsa tasmai
translated: Gautama went to where Pravahana Jaibali was.

original: āsanamāhāryodakamāhārayāṃ cakārātha hāsmā arghaṃ cakāra / / /
analyzed: āsanam āhārya udakam āhārayāṃ cakāra atha ha asmai argham cakāra
translated: He prepared a seat and water for washing the feet, and offered him the Arghya.

original: sa hovāca varam bhavate gautamāya dadma iti sa hovāca pratijñāto ma eṣa varo yāṃ
analyzed: sa ha uvāca varam bhavate gautamāya dadmaḥ iti sa ha uvāca pratijñātaḥ me eṣa varaḥ yām
translated: He said, 'We give you a boon, O Gautama.' He said, 'This boon is already promised to me.

original: tu kumārasyānte vācamabhāṣathāstām me brūhīti / / /
analyzed: tu kumārasya ante vācam abhāṣatha astām me brūhi iti
translated: Tell me the words that you spoke to the prince.'

original: sa hovāca daiveṣu vai gautama tadvareṣu mānuṣāṇām brūhīti / / /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca daiveṣu vai gautama tad vareṣu mānuṣāṇām brūhi iti
translated: He said, 'O Gautama, that is among the divine boons. Tell me among the human ones.'

original: sa hovāca vijñāyate hāsti hiraṇyasyāpāttaṃ go aśvānāṃ dāsīnām pravarāṇām
analyzed: sa ha uvāca vijñāyate ha asti hiraṇyasya apāttam goḥ aśvānām dāsīnām pravarāṇām
translated: He said, 'It is known that there is gold, cows, horses, female slaves, and the best of chariots.

original: paridhānānām mā no bhavānbahoranantasyāparyantasyābhyavadānyo bhūditi sa vai
analyzed: paridhānānām mā naḥ bhavān bahoḥ anantasya aparyantasya abhyavadānyaḥ bhūt iti sa vai
translated: Do not be a consumer of our vast, endless, boundless (wealth).

original: gautama tīrthenecāsā ityupaimyaham bhavantīmiti vācā ha smaiva pūrva upayanti / / /
analyzed: gautama tīrthena ica asau iti upaimi aham bhavantīm iti vācā ha sma eva pūrve upayanti
translated: He (the guest) said, O Gautama, I come to you as a guest. In former times they used to approach (the guest) with speech (i.e. an invitation to enter).

original: sa hopāyanakīrtā uvāca tathā nastvaṃ gautama māparādhāstava ca pitāmahā
analyzed: sa ha upāyana kīrtāḥ uvāca tathā naḥ tvam gautama mā aparādhāḥ tava ca pitāmahāḥ
translated: He (the host) said, So be it. O Gautama, do not offend, nor your grandfather,

original: yatheyaṃ vidyetaḥ pūrvaṃ na kasmiṃścana brāhmaṇa uvāsa tāṃ tvahaṃ tubhyaṃ
analyzed: yathā iyam vidyā itas pūrvam na kasmiṃścana brāhmaṇe uvāsa tām tu aham tubhyam
translated: since this knowledge has not dwelt in any Brâhmana before this. I will tell it to you,

original: vakṣyāmi ko hi tvaivam bruvantamarhati pratyākhyātumiti / / /
analyzed: vakṣyāmi kaḥ hi tvā evam bruvantam arhati pratyākhyātum iti
translated: for who is able to refuse one who speaks thus?

original: asau vai loko'gnirgautama tasyāditya eva samidraśmayo dhūmo'hararciścandramā🔽aṅgārā nakṣatrāṇi viṣphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau devāḥ śraddhāṃ juhvati tasyā
analyzed: asau vai lokaḥ agniḥ gautama tasya ādityaḥ eva samidh raśmayaḥ dhūmaḥ ūhara rciḥ candramāḥ  aṅgārāḥ nakṣatrāṇi viṣphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ śraddhām juhvati tasyāḥ
translated: The world yonder is the fire, O Gautama; the sun is its fuel, the rays are its smoke, the day is its flame, the moon is its coals, the stars are its sparks. In this fire the gods offer faith.

original: āhuteḥ somo rājā sambhavati / / /
analyzed: āhuteḥ somaḥ rājā sambhavati
translated: From that oblation king Soma is produced.🔽 The rain-cloud is the fire, O Gautama; the year is its fuel, the clouds are its smoke, the lightning is its flame, the thunder is its coals, the hail-storms are its sparks. In this fire the gods offer Soma.

original: parjanyo vā agnirgautama tasya saṃvatsara eva samidabhrāṇi dhūmo
analyzed: parjanyaḥ vai agniḥ gautama tasya saṃvatsaraḥ eva samidh abhrāṇi
translated: The rain is the oblation. From that oblation the plants are produced.🔽 The earth is the fire, O Gautama; the plants are its fuel, the herbs are its smoke, the grass is its flame, the shrubs are its coals, the trees are its sparks. In this fire the gods offer the rain.🔽 The food is the oblation. From that oblation man is produced.🔽 The woman is the fire, O Gautama; the man is its fuel, the embrace is its smoke, the kiss is its flame, the friction of the limbs is its coals, the sweat is its sparks. In this fire the gods offer food.🔽 The seed is the oblation. From that oblation a son is produced.

original: vidyudarciraśaniraṅgārā hrādunayo viṣphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau devāḥ somaṃ
analyzed: vidyut arciḥ aśaniḥ aṅgārāḥ hrādunayaḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ somam
translated: The mind is the fire, O Gautama; the breath is its fuel, the voice is its smoke, the eyes are its flame, the ears are its coals, the skin is its sparks. In this fire the gods offer the seed.🔽 The body is the oblation. From that oblation a son is produced.🔽 The heart is the fire, O Gautama; the mind is its fuel, the understanding is its smoke, the will is its flame, the memory is its

original: juhvati tasyā āhutervṛṣṭiḥ sambhavati / / /
analyzed: juhvati tasyāḥ āhuteḥ vṛṣṭiḥ sambhavati
translated: From the libation poured into that (fire) rain is produced.

original: ayaṃ vai loko'gnirgautama tasya pṛthivyeva samidvāyurdhūmo rātrirarcirdiśo'ṅgārā
analyzed: ayam vai lokaḥ agniḥ gautama tasya pṛthivī eva samidh vāyuḥ dhūmaḥ rātriḥ arciḥ diśā uṅgārā
translated: This world, O Gautama, is the fire; its fuel is the earth, the smoke is the wind, the flame is the night, the embers are the quarters (of the horizon),

original: avāntaradiśo viṣphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau devā vṛṣṭiṃ juhvati tasyā
analyzed: avāntara diśaḥ viṣphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ vṛṣṭim juhvati tasyāḥ
translated: and the sparks are the intermediate quarters. In that fire the gods offer rain;

original: āhuterannaṃ sambhavati / / /
analyzed: āhuteḥ annam sambhavati
translated: from that libation food is produced.

original: puruṣo vā agnirgautama tasya vyāttameva samitprāṇo dhūmo vāgarciścakṣuraṅgārāḥ
analyzed: puruṣaḥ vai agniḥ gautama tasya vyāttam eva samidh prāṇaḥ dhūmaḥ vāc arciḥ cakṣuḥ aṅgārāḥ
translated: Man, O Gautama, is the fire; his mouth is the fuel, the breath is the smoke, speech is the flame, the eye is the ember,

original: śrotraṃ viṣphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau devā annaṃ juhvati tasyā āhute retaḥ🔽sambhavati / / /
analyzed: śrotram viṣphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ annam juhvati tasyāḥ āhute retaḥ  sambhavati
translated: the ear is the spark. In that fire the gods offer food; from that libation seed is produced.

original: yoṣā vā agnirgautama tasyā upastha eva samillomāni dhūm🔽o yonirarciryadantaḥ karoti te'ṅgārā abhinandā visphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau
analyzed: yoṣā vai agniḥ gautama tasyāḥ upasthe eva samidh lomāni dhūm  ā u yoniḥ arciḥ yat antar karoti teṅgārāḥ abhinandāḥ visphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau
translated: Woman, O Gautama, is the fire; her lap is the fuel, the hair is the smoke,

original: devā reto juhvati tasyā āhuteḥ puruṣaḥ sambhavati sa jāyate sa jīvati yāvajjīvatyatha
analyzed: devāḥ retaḥ juhvati tasyāḥ āhuteḥ puruṣaḥ sambhavati sa jāyate sa jīvati yāvat jīvati atha
translated: the womb is the flame, what he does within is the ember, the kisses are the sparks. In that fire the gods offer seed; from that libation man is produced. He is born, he lives as long as he lives;

original: yadā mriyate'thainamagnaye haranti / / /
analyzed: yadā mriyate itha enam agnaye haranti
translated: then when he dies they carry him to that fire, to Agni.

original: tasyāgnirevāgnirbhavati samitsamiddhūmo dhūmo'rcirarciraṅgārā viṣphuliṅgā
analyzed: tasya agniḥ eva agniḥ bhavati samidh samidh dhūmaḥ dhūma ūrciḥ arciḥ aṅgārāḥ viṣphuliṅgā
translated: Its fire is indeed fire, its fuel is fuel, its smoke is smoke, its flame is flame, its coals are coals, its sparks are sparks.

original: viṣphuliṅgāstasminnetasminnagnau devāḥ puruṣaṃ juhvati tasyā āhuteḥ puruṣo
analyzed: viṣphuliṅgāḥ tasmin etasmin agnau devāḥ puruṣam juhvati tasyāḥ āhuteḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: In that fire the gods offer a man. From that oblation a man

original: bhāsvaravarṇaḥ sambhavati / / /
analyzed: bhāsvara varṇaḥ sambhavati
translated: is born with a radiant complexion.

original: te ya evametadviduḥ ye cāmī araṇye śraddhāṃ satyamupāsate
analyzed: te ye evam etat viduḥ ye ca amī araṇye śraddhām satyam upāsate
translated: Those who know this, and those in the forest who worship faith and truth,

original: te'rcirabhisambhavantyarciṣo'harahnu
analyzed: tāḥ ṛciḥ abhisambhavanti arciṣā uhara hnu
translated: they attain the flame, from the flame the day,

original: āpūryamāṇapakṣamāpūryamāṇapakṣādyānṣaṇmāsānudaṅṅāditya eti māsebhyo
analyzed: āpūryamāṇapakṣam āpūryamāṇapakṣa ādyān ṣaṭ māsān udaṅ ādityaḥ eti māsebhyaḥ
translated: from the waxing fortnight, from the waxing fortnight, the six months when the sun moves north, from the months

original: devalokaṃ devalokādādityamādityādvaidyutaṃ tānvaidyutātpuruṣo mānasa etya
analyzed: deva lokam deva lokāt ādityam ādityāt vaidyutam tān vaidyutāt puruṣaḥ mānasaḥ etya
translated: the world of the gods, from the world of the gods the sun, from the sun the lightning. From the lightning the man attains the mind.

original: brahmalokāngamayati te teṣu brahmalokeṣu parāḥ parāvato vasanti teṣāmiha na
analyzed: brahma lokān gamayati te teṣu brahma lokeṣu parāḥ parāvataḥ vasanti teṣām iha na
translated: He leads them to the world of Brahman. They dwell in those worlds of Brahman, the highest, beyond which there is nothing higher. For them there is

original: punarāvṛttirasti / / /
analyzed: punarāvṛttiḥ asti
translated: no return here.

original: atha ye yajñena dānena tapasā lokaṃ jayanti te dhūmamabhisambhavanti
analyzed: atha ye yajñena dānena tapasā lokam jayanti te dhūmam abhisambhavanti
translated: Now, those who conquer the world through sacrifice, giving, and austerity, they attain the smoke,

original: dhūmādrātriṃ
analyzed: dhūmāt rātrim
translated: from the smoke the night,

original: rātrerapakṣīyamāṇapakṣamapakṣīyamāṇapakṣādyānṣaṇmāsāndakṣiṇāditya eti
analyzed: rātreḥ apakṣīyamāṇapakṣam apakṣīyamāṇapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ māsān dakṣiṇā ādityaḥ eti

analyzed: śilpāt kaśyapācilpaḥ kaśyapaḥ kaśyapāt naidhruveḥ kaśyapaḥ naidhruviḥ vācaḥ
translated: Kaśyapa from Śilpa. Śilpa from Kaśyapa. Kaśyapa from Kaśyapa. Kaśyapa from Naidhruvi. Kaśyapa from Naidhruvi from speech.

original: vāgambhiṇyā ambhiṇyādityādādityānīmāni śuklāni yajūṃṣi vājasaneyena
analyzed: vāc ambhiṇyāḥ ambhiṇyāḥ ādityāt ādityāni imāni śuklāni yajūṃṣi vājasaneyena
translated: Speech from Ambhinī. Ambhinī from Āditya. Āditya from these white Yajuṣs are being narrated by Vājasaneya.🔽Yājñavalkya. For this is indeed the semen, brought with milk and energy, from the milk.

original: yājñavalkyenākhyāyante maṇā hyeṣa tejasā saha payaso reta ābhṛtamiti payaso🔽hyetadreta ābhṛtaṃ tasya dohamaśīmahyuttarāmuttarāṃ
analyzed: yājñavalkyena ākhyāyante maṇā hi eṣa tejasā saha payasaḥ retaḥ ābhṛtam iti payasaḥ 🔽hi etat retaḥ ābhṛtam tasya doham aśīmahi uttarām uttarām
translated: For this semen is indeed brought. May we obtain its essence, the next and next.

original: samāmityāśiṣamevaitadāśāste'tha cātvāle mārjayante'sāveva bandhuḥ / / /🔽athāto dakṣiṇānām suvarṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ śatamānam brahmaṇe dadātyāsīno vai brahmā
analyzed: samām iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste tha cātvāle mārjayante asau eva bandhuḥ  atha atas dakṣiṇānām suvarṇam hiraṇyam śata mānam brahmaṇe dadāti āsīnaḥ vai brahmā
translated: He then touches the Cātvāla with the same formula.🔽Now then as to the Dakshinas. He gives to the Brahman a piece of gold, a Suvarna, of a hundred (grains of gold). The Brahman sits (at the sacrifice);

original: yaśaḥ śayānaṃ hiraṇyaṃ tasmātsuvarṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ śatamānam brahmaṇe dadāti / / /🔽atha yaiṣā gharmadughā tāmadhvaryave dadāti taptaiva vai
analyzed: yaśaḥ śayānam hiraṇyam tasmāt suvarṇam hiraṇyam śata mānam brahmaṇe dadāti  atha yā eṣā gharma dughā tām adhvaryave dadāti taptā eva vai
translated: gold is glory: therefore he gives to the Brahman a piece of gold, a Suvarna, of a hundred (grains).

original: gharmastaptamivādhvaryurniṣkrāmati tasmāttāmadhvarya ve dadāti / / /
analyzed: gharmaḥ taptam iva adhvaryuḥ niṣkrāmati tasmāt tām adhvarya ve dadāti
translated: Then that milch-cow of the Gharma he gives to the Adhvaryu. The Gharma is indeed heated, and the Adhvaryu goes out as if heated: therefore he gives it to the Adhvaryu.

original: atha yaiṣā yajamānasya vratadughā tāṃ hotre dadāti yajño vai hotā yajño
analyzed: atha yā eṣā yajamānasya vrata dughā tām hotre dadāti yajñaḥ vai hotā yajñaḥ
translated: Then that milch-cow of the sacrificer's vow he gives to the Hotri. The Hotri is the sacrifice,

original: yajamānastasmāttāṃ hotre dadāti / / /🔽atha yaiṣā patnyai vratadughā tāmudgātṛbhyo dadāti patnīkarmeva vā ete'tra
analyzed: yajamānaḥ tasmāt tām hotre dadāti  atha yā eṣā patnyai vrata dughā tām udgātṛbhyaḥ dadāti patnī karma iva vai etā itra
translated: the sacrificer is the sacrifice: therefore he gives it to the Hotri.

original: kurvanti yadudgātārastasmāttāmudgātṛbhyo dadāti / / /
analyzed: kurvanti yat udgātāraḥ tasmāt tām udgātṛbhyaḥ dadāti
translated: Then that milch-cow of the wife's vow he gives to the Udgâtris. The Udgâtris indeed perform the wife's office here: therefore he gives it to the Udgâtris.

original: athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
translated: Now that life, that light, enters him who either recites this (hymn) or eats (the food) of him who recites it.

original: vratacaryā yā sṛṣṭau / / /
analyzed: vrata caryā yā sṛṣṭau
translated: The observance of his vow is the same as at the creation.

original: sarveṣām vā eṣa bhūtānām sarveṣāṃ devānāmātmā yadyajñastasya samṛddhimanu
analyzed: sarveṣām vai eṣa bhūtānām sarveṣām devānām ātmā yat yajñaḥ tasya samṛddhim anu
translated: in accordance with its prosperity

original: yajamānaḥ prajayā paśubhirṛdhyate vi vā eṣa prajayā paśubhirṛdhyate yasya gharmo
analyzed: yajamānaḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ ṛdhyate vi vai eṣa prajayā paśubhiḥ ṛdhyate yasya gharmaḥ
translated: the sacrificer prospers with offspring and cattle. He prospers indeed with offspring and cattle,

original: vidīryate tatra prāyaścittiḥ / / /🔽pūrṇāhutiṃ juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇaṃ sarveṇaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ
analyzed: vidīryate tatra prāyaścittiḥ  pūrṇāhutim juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇam sarveṇa eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍham
translated: whose Gharma breaks. There is an expiation for that.

original: yajñasya / / /🔽svāhā prāṇebhyaḥ sādhipatikebhya iti mano vai prāṇānāmadhipatirmanasi hi sarve
analyzed: yajñasya  svāhā prāṇebhyaḥ sa adhipatikebhyaḥ iti manaḥ vai prāṇānām adhipatiḥ manasi hi sarve
translated: He offers a full oblation. The full is everything; with everything he heals whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.🔽(To the Gharma) which has been broken,

original: prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāstanmanasaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ tat manasā eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: 'Svâhâ to the vital airs with the lords of the vital airs,'--the mind is the lord of the vital airs, for all the vital airs are established on the mind: he thus heals it by the mind, whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

original: pṛthivyai svāheti pṛthivī vai sarveṣāṃ devānāmāyatanaṃ
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā iti pṛthivī vai sarveṣām devānām āyatanam
translated: 'To the earth Svâhâ!'--the earth is the abode of all the gods:

original: tatsarvābhirevaitaddevatābhirbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /

translated: he thus heals it by all the deities, whatever has been unsuccessful in the sacrifice.

analyzed: agnaye svāhā iti agniḥ vai sarveṣām devānām ātmā

analyzed: nābhyai svāhā pūtāya svāhā iti aniruktam aniruktaḥ vai prajāpatiḥ
translated: 'To the navel hail! To the purified hail!' The undefined (verse); Prajapati is undefined.

original: prajāpatiryajñastatprajāpatimevaitadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ tat prajāpatim eva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati
translated: Prajapati is the sacrifice; he thus heals the sacrifice which is Prajapati.

original: trayodaśaitā āhutayo bhavanti trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ
analyzed: trayodaśa etāḥ āhutayaḥ bhavanti trayodaśa vai māsāḥ samvatsarasya samvatsaraḥ
translated: These are thirteen oblations; the year consists of thirteen months.

original: prajāpatiḥ prajāpatiryajñastatprajāpatimevaitadyajñam bhiṣajyati / / /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ prajāpatiḥ yajñaḥ tat prajāpatim eva etat yajñam bhiṣajyati
translated: Prajapati is the sacrifice; verily he heals that sacrifice, Prajapati.

original: vāce svāheti mukhamevāsminnetaddadhāti prāṇāya svāhā prāṇāya svāheti nāsike🔽evāsminnetaddadhāti cakṣuṣe svāhā cakṣuṣe svāhetyakṣiṇī evāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: vāce svāhā iti mukham eva asmin etat dadhāti prāṇāya svāhā prāṇāya svāhā iti nāsike  eva asmin etat dadhāti cakṣuṣe svāhā cakṣuṣe svāhā iti akṣiṇī eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: 'To speech hail!' he says; verily he puts the mouth in it. 'To expiration hail! To inspiration hail!'🔽Verily he puts the nostrils in it. 'To the eye hail! To the ear hail!'

original: śrotrāya svāhā śrotrāya svāheti karṇāvevāsminnetaddadhāti / / /
analyzed: śrotrāya svāhā śrotrāya svāhā iti karṇau eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: Verily he puts the ears in it.

original: saptaitā āhutayo bhavanti sapta vā ime śīrṣanprāṇāstānevāsminnetaddadhāti
analyzed: sapta etāḥ āhutayaḥ bhavanti sapta vai ime śīrṣan prāṇāḥ tān eva asmin etat dadhāti
translated: These are seven oblations; seven are these breaths in the head; verily he places them in it.

original: pūrṇāhutimuttamāṃ juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇaṃ sarveṇaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: pūrṇāhutim uttamām juhoti sarvam vai pūrṇam sarveṇa eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca
translated: He offers a full oblation as the last; the full means all; verily he heals with all whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.

original: vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: Whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.

original: manasaḥ kāmamākūtimiti manasā vā idaṃ sarvamāptaṃ tanmanasaivaitadbhiṣajyati
analyzed: manasaḥ kāmam ākūtim iti manasā vai idam sarvam āptam tat manasā eva etat bhiṣajyati
translated: 'The desire, the intention of the mind,' he says; by the mind all this is attained; verily he heals it by the mind, whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.

original: yatkiṃ ca vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya / / /
analyzed: yat kim ca vivṛḍham yajñasya
translated: Whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.

original: vācaḥ satyamaśīyeti vācā vā idaṃ sarvamāptaṃ tadvācaivaitadbhiṣajyati yatkiṃ ca
analyzed: vācaḥ satyam aśīya iti vācā vai idam sarvam āptam tat vācā eva etat bhiṣajyati yat kim ca
translated: 'The truth of speech may I attain,' he says; by speech all this is attained; verily he heals it by speech, whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.🔽Whatever is amiss in the sacrifice.

original: vivṛḍhaṃ yajñasya paśūnāṃ rūpamannasya raso yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatām mayi
analyzed: vivṛḍham yajñasya paśūnām rūpam annasya rasaḥ yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatām mayi
translated: The firm form of the sacrifice, the essence of food, glory and prosperity may rest in me.

original: svāhetyāśiṣamevaitadāśāste / / /🔽atha taṃ copaśayāṃ ca piṣṭvā mārtsnayā mṛdā saṃsṛjyāvṛtā karotyāvṛtā
analyzed: svāhā iti āśiṣam eva etat āśāste  atha tam ca upaśayām ca piṣṭvā mārtsnayā mṛdā saṃsṛjya āvṛtā karoti āvṛtā
translated: With 'Svâhâ' he invokes a blessing.

original: pacatyutsādanārthamatha ya upaśayayordṛḍhaḥ syāttena pracaret / / /
analyzed: pacati utsādana artham atha yaḥ upaśayayoḥ dṛḍhaḥ syāt tena pracaret
translated: Then, having ground that (cake) and the substitute together with clay, he makes (a cake) with the Avakâ formula, he bakes it with the Avakâ formula, for the purpose of filling up. Then he should proceed with that (cake) which is the firmer of the two substitutes.

original: saṃvatsaro vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai saṃvatsaraḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The Pravargya, doubtless, is the year, and the year is everything, and the Pravargya is everything.

original: yatpravṛktastadvasanto yadrucitastadgrīṣmo yatpinvitastadvarṣā yadā vai varṣāh
analyzed: yat pravṛktaḥ tat vasantaḥ yat rucitaḥ tat grīṣmaḥ yat pinvitaḥ tat varṣāḥ yadā vai varṣāḥ
translated: When it is turned up, that is the spring; when it is heated, that is the summer; when it is swollen, that is the rainy season; for when the rains

original: pinvante'thaināḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvante ha vāasmai varṣā ya🔽evametadveda / / /
analyzed: pinvante itha enāḥ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvante ha vā asmai varṣāḥ ya  evam etat veda
translated: swell (the rivers), then all the gods and all beings live upon them. The rains swell for him who knows this thus.

original: ime vai lokāḥ pravargyaḥ sarvam vā ime lokāḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: ime vai lokāḥ pravargyaḥ sarvam vai ime lokāḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The Pravargya, doubtless, is these worlds, and these worlds are everything, and the Pravargya is everything.

original: yatpravṛktastadayaṃ loko yadrucitastadantarikṣaloko yatpinvitastadasau loko yadā vā
analyzed: yad pravṛktaḥ tat ayam lokaḥ yad rucitaḥ tat antarikṣa lokaḥ yad pinvitaḥ tat asau lokaḥ yadā vā
translated: When it is turned up, that is this (terrestrial) world; when it is heated, that is the air-world; when it is swollen, that is the sky-world; for when the rains🔽swell (the rivers), then all the gods and all beings live upon them. The rains swell for him who knows this thus.

original: asau lokaḥ pinvate'thainaṃ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvate ha vā asm /
analyzed: asau lokaḥ pinvate itha enam sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvate ha vai asmin
translated: This world swells, and then all the gods and all beings depend on it for support. It swells for him.

original: asau loko ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: asau lokaḥ yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: This world swells for him who knows this.

original: etā vai devatāḥ pravargyaḥ agnirvāyurādityaḥ sarvam vā etā devatā sarvam
analyzed: etāḥ vai devatāḥ pravargyaḥ agniḥ vāyuḥ ādityaḥ sarvam vai etāḥ devatā sarvam
translated: These deities are the Pravargya: Agni, Vayu, and Aditya. All these deities are all the Pravargya.

original: pravargyaḥ sa yatpravṛktastadagniryadrucitastadvāyuryatpinvitastadasāvādityo yadā vā
analyzed: pravargyaḥ sa yat pravṛktaḥ tat agniḥ yat rucitaḥ tat vāyuḥ yat pinvitaḥ tat asau ādityaḥ yadā vā
translated: When it is raised, that is Agni; when it is shining, that is Vayu; when it is swelling, that is Aditya. When

original: asāvādityaḥpinvate'thainaṃ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvate ha vā asmā
analyzed: asau ādityaḥ pinvate itha enam sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvate ha vai asmai
translated: Aditya swells, then all the gods and all beings depend on it for support. It swells for him.

original: asāvādityo ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: asau ādityaḥ yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: Aditya swells for him who knows this.

original: yajamāno vai pravargyaḥ tasyātmā prajā paśavaḥ sarvam vai yajamānaḥ sarvam
analyzed: yajamānaḥ vai pravargyaḥ tasya ātmā prajā paśavaḥ sarvam vai yajamānaḥ sarvam
translated: The sacrificer is the Pravargya; his body, offspring, and cattle are all the Pravargya.

original: pravargyaḥ sa yatpravṛktastadātmā yadrucitastatprajā yatpinvitastatpaśavo yadā vai
analyzed: pravargyaḥ sa yat pravṛktaḥ tat ātmā yat rucitaḥ tat prajāḥ yat pinvitaḥ tat paśavaḥ yadā vai
translated: When it is raised, that is the body; when it is shining, that is offspring; when it is swelling, that is cattle. When

original: paśavaḥ pinvate'thaināntsarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvante ha vā asmai
analyzed: paśavaḥ pinvate itha enān sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvante ha vai asmai
translated: cattle swell, then all the gods and all beings depend on them for support. Cattle swell for him.

original: paśavo ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: paśavaḥ yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: Cattle swell for him who knows this.

original: agnihotram vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vāagnihotraṃ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa yadadhiśritaṃ🔽tatpravṛkto yadunnītaṃ tadrucito yaddhutaṃ tatpinvito yadā vāagnihotram
analyzed: agnihotram vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vā agnihotram sarvam pravargyaḥ sa yat adhiśritam  tad pravṛktaḥ yat unnītam tat rucitaḥ yat hutam tad pinvitaḥ yadā vā agnihotram
translated: The Pravargya is the Agnihotra, the Pravargya is everything, the Agnihotra is everything. What is put on the fire is the Pravargya, what is poured out is the Pravargya, what is offered is the Pravargya. When the Agnihotra is offered,

original: pinvate'thainatsarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvate ha vā asmā agnihotraṃ🔽ya evametadveda / / /🔽darśapūrṇamāsau vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai darśapūrṇamāsau sarvam pravargyaḥ sa🔽yadadhiśritaṃ tatpravṛkto yadāsannaṃ tadrucito yaddhutaṃ tatpinvito yadā vai
analyzed: pinvate itha enat sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvate ha vai asmai agnihotram  yaḥ evam etat veda  darśapūrṇamāsau vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai darśapūrṇamāsau sarvam pravargyaḥ sa  yat adhiśritam tat pravṛktaḥ yat āsannam tat rucitaḥ yat hutam tat pinvitaḥ yadā vai
translated: The Agnihotra is the Pravargya; the whole Agnihotra is the whole Pravargya. What is put on the fire is the Pravargya; what is drawn out is the Ruci; what is offered is the Pini. When the Agnihotra swells, then all the gods and all beings live on it. The Agnihotra swells for him who knows this thus.

original: darśapūrṇamāsau pinvete athainau sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvete ha🔽vā asmai darśapūrṇamāsau ya evametadveda / / /🔽cāturmāsyāni vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai cāturmāsyāni sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: darśa pūrṇamāsau pinvete atha enau sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvete ha  vai asmai darśa pūrṇamāsau yaḥ evam etat veda  cāturmāsyāni vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai cāturmāsyāni sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The new and full moon sacrifices are the Pravargya; the whole new and full moon sacrifices are the whole Pravargya. What is put on the fire is the Pravargya; what is near is the Ruci; what is offered is the Pini. When the new and full moon sacrifices swell, then all the gods and all beings live on them. The new and full moon sacrifices swell for him who knows this thus.

original: yadadhiśritaṃ tatpravṛkto yadāsannaṃ tadru cito yaddhutaṃ tatpinvito yadā vai
analyzed: yat adhiśritam tat pravṛktaḥ yat āsannam tat ru citaḥ yat hutam tat pinvitaḥ yadā vai
translated: The seasonal sacrifices are the Pravargya; the whole seasonal sacrifices are the whole Pravargya. What is put on the fire is the Pravargya; what is near is the Ruci; what is offered is the Pini. When the seasonal sacrifices swell,

original: cāturmāsyāni pinvante'thaināni sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvante ha vā
analyzed: cāturmāsyāni pinvante itha enāni sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvante ha vā
translated: The seasonal sacrifices swell, and then all the gods and all beings depend on them. They swell

original: asmai cāturmāsyāni ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: asmai cāturmāsyāni yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: for him who knows this thus.

original: paśubandho vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai paśubandhaḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: paśubandhaḥ vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai paśubandhaḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: The animal sacrifice is the Pravargya. The animal sacrifice is everything, the Pravargya is everything.

original: yadadhiśritastatpravṛkto yadāsannastadrucito yaddhutastatpinvito yadā vai
analyzed: yad adhiśritaḥ tad pravṛktaḥ yad āsannaḥ tad rucitaḥ yad hutaḥ tad pinvitaḥ yadā vai
translated: When it is put on the fire, then it is started; when it is near, then it is glowing; when it is offered, then it is swollen. When

original: paśubandhaḥ pinvate'thainaṃ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupajīvanti pinvate ha vā
analyzed: paśubandhaḥ pinvate itha enam sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upajīvanti pinvate ha vā
translated: the animal sacrifice swells, then all the gods and all beings depend on it. The animal sacrifice swells

original: asmai paśubandho ya evametadveda / / /
analyzed: asmai paśubandhaḥ yaḥ evam etat veda
translated: for him who knows this thus.

original: somo vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai somaḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
analyzed: somaḥ vai pravargyaḥ sarvam vai somaḥ sarvam pravargyaḥ sa
translated: Soma is the Pravargya. Soma is everything, the Pravargya is everything.

original: yadabhiṣutastatpravṛkto yadunnītastadrucito yaddhutastatpinvito yadā vai somaḥ
analyzed: yat abhiṣutaḥ tat pravṛktaḥ yat unnītaḥ tat rucitaḥ yat hutaḥ tat pinvitaḥ yadā vai somaḥ
translated: When it is pressed, then it is started; when it is drawn up, then it is glowing; when it is offered, then it is swollen. When

original: pinvate'thainaṃ sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtānyupayuñjanti pinvate ha vā asmai somo ya
analyzed: pinvatetha enam sarve devāḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni upayuñjanti pinvate ha vai asmai somaḥ yaḥ
translated: the Soma swells, then all the gods and all beings use it. The Soma swells

original: evametadveda na ha vā asyāpravargyeṇa kena cana yajñeneṣṭam bhavati ya
analyzed: evam etat veda na ha vai asya a pravargyeṇa kena cana yajñena iṣṭam bhavati yaḥ
translated: for him who knows this thus. No sacrifice of his is performed without the Pravargya,

original: evametadveda / / /
analyzed: evam etat veda
translated: if he knows this thus.

original: athaitadvai āyuretajjyotiḥ praviśati ya etamanu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
analyzed: atha etat vai āyuḥ etat jyotiḥ praviśati yaḥ etam anu vā brūte bhakṣayati vā tasya
translated: Now, this is the life, this is the light that enters him who either recites this or eats it.

original: vratacaryā yā sṛṣṭau
analyzed: vrata caryā yā sṛṣṭau
translated: The observance of vows is the same as in creation.
